division five , by the air force followed by 11 states .	61.92087
division six will be headed by the coast guard , followed by the reserve forces of all services , five states , puerto rico , the virgin islands , guam , american samoa , the trust territories and the canal zone .	54.29828
-- what does 1961 offer in political and governmental developments in mississippi ? ?	180.7939
even for those who have been observing the political scene a long time , no script from the past is worth very much in gazing into the state ' s immediate political future .	143.73424
this is largely because of the unpredictability of the man who operates the helm of the state government and is the elected leader of its two million inhabitants -- gov . ross barnett .	91.30012
barnett , who came into office with no previous experience in public administration , has surrounded himself with confusion which not only keeps his foes guessing but his friends as well .	242.9458
consequently , it is uncertain after nearly 12 months in office just which direction the barnett administration will take in the coming year .	161.99368
some predict the administration will settle down during 1961 and iron out the rough edges which it has had thus far .	222.38855
the builtin headache of the barnett regime thus far has been the steady stream of job-seekers and others who feel they were given commitments by barnett at some stage of his eight-year quest for the governor ' s office .	82.98305
there are many who predict that should barnett decide to call the legislature back into special session , it will really throw his administration into a scramble .	123.66089
certainly nobody will predict that the next time the lawmakers come back together barnett will be able to enjoy a re-enactment of the strange but successful `` honeymoon ' ' he had in the 1960 legislative session .	87.83458
if barnett doesn ' t call a special session in 1961 , it will be the first year in the last decade that the legislature has not met in regular or special session .	49.45814
the odds favor a special session , more than likely early in the year .	49.527924
legislators always get restless for a special session ( whether for the companionship or the $22 . 50 per diem is not certain ) and if they start agitating .	203.87056
barnett is not expected to be able to withstand the pressure .	64.06553
the issue which may make it necessary to have a session is the highly sensitive problem of cutting the state ' s congressional districts from six to five to eliminate one congressional seat .	165.8143
with eyes focused on the third congressional district , the historic delta district , and congressman frank e . smith as the one most likely to go , the redistricting battle will put to a test the longstanding power which lawmakers from the delta have held in the legislature .	110.83432
mississippi ' s relations with the national democratic party will be at a crossroads during 1961 , with the first democratic president in eight years in the white house .	46.86813
split badly during the recent presidential election into almost equally divided camps of party loyalists and independents , the democratic party in mississippi is currently a wreck .	103.38454
and there has been no effort since the election to pull it back together .	271.1337
barnett , as the titular head of the democratic party , apparently must make the move to reestablish relations with the national democratic party or see a movement come from the loyalist ranks to completely bypass him as a party functionary .	95.09386
with a democratic administration , party patronage would normally begin to flow to mississippi if it had held its democratic solidarity in the november election .	193.6786
now , the picture is clouded , and even us sens . james o . eastland and john c . stennis , who remained loyal to the ticket , are uncertain of their status .	104.16504
reports are that it is more than probable that the four congressmen from mississippi who did not support the party ticket will be stripped of the usual patronage which flows to congressmen .	114.2628
-- the gov . jimmie h . davis administration appears to face a difficult year in 1961 , with the governor ' s theme of peace and harmony subjected to severe stresses .	126.718
the year will probably start out with segregation still the most troublesome issue .	369.33975
but it might give way shortly to another vexing issue -- that of finances in state government .	132.17499
the transition from segregation to finances might already be in progress , in the form of an administration proposal to hike the state sales tax from 2 per cent to 3 per cent .	52.515156
the administration has said the sales tax proposal is merely part of the segregation strategy , since the revenues from the increase would be dedicated to a grant in aid program .	95.5022
but the tardiness of the administration in making the dedication has caused legislators to suspect the tax bill was related more directly to an over-all shortage of cash than to segregation .	117.397026
indeed , the administration ' s curious position on the sales tax was a major factor in contributing to its defeat .	86.11012
the administration could not say why $28 million was needed for a grant-in-aid program .	88.82775
the effectiveness of the governor in clearing up some of the inconsistencies revolving about the sales tax bill may play a part in determining whether it can muster the required two-thirds vote .	100.0695
the tax bill will be up for reconsideration wednesday in the house when the legislature reconvenes .	69.64764
davis may use the tax bill as a means to effect a transition from special sessions of the legislature to normalcy .	63.500523
if it fails to pass , he can throw up his hands and say the legislature would not support him in his efforts to prevent integration .	65.12858
he could terminate special sessions of the legislature .	9.391399
actually , davis would have to toss in the towel soon anyway .	108.62152
many legislators are already weary and frustrated over the so-far losing battle to block token integration .	140.3956
this is not the sort of thing most politicos would care to acknowledge publicly .	265.2023
they would like to convey the notion something is being done , even though it is something they know to be ineffectual .	72.56152
passage of the sales tax measure would also give davis the means to effect a transition .	259.279
he could tell the legislature they had provided the needed funds to carry on the battle .	110.10979
then he could tell them to go home , while the administration continued to wage the battle with the $28 million in extra revenues the sales tax measure would bring in over an eight months period .	142.604
it is difficult to be certain how the administration views that $28 million , since the views of one leader may not be the same as the views of another one .	106.21774
but if the administration should find it does not need the $28 million for a grant-in-aid program , a not unlikely conclusion , it could very well seek a way to use the money for other purposes .	102.542435
this would be in perfect consonance with the underlying concern in the administration -- the shortage of cash .	45.091537
it could become an acute problem in the coming fiscal year .	140.5305
if the administration does not succeed in passing the sales tax bill , or any other tax bill , it could very well be faced this spring at the fiscal session of the legislature with an interesting dilemma .	53.625755
since the constitution forbids introduction of a tax bill at a fiscal session , the administration will either have to cut down expenses or inflate its estimates of anticipated revenues .	95.08579
in either case , it could call a special session of the legislature later in 1961 to make another stab at raising additional revenues through a tax raiser .	169.09985
the prospect of cutting back spending is an unpleasant one for any governor .	320.84738
it is one that most try to avoid , as long as they can see an alternative approach to the problem .	40.119026
but if all alternatives should be clearly blocked off , it can be expected the davis administration will take steps to trim spending at the spring session of the state legislature .	59.05942
this might be done to arouse those who have been squeezed out by the trims to exert pressure on the legislature , so it would be more receptive to a tax proposal later in the year .	73.55598
a constant problem confronting davis on any proposals for new taxes will be the charge by his foes that he has not tried to economize .	81.56207
any tax bill also will revive allegations that some of his followers have been using their administration affiliations imprudently to profit themselves .	142.51753
the new year might see some house-cleaning , either genuine or token , depending upon developments , to give davis an opportunity to combat some of these criticisms .	107.15004
city controller alexander hemphill charged tuesday that the bids on the frankford elevated repair project were rigged to the advantage of a private contracting company which had `` an inside track ' ' with the city .	106.07
estimates of the city ' s loss in the $344 , 000 job have ranged as high as $200 , 000 .	80.14364
hemphill said that the hughes steel erection co . contracted to do the work at an impossibly low cost with a bid that was far less than the `` legitimate ' ' bids of competing contractors .	89.910355
the hughes concern then took `` shortcuts ' ' on the project but got paid anyway , hemphill said .	83.21402
the controller ' s charge of rigging was the latest development in an investigation which also brought these disclosures tuesday	165.03929
the city has sued for the full amount of the $172 , 400 performance bond covering the contract .	136.52226
the philadelphia transportation co . is investigating the part its organization played in reviewing the project .	305.84436
the signature of harold v . varani , former director of architecture and engineering in the department of public property , appeared on payment vouchers certifying work on the project .	86.20824
varani has been fired on charges of accepting gifts from the contractor .	45.321194
managing director donald c . wagner has agreed to cooperate fully with hemphill after a period of sharp disagreement on the matter .	75.8631
the announcement that the city would sue for recovery on the performance bond was made by city solicitor david berger at a press conference following a meeting in the morning with wagner and other officials of the city and the ptc as well as representatives of an engineering firm that was pulled off the el project before its completion in 1959 .	96.76079
the hughes company and the consolidated industries , inc . , both of 3646 n . 2d st . , filed for reorganization under the federal bankruptcy law .	114.81584
on monday , the hughes concern was formally declared bankrupt after its directors indicated they could not draw up a plan for reorganization .	122.29353
business relations between the companies and city have been under investigation by hemphill and district attorney james c . crumlish , jr . .	32.373592
the suit was filed later in the day in common pleas court 7 against the hughes company and two bonding firms .	281.09772
travelers indemnity co . and the continental casualty co . .	26.557999
at berger ' s direction , the city also intervened in the hughes bankruptcy case in u . s . district court in a move preliminary to filing a claim there .	90.4229
`` i am taking the position that the contract was clearly violated ' ' , berger said .	57.705784
the contract violations mostly involve failure to perform rehabilitation work on expansion joints along the el track .	136.93666
the contract called for overhauling of 102 joints .	4.312232
the city paid for work on 75 , of which no more than 21 were repaired , hemphill charged .	117.95359
hemphill said the hughes concern contracted to do the repairs at a cost of $500 for each joint .	133.29622
the bid from a . belanger and sons of cambridge , mass . , which listed the same officers as hughes , was $600 per joint .	157.64447
but , hemphill added , bids from other contractors ranged from $2400 to $3100 per joint .	75.91492
berger ' s decision to sue for the full amount of the performance bond was questioned by wagner in the morning press conference .	76.1566
wagner said the city paid only $37 , 500 to the hughes company .	26.450632
`` we won ' t know the full amount until we get a full report ' ' , wagner said .	75.01048
`` we can claim on the maximum amount of the bond ' ' , berger said .	15.973823
wagner replied , `` can ' t you just see the headline ' city hooked for $172 , 000 ' ' ' ? ?	106.004974
berger insisted that `` we know enough to sue for the full amount ' ' .	41.198208
douglas m . pratt , president of the ptc , who attended the meeting , said the transit company is reviewing the work on the el .	111.09994
`` we want to find out who knew about it ' ' , pratt said .	20.29676
`` certain people must have known about it ' ' .	8.205389
`` the ptc is investigating the whole matter ' ' , pratt said .	34.438595
samuel d . goodis , representing the philadelphia hotel association , objected on tuesday to a proposed boost by the city in licensing fees , saying that occupancy rates in major hotels here ranged from 48 to 74 percent last year .	110.72407
goodis voiced his objection before city council ' s finance committee .	47.31481
for hotels with 1000 rooms , the increased license fee would mean an expense of $5000 a year , goodis said .	118.57012
his testimony came during a hearing on a bill raising fees for a wide variety of licenses , permits and city services .	92.44203
the new fees are expected to raise an additional $740 , 000 in the remainder of 1961 and $2 , 330 , 000 more a year after that .	50.271988
the ordinance would increase the fee for rooming houses , hotels and multi-family dwellings to $5 a room .	88.448204
the cost of a license now is $2 , with an annual renewal fee of $1 .	36.517197
goodis said that single rooms account for 95 percent of the accomodations in some hotels .	83.54819
the city expects the higher rooming house , hotel and apartment house fees to bring in an additional $457 , 000 a year .	86.72745
the increase also was opposed by leonard kaplan , spokesman for the home builders association of philadelphia , on behalf of association members who operate apartment houses .	141.98479
a proposal to raise dog license fees drew an objection from councilwoman virginia knauer , who formerly raised pedigreed dogs .	88.14876
the ordinance would increase fees from $1 for males and $2 for females to a flat $5 a dog .	249.05196
mrs . knauer said she did not think dog owners should be penalized for the city ' s services to animal care .	103.2054
in reply , deputy police commissioner howard r . leary said that the city spends more than $115 , 000 annually to license and regulate dogs but collects only $43 , 000 in fees .	86.96088
he reported that the city ' s contributions for animal care included $67 , 000 to the women ' s s . p . c . a .	51.520653
$15 , 000 to pay six policemen assigned as dog catchers and $15 , 000 to investigate dog bites .	64.83863
city finance director richard j . mcconnell indorsed the higher fees , which , he said , had been under study for more than a year .	88.63021
the city is not adequately compensated for the services covered by the fees , he said .	78.65336
the new fee schedule also was supported by commissioner of licenses and inspections barnet lieberman and health commissioner eugene a . gillis .	133.15125

the petitions will be presented in open court to president judge william f . dannehower , davenport said .	130.61928

victim of the accident was robert lee stansbery , 39 .	61.94934

the city planning commission on tuesday approved agreements between two redevelopers and the redevelopment authority for the purchase of land in the $300 , 000 , 000 eastwick redevelopment area project .	54.00416
the commission also approved a novel plan that would eliminate traffic hazards for pedestrians in the project .	91.527824
one of the agreements calls for the new eastwick corp . to purchase a 1311 acre tract for $12 , 192 , 865 .	106.18558
the tract is bounded by island ave . , dicks ave . , 61st st . , and eastwick ave . .	135.25607
it is designated as stage 1 residential on the redevelopment authority ' s master plan and will feature row houses , garden apartments , four small parks , schools , churches , a shopping center and several small clusters of stores .	92.57234
the corporation was formed by the reynolds metal co . and the samuel a . and henry a . berger firm , a philadelphia builder , for work in the project .	122.65397
the second agreement permits the authority to sell a 520-acre tract west of stage 1 residential to philadelphia builders eastwick corp . , a firm composed of 10 philadelphia area builders , which is interested in developing part of the project .	77.889854
the plan for eliminating traffic hazards for pedestrians was developed by dr . constantinos a . doxiadis , former minister of reconstruction in greece and a consulting planner for the new eastwick corp . .	80.75319
the plan calls for dividing the project into 16 sectors which would be barred to vehicular traffic .	50.90511
it provides for a series of landscaped walkways and a central esplanade that would eventually run through the center of the entire two-and-a-half-mile length of the project .	76.13166
the esplanade eliminates grovers ave . , which on original plans ran through the center of the development .	102.422806
the esplanade would feature pedestrian bridges over roads in the project .	20.770267
kansas city , mo . , feb . 9 ( upi )	36.867092
-- the president of the kansas city local of the international association of fire fighters was severly injured today when a bomb tore his car apart as he left home for work .	130.45377
battalion chief stanton m . gladden , 42 , the central figure in a representation dispute between the fire fighters association and the teamsters union , suffered multiple fractures of both ankles .	47.740604
the battalion chief said he had just gotten into his 1958 model automobile to move it from the driveway of his home so that he could take his other car to work .	111.3525
`` i ' d just turned on the ignition when there was a big flash and i was lying on the driveway ' ' , he said .	50.54694
gladden ' s wife and two of his sons , john , 17 , and jim , 13 , were inside the house .	141.66565
the younger boy said the blast knocked him out of bed and against the wall .	47.790703
the explosion sent the hood of the car flying over the roof of the house .	41.21262
the left front wheel landed 100 feet away .	5.5307646
police laboratory technicians said the explosive device , containing either tnt or nitroglycerine , was apparently placed under the left front wheel .	182.7843
it was first believed the bomb was rigged to the car ' s starter .	26.127771
gladden had been the target of threatening telephone calls in recent months and reportedly received one last night .	76.33967
the fire department here has been torn for months by dissension involving top personnel and the fight between the fire fighters association and the teamsters union .	67.8778
gladden has been an outspoken critic of the present city administration and led his union ' s battle against the teamsters , which began organizing city firemen in 1959 .	92.64202
the fire fighters association here offered a $5 , 000 reward for information leading to the arrest of the person or persons responsible for the bombing .	63.75149
a $500 reward was offered by the association ' s local in kansas city , kas . .	79.41393
the association said it would post 24 hour guards at gladden ' s home and at those of james mining and eugene shiflett .	79.61298
mining is secretary-treasurer of the local and shiflett is a member of its executive committee .	58.018745
ankara , turkey , oct . 24 ( ap )	2.12407
-- turkish political leaders bowed today to military pressure and agreed to form an emergency national front government with gen . cemal gursel as president .	183.7284
an agreement between the leaders of four parties which contested indecisive elections on oct . 15 was reached after almost 18 hours of political bargaining under the threat of an army coup d ' etat .	96.29617
by-passing the military junta which has ruled turkey since the overthrow of premier adnan menderes 17 months ago , the army general staff , led by gen . cedvet sunay , had set a deadline for the parties to join in a national coalition government .	84.47408
the army leaders threatened to form a new military government if the parties failed to sign an eight point protocol agreeing on gen . gursel as president .	143.69244
gen . gursel has headed the military junta the last 17 months .	118.20962
the military also had demanded pledges that there would be no changes in the laws passed by the junta and no leaders of the menderes regime now in prison would be pardoned .	67.10921
party leaders came out of the final meeting apparently satisfied and stated that complete agreement had been reached on a solution to the crisis created by the elections which left no party with enough strength to form a government on its own .	149.44643
vincent g . ierulli has been appointed temporary assistant district attorney , it was announced monday by charles e . raymond , district attorney .	34.39951
ierulli will replace desmond d . connall who has been called to active military service but is expected back on the job by march 31 .	91.744385
ierulli , 29 , has been practicing in portland since november , 1959 .	111.58536
he is a graduate of portland university and the northwestern college of law .	109.36226
he is married and the father of three children .	8.740336
helping foreign countries to build a sound political structure is more important than aiding them economically , e . m . martin , assistant secretary of state for economic affairs told members of the world affairs council monday night .	56.713566
martin , who has been in office in washington , d . c . , for 13 months spoke at the council ' s annual meeting at the multnomah hotel .	33.20924
he told some 350 persons that the united states ' challenge was to help countries build their own societies their own ways , following their own paths .	176.05936
`` we must persuade them to enjoy a way of life which , if not identical , is congenial with ours ' ' , he said but adding that if they do not develop the kind of society they themselves want it will lack ritiuality and loyalty .	71.79701
insuring that the countries have a freedom of choice , he said , was the biggest detriment to the soviet union .	38.688297
he cited east germany where after 15 years of soviet rule it has become necessary to build a wall to keep the people in , and added , `` so long as people rebel , we must not give up ' ' .	117.01553
martin called for patience on the part of americans .	78.34695
`` the countries are trying to build in a decade the kind of society we took a century to build ' ' , he said .	55.56798
by leaving our doors open the united states gives other peoples the opportunity to see us and to compare , he said .	138.08136
`` we have no reason to fear failure , but we must be extraordinarily patient ' ' , the assistant secretary said .	41.166767
economically , martin said , the united states could best help foreign countries by helping them help themselves .	144.82448
private business is more effective than government aid , he explained , because individuals are able to work with the people themselves .	82.35666
the united states must plan to absorb the exported goods of the country , at what he termed a `` social cost ' ' .	60.18402
martin said the government has been working to establish firmer prices on primary products which may involve the total income of one country .	136.87294
the portland school board was asked monday to take a positive stand towards developing and coordinating with portland ' s civil defense more plans for the city ' s schools in event of attack .	89.61041
but there seemed to be some difference of opinion as to how far the board should go , and whose advice it should follow .	152.82988
the board members , after hearing the coordination plea from mrs . ralph h . molvar , 1409 sw maplecrest dr . , said they thought they had already been cooperating .	179.67714
chairman c . richard mears pointed out that perhaps this was not strictly a school board problem , in case of atomic attack , but that the board would cooperate so far as possible to get the children to where the parents wanted them to go .	102.41103
dr . melvin w . barnes , superintendent , said he thought the schools were waiting for some leadership , perhaps on the national level , to make sure that whatever steps of planning they took would `` be more fruitful ' ' , and that he had found that other school districts were not as far along in their planning as this district .	121.53176
`` los angeles has said they would send the children to their homes in case of disaster ' ' , he said .	47.814007
i think everybody is agreed that we need to hear some voice on the national level that would make some sense and in which we would have some confidence in following .	82.59503
mrs . molvar , who kept reiterating her request that they `` please take a stand ' ' , said , `` we must have faith in somebody -- on the local level , and it wouldn ' t be possible for everyone to rush to a school to get their children ' ' .	60.023384
dr . barnes said that there seemed to be feeling that evacuation plans , even for a high school where there were lots of cars `` might not be realistic and would not work ' ' .	90.36591
mrs . molvar asked again that the board join in taking a stand in keeping with jack lowe ' s program .	175.82143
the board said it thought it had gone as far as instructed so far and asked for more information to be brought at the next meeting .	110.7019
it was generally agreed that the subject was important and the board should be informed on what was done , is going to be done and what it thought should be done .	105.29254

a stronger stand on their beliefs and a firmer grasp on their future were taken friday by delegates to the 29th general council of the assemblies of god , in session at the memorial coliseum .	90.84097
the council revised , in an effort to strengthen , the denomination ' s 16 basic beliefs adopted in 1966 .	152.6281
the changes , unanimously adopted , were felt necessary in the face of modern trends away from the bible .	82.76957
the council agreed it should more firmly state its belief in and dependence on the bible .	156.98975
at the adoption , the rev . t . f . zimmerman , general superintendent , commented , `` the assemblies of god has been a bulwark for fundamentalism in these modern days and has , without compromise , stood for the great truths of the bible for which men in the past have been willing to give their lives ' ' .	55.45887
however , the first belief stood for entire revision with a new third point added to the list .	276.7459
the first of 16 beliefs of the denomination , now reads	240.5237
`` the scriptures , both old and new testament , are verbally inspired of god and are the revelation of god to man , the infallible , authoritative rule of faith and conduct ' ' .	77.22086
the third belief , in six points , emphasizes the diety of the lord jesus christ , and	19.676485
-- and his exaltation to the right hand of god .	14.263973
friday afternoon the rev . t . f . zimmerman was reelected for his second consecutive two-year term as general superintendent of assemblies of god .	66.80395
his offices are in springfield , mo . .	29.943335
friday night the delegates heard the need for their forthcoming program , `` breakthrough ' ' scheduled to fill the churches for the next two years .	86.29094
in his opening address wednesday the rev . mr . zimmerman , urged the delegates to consider a 10-year expansion program , with `` breakthrough ' ' the theme for the first two years .	69.86757
the rev . r . l . brandt , national secretary of the home missions department , stressed the need for the first two years ' work .	160.74692
`` surveys show that one out of three americans has vital contact with the church .	206.45094
this means that more than 100 million have no vital touch with the church or religious life ' ' , he told delegates friday .	81.91956
talking of the rapid population growth ( upwards of 12 , 000 babies born daily ) with an immigrant entering the united states every 1-1/2 minutes , he said `` our organization has not been keeping pace with this challenge ' ' .	99.402466
`` in 35 years we have opened 7 , 000 churches ' ' , the rev . mr . brandt said , adding that the denomination had a national goal of one church for every 10 , 000 persons .	44.834503
`` in this light we need 1 , 000 churches in illinois , where we have 200	78.1616
800 in southern new england , we have 60	454.3158
we need 100 in rhode island , we have none ' ' , he said .	17.179657
to step up the denomination ' s program , the rev . mr . brandt suggested the vision of 8 , 000 new assemblies of god churches in the next 10 years .	63.866257
to accomplish this would necessitate some changes in methods , he said .	83.97191
`` the church ' s ability to change her methods is going to determine her ability to meet the challenge of this hour ' ' .	67.07961
-- encouraging by every means , all existing assemblies of god churches to start new churches .	218.9282

-- arranging for ministerial graduates to spend from 6-12 months as apprentices in well-established churches .	288.32483
u . s . dist . judge charles l . powell denied all motions made by defense attorneys monday in portland ' s insurance fraud trial .	120.19064
denials were of motions of dismissal , continuance , mistrial , separate trial , acquittal , striking of testimony and directed verdict .	51.016975
in denying motions for dismissal , judge powell stated that mass trials have been upheld as proper in other courts and that `` a person may join a conspiracy without knowing who all of the conspirators are ' ' .	143.35812
attorney dwight l . schwab , in behalf of defendant philip weinstein , argued there is no evidence linking weinstein to the conspiracy , but judge powell declared this is a matter for the jury to decide .	71.82139
schwab also declared there is no proof of weinstein ' s entering a conspiracy to use the u . s . mails to defraud , to which federal prosecutor a . lawrence burbank replied	47.630367
`` it is not necessary that a defendant actually have conpired to use the u . s . mails to defraud as long as there is evidence of a conspiracy , and the mails were then used to carry it out ' ' .	48.221737
in the afternoon , defense attorneys began the presentation of their cases with opening statements , some of which had been deferred until after the government had called witnesses and presented its case .	125.87741
-- the orioles tonight retained the distinction of being the only winless team among the eighteen major-league clubs as they dropped their sixth straight spring exhibition decision , this one to the kansas city athletics by a score of 5 to 3 .	176.41475
indications as late as the top of the sixth were that the birds were to end their victory draught as they coasted along with a 3-to-o advantage .	201.75269
over the first five frames , jack fisher , the big righthander who figures to be in the middle of oriole plans for a drive on the 1961 american league pennant , held the a ' s scoreless while yielding three scattered hits .	138.25311
then dick hyde , submarine-ball hurler , entered the contest and only five batters needed to face him before there existed a 3-to-3 deadlock .	295.09122
a two-run homer by norm siebern and a solo blast by bill tuttle tied the game , and single runs in the eighth and ninth gave the athletics their fifth victory in eight starts .	151.94109
with one down in the eighth , marv throneberry drew a walk and stole second as hyde fanned tuttle .	104.75419
catcher frank house ' s throw in an effort to nab throneberry was wide and in the dirt .	76.758995
then heywood sullivan , kansas city catcher , singled up the middle and throneberry was across with what proved to be the winning run .	81.00974
rookie southpaw george stepanovich relieved hyde at the start of the ninth and gave up the a ' s fifth tally on a walk to second baseman dick howser , a wild pitch , and frank cipriani ' s single under shortstop jerry adair ' s glove into center .	60.0963
the orioles once again performed at the plate in powderpuff fashion , gathering only seven blows off the offerings of three kansas city pitchers .	123.75545
three were doubles , brooks robinson getting a pair and marv breeding one .	56.31012
bill kunkel , bob hartman and ed keegan did the mound chores for the club down from west palm beach to play the game before 767 paying customers in miami stadium .	161.0846
the birds got five hits and all three of their runs off kunkel before hartman took over in the top of the fourth .	91.34963
hartman , purchased by the a ' s from the milwaukee braves last fall , allowed no hits in his scoreless three-inning appearance , and merited the triumph .	128.6447
keegan , a 6-foot-3-inch 158-pounder , gave up the orioles ' last two safeties over the final three frames , escaping a load of trouble in the ninth when the birds threatened but failed to tally .	103.400116

-- a texas halfback who doesn ' t even know the team ' s plays , eldon moritz , ranks fourth in southwest conference scoring after three games .	131.22658
time stands still every time moritz , a 26-year-old army signal corps veteran , goes into the field .	164.63464
although he never gets to play while the clock is running , he gets a big kick -- several every saturday , in fact -- out of football .	191.09349

that ' s because he already has kicked 14 extra points in 15 tries .	188.93736
he ran his string of successful conversions this season to 13 straight before one went astray last saturday night in the 41-8 slaughter of washington state .	290.5355
moritz is listed on the longhorn roster as a right halfback , the position at which he lettered on the 1956 team .	153.24147
but ask coach darrell royal what position he plays and you ' ll get the quick response , `` place-kicker ' ' .	45.320236
a 208-pound , 6-foot 1-inch senior from stamford , moritz practices nothing but place-kicking .	220.99687
last year , when he worked out at halfback all season , he didn ' t get into a single game .	50.688038

`` so i started practicing on it in spring training .	76.59476

`` i kicked about 110 extra points in 135 tries during three years in high school ' ' , he said , `` and made 26 in a row at one time .	56.18489

moritz came to texas in 1954 but his freshman football efforts were hampered by a knee injury .	62.579
he missed the 1955 season because of an operation on the ailing knee , then played 77 minutes in 1956 .	86.1206

both , of course , were remarkable feats and further embossed the fact that baseball rightfully is the national pastime .	69.40873
of the two cherished achievements the elderly spahn ' s hitless pitching probably reached the most hearts .	121.40208
it was a real stimulant to a lot of guys i know who have moved past the 2-score-year milestone .	306.42096
and one of the milwaukee rookies sighed and remarked , `` wish i was 40 , and a top-grade big leaguer .	151.93036
the modest and happy spahn waved off his new laurels as one of those good days .	130.71902
but there surely can be no doubt about the slender southpaw belonging with the all-time great lefthanders in the game ' s history .	41.282837
yes , with bob grove , carl hubbell , herb pennock , art nehf , vernon gomez , et al .	32.64958
spahn not only is a superior pitcher but a gentlemanly fine fellow , a ball player ' s ball player , as they say in the trade .	76.7186
i remember his beardown performance in a meaningless exhibition game at bears stadium oct . 14 , 1951 , before a new record crowd for the period of 18 , 792 .	108.001854
`` spahnie doesn ' t know how to merely go through the motions ' ' , remarked enos slaughter , another all-out guy , who played rightfield that day and popped one over the clubhouse .	186.71231
the spectacular mays , who reaches a decade in the big leagues come may 25 , joined six other sluggers who walloped four home runs in a span of nine innings .	75.71258
incidentally , only two did it before a home audience .	327.2592
bobby lowe of boston was the first to hit four at home and gil hodges turned the trick in brooklyn ' s ebbetts field .	226.25447
ed delahanty and chuck klein of the phillies , the braves ' joe adcock , lou gehrig of the yankees , pat seerey of the white sox and rocky colavito , then with cleveland , made their history on the road .	63.647186
willie ' s big day revived the running argument about the relative merits of mays and mickey mantle .	39.74992
this is an issue which boils down to a matter of opinion , depending on whether you ' re an american or national fan and anti or pro-yankee .	111.1171
the record books , however , would favor the giants ' ace .	41.930176
in four of his nine previous seasons mays hit as many as 25 home runs and stole as many as 25 bases .	78.908195
willie ' s lifetime batting average of is 11 points beyond mickey ' s .	544.1051
the giants who had been anemic with the bat in their windy candlestick park suddenly found the formula in milwaukee ' s park .	119.78134
it will forever be a baseball mystery how a team will suddenly start hitting after a distressing slump .	407.2511
the denver-area tv audience was privileged to see mays ' four home runs , thanks to a new arrangement made by bob howsam that the games are not to be blacked out when his bears are playing at home .	146.10316
this rule providing for a blackout of televised baseball 30 minutes before the start of a major or minor league game in any area comes from the game ' s top rulers .	68.12405
the last couple of years the bears management got the business from the `` living room athletic club ' ' when games were cut off .	144.64394
actually they were helpless to do anything about the nationwide policy .	209.50699
this year , i am told , the cbs network will continue to abide by the rule but nbc will play to a conclusion here .	170.17097
there are two more sunday afternoons when the situation will arise .	323.9744
it is an irritable rule that does baseball more harm than good , especially at the minor league level .	63.79729
you would be surprised how many fans purposely stayed away from bears stadium last year because of the television policy .	145.81789
this dissatisfaction led to howsam ' s request that the video not be terminated before the end of the game .	51.37384
-- the powerful new york yankees won their 19th world series in a 5-game romp over outclassed cincinnati , crushing the reds in a humiliating 13-5 barrage monday in the loosely played finale .	71.36315
with mickey mantle and yogi berra both out of action due to injuries , the american league champs still mounted a 15-hit attack against a parade of eight cincinnati pitchers , the most ever used by one team in a series game .	105.156166
johnny blanchard , mantle ' s replacement , slammed a 2-run homer as the yankees routed loser joey jay in a 5-run first inning .	48.112637
hector lopez , subbing for berra , smashed a 3-run homer off bill henry during another 5-run explosion in the fourth .	134.8726
the yanks also took advantage of three cincinnati errors .	88.3802
the crowd of 32 , 589 had only two chances to applaud .	101.46557
in the third frank robinson hammered a long home run deep into the corner of the bleachers in right center , about 400 feet away , with two men on .	127.992676
momentarily the reds were back in the ball game , trailing only 6-3 , but the drive fizzled when john edwards fouled out with men on second and third and two out .	156.30621
in the fifth , wally post slashed a 2-run homer off bud daley , but by that time the score was 11-5 and it really didn ' t matter .	84.84725
the yankee triumph made ralph houk only the third man to lead a team to both a pennant and a world series victory in his first year as a manager .	130.10954
only bucky harris , the `` boy-manager ' ' of washington in 1924 , and eddie dyer of the st . louis cardinals in 1946 had accomplished the feat .	30.171665
-- nick skorich , the line coach for the football champion philadelphia eagles , was elevated today to head coach .	81.474686
skorich received a three-year contract at a salary believed to be between $20 , 000 and $25 , 000 a year .	52.740414
he succeeds buck shaw , who retired at the end of last season .	20.68663
the appointment was announced at a news conference at which skorich said he would retain two members of shaw ' s staff -- jerry williams and charlie gauer .	81.40126
skorich was considered the logical choice after the club gave norm van brocklin permission to seek the head coaching job with the minnesota vikings , the newest national football league entry .	112.54234
van brocklin , the quarterback who led the eagles to the title , was signed by the vikings last wednesday .	101.31512
philadelphia permitted him to seek a better connection after he had refused to reconsider his decision to end his career as a player .	71.43901
with skorich at the helm , the eagles are expected to put more emphasis on running , rather than passing .	131.20349
in the past the club depended largely on van brocklin ' s aerials .	66.78742
skorich , however , is a strong advocate of a balanced attack -- split between running and passing .	243.65569
skorich , who is 39 years old , played football at cincinnati university and then had a three-year professional career as a lineman under jock sutherland with the pittsburgh steelers .	129.6981
an injury forced skorich to quit after the 1948 season .	154.78699
he began his coaching career at pittsburgh central catholic high school in 1949 .	83.90907
he remained there for four years before moving to rensselaer polytechnic institute in troy , n . y . .	84.47574
he was there one season before rejoining the steelers as an assistant coach .	55.40152
four years later he resigned to take a similar job with the green bay packers .	229.35626
the eagles signed him for shaw ' s staff in 1959 .	77.54887

the 53-year-old shea , a prominent corporation lawyer with a sports background , is generally recognized as the man most responsible for the imminent return of a national league club to new york .	79.89749
named by mayor wagner three years ago to head a committee that included james a . farley , bernard gimbel and clint blume , shea worked relentlessly .	186.46532
his goal was to obtain a national league team for this city .	158.40024
the departure of the giants and the dodgers to california left new york with only the yankees .	150.98233
despite countless barriers and disappointments , shea moved forward .	47.933697
when he was unable to bring about immediate expansion , he sought to convince another national league club to move here .	161.0201

the continental league never got off the ground , but after two years it forced the existing majors to expand .	129.3092
the new york franchise is headed by mrs . charles shipman payson .	57.176205

he merely became victimized by a form of athletics that respects no one and aggravates all .	231.39519

then the pixies and the zombies took over while the banshees wailed in the distance .	178.23792
on the narrow fairway of a 508-yard hole , arnold whipped into his second shot .	60.63462

he tried again and once more sliced out of bounds .	20.474596
he hooked the next two out of bounds on the opposite side .	11.853751
`` it is possible that i over-corrected ' ' , he said ruefully .	12.170029
each of the four wayward shots cost him two strokes .	36.13094

the baltimore and ohio railroad announced yesterday it would reduce the total amount of its payroll by 10 per cent through salary cuts and lay-offs effective at 12 01 a . m . next saturday .	117.49604
the current monthly payroll comes to about $15 , 000 , 000 .	4.0966554
howard e . simpson , the railroad ' s president , said , `` a drastic decline in freight loading due principally to the severe slump in the movement of heavy goods has necessitated this regrettable action ' ' .	100.53338
the reduction in expenses will affect employees in the thirteen states in which the b . & o . operates .	29.14692
a flat reduction of 10 per cent in the salary of all officers , supervisors and other employees not belonging to unions .	132.16136
there are about 3 , 325 officers and employees in this class .	20.176239
sufficient lay-offs of union employees to bring about a 10 per cent cut in the union payroll expense .	52.86185
since the railroad cannot reduce the salary of individual union members under contract , it must accomplish its payroll reduction by placing some of the men on furlough , a b . & o . spokesman said .	114.182144
those union members kept on their jobs , therefore , will not take a cut in their wages .	67.235435
the spokesman said the number to be furloughed cannot be estimated since the lay-offs must be carried out in each area depending on what men are most needed on the job .	91.305824

-- the anne arundel county school superintendent has asked that the board of education return to the practice of recording its proceedings mechanically so that there will be no more question about who said what .	90.21286
the proposal was made by dr . david s . jenkins after he and mrs . d . ellwood williams , jr . , a board member and long-time critic of the superintendent , argued for about fifteen minutes at this week ' s meeting .	52.642292
the disagreement was over what dr . jenkins had said at a previous session and how his remarks appeared in the minutes presented at the following meeting .	123.761696
mrs . williams had a list which she said contained about nine or ten discrepancies between her memory of dr . jenkins ' s conversation and how they were written up for the board ' s approval .	83.39296
`` i hate to have these things come up again and again ' ' , dr . jenkins commented as he made his suggestion .	41.115253
`` these are the board ' s minutes .	6.562122
i ' ll write what you tell me to ' ' .	10.684894
for a number of years the board used a machine to keep a permanent record but abandoned the practice about two years ago .	125.92418
it was about that time , a board member said later , that dr . thomas g . pullen , jr . , state superintendent of schools , told dr . jenkins and a number of other education officials that he would not talk to them with a recording machine sitting in front of him .	68.18404
the board of county commissioners , the sanitary commission , the planning and zoning board and other county official bodies use recording machines for all public business in order to prevent law suits and other misunderstandings about what actually happened at their meetings .	252.28249
dr . jenkins notes , however , that most of the school boards in the state do not do so .	52.290054

the vice president of the city council complained yesterday that there are `` deficiencies ' ' in the city ' s snow clearing program which should be corrected as soon as possible .	47.96861
councilman william d . schaefer ( d . , fifth ) said in a letter to mayor grady that plowing and salting crews should be dispatched earlier in storms and should be kept on the job longer than they were last month .	192.66766
conceding that several cities to the north were in worse shape than baltimore after the last storm , mr . schaefer listed several improvements he said should be made in the snow plan here .	120.596176
he said the snow plan was put in effect too slowly in december .	234.51364
equipment should be in operation `` almost immediately after the first snowfall ' ' , mr . schaefer said .	35.414364
the councilman , who is the administration floor leader , also criticized bernard l . werner , public works director , for `` halting snow operations ' ' on tuesday night after the sunday storm .	110.54877
mr . werner said yesterday that operations continued through the week .	35.408386
what he did , mr . werner said , was let manual laborers go home tuesday night for some rest .	101.96149
mr . schaefer also recommended that the snow emergency route plan , under which parking is banned on key streets and cars are required to use snow tires or chains on them , should be `` strictly enforced ' ' .	107.522896
admitting that main streets and the central business district should have priority , the councilman said it is also essential that small shopping areas `` not be overlooked if our small merchants are to survive ' ' .	135.37848
recounting personal observations of clearance work , the councilman cited instances of inefficient use of equipment or supplies by poorly trained workers and urged that plow blades be set so they do not leave behind a thin layer of snow which eventually freezes .	143.82063

maryland contracts for future construction during october totaled $77 , 389 , 000 , up to 10 per cent compared to october , 1960 , f . w . dodge , dodge corporation , reported .	69.52513
nonresidential at $20 , 447 , 000 , down 28 per cent	87.22492
residential at $47 , 101 , 000 , up 100 per cent	23.376049
and heavy engineering at $9 , 841 , 000 , down 45 per cent .	33.802322
the cumulative total of construction contracts for the first ten months of 1961 amounted to $634 , 517 , 000 , a 4 per cent increase compared to the corresponding period of last year .	67.66207
nonresidential at $253 , 355 , 000 , up 22 per cent	63.674747
residential at $278 , 877 , 000 , up 12 per cent	22.494316
and heavy engineering at $102 , 285 , 000 , down 33 per cent .	36.339172
residential building consists of houses , apartments , hotels , dormitories and other buildings designed for shelter .	96.79248
the share of the new housing market enjoyed by apartments , which began about six years ago , has more than tripled within that span of time .	102.919525
in 1961 , it is estimated that multiple unit dwellings will account for nearly 30 per cent of the starts in residential construction .	69.11977
while availability of mortgage money has been a factor in encouraging apartment construction , the generally high level of prosperity in the past few years plus rising consumer income are among the factors that have encouraged builders to concentrate in the apartment-building field .	153.28612
although economic and personal circumstances vary widely among those now choosing apartments , leo j . pantas , vice president of a hardware manufacturing company , pointed out recently that many apartment seekers seem to have one characteristic in common a desire for greater convenience and freedom from the problems involved in maintaining a house .	137.15622
`` convenience is therefore the key to the housing market today .	128.90332
trouble-free , long-life , quality components will play an increasingly important part in the merchandising of new housing in 1960 ' ' , pantas predicted .	104.97316
sixty-seven living units are being added to the 165-unit harbor view apartments in the cherry hill section .	1071.2429
ultimately the development will comprise 300 units , in two-story and three-story structures .	72.598656
various of the apartments are of the terrace type , being on the ground floor so that entrance is direct .	131.91628
others , which are reached by walking up a single flight of stairs , have balconies .	64.34922
the structures housing the apartments are of masonry and frame construction .	60.34365
heating is by individual gas-fired , forced warm air systems .	90.26088
construction in 1962 will account for about 15 per cent of the gross national product , according to a study by johns-manville corporation .	47.70755
-- vital secrets of britain ' s first atomic submarine , the dreadnought , and , by implication , of the entire united states navy ' s still-building nuclear sub fleet , were stolen by a london-based soviet spy ring , secret service agents testified today .	80.10211
the dreadnought was built on designs supplied by the united states in 1959 and was launched last year .	24.72967
it is a killer sub -- that is , a hunter of enemy subs .	115.77536
it has a hull patterned on that of the united states navy ' s nautilus , the world ' s first atomic submarine .	24.590258
its power unit , however , was derived from the reactor of the more modern american nuclear submarine skipjack .	31.992027
the announcement that the secrets of the dreadnought had been stolen was made in bow st . police court here at the end of a three day hearing .	140.73946
two british civil servants , miss ethel gee , 46 , and her newly devoted friend , harry houghton , 55 , and divorced .	66.61147
they are accused of whisking secrets out of naval strongrooms over which they kept guard .	376.92368
gordon a . lonsdale , 37 , a mystery man presumed to be russian although he carries a canadian passport .	109.37781
when arrested , he had the submarine secrets on a roll of candid camera film as well as anti-submarine secrets in christmas gift wrapping , it was testified .	76.29956
a shadowy couple who call themselves peter kroger , bookseller , and wife , joyce .	55.69303
( in washington , the federal bureau of investigation identified the krogers as morris and lola cohen , an american couple formerly of new york city )	77.87314
in their suburban cottage the crown charges , the krogers received secrets from the mystery man , usually on the first saturday evening of each month , and spent much of the week-end getting the secrets off to moscow , either on a powerful transmitter buried under the kitchen floor or as dots posted over period marks in used books .	171.67549
each dot on magnification resumed its original condition as a drawing , a printed page , or a manuscript .	100.63012
her young british lawyer , james dunlop , pleaded that she was sorely needed at her portland home by her widowed mother , 80 , her maiden aunt , also 80 and bedridden for 20 years , and her uncle , 76 , who once ran a candy shop .	142.44675
`` i am not prepared to grant bail to any of them ' ' , said the magistrate , k . j . p . baraclough .	35.73886
the trial will be held , probably the first week of march , in the famous old bailey central criminal court where klaus fuchs , the naturalized british german born scientist who succeeded in giving american and british atomic bomb secrets to russia and thereby changed world history during the 1950s , was sentenced to 14 years in prison .	101.04705
fourteen years is the maximum penalty now faced by the new five , who may have altered history in the 1960s .	161.44879
fuchs , after nine and a half years , was released , being given time off for good behavior .	239.60916
the magistrate tonight refused to return to the five $29 , 000 in american and british currency , mostly $20 bills , and in british government bonds and stocks .	68.69345
`` this is russian money ' ' , said mervin griffith-jones for the attorney general ' s office .	55.53302
he asserted that the krogers were the bankers for moscow , lonsdale the red paymaster , and the two civil servants the recipients for selling their country ' s secrets .	101.246925
the fact that secrets of the dreadnought , and thereby of the american undersea fleet , were involved in the spy case had been hinted at earlier .	69.63797
but just before luncheon today the fact was announced grimly by the british navy ' s chief adviser to the cabinet on underwater warfare , capt . george symonds .	80.26093
he said that drawings of the dreadnought and printed details about the ship were found reproduced in an undeveloped roll of film taken from lonsdale when he was arrested with the two civil servants outside the old vic theater saturday afternoon , jan . 7 .	93.394844
the information , he said , would have been of the highest value to a potential enemy .	110.10402
just how many sub secrets were being handed over when the ring , watched for six months , was broken remained untold .	126.738976
the british defending lawyers , who today increased from three to four , demanded to know if they could make the information involved seem of little value to a jury , the chances of their clients would improve .	137.48186
so in the name of justice the magistrate cleared the court of all except officials to allow the captain to elaborate for almost an hour .	122.12919
almost any information about the dreadnought would also reveal secrets about the american underwater fleet .	106.927505
britain began designing the ship in 1956 but got nowhere until the american government decided to end a ban on sharing military secrets with britain that had been imposed after fuchs blabbed .	160.68484
the united states offered to supply a complete set of propelling equipment like that used in the skipjack .	359.35516
with the machinery went a complete design for the hull .	30.426107
the skipjack was a second generation atomic sub , much advanced on the nautilus and the other four which preceded it .	154.46896
`` much of the navy ' s future depends upon her ' ' , an american naval announcement said on the skipjack ' s first arrival in british waters in august , 1959 , for exhibition to selected high officers at portland underwater research station .	89.540276
it was there that the two accused civil servants were at work .	123.1483
`` her basic hull form ( a teardrop ) and her nuclear power plant will be used for almost all new submarines , including the potent polaris missile submarines ' ' , the statement went on .	66.84971
the atom reactor , water cooled , was the result of almost a decade of research at the naval reactors branch of the atomic energy commission and westinghouse electric corp . .	54.774006
thru development , the reactor and its steam turbines had been reduced greatly in size , and also in complexity , allowing a single propeller to be used , the navy said .	74.19307
the hull was also a result of almost a decade of work .	26.824528
it was first tried out on a conventional submarine , the albacore , in 1954 .	91.46391
the skipjack became the fastest submarine ever built .	27.127043
reputedly it could outrun , underwater , the fastest destroyers .	101.06985
it could , reputedly , go 70 , 000 miles without refueling and stay down more than a month .	46.695744
it was of the hunter-killer type , designed to seek out ships and other submarines with its most advanced gear and destroy them with torpedoes .	173.2698
the navy captain disclosed also that a list of questions found in miss gee ' s purse would , if completed and handed back , have given the kremlin a complete picture `` of our current anti-submarine effort and would have shown what we are doing in research and development for the future ' ' .	98.17269
the spy ring also was particularly interested in asdic , the underwater equipment for detecting submarines , it was testified .	84.990234
six radiomen told how , twice on two days after the ring was nabbed , a transmitter near moscow was heard calling , using signals , times and wavelengths specified on codes found hidden in cigaret lighters in lonsdale ' s apartment and the krogers ' house and also fastened to the transmitter lid .	118.35011
oddly , the calls were still heard 11 days after the five were arrested .	43.103653
the charge that the federal indictment of three chicago narcotics detail detectives `` is the product of rumor , combined with malice , and individual enmity ' ' on the part of the federal narcotics unit here was made yesterday in their conspiracy trial before judge joseph sam perry in federal district court .	176.48273
the three -- miles j . cooperman , sheldon teller , and richard austin -- and eight other defendants are charged in six indictments with conspiracy to violate federal narcotic laws .	118.32783
in his opening statement to a jury of eight women and four men , bernard h . sokol , attorney for the detectives , said that evidence would show that his clients were `` entirely innocent ' ' .	78.27749
`` when they became members of the city police narcotics unit ' ' , sokol said , `` they were told they would have to get to know certain areas of chicago in which narcotics were sold and they would have to get to know people in the narcotics racket .	68.572365
they , on occasion , posed as addicts and peddlers ' ' .	9.06667
although federal and city narcotic agents sometimes worked together , sokol continued , rivalries developed when they were `` aiming at the same criminals ' ' .	115.94109
this , he added , brought about `` petty jealousies ' ' and `` petty personal grievances ' ' .	26.52307
`` in the same five year period that the united states says they ( the detectives ) were engaged in this conspiracy ' ' , sokol continued , `` these three young men received a total of 26 creditable mentions and many special compensations , and were nominated for the lambert tree award and the mayor ' s medal ' ' .	86.40025
in opening , d . arthur connelly , assistant united states attorney , read the indictment , but made no comments .	150.74516
attorneys for the eight other defendants said only that there was no proof of their clients ' guilt .	47.6593
cooperman and teller are accused of selling $4 , 700 worth of heroin to a convicted narcotics peddler , otis sears , 45 , of 6934 indiana av . .	89.01546
among other acts , teller and austin are accused of paying $800 to sears .	91.34254
the first witness , moses winston mardis , 5835 michigan av . , a real estate agent and former bail bondsman , took the stand after opening statements had been made .	106.20199
but court adjourned after he testified he introduced james white and jeremiah hope pullings , two of the defendants , and also introduced pullings to jessy maroy , a man mentioned in the indictment but not indicted .	124.438965

-- a jury of seven men and five women found 21-year-old richard pohl guilty of manslaughter yesterday in the bludgeon slaying of mrs . anna hengesbach .	61.934605
he returned to his cell in the county jail , where he has been held since his arrest last july , without a word to his court-appointed attorney , jack walker , or his guard .	91.80846
the verdict brought vindication to the dead woman ' s stepson , vincent hengesbach , 54 , who was tried for the same crime in december , 1958 , and released when the jury failed to reach a verdict .	38.517662
mrs . hengesbach was killed on aug . 31 , 1958 .	20.480986
hengesbach has been living under a cloud ever since .	120.4768
when the verdict came in against his young neighbor , hengesbach said	73.82305
`` i am very pleased to have the doubt of suspicion removed .	469.002
still , i don ' t wish to appear happy at somebody else ' s misfortune ' ' .	29.637423
hengesbach , who has been living on welfare recently , said he hopes to rebuild the farm which was settled by his grandfather in westphalia , 27 miles southwest of here .	178.5593
hengesbach has been living in grand ledge since his house and barn were burned down after his release in 1958 .	101.4171
pohl confessed the arson while being questioned about several fires in the westphalia area by state police .	184.1537
however , the confession , which was the only evidence against him , was retracted before the trial .	136.06863

pohl could receive from 1 to 15 years in prison or probation .	43.590443
walker said he was considering filing a motion for a new trial which would contend that the verdict was against the weight of the evidence and that there were several errors in trial procedure .	98.03806
a verdict against pohl came at 4 05 p . m . after almost 13-1/2 hours of deliberation .	55.642223
the jury , which was locked up in a motel overnight , was canvassed at the request of walker after the verdict was announced .	68.75234
the jury foreman , mrs . olive heideman , of rural elsie , said that a ballot was not even taken until yesterday morning and that the first day of deliberation was spent in going over the evidence .	153.37486
she said the jurors agreed that pohl ' s confession was valid .	100.100945
the jury asked judge cash to send in his written definition of the difference between first and second-degree murder and manslaughter .	51.06061
some 30 spectators remained in the court during the day and were on hand to hear the verdict read .	136.63577
the trial had packed the large courtroom for more than a week .	48.62782
a sterling township family of six surviving children , whose mother died yesterday as the aftermath to a fire that also killed one of the children , found today they had the help of hundreds of neighbors and school friends .	158.75769
while neighbor women assumed some of the dead mother ' s duties , fund-raising events were being planned by a homeowners association and a student council for the hard-hit henry kowalski family , 34220 viceroy .	114.73212
mrs . eleanor kowalski , 42 , died yesterday afternoon in holy cross hospital of burns suffered in a fire that followed a bottled gas explosion saturday night at the flat of her widowed mother , mrs . mary pankowski , in the adjoining suburb of warren .	70.3994
funeral services for mrs . kowalski and her daughter , christine , 11 , who died of burns at the same hospital monday , have been scheduled for 10 a . m . tomorrow in st . anne ' s catholic church , 31978 mound , in warren .	107.20809
the mother and daughter , who will be buried side by side in mt . olivet cemetery , rested together today in closed caskets at the lyle elliott funeral home , 31730 mound , warren .	95.92267
mrs . pankowski , 61 , remained in holy cross hospital as a result of the explosion , which occurred while mrs . kowalski fueled a cook stove in the grandmother ' s small upstairs flat at 2274 eight mile road east .	88.49541
assistant fire chief chester cornell said gas fumes apparently were ignited by a candle which one of the three kowalski girls present held for her mother , because the flat lacked electricity .	217.42947
christine ' s twin sister , patricia , and darlene kowalski , 8 , escaped with minor burns .	80.018394
they are home now with the other kowalski children , vicky , 14	319.40363
`` all we have left in the world is one another , and we must stay together the way mother wanted ' ' , kowalski said in telling his children of their mother ' s death yesterday afternoon .	91.47037
kowalski , a roofer who seldom worked last winter , already was in arrears on their recently purchased split-level home when the tragedy staggered him with medical and funeral bills .	184.50897
neighbor women , such as mrs . sidney baker , 2269 serra , sterling township , have been supplying the family with meals and handling household chores with kowalski ' s sister-in-law , mrs . anna kowalski , 22111 david , east detroit .	95.71359
another neighbor , mrs . frank c . smith , 2731 pall mall , sterling township , surprised kowalski by coming to the home yesterday with $135 collected locally toward the $400 funeral costs .	227.27145

he said contributions also could be mailed to post office box 553 , warren village station .	159.61761
vicky kowalski meanwhile learned that several of her fellow students had collected almost $25 for her family during the lunch hour yesterday at fuhrmann junior high school , 5155 fourteen mile road east .	122.287

but today he wanted to make a public statement .	114.69891

-- two americans and seven cubans were executed by firing squads today as castro military tribunals began decreeing the death penalty for captured invasion forces and suspected collaborators .	112.77844
a havana radio broadcast identified the americans as howard anderson and august jack mcnair .	67.56116
the executions took place at dawn only a few hours after havana radio announced their conviction by a revolutionary tribunal at pinar del rio , where the executions took place .	73.15529

anderson operated three havana automobile service stations and was commander of the havana american legion post before it disbanded since the start of fidel castro ' s regime .	136.5496
anderson ' s wife and four children live in miami .	43.004585
mcnair , 25 , was seized march 20 with four cubans and accused of trying to land a boatload of rifles in pinar del rio , about 35 miles from havana .	74.55569

emory university ' s board of trustees announced friday that it was prepared to accept students of any race as soon as the state ' s tax laws made such a step possible .	104.03697
`` emory university ' s charter and by-laws have never required admission or rejection of students on the basis of race ' ' , board chairman henry l . bowden stated .	85.597824
but an official statement adopted by the 33-man emory board at its annual meeting friday noted that state taxing requirements at present are a roadblock to accepting negroes .	100.49542
the statement explained that under the georgia constitution and state law , tax-exempt status is granted to educational institutions only if they are segregated .	134.21912
`` emory could not continue to operate according to its present standards as an institution of higher learning , of true university grade , and meet its financial obligations , without the tax-exemption privileges which are available to it only so long as it conforms to the aforementioned constitutional and statutory provisions ' ' , the statement said .	97.29544
the statement did not mention what steps might be taken to overcome the legal obstacles to desegregation .	37.677223
an emory spokesman indicated , however , that the university itself did not intend to make any test of the laws .	84.19142
the georgia constitution gives the legislature the power to exempt colleges from property taxation if , among other criteria , `` all endowments to institutions established for white people shall be limited to white people , and all endowments to institutions established for colored people shall be limited to colored people ' ' .	120.46738
at least two private colleges in the atlanta area now or in the past have had integrated student bodies , but their tax-exempt status never has been challenged by the state .	110.20167
some church leaders , both clerical and lay , have criticized the university for not taking the lead in desegregation .	88.56287
the student newspaper , the emory wheel , as early as the fall of 1954 called for desegregation .	129.72087
`` from its beginning ' ' , the trustees ' statement said friday , `` emory university has assumed as its primary commitment a dedication to excellence in christian higher learning .	126.94201
teaching , research and study , according to highest standards , under christian influence , are paramount in the emory university policy .	72.2613
`` as a private institution , supported by generous individuals , emory university will recognize no obligation and will adopt no policy that would conflict with its purpose to promote excellence in scholarship and christian education .	175.77876
`` there is not now , nor has there ever been in emory university ' s charter or by-laws any requirement that students be admitted or rejected on the basis of race , color or creed .	79.99219
insofar as its own governing documents are concerned , emory university could now consider applications from prospective students , and others seeking applications from prospective students , and others seeking the opportunity to study or work at the university , irrespective of race , color or creed .	49.260483
`` on the other hand , emory university derives its corporate existence from the state of georgia .	38.685123
`` when and if it can do so without jeopardizing constitutional and statutory tax-exemption privileges essential to the maintenance of its educational program and facilities , emory university will consider applications of persons desiring to study or work at the university without regard to race , color or creed , continuing university policy that all applications shall be considered on the basis of intellectual and moral standards and other criteria designed to assure the orderly and effective conduct of the university and the fulfillment of its mission as an institution of christian higher education ' ' .	76.57756

the department is planning to expand its eradication program soon to four additional counties -- troup , pierce , bryan and bulloch -- to treat 132 , 000 acres infested by the ants , according to w . e . blasingame state entomologist .	78.70971
low-flying planes will spread a granular-type chemical , heptachlor , over 30 , 000 acres in troup , 37 , 000 acres in pierce and 65 , 000 acres in bulloch and bryan counties .	28.844315
the eradication effort is being pushed in bibb and jones counties , over 37 , 679 acres .	62.222565
the department has just finished treating 20 , 000 acres in urban areas of macon .	29.14628
also being treated are houston , bleckley , tift , turner and dodge counties , blasingame said .	56.907093
the fire ant is thought to infest approximately two million acres of land in georgia , attacking crops , young wildlife and livestock and can be a serious health menace to humans who are allergic to its venom , blasingame said .	102.82525
the north-bound entrance to the expressway at 14th street will be closed during the afternoon rush traffic hours this week .	79.95317
this is being done so that georgia tech can complete the final phase of a traffic survey on the north expressway .	146.10107

-- for a second month in a row , multnomah county may be short of general assistance money in its budget to handle an unusually high summer month ' s need , the state public welfare commission was told friday .	148.92697
it is the only county in the state so far this month reporting a possible shortage in ga category , for which emergency allotment can be given by the state if necessary .	134.18788
william smythe , director of field service , told the commissioners that multnomah , as of aug . 22 , had spent $58 , 918 out of its budgeted $66 , 000 in the category , leaving only $7 , 082 for the rest of the month .	114.43668
at the rate of need indicated in the early weeks of the month , this could mean a shortage of as high as $17 , 000 .	91.75939
but it probably will be less because of a usual slackening during the last weeks of each month , smythe said .	116.961365
no request for emergency allotment had yet been received , however .	86.10483
the commission , meeting for the first time with both of its newly-appointed commissioners , roy webster , of hood river , and dr . ennis keizer , of north bend , approved a year ' s contract for a consultant in the data processing department who has been the center of considerable controversy in the past .	95.92953
the contract with ray field , who has been converting the agencies electronic data processing program to magnetic tape , would renew his present salary of $8 an hour up to a maximum of 200 hours a month .	108.4633
field does the planning for the machine operations and fiscal processes and the adapting of the data processing system to new programs as they are made necessary by legislative and policy changes .	106.62507
acting administrator andrew f . juras said that because of field ' s unique position and knowledge in the program , the agency now would be seriously handicapped if he was not continued for a period .	122.476074
but he emphasized that the agency must train people within its own employ to fulfill what field handles , and he said he personally `` regrets very much that the agency has not done this in the past ' ' .	84.87898
he pointed out to the commissioners that the agency was literally dependent now on the machine processing , `` and the whole wheels of the agency would stop if it broke down or the three or four persons directing it were to leave ' ' .	147.22281
juras said he insisted field be continued on a consultant basis only and be answerable directly to the administrator of the agency and not to other agencies of the government .	63.042362
he also said that the salary , in terms of going rates in the field , was `` modest ' ' in terms of the man ' s responsibility .	62.450996
the conversion to magnetic tape is not yet completed , he said , and added field ' s long service in state government and welfare employ gave him familiarity with the welfare program .	231.44684
`` do you feel you can stand up to the next legislative session and defend this contract ' ' ? ?	91.12158
asked mrs . grace o . peck , representative from multnomah county , of the commission chairman , joseph e . harvey jr . .	64.91434
`` my feeling at the moment ' ' , he said , `` is that we have no alternative , irrespective of some of the arguments about him .	32.51415
the continued operation of this program depends on having his service ' ' .	123.70458
mrs . peck , later joined by the commission ' s vice-chairman , mrs . lee patterson , took harvey to task for comments he had made to the north portland rotary club tuesday .	95.27159
a publicity release from oregon physicians service , of which harvey is president , quoted him as saying the welfare office move to salem , instead of `` crippling ' ' the agency , had provided an avenue to correct administrative weaknesses , with the key being improved communications between f & a and the commission staff .	170.98784
`` i rather resent ' ' , she said , `` you speaking to those groups in portland as though just the move accomplished this .	218.95139
i think you fell short of the real truth in the matter that the move is working out through the fine cooperation of the staff and all the people .	100.68969
