a 16-year-old portland businessman and his junior achievement company , have been judged the `` company of the year ' ' in national competition completed this week at ohio state university , columbus , ohio .	137.54842
tim larson , a junior at wilson high school and president of spice-nice , is the young executive who guided his firm to the top-ranking position over the 4 , 500 other junior achievement companies in the united states and canada .	120.8739
the award is the first such honor in the 11-year history of ja activities in portland , according to ralph scolatti , local executive director for junior achievement .	180.8189
spice-nice , counseled by georgia-pacific corp . , had previously taken first-place honors in both local competition and the regional conference at san francisco .	103.32317
the `` pocket-size ' ' company set records with $2 , 170 in sales of its products , a selection of barbecue spices , and paid stockholders a 20 per cent dividend on their investment .	94.64695
the junior achievement program is designed to give teenagers practical experience in business by allowing them actually to form small companies , under the guidance and sponsorship of business firms .	127.48547
the youngsters sell stock , produce and sell a product , pay taxes , and show a profit or loss just like full-scale businesses .	85.86988
national competition was the culmination of work which began with the school year last fall and continued until just before summer vacation .	232.37486
participants in the 27 portland companies worked one night a week through the school year , guided and counseled by adult advisors drawn from local business and industry .	100.34176
over 400 portland firms contributed funds for the maintenance of junior achievement headquarters here .	71.20567
for winning larson will receive a $100 u . s . savings bond from the junior achievement national organization .	60.02633
his company , spice-nice , will receive a $250 award , which will be distributed among the 16 charter members .	103.49611
advisors for the `` national champion ' ' company were john k . morgan , william h . baker , leonard breuer and william f . stephenson , all of georgia-pacific corp . .	57.687214
young larson is the son of mr . and mrs . lawrence larson , 5847 sw nevada ct . , portland .	100.964165

-- the fbi yesterday arrested on a perjury charge one of the members of the jury that failed to reach a verdict in the `` freedom rider ' ' bus burning trial four weeks ago .	66.307434
u . s . attorney macon weaver said the federal complaint , charged that the juror gave false information when asked about ku klux klan membership during selection of jury .	190.54665
he identified the man as lewis martin parker , 59 , a farmer of hartselle , ala . .	63.686714
eight men were tried together in u . s . district court in anniston , ala . , on charges of interfering with interstate transportation and conspiracy growing out of a white mob ' s attack on a greyhound bus carrying the first of the freedom riders .	67.72088
one of the eight defendants was freed on a directed verdict of acquittal .	54.76445
a mistrial was declared in the case against the other seven when the jury was unable to agree on a verdict .	50.86294
the arrest of mr . parker marks the third charge of wrongdoing involving the jury that heard the case .	115.046234
the first incident occurred before the trial got under way when judge h . hobart grooms told the jury panel he had heard reports of jury-tampering efforts .	238.97794
he asked members of the panel to tell him if anyone outside the court had spoken to them about the case .	175.55745
two members of the panel later told in court about receiving telephone calls at their homes from anonymous persons expressing interest in the trial .	153.96379
then , when the case went to the jury , the judge excused one of the jurors , saying the juror had told him he had been accosted by masked men at his motel the night before the trial opened .	72.32921
the juror said the masked men had advised him to be lenient .	40.22694
the judge replaced the juror with an alternate .	313.80408
no formal charges have been filed as a result of either of the two reported incidents .	108.36658
at the opening of the trial , the jury panel was questioned as a group by mr . weaver about ku klux klan connections .	48.966713
one member of the panel -- not mr . parker -- indicated he had been a member of the kkk at one time .	71.209785
the perjury charge against mr . parker carries a maximum penalty of $2 , 000 fine and five years imprisonment on conviction .	83.97868
-- the new york university board of trustees has elected the youngest president in the 130-year history of nyu , it was announced yesterday .	78.22685
the new president is 37-year-old dr . james mcn . hester , currently dean of the nyu graduate school of arts and sciences .	69.005165
he will take over his new post jan . 1 .	12.232784
dr . hester , also one of the youngest men ever to head a major american university , succeeds dr . carroll v . newsom who resigned last september to join prentice-hall inc . publishing firm .	126.6611
dr . hester , of princeton , n . j . , is a native of chester , pa . he joined nyu in september , 1960 .	29.584494
prior to that he was associated with long island university in brooklyn .	209.25299
vast spraying programs conducted by `` technicians with narrow training and little wisdom ' ' are endangering crops and wildlife , carl w . buchheister , president of the national audubon society , said today .	82.52331
`` it is like handing a loaded automatic to an 8-year-old and telling him to run out and play ' ' , he commented .	62.9523
buchheister told delegates to the west coast audubon convention that aerial spraying in louisiana failed to destroy its target , the fire ant .	112.07953
`` but it did destroy the natural controls of a borer and released a new plague that wrecked a sugar cane crop ' ' , he said .	61.575264
the conservation leader said other mistakes in spraying had caused serious damage in ohio and wyoming .	488.69525
there have even been serious errors in the u . s . forest service , whose officials pride themselves in their scientific training , he added .	75.98789
`` the news of their experiments reaches the farmers who , forgetting that birds are the most efficient natural enemies of insects and rodents , are encouraged to try to get rid of all birds that occasionally peck their grapes or their blueberries ' ' , buchheister told the delegates .	143.85129
in addition to urging greater restrictions on aerial spraying , buchheister called for support of the wilderness bill , creation of national seashore parks , including point reyes	260.54315
stronger water pollution control programs , and federal ratification of an international convention to halt pollution of the sea by oil .	121.42211
the reed rogers da fonta wild life sanctuary in marin county on friday officially became the property of the national audubon society .	98.607315
mrs . norman livermore , president of the marin conservation league , handed over the deed to the 645-acre tidelands tract south of greenwood beach to carl w . buchheister , president of the society .	104.26636
the presentation was made before several hundred persons at the annual meeting of the league at olney hall , college of marin , kentfield .	50.330822
buchheister pledged the land would be an `` inviolate ' ' sanctuary for all birds , animals and plants .	67.08502
seventeen years ago today , german scientist willy fiedler climbed into a makeshift cockpit installed in a v-1 rocket-bomb that was attached to the underbelly of a heinkel bomber .	37.97284
the world war 2 , german bomber rolled down a runway and took off .	54.17679
the only way fiedler could get back to earth alive was to fly the pulse jet missile and land it on the airstrip .	202.66423
now a quiet-spoken , middle-aged man , fiedler is an aeronautical engineer for lockheed ' s missiles and space division at sunnyvale , where he played a key role in the development of the navy ' s polaris missile .	61.031208
he sat in his office yesterday and recalled that historic flight in 1944 .	103.13997
`` the first two pilots had crashed ' ' , he said .	6.000627
`` i had developed the machines and therefore knew them .	214.44861
it was time to go up myself ' ' .	1.4505783
fiedler was then technical director of hitler ' s super-secret `` reichenberg project ' ' , which remained unknown to the allies until after the war .	90.9123
about 200 of the special v-1 rocket-bombs were to be made ready for manned flight with an explosive warhead .	54.809204
the target was allied shipping -- a desperate effort to stave off the allied invasion of europe .	46.321823
the success of the project depended upon fiedler ' s flight .	10.712434
squeezed into the few cubic feet normally filled by the rocket ' s automatic guidance mechanism , the scientist waited while the bomber gained altitude .	143.86063
at 12 , 000 feet , fiedler signaled `` release ' ' , and started the roaring pulse-jet engine -- then streaked away from beneath the heinkel .	92.58209
to the german pilot in the bomber the rocket became a faint black speck , hurtling through the sky at the then incredible speed of 420 m . p . h . .	117.17276
it was probably man ' s first successful flight in a missile .	43.40513
`` she flew beautifully ' ' , said fiedler .	331.89514
`` there was only one power control -- a valve to adjust the fuel flow .	91.12054
i had exactly 20 minutes to get down to the test strip ' ' .	23.441442
using a steering system that controlled the modified rocket ' s tail surfaces and wings equipped with ailerons , fiedler was to land the missile on a skid especially bolted under the fuselage .	166.82712
he managed to maneuver the missile to a landing speed of 200 m . p . h . -- fast even for a modern jet plane touchdown -- and banked into the airfield .	157.07407
moments later the v-1 skimmed across the landing strip , edging closer and closer to a touchdown -- then in a streamer of dust it landed .	161.31189
fiedler went on to make several other test flights before german pilots took over the reichenberg missiles .	113.03153
the missiles were to be armed with an underwater bomb .	35.916603
pilots would steer them in a suicide dive into the water , striking below the waterline of individual ships .	201.91707
a crack corps of 50 pilots was formed from the ranks of volunteers , but the project was halted before the end of the war , and the missiles later fell into allied hands .	42.32988
now a family man with three children , fiedler lives in a quiet residential area near the lockheed plant at sunnyvale .	139.16827
his spare time is spent in soaring gliders .	3.7307153
`` it ' s so quiet ' ' , he said , `` so slow , serene -- and so challenging ' ' .	59.13816
john di massimo has been elected president of the 1961 columbus day celebration committee , it was announced yesterday .	101.01241
other officers are angelo j . scampini , vice president , joseph v . arata , treasurer , and fred j . casassa , secretary .	46.315136
judge john b . molinari was named chairman of the executive committee .	19.577324
elios p . anderlini , attilio beronio , leo m . bianco , frederic campagnoli , joseph cervetto , armond j . de martini , grace duhagon , john p . figone , john p . figone jr . , stephen mana , john moscone , calude perasso , angelo petrini , frank ratto , and george r . reilly .	73.56025
dr . albert schweitzer , world-famous theologian and medical missionary , has endorsed an easter march for disarmament which begins tomorrow in sunnyvale .	182.68541
members of the san francisco american friends service , a quaker organization , will march to san francisco for a rally in union square at 2 p . m . saturday .	49.865562
in a letter to the american friends service , dr . schweitzer wrote	52.38821
`` leading nations of the west and of the east keep busy making newer nuclear weapons to defend themselves in the event the constantly threatening nuclear war should break out .	174.25398
`` they cannot do otherwise than live in dread of each other since these weapons imply the possibility of such grisly surprise attack .	143.85959
the only way out of this state of affairs is agreement to abolish nuclear weapons	95.37468
`` governments apparently do not feel obligated to make the people adequately aware of this danger	180.32234
therefore we need guardians to demonstrate against the ghastly stupidity of nuclear weapons and jolt the people out of their complacency ' ' .	39.417843
a federal grand jury called 10 witnesses yesterday in an investigation of the affairs of ben stein , 47 , who collected big fees as a `` labor consultant ' ' and operator of a janitors ' service .	83.86156
before he testified for 20 minutes , stein , who lives at 3300 lake shore dr . , admitted to reporters that he had a wide acquaintance with crime syndicate hoodlums .	41.290417
among his gangland buddies , he said , were joseph ( joey ) glimco , a mob labor racketeer , and four gang gambling chiefs , gus ( slim ) alex , ralph pierce , joe ( caesar ) divarco , and jimmy ( monk ) allegretti .	61.675613
another hoodlum , louis arger , drew $39 , 000 from stein ' s janitor firm , the national maintenance company , in three years ending in 1959 , stein disclosed in an interview .	98.40849
`` i put arger on the payroll because he promised to get my firm the stevedore account at navy pier ' ' , stein said .	130.1469
`` but arger never was able to produce it , so i cut him off my payroll ' ' .	76.86261
other witnesses , after appearances before the jury , which reportedly is probing into possible income tax violations , disclosed that government prosecutors were attempting to connect stein and his company with a number of gangsters , including glimco and alex .	99.947754
the federal lawyers , according to their witnesses , also were tracing stein ' s fees as a labor consultant .	50.30521
under scrutiny , two of the witnesses said , were payments and loans to stein ' s national maintenance company at 543 madison st . .	70.97604
the company supplies janitors and workmen for mccormick place and factories , liquor firms , and other businesses .	139.59596
among the witnesses were ed j . lee , director of mccormick place	235.83263
jerome leavitt , a partner in the union liquor company , 3247 s . kedzie av . , dominic senese , a teamster union slugger who is a buddy of stein and a cousin of tony accardo , onetime gang chief	84.06478
and frank w . pesce , operator of a glimco dominated deodorant firm , the best sanitation and supply company , 1215 blue island av . .	153.435
lee said he had told the jury that he made an agreement in april with stein to supply and supervise janitors in mccormick place .	59.07948
stein ' s fee , lee said , was 10 per cent of the janitors ' pay .	49.741833
stein estimated this amount at `` about $1 , 500 or $1 , 600 a month ' ' .	39.26136
leavitt , as he entered the jury room , said he was prepared to answer questions about the $12 , 500 his liquor firm paid to stein for `` labor consultant work ' ' with five unions which organized leavitt ' s workers .	108.60867
leavitt identified the unions as a warehouseman ' s local , the teamsters union , a salesman ' s union , the janitors ' union , and a bottling workers ' union .	53.509
government attorneys , leavitt said , have questioned him closely about `` five or six loans ' ' totaling about $40 , 000 which the liquor company made to stein in the last year .	91.69006
all of the loans , in amounts up to $5 , 000 each , have been repaid by stein , according to leavitt .	64.60351
stein said he needed the money , leavitt said , to `` meet the payroll ' ' at national maintenance company .	52.047672
the deodorant firm run by pesce has offices in the headquarters of glimco ' s discredited taxi drivers ' union at 1213-15 blue island av . .	65.02558
the radiation station of the chicago board of health recorded a reading of 1 micro-microcurie of radiation per cubic meter of air over chicago yesterday .	221.40538
the reading , which has been watched with interest since russia ' s detonation of a super bomb monday , was 4 on tuesday and 7 last saturday , a level far below the danger point , according to the board of health .	170.96005
the weather bureau has estimated that radioactive fallout from the test might arrive here next week .	193.92238
a board of health spokesman said there is no reason to believe that an increase in the level here will occur as a result of the detonation .	38.261402
curtis allen huff , 41 , of 1630 lake av . , wilmette , was arrested yesterday on a suppressed federal warrant charging him with embezzling an undetermined amount of money from the first federal savings and loan association , 1 s . dearborn st . , where he formerly was employed as an attorney .	115.05995
federal prosecutors estimated that the amount may total $20 , 000 , altho a spokesman for the association estimated its loss at approximately $10 , 000 .	51.602955
huff ' s attorney , antone f . gregorio , quoted his client as saying that part of the embezzlement represented money paid to huff , as attorney for the loan association , in satisfaction of mechanic ' s liens on property on which the association held mortgages .	148.66432
huff told gregorio that he took the money to pay `` the ordinary bills and expenses of suburban living ' ' .	57.093845
huff , who received a salary of $109 a week from the loan association from october of 1955 until september of this year , said that his private practice was not lucrative .	134.08592
huff lives with his wife , sue , and their four children , 6 to 10 years old , in a $25 , 000 home with a $17 , 000 mortgage .	93.632065
the complaint on which the warrant was issued was filed by leo blaber , an attorney for the association .	84.12312
the shortage was discovered after huff failed to report for work on sept . 18 .	163.29512
on that date , according to gregorio , huff left his home and took a room in the new lawrence hotel at 1020 lawrence av . .	93.95498
there , gregorio said , huff wrote a complete statement of his offense .	108.9772
later , huff cashed three checks for $100 each at the sherman house , using a credit card .	97.51355
when huff attempted to cash another $100 check there monday , hotel officials called police .	464.009
-- greece and west germany have ratified an agreement under which germany will pay $28 , 700 , 000 to greek victims of nazi persecution , it was announced today .	60.814205
probably the hottest thing that has hit the dallas investment community in years was the morton foods stock issue , which was sold to the public during the past week .	120.328674
for many reasons , the demand to buy shares in the dallas-headquartered company was tremendous .	84.7271
it was not a case of the investment bankers having to sell the stock	49.207424
it was more one of allotting a few shares to a number of customers and explaining to others why they had no more to sell .	54.47834
investors who wanted 100 shares in many cases ended up with 25 , and customers who had put in a bid to buy 400 shares found themselves with 100 and counted themselves lucky to get that many .	246.35825
in fact , very few customers , anywhere in the nation , were able to get more than 100 shares .	30.089643
some dallas investment firms got only 100 shares , for all of their customers .	30.724688
a measure of how hot the stock was , can be found in what happened to it on the market as soon as trading began .	126.57639
the stock was sold in the underwriting at a price of $12 . 50 a share .	102.70064
the first over-the-counter trade wednesday afternoon at eppler , guerin & turner , the managing underwriter , was at $17 a share .	89.44566
and from that the stock moved right on up until it was trading thursday morning at around $22 a share .	275.6383
but the morton foods issue was hot long before it was on the market .	39.474236
indeed , from the moment the reports of the coming issue first started circulating in dallas last january , the inquiries and demand for the stock started building up .	223.39665
letters by the reams came in from investment firms all over the nation , all of them wanting to get a part of the shares that would be sold ( 185 , 000 to the public at $12 . 50 , with another 5 , 000 reserved for morton foods employes at $11 . 50 a share ) .	70.275604
there was even a cable in french from a bank in switzerland that had somehow learned about the dallas stock offering .	196.30832
`` we subscribe 500 shares of morton foods of texas .	45.52959
cable confirmation ' ' , it said translated .	104.00006
but e . g . t . could not let the swiss bank have even 10 shares .	277.46817
after it allotted shares to 41 underwriters and 52 selling group members from coast to coast there were not many shares for anyone .	373.6606
but the result of it all was , e . g . t . partner dean guerin believes , an effective distribution of the stock to owners all over the nation .	73.99112
`` i feel confident the stock will qualify for the ' national list ' ' ' , he said , meaning its market price would be quoted regularly in newspapers all over the country .	136.12593
he was also pleased with the wide distribution because he thought it proved again his argument that dallas investment men can do just as good a job as the big new york investment bankers claim only they can do .	227.34048
but what made the morton foods stock issue such a hot one ? ?	278.3056
the answer is that it was a combination of circumstances .	36.67941
first , the general stock market has been boiling upward for the last few months , driving stocks of all kinds up .	104.00974
as a result , it is not easy to find a stock priced as the morton issue was priced ( at roughly 10 times 1960 earnings , to yield a little over 5 per cent on the 64-cent anticipated dividend ) .	192.77711
second , the `` potato chip industry ' ' has caught the fancy of investors lately , and until morton foods came along there were only two potato chip stocks -- frito and h . w . lay -- on the market .	64.01404
both of those have had dynamic run-ups in price on the market in recent months , both were selling at higher price-earnings and yield bases than morton was coming to market at , and everyone who knew anything about it expected the morton stock to have a fast run-up .	148.44756
and third , the potato chip industry has taken on the flavor of a `` growth ' ' industry in the public mind of late .	92.34392
foods , which long had been considered `` recession resistant ' ' but hardly dynamic stocks , have been acting like growth stocks , going to higher price-earnings ratios .	146.13362
the potato chip industry these days is growing , not only as a result of population increase and public acceptance of convenience foods , but also because of a combination of circumstances that has led to growth by merger .	63.79011
the history of the u . s . potato chip industry is that many of today ' s successful companies got started during the deep depression days .	109.55173
those that remain are those that were headed by strong executives , men with the abilities to last almost 30 years in the competitive survival of the fittest .	143.8926
but today many of those men are reaching retirement age and suddenly realizing that they face an estate tax problem with their closely held companies and also that they have no second-echelon management in their firms .	210.81877
so they go looking for mergers with other firms that have publicly quoted stock , and almost daily they pound on the doors of firms like frito .	216.45047
all those things combined to make the morton foods stock the hot issue that it was and is .	119.982956
now , if morton ' s newest product , a corn chip known as chip-o ' s , turns out to sell as well as its stock did , the stock may turn out to be worth every cent of the prices that the avid buyers bid it up to .	144.51129
dallas and north texas is known world-wide as the manufacturing and distribution center of cotton gin machinery and supplies , valued in the millions of dollars .	62.24515
more than 10 companies maintain facilities in dallas and one large manufacturer is located to the north at sherman .	165.01064
it is no coincidence that the texas cotton ginner ' s association is meeting here this week for the 46th time in their 52-year history .	84.67439
the exhibition of cotton ginning machinery at the state fair grounds is valued at more than a million dollars .	48.07112
it weighs in the tons , so the proximity of factory and exhibition area makes it possible for an outstanding exhibit each year .	248.04562
a modern cotton gin plant costs in the neighborhood of $250 , 000 , and it ' s a safe assumption that a large percentage of new gins in the u . s . and foreign countries contain machinery made in this area .	58.001266
the murray co . of texas , inc . , originated in dallas in 1896 .	42.326496
they ' ve occupied a 22-acre site since the early 1900 ' s .	20.777178
more than 700 employees make gin machinery that ' s sold anywhere cotton is grown .	218.35385
murray makes a complete line of ginning equipment except for driers and cleaners , and this machinery is purchased from a dallas-based firm .	64.94579
the continental gin co . began operations in dallas in 1899 .	149.34677
the present company is a combination of several smaller ones that date back to 1834 .	474.20816
factories are located here and in prattville , ala . .	13.268333
about 40 per cent of the manufacturing is done at the dallas plant by more than 200 employes .	298.08273
the company sells a complete line of gin machinery all over the cotton-growing world .	143.63051
hardwicke-etter co . of sherman makes a full line of gin machinery and equipment .	20.30587
the firm recently expanded domestic sales into the southeastern states as a result of an agreement with cen-tennial gin co . .	69.429886
the company began operation in 1900 with hardware and oil mill supplies .	25.921164
in 1930 , they began making cotton processing equipment .	3.3748906
presently , hardwicke-etter employs 300-450 people , depending on the season of the year .	18.529066
the lummus cotton gin co . has had a sales and service office in dallas since 1912 .	225.00377
factory operations are in columbus , ga . .	38.393024
the moss gordin lint cleaner co . and gordin unit system of ginning have joint headquarters here .	644.83325
the cleaner equipment firm began operations in 1953 and the unit system , which turns out a complete ginning system , began operations in 1959 .	73.1526
the john e . mitchell co . began work in dallas in 1928 .	137.85631
the firm is prominent in making equipment for cleaning seed cotton , driers , and heaters , and they lay claim to being the first maker ( 1910 ) of boil extraction equipment .	113.27736
the increase in mechanical harvesting of cotton makes cleaning and drying equipment a must for modern gin operation .	179.49167
mitchell employs a total of about 400 people .	5.945734
the hinckley gin supply co . is a maker of `` overhead equipment ' ' .	46.900436
this includes driers , cleaners , burr extractors , separators and piping that ' s located above gin stands in a complete gin .	110.3268
the firm began operations back in 1925 and sells equipment in the central cotton belt , including the mississippi delta .	67.09891
the cen-tennial gin supply co . has home offices and factory facilities here .	86.41809
they make gin saws and deal in parts , supplies and some used gin machinery .	107.613014
the stacy co . makes cleaning and drying equipment for sale largely in texas .	217.63838
they ' ve been in dallas since 1921 .	5.759819
cotton belt gin service , inc . of dallas makes gin saws and started here 14 years ago .	182.17365
the firm also handles gin and oil mill supplies such as belting , bearings , etc . .	67.48604
cotton processing equipment is a sizable segment of dallas business economy .	197.30992
new car sales in dallas county during march showed slight signs of recovering from the doldrums which have characterized sales this year .	289.22678
registrations of new cars in dallas county cracked the 3 , 000 mark in march for the first time this year .	68.10488
totaling 3 , 399 , sales jumped 14 per cent over february ' s 2 , 963 .	42.167706
however , compared with march 1960 new car sales of 4 , 441 , this march was off 23 per cent .	131.08067

this year-to-year decline for dallas county closely follows the national trend -- estimated sales of domestic cars in the u . s . for first three months of 1961 were about 1 , 212 , 000 or 80 per cent of the total in the first quarter a year earlier .	56.705807
with the march pickup , dealers are optimistic that the april-june quarter will equal or top last year .	244.22949
the march gain plus this optimism has been encouraging enough to prompt auto makers to boost production schedules for the next quarter .	59.98324
on the local level , compacts continue to grab a larger share of the market at the expense of lower-priced standard models and foreign cars .	55.573124

-- `` the present recovery movement will gather steady momentum to lift the economy to a new historic peak by this autumn ' ' , beryl w . sprinkel , economist of harris trust & savings bank , chicago , predicted at the closing session here tuesday of investment bankers assn . , california group , conference .	141.79886
another speaker , william h . draper , jr . , former under secretary of the army and now with the palo alto venture capital firm of draper , gaither & anderson , urged the u . s . to `` throw down the gauntlet of battle to communism and tell moscow bluntly we won ' t be pushed around any more ' ' .	86.94338
he urged support for president kennedy ' s requests for both defense and foreign aid appropriations .	122.96499
sprinkel told conferees that the recent improvement in economic activity was not a `` temporary flash in the pan ' ' but the beginning of a substantial cyclical expansion that will carry the economy back to full employment levels and witness a renewal of our traditional growth pattern .	141.59555
`` in view of the current expansion , which promises to be substantial ' ' he said the odds appear to favor rising interest rates in coming months , but `` there is reason to believe the change will not be as abrupt as in 1958 nor as severe as in late 1959 and 1960 ' ' .	153.67715
sprinkel strongly refuted the current neo-stagnationist thesis that we are facing a future of limited and slow growth , declaring that this pessimism `` is based on very limited and questionable evidence ' ' .	119.25877
rather than viewing the abortive recovery in 1959-60 as a reason for believing we have lost prospects for growth ' ' , he said `` it should be viewed as a lesson well learned which will increase the probability of substantial improvement in this recovery ' ' .	82.80695
he cautioned that `` the greater danger in this recovery may be excessive stimulation by government which could bring moderate inflation ' ' .	78.13458
the economist does not look for a drastic switch in the budget during this recovery and believes it `` even more unlikely that the federal reserve will aggressively tighten monetary policy in the early phases of the upturn as was the case in 1958 ' ' .	71.08101
the unsatisfactory 1958-60 expansion , he said , was not due to inadequate growth forces inherent in our economy but rather to the adverse effect of inappropriate economic policies combined with retrenching decisions resulting from the steel strike .	191.31622
draper declared , `` as i see it , this country has never faced such great dangers as threaten us today .	99.54201
we must be ready for any needed sacrifice ' ' .	7.522276
he said that from his experience of two years with gen . clay in west berlin administration , that `` russia respects our show of strength , but that presently we ' re not acting as we should and must ' ' .	153.89648
he called the cuban tractor plan an outright blackmail action , and noted that in war `` you can ' t buy yourself out and that ' s what we ' re trying to do ' ' .	56.83493
while he declined to suggest , how , he said that sooner or later we must get rid of castro , `` for unless we do we ' re liable to face similar situations in this hemisphere .	90.47115
its the start of a direct threat to our own security and i don ' t believe we can permit that ' ' .	51.5504
-- stock market tuesday staged a technical recovery , erasing all of monday ' s losses in the associated press average and making the largest gain in about two weeks .	171.4582
analysts saw the move as a continuation of the recovery drive that got under way late monday afternoon when the list sank to a hoped-for `` support level ' ' represented by around 675 in the dow jones industrial average .	338.2489
it was a level at which some of the investors standing on the sidelines were thought likely to buy the pivotal issues represented in the averages .	201.20844
although it looked like a routine technical snapback to wall streeters it was accompanied by some good news .	99.749886
a substantial rise in new orders and sales of durable goods was reported for last month .	71.190025

of 1 , 253 issues traded , 695 advanced and 354 declined .	135.3082

a $25 billion advertising budget in an $800 billion economy was envisioned for the 1970s here tuesday by peter g . peterson , head of one of the world ' s greatest camera firms , in a key address before the american marketing assn . .	163.01527
however , peterson , president of bell & howell , warned 800 u . s . marketing leaders attending a national conference at the ambassador , that the future will belong to the industrialist of creative and `` unconventional wisdom ' ' .	84.09782
`` as we look to the $800 billion economy that is predicted for 1970 and the increase of about 40% in consumer expenditures that will be required to reach that goal , management can well be restless about how this tremendous volume and number of new products will be created and marketed ' ' , peterson said .	118.92572
`` with this kind of new product log-jam , the premium for brilliant product planning will obviously go up geometrically ' ' .	196.52805
the executive paid tribute to research and development and technology for their great contributions in the past , but he also cautioned industry that they tend to be great equalizers because they move at a fairly even pace within an industry and fail to give it the short-term advantage which it often needs .	171.94823
peterson said america has nothing to fear in world competition if it dares to be original in both marketing and product ideas .	229.26059
he cited , as an example , how the american camera industry has been able to meet successfully the competition of japan despite lower japanese labor costs , by improving its production know-how and technology .	107.657005
he also used as an example the manufacturer who introduced an all-automatic camera in germany , with the result that it became the best selling camera in the german market .	194.96815

taylor , president and voting stockholder of taylor and co . , beverly hills , has been active in the securities business since 1925 .	52.283356

in other words , i am getting only half the dividends i should .	211.45898

that bank handles most of the paper work for diversified growth stock fund , fundamental investors , diversified investment fund and television-electronics fund .	145.50206

but it seems that this `` electronic brain ' ' wasn ' t `` programmed ' ' correctly .	23.494413
this resulted in a great number of errors .	33.849316
and letters began to come in to this column from irate shareholders .	71.07324
i visited the bank in march and wrote a story about the situation .	86.299866
at that time , the people at the bank said they felt that they had the situation in hand .	201.52106
they indicated that no new errors were being made and that all old errors would be corrected `` within 60 days ' ' .	121.143074
that 60-day period is over and letters are still coming in from shareholders of these four funds , complaining about mistakes in their accounts .	122.12349
maybe it ' s taking longer to get things squared away than the bankers expected .	268.58688
any shareholder of any of these funds who finds a mistake in his account certainly should get in touch with the bank .	98.49928

hayes said that if a way can be found to deal effectively with short-term capital movements between nations , `` there is no reason , in my judgment why the international financial system cannot work satisfactorily for at least the foreseeable future ' ' .	106.16796
-- new york central railroad president alfred e . perlman said tuesday his line would face the threat of bankruptcy if the chesapeake & ohio and baltimore & ohio railroads merge .	87.989174
perlman said bankruptcy would not be an immediate effect of the merger , but could possibly be an ultimate effect .	49.340244
the railroad president made the statement in an interview as the interstate commerce commission opened round 2 of its hearing into the c & o ' s request to control and then merge with the b & aj .	90.73379
`` all these kind of things weaken us ' ' , perlman said .	28.709238

on $1 . 1 billion of 90-day bills , the average yield was 2 . 325% .	80.66391

-- `` consumer uncertain about economic conditions ' ' .	1.4042816
this was the chief reason for a so-so sales outlook given by two-thirds of 56 builders polled by the national housing center .	82.40852
other reasons mentioned by one-third or more of the builders were `` resistance to high interest rates , cost advantage of buying over renting has narrowed , shelter market nearing saturation and prospects unable to qualify ' ' .	145.15343
the poll was taken at the center ' s annual builders ' intentions conference .	427.84708
expect their own production volume , and presumably sales , to jump 30 percent in 1961 .	131.28973
look for home building nationally to advance less than 10 percent this year from 1960 ' s 1 , 257 , 700 non-farm housing starts .	45.484665

-- farm machinery dealer bob houtz tilts back in a battered chair and tells of a sharp pickup in sales `` we ' ve sold four corn pickers since labor day and have good prospects for 10 more .	190.77065
we sold only four pickers all last year ' ' .	4.451129
gus ehlers , competitor of mr . houtz in this farm community , says his business since august 1 is running 50% above a year earlier .	168.77924
`` before then , my sales during much of the year had lagged behind 1960 by 20% ' ' , he says .	82.456276
though the sales gains these two dealers are experiencing are above average for their business , farm equipment sales are climbing in most rural areas .	127.41765
paradoxically , the sales rise is due in large measure to government efforts to slash farm output .	301.47635
although the administration ' s program cut crop acreage to the lowest point since 1934 , farmers , with the help of extra fertilizer and good weather , are getting such high yields per acre that many are being forced to buy new harvesting machines .	105.87929
fields of corn and some other crops in many cases are so dense that older equipment cannot handle them efficiently .	158.36398
the higher price supports provided by the new legislation , together with rising prices for farm products , are pushing up farm income , making it possible for farmers to afford the new machinery .	91.06185
seven of the eight companies that turn out full lines of farm machinery say sales by their dealers since the start of august have shown gains averaging nearly 10% above last year .	193.47322
`` in august our dealers sold 13% more farm machinery than a year earlier and in september retail sales were 14% higher than last year ' ' , says mark v . keeler , farm equipment vice president of international harvester co . .	69.16135
for the year to date , sales of the company ' s farm equipment dealers still lag about 5% behind 1960 .	114.53451
among individual dealers questioned in nearly a score of states , two out of three report their sales since august 1 show sizable gains from a year earlier , with the increases ranging from 5% to 50% .	123.57589
not all sections are showing an upswing , however	218.79462
the drought-seared north central states are the most notable exceptions to the uptrend .	132.4596
the significance of the pickup in farm machinery sales extends beyond the farm equipment industry .	56.418457
the demand for farm machinery is regarded as a yardstick of rural buying generally .	92.38585
farmers spend more of their income on tractors and implements than on any other group of products .	80.62603
more than 20 million people live on farms and they own a fourth of the nation ' s trucks , buy more gasoline than any other industry and provide a major market for home appliances , chemicals and other products .	92.58086
farmers are so eager for new machinery that they ' re haggling less over prices than they did a year ago , dealers report .	205.73415
`` farmers aren ' t as price conscious as last year so we can get more money on a sale ' ' , says jack martin , who sells j . i . case tractors and implements in sioux city , iowa .	118.130165
`` this morning , we allowed a farmer $600 on the old picker he traded in on a new $2 , 700 model .	152.78362
last year , we probably would have given him $700 for a comparable machine ' ' .	34.901325
in august of 1960 , he sold seven .	33.682407
with dealer stocks of new equipment averaging about 25% below a year ago , the affects of the rural recovery are being felt almost immediately by the country ' s farm equipment manufacturers .	53.95771
for example , farm equipment shipments of international harvester in august climbed about 5% above a year earlier , mr . keeler reports .	75.02236
tractor production at massey-ferguson , ltd . , of toronto in july and august rose to 2 , 418 units from 869 in the like period a year earlier , says john staiger , vice president .	82.04247
with the lower dealer inventories and the stepped-up demand some manufacturers believe there could be shortages of some implements .	215.33292
merritt d . hill , ford motor co . vice president , says his company is starting to get calls daily from dealers demanding immediate delivery or wanting earlier shipping dates on orders for corn pickers .	268.40878
except for a few months in late 1960 and early 1961 , retail farm equipment sales have trailed year-earlier levels since the latter part of 1959 .	222.42567
the rise in sales last winter was checked when the government ' s new feed grain program was adopted	293.4587
the program resulted in a cutback of around 20% in planted acreage and , as a result , reduced the immediate need for machines .	152.45789
nearly all of the farm equipment manufacturers and dealers say the upturn in sales has resulted chiefly from the recent improvement in crop prospects .	166.71246
total farm output for this year is officially forecast at 129% of the 1947-49 average , three points higher than the july 1 estimate and exactly equal to the final figure for 1960 .	219.83182
the government also is aiding farmers ' income prospects .	21.175533
agriculture department economists estimate the government this year will hand farmers $1 . 4 billion in special subsidies and incentive payments , well above the record $1 . 1 billion of 1958 and about double the $639 million of 1960 .	145.62936
price support loans may total another $1 billion this year .	42.350105
with cash receipts from marketings expected to be slightly above 1960 , farmers ' gross income is estimated at $39 . 5 billion , $1 . 5 billion above 1960 ' s record high .	62.739685
net income may reach $12 . 7 billion , up $1 billion from 1960 and the highest since 1953 .	98.63972
the government reported last week that the index of prices received by farmers rose in the month ended at mid-september for the third consecutive month , reaching 242% of the 1910-14 average compared with 237% at mid-july .	269.742
kennedy opposes any widespread relief from a high court depletion ruling .	22.038671
the supreme court decision in mid-1960 was in the case of a company making sewer pipe from clay which it mined .	109.255356
the company , in figuring its taxable earnings , deducted a percentage of the revenue it received for its finished products .	87.0862
such `` depletion allowances ' ' , in the form of percentages of sales are authorized by tax law for specified raw materials producers using up their assets .	171.4546
the high court held that the company must apply its percentage allowance to the value of the raw materials removed from the ground , not to the revenue from finished products .	100.43631
a measure passed by congress just before adjourning softened the ruling ' s impact , on prior-year returns still under review , for clay-mining companies that make brick and tile products .	228.3782
the measure allows such companies in those years to apply their mineral depletion allowances to 50% of the value of the finished products rather than the lower value of raw clay alone .	83.81634
president kennedy , in signing the relief measure into law , stressed he regarded it as an exception .	171.55421
`` my approval of this bill should not be viewed as establishing a precedent for the enactment of similar legislation for other mineral industries ' ' , the president said .	59.032646
charitable deductions come in for closer scrutiny by the i . r . s . .	56.740154
the service announced that taxpayers making such claims may be called on to furnish a statement from the recipient organization showing the date , purpose , amount and other particulars of the contribution .	114.647675
requests for substantiation , the service indicated , can be especially expected in cases where it suspects the donor received some material benefit in return , such as tickets to a show .	302.21918
in such an instance , revenuers stressed , the deduction must be reduced by the value of the benefit received .	47.180225
a rule on the federal deductibility of state taxes is contested .	102.32068
a realty corporation in louisiana owed no tax , under federal law , on its gain from the sale of property disposed of in line with a plan of liquidation .	116.79484
louisiana , however , collected an income tax on the profits from the sale .	31.071129
the corporation , in filing its final federal income return , claimed the state tax payment as a deductible expense , as permitted under u . s . tax law .	118.060905
the revenue service disallowed the claim , invoking a law provision that generally bars deductions for expenses incurred in connection with what it said was tax-exempt income .	265.7679
it said the tax-freedom of the gain in this case stemmed not from the exempt status of the income but from a special rule on corporate liquidations .	176.66737
the tax court decision and a similar earlier finding by the ninth circuit court of appeals challenges a year-old i . r . s . ruling on the subject .	132.99852
the service has not said what its next step will be .	83.89587
peace corps volunteers are assured a tax benefit under the law creating the agency .	56.372875
it provides that the $1 , 800 termination payment each cadet is to get , after serving a two-year hitch without pay , will be spread over both years , not taxed in its entirety at a possibly higher rate in the year received .	208.67775
the owner of a public relations firm owed no income tax on payments he received from a client company and `` kicked back ' ' to the company ' s advertising manager , the tax court ruled .	93.42388
the taxpayer testified that in order to retain the account he had to pad his invoices and pay the excess to the manager .	157.51117
the court upheld the taxpayer ' s contention that these `` kickbacks ' ' were not his income though they passed through his hands .	124.3195
the court limited its decision to the tax issue involved , commenting `` it is not our province to pass judgment on the morality of the transaction ' ' .	92.375496
a portable kerosene range designed for use aboard boats is sold with a special railing to keep it from moving with the motion of the vessel .	156.30391
the revenue service said the addition of the attachment does not keep the range from coming under the federal manufacturers ' excise tax on household-type appliances .	225.43936
hiring the wife for one ' s company may win her tax-aided retirement income .	152.5143
a spouse employed by a corporation her husband controls , for example , may be entitled to distributions under the company ' s pension plan as well as to her own social security coverage .	49.47782
she would be taxed on the pensions when received , of course , but the company ' s contributions would be tax-free .	49.71734
a frequent pitfall in this sort of arrangement , experts warn , is a tendency to pay the wife more than her job is worth and to set aside an excessive amount for her as retirement income .	153.21588
in that event , they note , the revenue service might declare the pension plan is discriminatory and deny it tax privileges under the law .	269.33792
possible upshots the company could be denied a deduction for its pension payments , or those payments for the wife and other employes could be ruled taxable to them in the year made .	101.78389
state briefs voters in four counties containing and bordering denver authorized the imposition of an additional 2% sales tax within that area .	234.77414
denver itself collects a 1% sales tax which is to be absorbed in the higher area tax .	52.35812
the washington state supreme court ruled that the state ' s occupation tax applied to sales , made at cost to an oil company , by a wholly-owned subsidiary set up to purchase certain supplies without divulging the identity of the parent .	113.07854
the state ' s occupation tax is computed on gross sales .	35.166973
the court held that the tax applied to non-profit sales because the corporations realized economic benefits by doing business as two separate entities .	287.57065

in private life , miss garson is mrs . e . e . fogelson and on the go most of the time commuting from dallas , where they maintain an apartment , to their california home in los angeles ' suburban bel-air to their ranch in pecos , new mexico .	64.910965

`` i like his clothes for their drama and simplicity and appreciate the great impact he has on fashion ' ' .	125.007576
black and white is her favorite color combination along with lively glowing pinks , reds , blues and greens .	77.32654
of scotch-irish-scandinavian descent , greer garson was born in county down , ireland .	490.60538
her mother was a greer and her father ' s family came from the orkney isles .	29.017466
reared in england , she studied to be a teacher , earned several scholarships and was graduated with honors from the university of london .	82.118355
she took postgraduate work at the university of grenoble in france and then returned to london to work on market research with an advertising firm .	239.42815

other triumphs include `` random harvest ' ' , `` madame curie ' ' , `` pride and prejudice ' ' , `` the forsythe saga ' ' and `` mrs . miniver ' ' ( which won her the academy award in 1943 ) .	38.084194
honors that have come to greer garson are countless .	118.0774
just this april she was nominated for the seventh time for an academy award for her portrayal of eleanor roosevelt in `` sunrise at campobello ' ' .	54.83281
she gave a fine portrayal of auntie mame on broadway in 1958 and has appeared in live television from `` captain brassbound ' s conversion ' ' to `` camille ' ' .	93.25182
she is in madame tussard ' s waxworks in london , a princess of the kiowa tribe and an honorary colonel in many states .	64.319405
she is adept at skeet shooting , trout fishing , afro-cuban and oriental dancing and southwestern archaeology .	22.711079

use one 6-ounce chicken breast for each guest .	11.722467
dip in melted butter and roll in flour .	18.91091

contemporary furniture that is neither danish nor straight-line modern but has sculptured pattern , many design facets , warmth , dignity and an effect of utter comfort and livability .	228.50926
that is the goal of two new collections being introduced in dallas this month .	114.84596
though there has been some avant garde indication that contemporary furniture might go back to the boxy look of the ' 20 ' s and ' 40 ' s , two manufacturers chose to take the approach of the sophisticated , but warm look in contemporary .	141.0483
these two , heritage and drexel , chose too not to produce the exactly matching design for every piece , but a collection of correlated designs , each of which could stand alone .	217.08792
the heritage collection , to be shown by sanger-harris and anderson ' s studio , has perhaps more different types of woods and decorations than any one manufacturer ever assembled together at one time .	152.41507
called perennian , to indicate its lasting , good today and tomorrow quality , the collection truly avoids the monotony of identical pieces .	192.11961
walnut , wormy chestnut , pecan , three varieties of burl , hand-woven philippine cane , ceramic tiles , marble are used to emphasize the feeling of texture and of permanence , the furniture to fit into rooms with tiled floors , brick or paneled walls , windows that bring in the outdoors .	88.12346
it is a collection with a custom-design look , offering simplicity with warmth , variety and vitality .	154.84198
the drexel collection , called composite , to be shown by titche ' s offers a realistic approach to decorating , a mature modern that is a variation of many designs .	104.7049
rounded posts give a soft , sculptured look , paneled doors have decorative burl panels or cane insets plus softening arches , table tops are inlaid in macassar ebony or acacia .	94.55205
a high-legged buffet provides easy-to-reach serving , a cocktail table has small snack tables tucked under each end , recessed arched panels decorate a 60-inch long chest .	119.03119
an interesting approach to the bedroom is presented , with a young , basic , functional group of chests , dressers and corner units and a canted headboard .	95.44174
the other bedroom has heavier styling , door-fronted dressers with acacia panels , a poster bed or a bed with arched acacia panels and matching mirror .	56.246704
colorful , bright eastman chromspun fabrics , with the magenta , pink and white tones predominating as well as golden shades are used with composite .	62.03255
the fabrics have scotchgard finish to resist soil and wrinkles .	38.74535

guests from across u . s . honor dr . swim	38.98351
when dr . w . a . swim celebrated his 75th birthday at the wilshire country club , guests came by chartered plane from all over the country .	114.56002
a flight originating in florida picked up guests on the east coast and midwest and a plane left from seattle taking on passengers at west coast points .	139.7784

he started practice in 1917 , and served on the state board of medical examiners .	139.11844
giving up the violin opened a whole new career for ilona schmidl-seeberg , a tiny hungarian who fritz kreisler had predicted would have a promising career on the concert stage .	139.5678
a heart attack when she was barely 20 put an end to the 10-hour daily practicing .	166.84822
she put the violin away and took out some linen , needles and yarn to while away the long , idle days in budapest .	173.10185
now her modern tapestries have been exhibited on two continents and , at 26 , she feels she is on the threshold of a whole new life in los angeles .	78.850426
her days as an art student at the university of budapest came to a sudden end during the hungarian uprisings in 1957 and she and her husband stephen fled to vienna .	70.36446
there they continued their studies at the university , she in art , he in architecture .	82.52397
and there she had her first showing of tapestry work .	213.2045
there ' s a lot of talk about the problem of education in america today .	49.38266
what most people don ' t seem to realize , if they aren ' t tied up with the thing as i am , is that 90% of the problem is transportation .	100.98559
i never dreamed of the logistical difficulties involved until , at long last , both of my boys got squeezed into high school .	200.95384
it seems like only last year that we watched them set out up the hill hand in hand on a rainy day in their yellow raincoats to finger-paint at the grammar school .	97.5943
getting to and from school was no problem .	10.998356
now they go to a high school that is two miles away .	54.922825
one might think the problem would be similar .	6.2166557
they could walk , ride on a bus or be driven .	43.318455
it ' s much more complex than that .	159.94478
generally , they go to school with a girl named gloriana , who lives down the block , and has a car .	45.724506
this is a way of getting to school , but , i understand , it entails a certain loss of social status .	49.86284
a young man doesn ' t like to be driven up in front of a school in a car driven by a girl who isn ' t even in a higher class than he is , and is also a girl .	69.13757
`` why don ' t you walk to school then ' ' ? ?	56.830757
`` my father walked , through two miles of snow , in illinois ' ' .	31.123316
`` no ' ' , i said , `` i didn ' t happen to grow up in illinois ' ' .	18.518007
i explained , however , that i had my share of hardship in making my daily pilgrimage to the feet of wisdom .	87.212944
i had to ride a streetcar two miles .	8.643111
sometimes there weren ' t even any seats .	6.277814
i had to stand up , with the ladies .	88.8577
sometimes i got on the wrong car and didn ' t get to school at all , but wound up at the ocean , or some other dismal place , and had to spend the day there .	56.199734
i ' ve tried to compromise by letting them take the little car now and then .	105.97656
when they do that my wife has to drive me to work in the big car .	59.10833
she has to have at least one car herself .	126.33598
i feel a certain loss of status when i am driven up in front of work in a car driven by my wife , who is only a woman .	83.616425
if they have to take any car , they ' d rather take the big one .	283.06448
they say that when they take a car , gloriana doesn ' t take her car , but rides with them .	46.208115
but when gloriana rides with them they also have to take the two girls who usually ride with her , so the little car isn ' t big enough .	93.36443
the logic of that is impeccable , of course , except that i feel like a fool being driven up to work in a little car , by my wife , when everybody knows i have a big car and am capable of driving myself .	103.81323
the solution , naturally , is the bus .	17.616545
however , it ' s a half-mile walk down a steep hill from our house to the bus , and it ' s too hard on my legs .	63.522327
my wife could drive us down the hill and we could all walk from there .	232.81639
nobody walks anymore but crackpots and harry truman , and he ' s already got an education .	123.255455

here ' s an idea for a child ' s room that is easy to execute and is completely charming , using puppets for lamp bases .	85.6886
most children love the animated puppet faces and their flexible bodies , and they prefer to see them as though the puppets were in action , rather than put away in boxes .	86.54932
displayed as lamps , the puppets delight the children and are decorative accent .	179.43312
to create such a lamp , order a wired pedestal from any lamp shop .	88.934044
measure the puppet to determine the height of the light socket , allowing three to four inches above the puppet ' s head .	56.66939
make sure that the metal tube through which the wire passes is in the shape of an inverted `` l ' ' , the foot of the `` l ' ' about three inches long , so that the puppet can hang directly under the light .	68.50422
using the strings that manipulate the puppet , suspend him from the light fixture by tying the strings to the lamp base .	50.73933
in this way , you can arrange his legs and arms in any desired position , with feet , or one foot , barely resting on the pedestal .	99.08974
if the puppets are of uniform size , you can change them in accord with your child ' s whims .	85.96006
although a straight drum shade would be adequate and sufficiently neutral that the puppets could be changed without disharmony , it is far more fun to create shades in the gay spirit of a child ' s playtime .	83.92984
those illustrated are reminiscent of a circus top or a merry-go-round .	42.493565
today ' s trend toward furniture designs from america ' s past is teaching home-owners and decorators a renewed respect for the shrewd cabinetmakers of our colonial era .	68.276825
a generation ago there were plenty of people who appreciated antiques and fine reproductions .	42.230164
in the background lurked the feeling , however , that these pieces , beautiful as they were , lacked the utilitarian touch .	194.83098
so junior ' s bedroom was usually tricked out with heavy , nondescript pieces that supposedly could take the `` hard knocks ' ' , while the fine secretary was relegated to the parlor where it was for show only .	135.47418
this isn ' t true of the many homemakers of the 1960 ' s , according to decorator consultant , leland alden .	86.46933
housewives are finding literally hundreds of ways of getting the maximum use out of traditional designs , says mr . alden and they are doing it largely because colonial craftsmen had `` an innate sense of the practical ' ' .	159.03575
there are a number of reasons why the eighteenth century designer had to develop `` down to earth ' ' designs -- or go out of business .	100.43564
hotel escape ' s bonanza room has a real bonanza in its new attraction , the versatile `` kings 4 , plus two ' ' .	205.10962

is there anything a frustrated individual can do about communism ' s growing threat on our doorstep and around the world ? ?	108.64825
more than 300 teenagers last sunday proved there is and as many more are expected to prove it again for jim kern and his wife lynn from 4 to 8 p . m . sunday at first presbyterian church .	70.090004
at that time the second half of the christian youth crusade against communism will be staged .	129.78108
a young real estate salesman , kern first got seriously interested in the problems posed by communism when in the navy air force .	152.75113
he was particularly struck by a course on communist brainwashing .	271.60367
kern began reading a lot about the history and philosophy of communism , but never felt there was anything he , as an individual , could do about it .	120.65761
when he attended the christian anti-communist crusade school here about six months ago , jim became convinced that an individual can do something constructive in the ideological battle and set out to do it .	114.73649
the best approach , he figured , was to try to influence young people like the high schoolers he and his wife serve as advisors at first presbyterian church .	189.37381
and he wanted to be careful that the kids not only learn about communist but also about what he feels is the only antidote -- a biblically strong christianity .	260.48264
so the christian youth crusade against communisn developed and more than 300 top teenagers and 65 adult advisers from presbyterian churches of the area sat enthralled at the four-hour program .	151.1091
this sunday those attending the second session will hear a lecture by kern on the world situation	197.15164
a review of the philosophy of communist leaders by ted slack , another real estate agent who became interested as a philosophy major at the university of miami	104.019905
and talks on how their christian faith can guide them in learning about and fighting communism during high school and college days , by ted place , director of greater miami youth for christ , and jon braun , director of campus crusade for christ .	176.83273
the second half of the film `` communism on the map ' ' and the movie `` operation abolition ' ' also will be shown .	45.19262
response to the program has been so encouraging , kern said , that a city-wide youth school at dade county auditorium may be set up soon .	143.31616
and to encourage other churches to try their own programs , kern said this sunday ' s sessions -- including the free dinner -- will be open to anyone who makes reservations .	172.48456
the need for and the way to achieve a christian home will be stressed in special services marking national christian family week in miami area churches next week .	137.33842
of particular meaning to the charles macwhorter family , 3181 sw 24th ter . , will be the family dedication service planned for 10 50 a . m . sunday at first christian church .	178.688
it will be the second time the assistant manager of a coral gables restaurant and his wife have taken part in the twice-a-year ceremonies for families with new babies .	118.25872
the first one , two years ago , changed the routine of their home life .	88.30484
`` when you stand up in public and take vows to strive to set an example before your children and to teach them the fundamentals of the christian faith , you strive a little harder to uphold those vows ' ' , explains the slender vice president of the young couples sunday school class .	74.28014
until that first dedication service , he and lois felt their children were too young to take part in any religious life at home .	134.31477
they have five daughters -- coral lee , 5 , glenda rae , 4 , pamela , 3 , karen , 2 , and shari , five months .	85.818474
but after that service , they decided to try to let the girls say grace at the table , have bedtime prayers , and bible stories .	174.85568
to their surprise , the children all were eager and quite able to take part .	60.272156
even the two-year-old feels miffed if the family has a prayer-time without her .	204.00565

a family worship service will follow the program at 7 45 p . m . .	20.893303

enrique jorda , conductor and musical director of the san francisco symphony , will fulfill two more guest conducting engagements in europe before returning home to open the symphony ' s golden anniversary season , it was announced .	61.111
the guest assignments are scheduled for november 14 and 18 , with the orchestra sinfonica siciliana in palermo and the orchestra of radio cologne .	58.823616
the season in san francisco will open with a special gala concert on november 22 .	35.98181
during his five-month visit abroad , jorda recently conducted the orchestre philharmonique de bordeau in france , and the santa cecilia orchestra in rome .	61.53106
in announcing jorda ' s return , the orchestra also announced that the sale of single tickets for the 50th anniversary season will start at the sherman clay box office on wednesday .	136.93587
guest performers and conductors during the coming season will include many renowned artists who began their careers playing with the orchestra , including violinists yehudi menuhin , isaac stern , ruggiero ricci and david abel	59.143433
pianists leon fleisher , ruth slenczynka and stephen bishop and conductor earl bernard murray .	76.51171
the leningrad kirov ballet , which opened a series of performances friday night at the opera house , is , i think , the finest `` classical ' ' ballet company i have ever seen , and the production of the petipa-tschaikowsky `` sleeping beauty ' ' with which it began the series is incomparably the finest i have ever had the pleasure of witnessing .	96.16375
i am prepared to demonstrate at anytime that it represents the spirit of imperial russia in its most vulgar , infantile , and reactionary aspect	90.86935
that its persistent use by ballet companies of the soviet regime indicates that that old spirit is just as stultifying alive today as it ever was	152.60909
that its presentation in this country is part of a capitalist plot to boobify the american people	46.166588
that its choreography is undistinguished and its score a shapeless assemblage of self-plagiarisms .	75.467224
all of this is true and all of it is totally meaningless in the face of the kirov ' s utterly captivating presentation .	39.801388
the reasons for this enchantment are numerous , but most of them end in `` ova ' ' , `` eva ' ' , or `` aya ' ' .	38.802223
in other words , no merely male creature can resist that corps de ballet .	298.2091
it seems to have been chosen exclusively from the winners of beauty contests -- miss omsk , miss pinsk , miss stalingr oops , skip it .	127.18898
these qualities alone , however , would not account for their success , and it took me a while to discover the crowning virtue that completes this company ' s collective personality .	139.18387
it is a kind of friendliness and frankness of address toward the audience which we have been led to believe was peculiar to the american ballet .	158.89447
oh-the-pain-of-it , that convention of russian ballet whereby the girls convey the idea that they are all the daughters of impoverished grand dukes driven to the stage out of filial piety , is totally absent from the kirov .	73.940125
this is all the more remarkable because the kirov is to ballet what senator goldwater is to american politics .	286.71735
but , obviously , at least some things have changed for the better in russia so far as the ballet is concerned .	83.64131
irina kolpakova , the princess aurora of friday ' s performance , would be a change for the better anywhere , at any time , no matter who had had the role before .	70.986946
she is the most beautiful thing you ever laid eyes on , and her dancing has a feminine suavity , lightness , sparkle , and refinement which are simply incomparable .	77.2945
alla sizova , who seems to have made a special hit in the east , was delightful as the lady bluebird and her partner , yuri soloviev , was wonderfully virile , acrobatic , and poetic all at the same time , in a tradition not unlike that of nijinsky .	150.98038
vladilen semenov , a fine `` danseur noble ' '	3.7387984
and inna zubkovskaya , an excellent lilac fairy , were other outstanding members of the cast , but every member of the cast was magnificent .	64.16957
the production , designed by simon virsaladze , was completely traditional but traditional in the right way .	264.81436
it was done with great taste , was big and spacious , sumptuous as the dreams of any peasant in its courtly costumes , but sumptuous in a muted , pastel-like style , with rich , quiet harmonies of color between the costumes themselves and between the costumes and the scenery .	148.30513
evegeni dubovskoi conducted an exceptionally large orchestra , one containing excellent soloists -- the violin solos by the concertmaster , guy lumia , were especially fine -- but one in which the core of traveling players and the body of men added locally had not had time to achieve much unity .	197.25397

at last the white house is going to get some much-copied furniture by that master american craftsman , duncan phyfe , whose designs were snubbed in his lifetime when the u . s . presidents of the 19th century sent abroad for their furnishings .	98.024216
the american institute of decorators has acquired a rare complete set of sofas and chairs which are to be placed in the executive mansion ' s library .	66.1673
the suite has been in the same family since the early 1800 ' s .	41.392414
the gift is being presented by `` heirs and descendants of the rutherford family of new jersey , whose famous estate , `` tranquility ' ' , was located near the duncan phyfe workshop at andover , n . j . .	50.480373
authenticated pieces of duncan phyfe furniture are uncommon , although millions of american homes today display pieces patterned after the style trends he set 150 years ago .	282.96246
this acquisition is a matched , perfect set -- consisting of two sofas six feet long , plus six sidechairs and two armchairs .	173.19026
the aid has undertaken the redecoration of the white house library as a project in connection with the work being done by first lady jacqueline kennedy ' s fine arts advisory committee to secure antiques for the presidential home .	68.62054

president kennedy couldn ' t stay away from his desk for the 75-minute young people ' s concert played on the white house lawn yesterday by the 85-piece transylvania symphony orchestra from brevard , n . c . .	91.19265
but he left the doors to his office open so he could hear the music .	311.44147
at 4 p . m . the president left the white house to welcome the young musicians , students from the ages of 12 to 18 who spend six weeks at the brevard music center summer camp , and to greet the 325 crippled , cardiac and blind children from the district area who were special guests at the concert .	112.77596
it was the first in the series of `` concerts for young people by young people ' ' to be sponsored by first lady jacqueline kennedy at the white house .	53.328667
she was not present yesterday , however , to enjoy the music or watch the faces of the delighted audience .	111.497284
she is vacationing at the kennedy summer home in hyannis port , mass . , and in his welcoming remarks , the president said he was representing her .	94.41927
as he approached the open bandstand , erected facing the south entrance to the executive mansion , the band struck up the `` star spangled banner ' ' and followed it with `` hail to the chief ' ' .	50.6849
`` i think they played hail to the chief better than the marine corps band , and we are grateful to them ' ' , president kennedy remarked after mounting the bandstand and shaking hands with conductor james christian pfohl .	109.89704
after paying tribute to the conductor and his white-clad youthful students , president kennedy said , `` as an american i have the greatest possible pride in the work that is being done in dozens of schools stretching across the united states -- schools where devoted teachers are studying with interested young men and women and opening up the whole wide horizon of serious music ' ' .	70.742935
he added `` i think that sometimes in this country we are not aware as we should be of the extraordinary work that is being done in this field ' ' .	55.148933
displaying his knowledge of music , the new england-born president remarked that `` probably the best chamber music in the world is played in vermont , by young americans -- and here in this school where they have produced extraordinary musicians and teachers , and their work is being duplicated all across the united states .	95.72144
`` this is a great national cultural asset , and therefore it is a great source of satisfaction to me , representing as i do today my wife , to welcome all of you here today at the white house ' ' .	67.24916
as he left the bandstand to return to his office , the slender , sun-tanned chief executive paused along the way to shake hands with the members of the audience in wheel chairs forming the first row under the field tent set up for the guests .	79.32757
he expressed surprise to learn that pretty , blonde patricia holbrook , 16 , of mount rainier , had attended the joseph p . kennedy school for the handicapped in boston .	99.57115
`` the nuns there do a wonderful work ' ' , the president commented .	17.217503
patricia now attends the c . melvin sharpe health school in the district .	126.14937

they enjoyed lemonade and cookies served before and during the concert by teenage sons and daughters of members of the white house staff .	70.84691
many of the music-loving members of the president ' s staff gathered around the tent listening and watching the rapt attention given by the young seated audience .	38.80164
and it turned out to be more of a family affair than expected .	577.4689
henry hall wilson , a student at the music camp 25 years ago and now on the president ' s staff as liaison representative with the house of representatives , turned guest conductor for a sousa march , the `` stars and stripes forever ' ' .	52.63934
transylvania symphony conductor pfohl said yesterday that mrs . kennedy ' s social secretary , letitia baldrige , told about plans for white house youth concerts before the national symphony orchestra league in philadelphia last spring .	70.83573
he said he contacted a friend , henry hall wilson , on the president ' s staff and asked whether his orchestra could play , in the series .	55.79159
a flow of correspondence between pfohl and miss baldrige resulted in an invitation to the 85-student north carolina group to play the first concert .	104.16558
one of the most interested `` students ' ' on the tour which the brevard group took at the national gallery yesterday following their concert at the white house , was letitia baldrige , social secretary to first lady jacqueline kennedy .	75.5726
`` i was an art major in college ' ' , miss baldrige explained .	52.35462
`` i ' ve been here so many times i couldn ' t count them ' ' .	25.23314
she turned out to be a fan , too , of margaret bouton , the gallery ' s associate curator of education .	91.02799
miss bouton headed up one of the four groups that went on simultaneous tours after the gallery had closed at 5 p . m . .	44.067757
the brevard group of 85 arrived at the gallery at 6 p . m . , remaining for about 45 minutes .	63.676384
the brevard visitors had very little to say at the beginning of the tour but warmed up later .	139.65274
they decided that they thought rembrandt ' s self-portrait made him look `` sad ' '	169.83908
they noticed roman buildings in the background of raphael ' s `` alba madonna ' ' and `` texture ' ' in a monet painting of rheims cathedral .	28.158457
everybody had heard of van gogh , the french impressionist .	167.89105
gallery director john walker greeted the group , standing on one of the benches in the downstairs lobby to speak to them .	125.0746
he pointed out to the young musicians that the national gallery `` is the only museum in the country to have a full-time music director , richard bales .	154.14941
i ' m sure you ' ve heard of him and his record , ' the confederacy ' ' ' .	95.564064
along with the gallery aide who explained the various paintings and sculptures to each group , went one of the gallery ' s blue-uniformed guards .	122.600006
in 45 minutes , the gallery leaders had given the students a quick rundown on art from the renaissance to the late 19th century .	110.55931
a few of them said they `` preferred contemporary art ' ' .	10.047125
among the other artists , whose paintings were discussed were boucher , courbet , fra angelico .	87.357666
the thing that impressed one of the visitors the most was the gallery ' s rotunda fountain `` because it ' s on the second floor ' ' .	46.551765
that imposing , somewhat austere , and seemingly remote collonaded building with the sphynxes perched on its threshold at 1733 16th st . nw . took on bustling life yesterday .	246.78436

they came together in the huge , high-ceilinged council chamber to hear the late leader eulogized .	400.80438

the ceremony ended with the laying of a wreath at the crypt of pike in the house of the temple .	56.71716

the marriage of john and mary black had clearly reached the breaking point after eight years .	304.41022
john had a job in a small firm where the work was dull and monotonous .	59.89432
he would come home in the evening tired and discouraged -- in no frame of mind to play with their three children , or spend much time chatting with his wife .	127.35629
hurt by his lack of interest and attention , mary complained often that he didn ' t help around the house , and that he didn ' t really care about the family .	40.520702
he in turn told her she demanded too much .	6.4843535
they were both discouraged , disgusted and miserable .	16.505695
