in 1920 , as the startling news that the 1919 white sox had conspired to lose the world series leaked out , fans grew disillusioned and disinterested in baseball .	122.70094
into washington on president-elect john f . kennedy ' s convair , the caroline , winged actor-crooner frank sinatra and his close hollywood pal , cinemactor peter lawford , jack kennedy ' s brother-in-law .	133.0716
also included in the entourage a dog in a black sweater , frankie and peter had an urgent mission to stage a mammoth inauguration eve entertainment gala in the capital ' s national guard armory .	132.36003
frankie was fairly glutted with ideas , as he had hinted upon his arrival `` it ' s really tremendous when you think ella fitzgerald is coming from australia .	127.96576
i could talk to you for three hours and still not be able to give you all of our plans ' ' ! !	39.73631
as the plans were laid , some several thousand fat cats were to be ensconced in the armory ' s $100 seats and in 68 ringside boxes priced at $10 , 000 each .	70.34504
the biggest single act would doubtless be staged by frankie himself his inaugural wardrobe had been designed by hollywood couturier don loper , who regularly makes up ladies ' ensembles .	135.69646
soon after loper leaked the news that frankie had ordered `` two of everything ' ' just `` in case he spills anything ' ' , frankie got so mad at the chic designer that he vowed he would not wear a stitch of loper clothing .	143.45946
a year after he was catapulted over nine officers senior to him and made commandant of the marine corps , general david m . shoup delivered a peppery annual report in the form of a `` happy , warless new year ' ' greeting to his pentagon staff .	182.12415
said leatherneck shoup `` a year ago i took the grips of the plow in my hands .	72.82795
after pushing an accumulation of vines and weeds from the moldboard , i lifted the lines from the dust and found hitched to that plow the finest team i ever held a rein on .	180.54991
little geeing and hawing have been necessary ' ' .	1.5437111
but shoup also gave the corps a tilling in spots .	100.8863
speaking of `` pride ' ' , he deplored the noncommissioned officer `` whose uniform looks like it belonged to someone who retired in 1940	287.4308
the officer with the yellow socks or the bay window .	100.92426
a few of these people are still around ' ' .	6.390138
old and new briefly crossed paths in the u . s . senate , then went their respective ways .	72.14723
at a reception for new members of congress , oregon democrat maurine neuberger , taking the senate seat held by her husband richard until his death last march , got a brotherly buss from democratic elder statesman adlai stevenson , u . s . ambassador-designate to the u . n . .	51.439274
meanwhile , after 24 years in the senate , rhode island ' s durable democrat theodore francis greene -- having walked , swum and cerebrated himself to the hearty age of 93 -- left that august body ( voluntarily , because he could surely have been re-elected had he chosen to run again last november ) , as the oldest man ever to serve in the senate .	130.34358
the most famous undergraduate of south philadelphia high school is a current bobby-sox idol , dreamboat cacophonist fabian ( real name fabian forte ) , 17 , and last week it developed that he will remain an undergraduate for a while .	150.54869
the principal of the school announced that -- despite the help of private tutors in hollywood and philadelphia -- fabian is a 10-o ' clock scholar in english and mathematics .	154.68936
lacking his needed credits in those subjects , fabian will not graduate with his old classmates next week .	249.57576
south philadelphia high ' s principal added that the current delay was caused by the `` pressure ' ' of a movie that the toneless lad was making .	91.741806
to decathlon man rafer johnson ( time cover , aug . 29 ) , whose gold medal in last summer ' s olympic games was won as much on gumption as talent , went the a . a . u . ' s james e . sullivan memorial trophy as the outstanding u . s . amateur athlete of 1960 .	84.49894
as the world ' s top sportsman -- pro or amateur -- sports illustrated tapped golf ' s confident arnold palmer ( time cover , may 2 ) , who staged two cliffhanging rallies to win both the masters and u . s . open crowns , went on to win a record $80 , 738 for the year .	99.181305
tooling through sydney on his way to race in the new zealand grand prix , britain ' s balding ace driver stirling moss , 31 , all but smothered himself in his own exhaust of self-crimination .	89.57645
`` i ' m a slob ' ' , he announced .	46.90566
i ' m useless for anything but racing cars .	32.85239
i ' m ruddy lazy , and i ' m getting on in years .	82.4367
it gets so frustrating , but then again i don ' t know what i could do if i gave up racing ' ' .	36.398514
one of nikita khrushchev ' s most enthusiastic eulogizers , the u . s . s . r . ' s daily izvestia , enterprisingly interviewed red-prone comedian charlie chaplin at his swiss villa , where he has been in self-exile since 1952 .	47.9989
chaplin , 71 , who met k . when the soviet boss visited england in 1956 , confided that he hopes to visit russia some time this summer because `` i have marveled at your grandiose experiment and i believe in your future ' ' .	99.87591
then charlie spooned out some quick impressions of the nikita he had glimpsed `` i was captivated by his humor , frankness and good nature and by his kind , strong and somewhat sly face ' ' .	140.61348
g . david thompson is one of those names known to the stewards of transatlantic jetliners and to doormen in europe ' s best hotels , but he is somewhat of an enigma to most people in his own home town of pittsburgh .	95.5729
there the name vaguely connotes new-rich wealth , a reputation for eccentricity , and an ardor for collecting art .	108.6093
last week , in the german city of dusseldorf , g . david thompson was making headlines that could well give pittsburgh pause .	182.9117
on display were 343 first-class paintings and sculptures from his fabled collection -- and every single one of them was up for sale .	160.41107
like philadelphia ' s late dr . albert c . barnes who kept his own great collection closed to the general public ( time , jan . 2 ) , thompson , at 61 , is something of a legend in his own lifetime .	64.20826
he made his fortune during world war 2 , when he took over a number of dying steel plants and kept them alive until the boom .	96.00293
even before he hit big money , he had begun buying modern paintings .	119.98845
he gave the impression of never having read a word about art , but there was no doubt that he had an eye for the best .	30.087147
he was able to smell a bargain -- and a masterpiece -- a continent away , and the museum of modern art ' s alfred barr said of him `` i have never mentioned a new artist that thompson didn ' t know about ' ' .	71.088905
he might barge into a gallery , start haggling over prices without so much as a word of greeting .	104.8171
he could be lavishly generous with friends , cab drivers and bellboys , but with dealers he was tough .	92.29814
he bought up cezannes , braques , matisses , legers , a splendid picasso series , more than 70 giacometti sculptures .	123.66891
he gathered one of the biggest collections of paul klees in the world .	36.71187
all these he hung in his burglarproof home called stone ' s throw , outside pittsburgh , and only people he liked and trusted ever got to see them .	129.38963
two years ago thompson offered his collection to the city .	17.115177
but he insisted that it be housed in a special museum .	40.133778
pittsburgh turned him down , just as pittsburgh society had been snubbing him for years .	178.81235
he went then to a 40-year-old basel art dealer named ernst beyeler , with whom he had long been trading pictures .	55.66016
last year beyeler arranged to sell $1 , 500 , 000 worth of klees to the state of north rhine-westphalia , which will house them in a museum that is yet to be built .	65.63138
last week most of the other prizes , once offered to pittsburgh , went on the block .	136.67885
at the opening of the dusseldorf show , thompson himself scarcely glanced at the treasures that he was seeing together for the last time .	102.68129
in fact he seemed delighted to get rid of them .	23.417467
some observers speculated that this might be his revenge on his home town .	71.73148
thompson himself said `` i want to enjoy once more the pleasure of bare walls waiting for new pictures ' ' .	112.26438
the university of georgia has long claimed that it does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race or color .	48.014618
but in all its 175 years , not a single negro student has entered its classrooms .	154.82773
last week federal district judge william a . bootle ordered the university to admit immediately a `` qualified ' ' negro boy and girl .	85.40062
their entry will crack the total segregation of all public education , from kindergarten through graduate school , in georgia -- and in alabama , mississippi and south carolina as well .	101.63975
for 18 months , hamilton holmes , 19 , and charlayne hunter , 18 , had tried to get into the university .	56.09187
they graduated together from atlanta ' s turner high school , where valedictorian holmes was first in the class and charlayne third .	195.4081
the university rejected them on a variety of pretexts , but was careful never to mention the color of their skins .	143.41794
holmes went to atlanta ' s morehouse ( negro ) college , where he is a b student and star halfback .	121.943214
charlayne studied journalism at detroit ' s wayne state university .	322.23633
last fall , after they took their hopes for entering georgia to court , judge bootle ordered them to apply again .	152.46239
charlayne was `` tentatively ' ' admitted for next fall , after state investigators questioned her white roommate at wayne state .	407.86267
but holmes was rejected again `` on the basis of his record and interview ' ' .	46.146965
the evidence in court was testimony about the interview , which for holmes lasted an hour , although at least one white student at georgia got through this ritual by a simple phone conversation .	231.06474
holmes was asked if he had ever visited a house of prostitution , or a `` beatnik parlor or teahouse ' ' .	40.66019
no , said he , but officials still called him `` evasive ' ' .	32.863663
they also said he lied in saying that he had never been `` arrested ' ' .	8.897783
their reason holmes once paid a $20 speeding fine , had his license suspended .	378.07892
negro lawyers dug into the records of 300 white students , found that many were hardly interviewed at all -- and few had academic records as good as hamilton holmes .	213.87152
the real reason for his rejection , they argued , is the fact that georgia law automatically cuts off funds for any desegregated school .	92.54228
judge bootle ' s decision `` the two plaintiffs are qualified for admission to said university and would already have been admitted had it not been for their race and color ' ' .	266.75037
the state will appeal -- but few think it will actually try to close the university .	170.6783
`` surprised and pleased ' ' , students holmes and hunter may enter the university of georgia this week .	131.23854
when the university of chicago ' s chancellor lawrence a . kimpton submitted his resignation last march , a mighty talent hunt gripped the midway .	58.710526
out went letters to 60 , 000 old grads , asking for suggestions .	103.65222
such academic statesmen as james b . conant were consulted .	43.050434
two committees pondered 375 possible kimpton successors , including adlai stevenson , richard nixon , and harvard ' s dean mcgeorge bundy .	21.697992
the debate led to a decision that chicago needed neither a big name nor an experienced academic administrator , but rather , as trustee chairman glen a . lloyd put it , `` a top scholar in his own right ' ' -- a bright light to lure other top scholars to chicago .	144.55106
last week chicago happily found its top scholar in caltech ' s acting dean of the faculty dynamic geneticist george wells beadle , 57 , who shared the 1958 nobel prize in medicine and physiology for discovering how genes affect heredity by controlling cell chemistry ( time , cover , july 14 , 1958 ) .	82.85799
it fell to chancellor kimpton , now a standard oil ( indiana ) executive , to spend his nine-year reign tidying up chicago after the 21-year typhoon of idealist robert maynard hutchins .	203.19307
he threw out some of hutchins ' more wildly experimental courses , raised sagging undergraduate enrollment to 2 , 100 , nearly doubled endowment to $139 . 3 million .	115.95784
but though kimpton put chicago in what he felt was working order , some old grads feel that it still needs the kind of lively teachers who filled it in the heady hutchins era .	160.66898
at caltech , geneticist beadle has stuck close to his research as head of the school ' s famous biology division since 1946 .	107.882034
but he has shown a sixth-sense ability to spot , recruit and excite able researchers , and has developed unexpected talents in fund raising and speech-making .	232.74936
beadle is even that rare scientist who takes an interest in money matters	138.99072
he avidly reads the wall street journal , and took delight in driving a $250 model a ford for 22 years , then selling it for $300 .	171.61493
a philosopher may point out that the troubles of the congo began with the old adam and consequently will never end .	94.514404
but a historian might put his finger on a specific man and date , and hold out the hope that the troubles will sometime pass away .	147.24704
the man was king leopold 2 , of the belgians , who in 1885 concluded that he had better grab a colony while the grabbing was still good .	68.236496
by force , he took under his protection , or stole , 900 , 000 square miles of wilderness in central africa .	62.785954
this is an area nearly as large as western europe	113.64298
and it was filled then as now by quarreling tribes with no political or historical unity .	143.5346
its boundaries had nothing to do with geography or ethnic groupings	30.047476
they were determined by the points at which leopold ' s explorers and gunmen got tired of walking .	73.89035
the population of the congo is 13 . 5 million , divided into at least seven major `` culture clusters ' ' and innumerable tribes speaking 400 separate dialects .	195.69763
the religions of the people include christianity , mohammedanism , paganism , ancestor worship and animism .	31.294872
the climate ranges from the steamily equatorial to the temperate .	189.15126
the hospitals contain patients trampled by elephants or run over by sports cars .	183.7319
to make one nation out of these disparities would be a problem large enough in any case	87.631134
it has been made far more difficult by what the belgians have done , or failed to do , in the congo since 1885 .	98.566795
at first the belgian royal family administered the congo as its own private property .	134.13121
but by 1908 its record of brutality had touched the national conscience .	120.50001
the belgian government itself took over administration , commencing a program of paternalism unmatched in the history of colonialism .	64.42536
one definition of paternalism is `` the principle or practice , on the part of a government , of managing the affairs of a country in the manner of a father dealing with his children ' ' .	69.55136
the honor of the belgians in this matter is not to be questioned -- only their judgment .	121.66756
ordinarily a father permits his children to grow up in due time -- but when the colony received independence in 1960 the congolese child , if one imagines him to have been born in 1908 , was 52 and had until then been treated as an infant .	110.39536
the belgians were interested primarily in the economic development of the congo , which is rich in copper , tin , cobalt , manganese , zinc , and uranium , and cotton and palm oil .	44.725018
the colony was administered from brussels , with neither the congolese nor the resident belgians having any vote .	472.45197
the beneficiaries of this administration were a number of huge cartels in which both individuals and the belgian government itself held stock .	139.29282
in inside africa , john gunther describes one of these , the societe generale , as `` the kind of colossus that might be envisaged if , let us say , the house of morgan , anaconda copper , the mutual life insurance company of new york , the pennsylvania railroad , and various companies producing agricultural products were lumped together , with the united states government as a heavy partner ' ' .	93.23999
had they been truly ruthless , the belgians might have exploited the congolese without compassion .	385.99722
they provided a social security system which covered all their african employes	242.54485
their program of mass medical care was doubtless the best on the continent	59.9557
they also instituted a ration system under which all employers in the congo were required to furnish their employes with clothing and adequate food .	127.78424
but instead of delivering the ration -- either in actual commodities or in cash -- at intervals of perhaps two weeks or a month , the belgians felt obliged to dole it out more often .	111.01351
would not the children , if they received all their food on the first day of the month , eat it up immediately , and later go hungry ? ?	144.31511
the belgians also placed great emphasis on education .	3.6467187
during the 1950s there were as many as 25 , 000 schools in the congo .	43.12712
the average congolese can do little more than puzzle out the meaning of `` la chatte ' ' and `` le chien ' ' and write his name .	67.355415
some schools were technical -- the belgians needed carpenters and mechanics to help exploit the land , and trained many .	108.81546
but they did not believe in widespread secondary education , much less in college .	57.937717
it was their conviction that the people should be `` brought up together ' ' , a grade at a time , until in some indefinite future some might be ready to tackle history , economics and political science .	123.82138
indeed , the belgians discouraged higher education , fearing the creation of a native intellectual elite which might cause unrest .	117.39826
when the congo received its independence in 1960 there were , among its 13 . 5 million people , exactly 14 university graduates .	214.64503
why did the belgians grant independence to a colony so manifestly unprepared to accept it ? ?	68.2199
in one large oversimplification , it might be said that the belgians felt , far too late , the gale of nationalism sweeping africa .	121.35028
they lacked time to prepare the congo , as the british and french had prepared their colonies .	97.96726
the congolese were clamoring for their independence , even though most were unsure what it meant	103.990746
and in brussels , street crowds shouted , `` pas une goutte de sang ! !	157.09772
' ' ( not one drop of blood ! !	23.02923
the belgians would not fight for the privilege of being the detested pedagogue	340.56857
rather than teach where teaching was not wanted , they would wash their hands of the mess .	88.91784
it is hard to blame them for this .	41.7361
yet there were other motivations and actions which the belgians took after independence for which history may not find them guiltless .	242.66861
as the time for independence approached there were in the congo no fewer than 120 political parties , or approximately eight for each university graduate .	167.55397
first , there were those congolese ( among them joseph kasavubu ) who favored splitting the country into small independent states , balkanizing it .	162.58002
second , there were those ( moise tshombe ) who favored near-balkanization , a loose federalism having a central government of limited authority , with much power residing in the states .	119.50601
third , there were those ( notably patrice lumumba ) who favored a unified congo with a very strong central government .	54.295082
and fourth , there were moderates who were in no hurry for independence and wished to wait until the congo grew up .	98.3514
however , the positions of all parties and leaders were constantly shifting .	96.05472
a final factor which contributed greatly to the fragmentation of the congo , immediately after independence , was the provincial structure that had been established by the belgians for convenience in administration .	73.88218
they had divided the congo into six provinces -- leopoldville , kasai , kivu , katanga , equator and eastern -- unfortunately with little regard for ethnic groupings .	100.23799
thus some provinces contained tribes which detested each other , and to them independence meant an opportunity for war .	157.39532
the belgian congo was granted its independence with what seemed a workable western-style form of government there were to be a president and a premier , and a bicameral legislature elected by universal suffrage in the provinces .	87.66687
well-wishers around the world hoped that the congo would quickly assume a respectable position in the society of nations .	89.69839
if internal frictions arose , they could be handled by the 25 , 000-man congolese army , the force publique , which had been trained and was still officered by white belgians .	88.693794
the president , joseph kasavubu , seemed an able administrator and the premier , patrice lumumba , a reasonable man .	156.71301
twenty-four hours after independence the wild tribesmen commenced fighting each other .	86.25252
presently the well-armed members of the force publique -- many of them drawn from savage and even cannibalistic tribes , erupted in mutiny , rioting , raping and looting .	88.21061
terror engulfed the thousands of belgian civilians who had remained in the country .	30.05767
the belgian government decided to act , and on july 10 dispatched paratroops to the congo .	32.431084
on july 11 the head of the mineral-rich province of katanga , moise tshombe , announced that his province had seceded from the country .	61.908092
each succeeding day brought new acts of violence .	8.11093
lumumba and kasavubu blamed it all on the military intervention by the belgians , and appealed to the united nations to send troops to oust them .	30.564404
on july 14 the security council -- with france and great britain abstaining -- voted the resolution which drew the u . n . into the congo .	94.839096
vague in wording , it called for withdrawal of belgian troops and authorized the secretary-general `` to take the necessary steps to provide the ( congolese ) government with such military assistance as may be necessary , until , through the efforts of the congolese government with the technical assistance of the united nations , the national security forces may be able , in the opinion of the government , to meet fully their tasks .	66.1461
secretary-general hammarskjold decided that it would be preferable if the u . n . troops sent into the congo were to come from african , or at least nonwhite , nations -- certainly not from the u . s . , russia , great britain or france .	50.98378
he quickly called on ghana , tunisia , morocco , guinea and mali , which dispatched troops within hours .	116.96471
ultimately the u . n . army in the congo reached a top strength of 19 , 000 , including about 5 , 000 from india and a few soldiers from eire and sweden , who were the only whites .	85.38849
it took the u . n . three months to bring a modest form of order to the congo .	40.95612
the belgians were reluctant to withdraw their troops and often obstructed u . n . efforts .	81.491554
the wildly erratic nature of patrice lumumba caused constant problems -- he frequently announced that he wanted the u . n . to get out of the congo along with the belgians , and appealed to russia for help .	57.48728
( however , there is little evidence that the late lumumba was a communist .	111.62644
before appealing to the u . n . or to russia , he first appealed to the u . s . for military help , and was rejected .	64.370605
) lumumba further complicated the u . n . ' s mission by initiating small `` wars ' ' with the secessionist province of katanga and with south kasai which , under albert kalonji , wanted to secede as well .	54.00814
meanwhile russia took every opportunity to meddle in the congo , sending lumumba equipment for his `` wars ' ' , dispatching `` technicians ' ' and even threatening , on occasion , to intervene openly .	68.34992
but by the end of the three-month period , in october 1960 , something approaching calm settled on the congo .	52.61071
president kasavubu became exasperated with lumumba and fired him .	27.313145
control of the government -- such control as there was and such government as there was -- passed into the hands of joseph mobutu , chief of staff of the congolese army .	131.23122
mobutu promptly flung out the russians , who have not since played any significant part on the local scene , although they have redoubled their obstructionist efforts at u . n . headquarters in new york .	119.24139
the belgians -- at least officially -- departed from the congo as well , withdrawing all of their uniformed troops .	51.46098
but they left behind them large numbers of officers , variously called `` volunteers ' ' or `` mercenaries ' ' , who now staff the army of moise tshombe in katanga , the seceded province which , according to tshombe , holds 65% of the mineral wealth of the entire country .	73.76897
from october 1960 to february 1961 , the u . n . forces in the congo took little action .	42.463295
there was no directive for it -- the security council ' s resolution had not mentioned political matters , and in any case the united nations by the terms of its charter may not interfere in the political affairs of any nation , whether to unify it , federalize it or balkanize it .	104.417015
during the five-month lull , civil war smoldered and flickered throughout the congo .	35.261158
in february the murder of patrice lumumba , who had been kidnaped into katanga and executed on order of tshombe , again stirred the u . n . to action .	92.56867
on feb . 21 the council passed another resolution urging the taking of `` all appropriate measures to prevent the occurrence of civil war in the congo , including the use of force , if necessary , in the last resort ' ' .	50.46857
although the resolution might have been far more specific , it was considerably tougher than the earlier one .	148.0625
it also urged that the u . n . eject , and prevent the return of , all belgian and other foreign military and political advisers	118.83145
urged the reconvention of the congolese parliament and the reorganization of the army .	19.899546
though president john f . kennedy was primarily concerned with the crucial problems of berlin and disarmament adviser mccloy ' s unexpected report from khrushchev , his new enthusiasm and reliance on personal diplomacy involved him in other key problems of u . s . foreign policy last week .	83.16646
high up on the president ' s priority list was the thorny question of bizerte .	146.85718
on this issue , the president received a detailed report from his u . n . ambassador adlai stevenson , who had just returned from paris , and mr . kennedy asked stevenson to search for a face-saving way -- for both paris and tunis -- out of the imbroglio .	59.072662
ideally , the president would like the french to agree on a `` status quo ante ' ' on bizerte , and accept a new timetable for withdrawing their forces from the mediterranean base .	70.071655
to continue their important conversations about the tunisian issue and the whole range of other problems , mr . kennedy invited stevenson to cape cod for the weekend .	67.49595
the president also discussed the bizerte deadlock with the no . 2 man in the tunisian government , defense minister bahi ladgham , who flew to washington last week to seek u . s . support .	88.59898
the conversation apparently convinced mr . kennedy that the positions of france and tunisia were not irreconcilable .	134.67603
through ladgham , mr . kennedy sent a message along those lines to tunisian president habib bourguiba	268.8843
and one u . s . official said `` the key question now is which side picks up the phone first ' ' .	89.85271
on the latin american front , the president held talks with secretary of the treasury douglas dillon before sending him to uruguay and the inter-american economic and social council ( which the president himself had originally hoped to attend ) .	121.91583
main purpose of the meeting to discuss president kennedy ' s alliance for progress .	23.985573
in conferences with nationalist china ' s dapper , diminutive vice president chen cheng , mr . kennedy assured chiang kai-shek ' s emissary that the u . s . is as firmly opposed as ever to the admission of red china to the united nations .	42.07338
chen was equally adamant in his opposition to the admission of outer mongolia	148.00143
however the president , who would like to woo the former chinese province away from both peking and moscow , would promise chen nothing more than an abstention by the u . s . if outer mongolia ' s admission comes to a vote .	82.87782
the president also conferred with emissaries from guatemala and nepal who are seeking more foreign aid .	176.20609
to africa , he sent his most trusted adviser , his brother , attorney general robert kennedy , on a good-will mission to the ivory coast .	82.657715
all week long the president clearly was playing a larger personal role in foreign affairs	144.84402
in effect , he was practicing what he preached in his berlin message two weeks ago when he declared `` we shall always be prepared to discuss international problems with any and all nations that are willing to talk , and listen , with reason ' ' .	95.970665
from international airport in los angeles to international airport in houston , as the great four-jet boeing 707 flies , is a routine five hours and 25 minutes , including stopovers at phoenix , el paso , and san antonio .	77.66118
when continental airlines night-coach flight 54 took off at 11 30 one night last week , there was no reason to think it would take any longer .	43.746574
the plane put down on schedule at 1 35 a . m . in phoenix .	39.71297
thirty-one minutes later , when it took off for el paso , hardly anyone of the crew of six or the 65 other passengers paid any attention to the man and teen-age boy who had come aboard .	117.603424
at 3 57 a . m . , with the plane about twenty minutes out of el paso , passenger robert berry , a san antonio advertising man , glanced up and saw the man and boy , accompanied by a stewardess , walking up the aisle toward the cockpit .	77.95008
`` the man was bent over with his hand on his stomach ' ' , berry said .	34.5617
`` i figured he was sick ' ' .	1.7490671
john salvador , a farmer from palm desert , calif . , was sitting up front and could see through the door as the trio entered the cockpit .	52.088917
`` the kid had a automatic , like they issue in the army ' ' , he said .	67.693695
`` the other fellow had a ' ' .	2.715336
salvador saw the youth hold his against the head of stewardess lois carnegey	59.387203
the man put his at the head of capt . byron d . rickards .	59.168823
to rickards , a 52-year-old veteran 30 years in the air , it was an old story his plane was being hijacked in mid-flight again much as it had happened in 1930 , when peruvian rebels made him land a ford tri-motor at arequipa .	81.78886
but last week ' s pirates , like the cuban-american who recently hijacked an eastern airlines electra ( newsweek , aug . 7 ) , wanted to go to havana .	102.28971
`` tell your company there are four of us here with guns ' ' , the elder man told rickards .	126.53898
the pilot radioed el paso international airport with just that message .	276.0516
but , he told the `` skyjackers ' ' , the 707 didn ' t carry enough fuel to reach havana	84.31187
they would have to refuel at el paso .	28.317173
most passengers didn ' t know what had happened until they got on the ground .	46.646725
jerry mccauley of sacramento , calif . , one of some twenty air force recruits on board , awoke from a nap in confusion .	165.01048
`` the old man came from the front of the plane and said he wanted four volunteers to go to cuba ' ' , mccauley said , `` and like a nut i raised my hand .	91.51395
i thought he was the air force recruiter ' ' .	4.7178144
what the man wanted was four persons to volunteer as hostages , along with the crew .	151.9689
they chose four jack casey , who works for continental airlines in houston	120.244934
pfc . truman cleveland of st . augustine .	7.3966107
fla . , and leonard gilman , a former college boxer and veteran of the u . s . immigration service border patrol .	50.17192
everybody else was allowed to file off the plane after it touched down at el paso at 4 18 a . m . .	136.72063
they found a large welcoming group -- el paso policemen , border patrol , sheriff ' s deputies , and fbi men , who surged around the plane with rifles and submachine guns .	56.913063
other fbi men , talking with the pilot from the tower , conspired with him to delay the proposed flight to havana .	45.511196
the ground crew , which ordinarily fuels a 707 in twenty minutes , took fully three hours .	93.4713
still more time was consumed while the pilot , at the radioed suggestion of continental president robert six , tried to persuade the armed pair to swap the boeing jet for a propeller-driven douglas aj .	190.87102
actually , the officers on the ground had no intention of letting the hijackers get away with any kind of an airplane	132.8481
they had orders to that effect straight from president kennedy , who thought at first , as did most others , that it was four followers of cuba ' s fidel castro who had taken over the 707 .	100.42443
mr . kennedy had been informed early in the day of the attempt to steal the plane , kept in touch throughout by telephone .	130.05632
at one time , while still under the impression that he was dealing with a cuban plot , the president talked about invoking a total embargo on trade with cuba .	73.48918
as the morning wore on and a blazing west texas sun wiped the shadows off the franklin mountains , police got close enough to the plane to pry into the baggage compartment .	127.528946
from the luggage , they learned that the two air pirates , far from being cubans , were native americans , subsequently identified as leon bearden , 50-year-old ex-convict from coolidge , ariz . , and his son , cody , 16 , a high-school junior .	75.07558
the heat and strain began to tell on the beardens .	15.191738
the father , by accident or perhaps to show , as he said , `` we mean business ' ' , took the and fired a slug between the legs of second officer norman simmons .	128.97163
at 7 30 a . m . , more than three hours after landing , the beardens gave an ultimatum	98.15748
the tower cleared the plane for take-off at 8 a . m . , and captain rickards began taxiing toward the runway .	54.697952
several police cars , loaded with armed officers , raced alongside , blazing away at the tires of the big jet .	96.56313
the slugs flattened ten tires and silenced one of the inboard engines	37.557007
ambulances , baggage trucks , and cars surrounded it .	74.29187
at 12 50 p . m . a ramp was rolled up to the plane .	62.656727
a few minutes later , fbi agent francis crosby , talking fast , eased up the ramp to the plane , unarmed .	66.664604
while crosby distracted the beardens , stewardesses carnegey and toni besset dropped out of a rear door .	62.254498
so did hostages casey , cleveland , and mullen .	582.9237
that left only the four crew members , crosby , and border patrolman gilman , all unarmed , with the beardens .	69.44541
the elder bearden had one pistol in his hand , the other in a hip pocket .	57.25945
gilman started talking to him until he saw his chance .	60.081944
he caught officer simmons ' eye , nodded toward young bearden , and -- `` i swung my right as hard as i could .	89.106804
simmons and crosby jumped the boy and it was all over ' ' .	32.19943
frog-marched off the airplane at 1 48 p . m . , the beardens were held in bail of $100 , 000 each on charges of kidnapping and transporting a stolen plane across state lines .	78.480125
( bearden reportedly hoped to peddle the plane to castro , and live high in cuba .	211.20737
) back home in coolidge , ariz . , his 36-year-old wife , mary , said `` i thought they were going to phoenix to look for jobs ' ' .	83.47074
taking precedence over all other legislation on capitol hill last week was the military strength of the nation .	43.586098
the senate put other business aside as it moved with unaccustomed speed and unanimity to pass -- 85 to 0 -- the largest peacetime defense budget in u . s . history .	59.385365
with the money all but in hand , however , the administration indicated that , instead of the 225 , 000 more men in uniform that president kennedy had requested , the armed forces would be increased by only 160 , 000 .	56.765865
the `` hold-back ' ' , as pentagon mutterers labeled it , apparently was a temporary expedient intended to insure that the army services are built up gradually and , thus , the new funds spent prudently .	129.3012
in all , the senate signed a check for $46 . 7 billion , which not only included the extra $3 . 5 billion requested the week before by president kennedy , but tacked on $754 million more than the president had asked for .	95.22259
( the senate , on its own , decided to provide additional b-52 and other long-range bombers for the strategic air command .	106.39201
) the house , which had passed its smaller appropriation before the president ' s urgent call for more , was expected to go along with the increased defense budget in short order .	199.44421
in other areas , congressional action last week included	2691.9053
the senate ( by voice vote ) and the house ( by 224-170 ) passed and sent to the white house the compromise farm bill which the president is expected to sign , not too unhappily .	113.02345
the senate also voted $5 . 2 billion to finance the government ' s health , welfare , and labor activities .	42.90232
debate on the all-important foreign-aid bill , with its controversial long-range proposals , had just begun on the senate floor at the weekend .	73.94365
white house legislative aides were still confident the bill would pass intact .	125.994995
most members of the u . s . senate , because they are human , like to eat as high on the hog as they can .	119.21568
but , because they are politicians , they like to talk as poor-mouth as the lowliest voter .	223.60382
as a result , ever since 1851 when the senate restaurant opened in the new wing of the capitol building , the senators have never ceased to grumble about the food -- even while they opposed every move that might improve it .	114.613396
over the years , enlivened chiefly by disputes about the relative merits of maine and idaho potatoes , the menu has pursued its drab all-american course .	81.424934
individual senators , with an eye to the voters back home , occasionally introduced smelts from michigan , soft-shell crabs from maryland , oysters from washington , grapefruit from florida .	165.07242
but plain old bean soup , served daily since the turn of the century ( at the insistence of the late sen . fred dubois of idaho ) , made clear to the citizenry that the senate ' s stomach was in the right place .	84.937
in a daring stroke , the senate ventured forth last week into the world of haute cuisine and hired a $10 , 000-per-year french-born maitre d ' hotel .	185.69913
holders of toll-road bonds are finding improvements in monthly reports on operation of the turnpikes .	128.13606
long-term trend of traffic on these roads seems clearly upward .	284.001
higher toll rates also are helping boost revenues .	16.93629
result is a better prospect for a full payoff by bonds that once were regarded as highly speculative .	424.73746
things are looking up these days for many of the state turnpikes on which investors depend for income from their toll-road bonds .	222.44011
traffic on nearly all the turnpikes has been growing .	240.17723
that added traffic means rising streams of dimes and quarters at toll gates .	27.818811
as a result of the new outlook for turnpikes , investors who bought toll-road bonds when these securities ranked as outright speculations are now finding new hope for their investments .	155.3085
another result is that buyers are tending to bid up the prices of these tax-exempt bonds .	97.01271
other tax-exempt bonds of state and local governments hit a price peak on february 21 , according to standard & poor ' s average .	241.88916
on balance , prices of those bonds have slipped a bit since then .	668.5376
however , in the same three-month period , toll-road bonds , as a group , have bucked this trend .	162.48291
on these bonds , price rises since february 21 easily outnumber price declines .	371.77463
investors , however , still see an element of more-than-ordinary risk in the toll-road bonds .	208.67068
you find the evidence of that in the chart on this page .	168.76305
many of the toll-road bonds still are selling at prices that offer the prospect of an annual yield of 4 per cent , or very close to that .	81.9672
and this is true in the case of some turnpikes on which revenues have risen close to , or beyond , the point at which the roads start to pay all operating costs plus annual interest on the bonds .	243.18002
that 4 per cent yield is well below the return to be had on good corporation bonds .	228.8366
it ' s not much more , in fact , than the return that is offered on u . s . treasury bonds .	76.58837
for investors whose income is taxed at high rates , though , a tax-free yield of 4 per cent is high .	32.83519
it is the equivalent of 8 per cent for an unmarried investor with more than $16 , 000 of income to be taxed , or for a married couple with more than $32 , 000 of taxed income .	46.454906
a new report on the earnings records of toll roads in the most recent 12-month period -- ending in february or march -- shows what is happening .	127.54786
the report is based on a survey by blyth & company , investment bankers .	123.10379
nearly all the turnpikes show gains in net revenues during the period .	8.922951
and there is the bright note the gains were achieved in the face of temporary traffic lags late in 1960 and early in 1961 as a result of business recession .	91.18069
many of the roads also were hit by an unusually severe winter .	163.49654
indication the long-term trend of turnpike traffic is upward .	24.74527
look , for example , at the ohio turnpike .	7.6719294
traffic on that road slumped sharply in january and february , as compared with those same months in 1960 .	89.43048
then march brought an 18 per cent rise in net revenues -- after operating costs .	59.63693
as a result , the road ' s net revenues in the 12 months ending march 31 were 186 per cent of the annual interest payments on the turnpike bonds .	30.96506
that was up from 173 per cent in the preceding 12 months .	30.846441
that same pattern of earnings shows up on the massachusetts turnpike .	40.779457
operating revenues were off in the first three months of 1961 , but up for the 12 months ending in march .	54.939667
costs were held down , despite a bitter winter .	55.28775
for the year , the road earned 133 per cent of its interest costs , against 121 per cent in the preceding period .	23.719917
the road ' s engineers look for further improvement when the turnpike is extended into boston .	81.62409
some turnpikes have not been in full operation long enough to prove what they can do .	82.53755
the 187-mile illinois state toll highway , for example , was not opened over its entire length until december , 1958 .	136.6823
in the 12 months ended in february , 1960 , the highway earned enough to cover 64 per cent of its interest load -- with the remainder paid out of initial reserves .	51.02397
in the 12 months ended in february , 1961 , this highway earned 93 per cent of its interest .	14.487714
in the first two months of 1961 , earnings of the illinois highway available for interest payments were up 55 per cent from early 1960 .	118.420685
success , for many turnpikes , has come hard .	582.0588
traffic frequently has failed to measure up to engineers ' rosy estimates .	229.76051
in these cases , the turnpike managements have had to turn to toll-rate increases , or to costly improvements such as extensions or better connections with other highways .	166.10432
many rate increases already have been put into effect .	117.62581
higher tolls are planned for july 1 , 1961 , on the richmond-petersburg , va . , turnpike , and proposals for increased tolls on the texas turnpike are under study .	97.51211
progress is being made , too , in improving motorists ' access to many turnpikes .	120.36666
net earnings of that road rose from 62 per cent of interest requirements in calendar 1957 to 86 per cent in the 12 months ended feb . 28 , 1961 .	31.05525
further improvements in earnings of the kansas turnpike are expected late in 1961 , with the opening of a new bypass at wichita , and still later when the turnpike gets downtown connections in both kansas city , kans . , and kansas city , mo . .	67.41229
meanwhile , there appears to be enough money in the road ' s reserve fund to cover the interest deficiency for eight more years .	140.78859
investors studying the toll-road bonds for opportunities find that not all roads are nearing their goals .	85.30624
traffic and revenues on the chicago skyway have been a great disappointment to planners and investors alike .	98.20341
if nothing is done , the prospect is that that road will be in default of interest in 1962 .	86.63454
west virginia toll bonds have defaulted in interest for months , and , despite recent improvement in revenues , holders of the bonds are faced with more of the same .	60.93504
the typical picture at this time is one of steady improvement .	176.82227
it ' s going to take time for investors to learn how many of the toll-road bonds will pay out in full .	104.80536
already , however , several of the turnpikes are earning enough to cover interest requirements by comfortable margins .	361.91986
many others are attracting the traffic needed to push revenues up to the break-even point .	46.35381
a top american official , after a look at europe ' s factories , thinks the u . s . is in a `` very serious situation ' ' competitively .	85.907974
commerce secretary luther hodges , accompanied by a member of our staff , on may 10 toured plants of two of italy ' s biggest companies -- fiat , the auto producer , and olivetti , maker of typewriters and calculating machines .	134.05046
our staff man cabled from turin as follows --	159.55971
`` follow secretary hodges through the fiat plant , and you learn this	115.77127
`` one , modern equipment -- much of it supplied under the marshall plan -- enables fiat to turn out 2 , 100 cars a day .	191.45831
`` two , wage costs are a fraction of the u . s . costs .	8.057288
a skilled worker on the assembly line , for example , earns $37 a week .	123.99337
fiat officials say they have had no strikes for more than six years .	60.83865
`` said secretary hodges ' it ' s a tough combination for the u . s . to face .	61.141342
`` olivetti had a special interest for hodges .	6.1386824
olivetti took over underwood , the u . s . typewriter maker , in late 1959 .	53.36213
within a year , without reducing wages , underwood ' s production costs were cut one third , prices were slashed .	271.86478
the result has been that exports of underwood products have doubled .	213.86122
`` the olivetti plant near turin has modern layout , modern machinery .	121.83325
the firm is design-conscious , sales-conscious , advertising-conscious .	53.886696
`` hodges is trying to get more foreign business to go to the u . s . .	19.042606
the inflow of foreign capital would help the u . s . balance of payments .	16.068295
`` hodges predicted ' i think we will see more foreign firms coming to the u . s . .	31.672419
there are many places where we can use their vigor and new ideas ' ' ' .	50.363945
foreign competition has become so severe in certain textiles that washington is exploring new ways of handling competitive imports .	184.48708
the recently unveiled kennedy moves to control the international textile market can be significant for american businessmen in many lines .	192.84515
important aspects of the kennedy textile plans are these	3036.4028
an international conference of the big textile-importing and textile-exporting countries will be called shortly by president kennedy .	109.703316
chief aims of the proposed conference are worth noting .	14.399177
the u . s . will try to get agreement among the industrialized countries to take more textile imports from the less-developed countries over the years .	110.947525
point is that developing countries often build up a textile industry first , need encouragement to get on their feet .	97.37657
if they have trouble exporting , international bill for their support will grow larger than it otherwise would .	226.2013
idea is to let these countries earn their way as much as possible .	34.138306
at the same time , another purpose of the conference will be to get certain low-wage countries to control textile exports -- especially dumping of specific products -- to high-wage textile-producing countries .	283.776
japan , since 1957 , has been `` voluntarily ' ' curbing exports of textiles to the u . s . .	19.977993
hong kong , india and pakistan have been limiting exports of certain types of textiles to britain for several years under the `` lancashire pact ' ' .	67.504196
none of these countries is happy with these arrangements .	539.3287
the japanese want to increase exports to the u . s . while they have been curbing shipments , they have watched hong kong step in and capture an expanding share of the big u . s . market .	62.335564
hong kong interests loudly protest limiting their exports to britain , while spanish and portuguese textiles pour into british market unrestrictedly .	74.77803
the indians and pakistanis are chafing under similar restrictions on the british market for similar reasons .	93.84832
the kennedy hope is that , at the conference or through bilateral talks , the low-wage textile-producing countries in asia and europe will see that `` dumping ' ' practices cause friction all around and may result in import quotas .	148.47934
gradual , controlled expansion of the world ' s textile trade is what president kennedy wants .	40.747105
this may point the way toward international stabilization agreements in other products .	49.431435
it ' s an important clue to washington thinking .	11.894149
note , too , that the kennedy textile plan looks toward modernization or shrinkage of the u . s . textile industry .	37.416187
`` get competitive or get out ' ' .	1.9132446
in veiled terms , that ' s what the kennedy administration is saying to the american textile industry .	47.150864
the government will help in transferring companies and workers into new lines , where modernization doesn ' t seem feasible .	103.69656
special depreciation on new textile machinery may be allowed .	561.52374
government research will look into new products and methods .	306.4673
import quotas aren ' t ruled out where the national interest is involved .	65.369865
but the kennedy administration doesn ' t favor import quotas .	7.411985
rather , they are impressed with the british government ' s success in forcing -- and helping -- the british textile industry to shrink and to change over to other products .	112.89305
what ' s happening in textiles can be handwriting on the wall for other lines having difficulty competing with imports from low-wage countries .	290.54962
among the highest-paid workers in the world are u . s . coal miners .	27.60697
yet u . s . coal is cheap enough to make foreign steelmakers ' mouths water .	45.412365
steel company of wales , a british steelmaker , wants to bring in virginia coal , cut down on its takings of welsh coal in order to be able to compete more effectively -- especially in foreign markets .	72.78337
virginia coal , delivered by ship in wales , will be about $2 . 80 a ton cheaper than welsh coal delivered by rail from nearby mines .	72.19741
u . s . coal is cheap , despite high wages , because of widespread mechanization of mines , wide coal seams , attactive rates on ocean freight .	133.84523
many of the coal seams in the nationalized british mines are twisting , narrow and very deep .	109.5873
productivity of u . s . miners is twice that of the british .	157.86803
welsh coal miners , communist-led , are up in arms at the suggestion that the steel company bring in american coal .	84.712715
the british government will have to decide whether to let u . s . coal in .	102.11913
the british coal industry is unprofitable , has large coal stocks it can ' t sell .	113.75651
every library borrower , or at least those whose taste goes beyond the five-cent fiction rentals , knows what it is to hear the librarian say apologetically , `` i ' m sorry , but we don ' t have that book .	69.55985
there wouldn ' t be much demand for it , i ' m afraid ' ' .	22.061693
behind this reply , and its many variations , is the ever-present budget problem all libraries must face , from the largest to the smallest .	275.59354
what to buy out of the year ' s grist of nearly 15 , 000 book titles ? ?	167.14476
what to buy for adult and child readers , for lovers of fiction and nonfiction , for a clientele whose wants are incredibly diversified , when your budget is pitifully small ? ?	135.6066
a startlingly high percentage do not exceed $500 annually , which includes the librarian ' s salary , and not even the new york public has enough money to meet its needs -- this in the world ' s richest city .	72.21225
the plight of a small community library is proportionately worse .	365.07147
confronted with this situation , most libraries either endure the severe limitations of their budgets and do what they can with what they have , or else depend on the bounty of patrons and local governments to supplement their annual funds .	93.26063
in some parts of the country , however , a co-operative movement has begun to grow , under the wing of state governments , whereby , with the financial help of the state , libraries share their book resources on a county-wide or regional basis .	83.48893
new york state has what is probably the most advanced of these co-operative systems , so well developed that it has become a model for others to follow .	149.96547
because it is so large a state , with marked contrasts in population density , the organization of the new york co-operative offers a cross-section of how the plan works .	86.91644
at one extreme are the systems of upper new york state , where libraries in two or more counties combine to serve a large , sparsely populated area .	99.28285
at the other are organizations like the newly formed nassau library system , in a high-density area , with ample resources and a rapidly growing territory to serve .	109.52247
both these types , and those in between , are in existence by reason of a legislative interest in libraries that began at albany as early as 1950 , with the creation by the legislature of county library systems financed by county governments with matching funds from the state .	107.26665
it was a step in the right direction , but it took an additional act passed in 1958 to establish fully the thriving systems of today .	88.63912
under this law annual grants are given to systems in substantial amounts .	338.26212
an earlier difficulty was overcome by making it clear that individual libraries in any area might join or not , as they saw fit .	177.62247
some library boards are wary of the plan .	11.681311
a large , well-stocked library , surrounded in a county by smaller ones , may feel that the demands on its resources are likely to be too great .	152.0495
a small library may cherish its independence and established ways , and resist joining in a cooperative movement that sometimes seems radical to older members of the board .	210.4028
within a system , however , the autonomy of each member library is preserved .	54.35412
the local community maintains responsibility for the financial support of its own library program , facilities , and services , but wider resources and additional services become available through membership in a system .	107.55192
all services are given without cost to members .	8.80193
so obvious are these advantages that nearly 95 per cent of the population of new york state now has access to a system , and enthusiastic librarians foresee the day , not too distant , when all the libraries in the state will belong to a co-op .	59.599316
to set up a co-operative library system , the law requires a central book collection of 100 , 000 nonfiction volumes as the nucleus , and the system is organized around it .	128.47543
the collection may be in an existing library , or it may be built up in a central collection .	55.66534
each system develops differently , according to the area it serves , but the universal goal is to pool the resources of a given area for maximum efficiency .	126.28142
the basic state grant is thirty cents for each person served , and there is a further book incentive grant that provides an extra twenty cents up to fifty cents per capita , if a library spends a certain number of dollars .	77.87499
in nassau county , for example , the heavily settled long island suburb of new york city , the system is credited by the state with serving one million persons , a figure that has doubled since 1950 .	138.48293
this system , by virtue of its variety and size , offers an inclusive view of the plan in operation .	93.86971
the nassau system recognizes that its major task it to broaden reference service , what with the constant expansion of education and knowledge , and the pressure of population growth in a metropolitan area .	90.998566
the need is for reference works of a more specialized nature than individual libraries , adequate to satisfy everyday needs , could afford .	121.330086
nassau is currently building a central collection of reference materials in its hempstead headquarters , which will reach its goal of 100 , 000 volumes by 1965 .	65.73179
the major part of this collection is in the central headquarters building , and the remainder is divided among five libraries in the system designated as subject centers .	97.32268
basic reference tools are the backbone of the collection , but there is also specialization in science and technology , an indicated weakness in local libraries .	107.98291
on microfilm , headquarters also has a file of the new york times from its founding in 1851 to the present day , as well as bound volumes of important periodicals .	60.185917
the entire headquarters collection is available to the patrons of all members on interlibrary loans .	109.52895
it is connected by teletype with the state library in albany , which will supply any book to a system that the system itself cannot provide .	196.13942
the books are carried around by truck in canvas bags from headquarters to the other libraries .	138.11113
each subject center library was chosen because of its demonstrated strength in a particular area , which headquarters could then build upon .	373.6291
east meadow has philosophy , psychology , and religion	577.4542
freeport houses social science , pure science , and language	120.642876
history , biography , and education are centered in hempstead	132.85254
levittown has applied science , business , and literature	1495.7589
while hewlett-woodmere is the repository of art , music , and foreign languages .	130.80763
the reference coordinator at headquarters also serves as a consultant , and is available to work with the local librarian in helping to strengthen local reference service .	92.67944
this kind of cooperation is not wholly new , of course .	40.355923
public libraries in nassau county have been lending books to each other by mail for a quarter-century , but the system enables this process to operate on an organized and far more comprehensive basis .	120.7353
local libraries find , too , that the new plan saves tax dollars because books can be bought through the system , and since the system buys in bulk it is able to obtain larger discounts than would be available to an individual library .	147.19348
the system passes on these savings to its members .	19.723085
further money is saved through economy in bookkeeping and clerical detail as the result of central billing .	90.47819
books are not the only resource of the system .	232.41132
schools and community groups turn to the headquarters film library for documentary , art , and experimental films to show at libraries that sponsor local programs , and to organizations in member communities .	174.58066
the most recent film catalogue , available at each library , lists 110 titles presently in the collection , any of which may be borrowed without charge .	167.1175
this catalogue lists separately films suitable for children , young adults , or adults , although some classics cut across age groups , such as `` nanook of the north ' ' , `` the emperor ' s nightingale ' ' , and `` the red balloon ' ' .	57.942303
workshops are conducted by the system ' s audio-visual consultant for the staffs of member libraries , teaching them the effective use of film as a library service .	94.16304
the system well understands that one of its primary responsibilities is to bring children and books together	445.48752
consequently an experienced children ' s librarian at headquarters conducts a guidance program designed to promote well-planned library activities , cooperating with the children ' s librarians in member libraries by means of individual conferences , workshops , and frequent visits .	108.764206
headquarters has also set up a central juvenile book-review and book-selection center , to provide better methods of purchasing and selection .	146.57893
sample copies of new books are on display at headquarters , where librarians may evaluate them by themselves or in workshop groups .	190.61444
story hours , pre-school programs , activities with community agencies , and lists of recommended reading are all in the province of the children ' s consultant .	62.195126
headquarters of the nassau system is an increasingly busy place these days , threatening to expand beyond its boundaries .	126.07805
in addition to the interlibrary loan service and the children ' s program , headquarters has a public relations director who seeks to get wider grassroots support for quality library service in the county	127.26274
it prepares cooperative displays ( posters , booklists , brochures , and other promotional material ) for use in member libraries	119.29888
it maintains a central exhibit collection to share displays already created and used	520.22205
and it publishes sum and substance , a monthly newsletter , which reports the system ' s activities to the staffs and trustees of member libraries .	83.266365
the system itself is governed by a board of trustees , geographically representing its membership .	70.655624
in nassau , as in other systems , the long-range objective is to bring the maximum service of libraries to bear on the schools , and on adult education in general .	79.42833
librarians , a patient breed of men and women who have borne much with dedication , can begin to see results today .	204.24762
library use is multiplying daily , and the bulk of the newcomers are those maligned americans , the teen-agers .	215.92947
to them especially the librarians , with the help of co-ops , hope they will never have to say , `` i ' m sorry , we don ' t have that book ' ' .	43.27863
today , more than ever before , the survival of our free society depends upon the citizen who is both informed and concerned .	197.22375
the great advances made in recent years in communist strength and in our own capacity to destroy require an educated citizenry in the western world .	124.71102
education must not be limited to our youth but must be a continuing process through our entire lives , for it is only through knowledge that we , as a nation , can cope with the dangers that threaten our society .	83.15301
the desire and ability to read are important aspects of our cultural life .	32.471874
we cannot consider ourselves educated if we do not read	203.09242
if we do not know how to use what we do read .	118.314735
we must not permit our society to become a slave to the scientific age , as might well happen without the cultural and spiritual restraint that comes from the development of the human mind through wisdom absorbed from the written word .	157.45786
a fundamental source of knowledge in the world today is the book found in our libraries .	132.37032
although progress has been made in america ' s system of libraries it still falls short of what is required if we are to maintain the standards that are needed for an informed america .	185.73172
the problem grows in intensity each year as man ' s knowledge , and his capacity to translate such knowledge to the written word , continue to expand .	97.405785
the inadequacy of our library system will become critical unless we act vigorously to correct this condition .	171.42159
there are , for example , approximately 25 , 000 , 000 people in this country with no public library service and about 50 , 000 , 000 with inadequate service .	41.39721
in college libraries , 57 per cent of the total number of books are owned by 124 of 1 , 509 institutions surveyed last year by the u . s . office of education .	44.5937
and over 66 per cent of the elementary schools with 150 or more pupils do not have any library at all .	119.038055
in every aspect of service -- to the public , to children in schools , to colleges and universities -- the library of today is failing to render vitally needed services .	97.72157
only public understanding and support can provide that service .	225.46721
this is one of the main reasons for national library week , april 16-22 , and for its theme `` for a richer , fuller life , read ' ' ! !	166.69354
the general assembly , which adjourns today , has performed in an atmosphere of crisis and struggle from the day it convened .	213.00603
it was faced immediately with a showdown on the schools , an issue which was met squarely in conjunction with the governor with a decision not to risk abandoning public education .	126.10709
there followed the historic appropriations and budget fight , in which the general assembly decided to tackle executive powers .	68.63533
the final decision went to the executive but a way has been opened for strengthening budgeting procedures and to provide legislators information they need .	235.00888
long-range planning of programs and ways to finance them have become musts if the state in the next few years is to avoid crisis-to-crisis government .	139.775
this session , for instance , may have insured a financial crisis two years from now .	258.7978
in all the turmoil , some good legislation was passed .	64.29616
some other good bills were lost in the shuffle and await future action .	229.89397
certainly all can applaud passage of an auto title law , the school bills , the increase in teacher pensions , the ban on drag racing , acceptance by the state of responsibility for maintenance of state roads in municipalities at the same rate as outside city limits , repeal of the college age limit law and the road maintenance bond issue .	167.86143
no action has been taken , however , on such major problems as ending the fee system , penal reform , modification of the county unit system and in outright banning of fireworks sales .	119.080185
only a token start was made in attacking the tax reappraisal question and its companion issue of attracting industry to the state .	126.19978
the legislature expended most of its time on the schools and appropriations questions .	38.67806
fortunately it spared us from the usual spate of silly resolutions which in the past have made georgia look like anything but `` the empire state of the south ' ' .	89.47211
we congratulate the entire membership on its record of good legislation .	93.13748
in the interim between now and next year , we trust the house and senate will put their minds to studying georgia ' s very real economic , fiscal and social problems and come up with answers without all the political heroics .	180.155
the league of women voters , 40 now and admitting it proudly , is inviting financial contributions in the windup of its fund drive .	183.02606
it ' s a good use of money .	7.24717
these women whose organization grew out of the old suffrage movement are dedicated to thomas jefferson ' s dictum that one must cherish the people ' s spirit but `` keep alive their attention ' ' .	103.167854
`` if once they become inattentive to the public affairs ' ' , jefferson said , `` you and i , and congress and assemblies , judges and governors , shall all become wolves ' ' .	104.07374
newspapermen and politicians especially are aware of the penetrating attention and expert analysis the league gives to public affairs .	238.74207
the league workers search out the pros and cons of the most complex issues and make them available to the public .	88.03513
the harder the choice , the more willing the league is to wade in .	537.0987
and the league takes a stand , with great regularity , on the side of right .	42.564827
cities and counties interested in industrial development would do well in the months ahead to keep their eyes peeled toward the 13 northwest georgia counties that are members of the coosa valley area planning and development commission .	77.712814
coupling its own budget of $83 , 750 with a $30 , 000 state grant authorized by gov . vandiver , the group expects to sign a contract in march with georgia tech . .	76.0765
then a full-time planning office will be established in rome to work with a five-member georgia tech research staff for development of an area planning and industrial development program .	64.139984
it recognizes the fact that what helps one county helps its neighbors and that by banding together in an area-wide effort better results can be accomplished than through the go-it-alone approach .	388.5341
the rusk belief in balanced defense , replacing the dulles theory of massive retaliation , removes a grave danger that has existed .	94.91274
the danger lay not in believing that our own a-bombs would deter russia ' s use of hers	99.29043
the danger lay in the american delusion that nuclear deterrence was enough .	323.98615
by limiting american strength too much to nuclear strength , this country limited its ability to fight any kind of war besides a nuclear war .	159.62273
this strategy heightened the possibility that we would have a nuclear war .	16.270456
it also weakened our diplomatic stance , because russia could easily guess we did not desire a nuclear war except in the ultimate extremity .	115.605064
this left the soviets plenty of leeway to start low-grade brushfire aggressions with considerable impunity .	150.12709
by maintaining the nuclear deterrent , but gearing american military forces to fight conventional wars too , secretary of state rusk junks bluff and nuclear brinkmanship and builds more muscle and greater safety into our military position .	177.7821
dekalb ' s budget for 1961 is a record one and carries with it the promise of no tax increase to make it balance .	251.0436
it includes a raise in the county minimum wage , creation of several new jobs at the executive level , financing of beefed-up industrial development efforts , and increased expenditures for essential services such as health and welfare , fire protection , sanitation and road maintenance .	171.61877
that such expansion can be obtained without a raise in taxes is due to growth of the tax digest and sound fiscal planning on the part of the board of commissioners , headed by chairman charles o . emmerich who is demonstrating that the public trust he was given was well placed , and other county officials .	67.89832
g . mennen williams is learning the difficulties of diplomacy rapidly .	167.15033
touring africa , the new u . s . assistant secretary of state observed `` africa should be for the africans ' ' and the british promptly denounced him .	49.940506
then he arrived in zanzibar and found africans carrying signs saying `` american imperialists , go home ' ' .	238.3493
confidence in the state ' s economic future is reflected in the georgia power company ' s record construction budget for this year .	98.425476
the firm does a large amount of research and its forecasts have meaning .	211.29106
it is good to know that georgia will continue to have sufficient electrical power not only to meet the demands of normal growth but to encourage a more rapid rate of industrialization .	106.44742
georgia ' s mental health program received a badly needed boost from the general assembly in the form of a $1 , 750 , 000 budget increase for the milledgeville state hospital .	72.89893
actually it amounts to $1 , 250 , 000 above what the institution already is receiving , considering the additional half-million dollars gov . vandiver allocated last year from the state surplus .	153.31082
either way it sounds like a sizable hunk of money and is .	78.3227
but exactly how far it will go toward improving conditions is another question because there is so much that needs doing .	244.56024
the practice of charging employes for meals whether they eat at the hospital or not should be abolished .	96.69391
the work week of attendants who are on duty 65 hours and more per week should be reduced .	184.2766
more attendants , nurses and doctors should be hired .	100.101234
patients deserve more attention than they are getting .	45.07318
even with the increase in funds for the next fiscal year , georgia will be spending only around $3 . 15 per day per patient .	103.43198
the national average is more than $4 and that figure is considered by experts in the mental health field to be too low .	141.05638
kansas , regarded as tops in the nation in its treatment of the mentally ill , spends $9 per day per patient .	89.128555
but in so many other areas we still are dragging .	57.93007
considering what is being done compared to what needs to be done , it behooves the hospital management to do some mighty careful planning toward making the best possible use of the increase granted .	232.67944
assassination , even of a tyrant , is repulsive to men of good conscience .	344.21588
rafael trujillo , the often blood-thirsty dictator of the dominican republic for 31 years , perhaps deserved his fate in an even-handed appraisal of history .	74.31107
but whether the murder of el benefactor in ciudad trujillo means freedom for the people of the caribbean fiefdom is a question that cannot now be answered .	191.67993
the responsibility for scores of deaths , including the abduction and murder of jesus maria galindez , a professor at columbia university in new york , has been laid at his door .	45.945538
he had been involved in countless schemes to do away with democratic leaders in neighboring countries such as president romulo betancourt of venezuela .	85.95255
it was a sort of poetic justice that at the time of his own demise a new plot to overthrow the venezuelan government , reportedly involving the use of dominican arms by former venezuelan dictator marcos perez jimenez , has been uncovered and quashed .	89.92309
the recent history of the dominican republic is an almost classical study of the way in which even a professedly benevolent dictatorship tends to become oppressive .	99.699814
unquestionably trujillo did some good things for his country he improved public facilities such as roads and sanitation , attracted industry and investment and raised the standard of living notably .	219.61075
but the price was the silence of the grave for all criticism or opposition .	310.2619
el benefactor ' s vanity grew with his personal wealth .	119.20517
the jails were filled to overflowing with political prisoners who had incurred his displeasure .	125.15776
he maintained amply financed lobbies in the united states and elsewhere which sycophantically chanted his praise , and his influence extended even to congress .	140.79866
until the last year or so the profession of friendship with the united states had been an article of faith with trujillo , and altogether too often this profession was accepted here as evidence of his good character .	96.15407
tardily the government here came to understand how this country ' s own reputation was tarnished by the association with repression .	69.86487
last year , after trujillo had been cited for numerous aggressions in the caribbean , the united states and many other members of the organization of american states broke diplomatic relations with him .	64.50999
thereupon followed a demonstration that tyranny knows no ideological confines .	53.995663
trujillo ' s dictatorship had been along conservative , right-wing lines .	65.06495
but after the censure he and his propaganda started mouthing communist slogans .	108.095474
there was considerable evidence of a tacit rapprochement with castro in cuba , previously a bete noire to trujillo -- thus illustrating the way in which totalitarianism of the right and left coalesces .	147.39154
what comes after trujillo is now the puzzle .	15.461017
the dominican people have known no democratic institutions and precious little freedom for a generation , and all alternative leadership has been suppressed .	113.15918
perhaps the army will be able to maintain stability , but the vacuum of free institutions creates a great danger .	74.38148
the dominican republic could turn toward communist-type authoritarianism as easily as toward western freedom .	135.85152
such a twist would be a tragedy for the dominican people , who deserve to breathe without fear .	76.45296
for that reason any democratic reform and effort to bring genuine representative government to the dominican republic will need the greatest sympathy and help .	121.22235
high-speed buses on the george washington memorial parkway , operating between downtown washington and cabin john , glen echo and brookmont , would constitute an alluring sample of what the new national capital transportation agency can do for this city .	237.87979
in presenting plans for such express buses before the montgomery county council , the administrator of the ncta , c . darwin stolzenbach , was frankly seeking support for the projects his agency will soon be launching .	120.17247
such support should not be difficult to come by if all the plans to be presented by the ncta are as attractive as this outline of express buses coming into the downtown area .	139.03355
because the buses would not stop on the parkway , land for bus stations and for parking areas nearby will be needed .	120.12172
the ncta is well advised to seek funds for this purpose from the present session of congress .	45.921158
the inference has been too widely accepted that because the communists have succeeded in building barricades across berlin the free world must acquiesce in dismemberment of that living city .	164.88905
so far as the record is concerned , the western powers have not acquiesced and should not do so .	298.8367
