and one of the best services available to the people who try to raise and can meat , to plant , grow vegetables and put them up .	89.80954
`` the county , though , seems more interested in those people who don ' t even try , those who sit and draw welfare checks and line up for surplus food ' ' .	130.19463
a driver of a dairy truck , who begins work at 1 a . m . finishes before breakfast , then goes out and grows a garden , and who has used the cannery to save and feed a family of five , asked , `` what in the world will we do ' ' ? ?	78.88867
`` what in the world ' ' , echoed others , those come with the beans , potatoes , the tomatoes , `` will any of us do ' ' ? ?	122.72897
moss , a man who knows how much the cannery helps the county , doesn ' t believe it will close .	74.53888
but he is in the middle , an employe of dekalb , but on the side of the people .	37.410664
`` don ' t ask me if i think the cannery helps ' ' , he said .	12.62034
`` sir , i know the cannery helps ' ' .	3.9013042
most of us would be willing to admit that forgiveness comes hard .	413.65765
when a person has thoughtlessly or deliberately caused us pain or hardship it is not always easy to say , `` just forget it ' ' .	49.93886
a person will never have spiritual poise and inner peace as long as the heart holds a grudge .	143.8716
i know a man who held resentment against a neighbor for more than three decades .	111.8402
one night , at the close of the evening service , he came forward , left his resentment at the altar and gave his heart to god .	118.032646
after almost everyone had gone he told me the simple story of how one of his neighbors had moved a fence a few feet over on his land .	128.1379
`` we tried to settle this dispute ' ' , he said , `` but could never come to an agreement .	31.00098
i settled it tonight ' ' , he continued .	206.40704
`` i leave this church with a feeling that a great weight has been lifted off my heart , i have left my grudge at the altar and forgiven my neighbor ' ' .	42.959393
forgiveness is the door through which a person must pass to enter the kingdom of god .	65.27343
you cannot wear the banner of god and at the same time harbor envy , jealousy and grudges in your heart .	65.0334
henry van dyke said , `` forgive and forget if you can	77.02915
we must , first of all , be willing to forgive others before we can secure god ' s forgiveness .	44.465336
`` for if ye forgive men their trespasses , your heavenly father will also forgive you but if ye forgive not men their trespasses , neither will your father forgive -- your trespasses ' ' .	104.07825
it will do no good to seek god ' s forgiveness until we have forgiven those who have done us wrong .	101.484344
then , jesus indicated that god ' s forgiveness is unlimited .	134.05038
in the prayer jesus taught his disciples to pray we find these words , `` forgive us our debts ' ' .	68.91011
when a person meets god ' s requirements for the experience of forgiveness he is forgiven .	65.04593
god ' s mercy and patience will last forever .	21.581171
forgiveness implies more than a person wanting his past sins covered by god ' s love .	65.97084
it also implies that a man wants his future to be free from the mistakes of the past .	43.833237
we want the past forgiven , but at the same time we must be willing for god to direct the future .	54.150833
finally , we must be willing to forgive others as many times as they sin against us .	213.56764
once peter asked , `` how oft shall my brother sin against me , and i forgive him ? ?	59.889183
jesus saith unto him , until seventy times seven ' ' .	36.39724
jesus not only taught forgiveness , he gave us an example of it on the cross .	54.335682
with all the energy of his broken body he prayed , `` father , forgive them , for they know not what they do ' ' .	70.315254
she ' s been in and out of my house for a dozen years now , although she ' s still a teen-ager who looks like a baby , she is getting married .	78.63967
her mother , now dead , was my good friend and when she came to tell us about her plans and to show off her ring i had a sobering wish to say something meaningful to her , something her mother would wish said .	153.85135
for a while there was such shrill girlish commotion i couldn ' t have made myself heard if i ' d had the equivalent of the message to garcia .	56.669693
but when some of the squeals had subsided and she had been through one of those sessions that are so indispensable to the young female -- six girls sprawled on one bed , drinking cokes and giggling -- she came back to the kitchen to talk with me a minute .	112.15748
`` how do you know you love somebody enough to get married ' ' ? ?	27.40534
it was the oldest and toughest question young lovers have ever asked how can you be sure ? ?	86.95309
`` aren ' t you sure ' ' ? ?	4.450464
i wanted to grab her by the arm and beg her to wait , to consider , to know for certain because life is so long and marriage is so important .	176.91142
but if she were just having a normal case of pre-nuptial jitters such a question might frighten her out of a really good marriage .	348.076
besides , in all honesty , i don ' t know how you can be sure .	12.086087
i don ' t know any secret recipe for certainty .	17.372662
in the fevered , intoxicating , breathless state of being in love the usual signposts that guide you to lasting and satisfying relationships are sometimes obscured .	138.13925
i knew of but one test and i threw it out to her for what it was worth .	121.81129
`` does he ever bore you ' ' ? ?	4.0441933
why , he ' s so darling and ' '	28.654682

does he care about things that matter to you ? ?	14.697637
can you visualize being stranded with him on a desert island for years and years and still find him fascinating ? ?	237.51382
because , honey , i thought silently , there are plenty of desert islands in every marriage -- long periods when you ' re hopelessly stranded , together .	66.746445
and if you bore each other then , heaven help you .	307.43622
she came back the other day to reassure me .	6.2108665
she has studied and observed and she is convinced that her young man is going to be endlessly enchanting .	45.507225
she asked if i had other advice and , heady with success , i rushed it in , i hope not too late .	458.51047
jokes , cartoons and cynics to the contrary , mothers-in-law make good friends .	303.74887
i do not know dr . wilson sneed well .	1660.2183
but i was deeply moved by his letter of resignation as rector of st . luke ' s church in atlanta .	45.32324
it was the cry of not just one heart	7982.6396
it spoke for many in the clergy , i suspect .	49.784203
imagine the searching and the prayer that lay behind the letter the rector wrote after almost a decade of service to this majestic church .	205.7892
`` such a church needs vigor and vitality in its rector and one man has only so much of these endowments ' ' , he told his members .	75.5468
a minister should not stay `` beyond the time that his leadership should benefit ' ' his church , he wrote , `` for he becomes ordinary .	141.64262
and so the young minister resigned , to go and study and pray , having never passed a day , he told his parishioners , when `` i did not gain from you far more than i ever gave to you ' ' .	112.20851
his very honest act called up the recent talk i had with another minister , a modest methodist , who said `` i feel so deeply blessed by god when i can give a message of love and comfort to other men , and i would have it no other way and it is unworthy to think of self .	99.96105
but oh , how i do sometimes need just a moment of rest , and peace , in myself ' ' .	63.701626
a man who gives himself to god and to the believers of his church takes upon himself a life of giving .	125.43905
he does not expect to get great riches or he would not have chosen to answer the call to preach .	112.86388
the good ones are not motivated to seek vainly , nor are they disposed to covet comfort , or they would have been led to fields that offer comfort and feed vanity .	172.15997
theirs is a sacrificial life by earthly standards .	3.1623003
yet we who lean upon such a man and draw strength from him and expect interpretation of the infinite through him -- we who readily accept his sacrifice as our due , we of the congregations are the first to tell him what is in our minds instead of listening to what is in his soul .	174.55052
we press him to conform to our comfortable conceptions and not to bruise our satisfactions with his word , and god ' s .	85.65049
we do not defeat the good ones with this cruelty , but we add to their burden , while expecting them to bestow saintliness upon us in return for ostentatious church attendance and a few bucks a week , american cash .	219.1509
if we break the minister to our bit , we are buying back our own sins .	166.93208
if he won ' t break , we add to the stress he bears .	239.60173
and a minister of all men is most conscious that he is mere man -- prone to the stresses that earthly humanity is heir to .	120.11147
we expect him to be noble , and to make us so -- yet he knows , and tries to tell us , how very humble man must be .	99.05011
we expect bestowal of god ' s love through him .	76.54794
the church truly is not a rest home for saints , but a hospital for sinners .	66.86724
yet every sunday we sinners go to that emergency room to receive first aid , and we leave unmindful that the man who ministered to us is a human being who suffers , too .	90.3991
mr . podger always particularly enjoyed the last night of each summer at loon lake .	122.997826
the narrow fringe of sadness that ran around it only emphasized the pleasure .	151.55107
the evening was not always spent in the same way .	25.607143
this year , on a night cool with the front of september moving in , but with plenty of summer still about , the podgers were holding a neighborhood gathering in the pod .	203.26117
the little cottage was bursting with people of all ages .	96.05564
in the midst of it all , mr . podger came out on the pod porch , alone .	51.30187
he had that day attended a country auction , and he had come back with a prize .	42.954643
the prize was an old-fashioned , woven cloth hammock , complete with cross-top pillow , fringed side pieces , and hooks for hanging .	171.75581
mrs . podger had obligingly pushed things around on the porch to make room for it , and there it was , slung in a vine-shaded corner , the night breeze rippling its fringe with a slow , caressing movement .	160.22417
mr . podger sat down in it , pushed himself back and forth in one or two slow , rhythmic motions , and then swung his feet up into it .	100.61362
he closed his eyes and let the unintelligible drift of voices sweep pleasantly over him .	53.81598
suddenly one young voice rose above the others .	19.716051
`` but ' ' , it said , `` do you always know when you ' re happy ' ' ? ?	30.738585
the voice sank back into the general tangle of sound , but the question stayed in mr . podger ' s mind .	82.00602
here , in the cool , autumn-touched evening , mr . podger mentally retraced a day that had left him greatly contented and at peace .	162.1791
it had begun with the blue jay feather .	33.675945
walking along the lake before breakfast , mr . podger had seen the feather , and the bird that had lost it in flight .	68.62558
the winging spread of blue had gone on , calling harshly , into the wood .	462.04248
the small shaft of blue had drifted down and come to rest at his feet .	81.88907
all day long mr . podger , who was a straw-hat man in the summer , had worn the feather in the band of his broad-brimmed sunshield .	87.95852
would a blue feather in a man ' s hat make him happy all day ? ?	326.78668
but it was something to have seen it floating down through the early morning sunshine , linking the blue of the sky with the blue of the asters by the lake .	69.248924
then , since the auction was being held nearby , he had walked to it .	47.884666
and there , on the way , had been the box turtle , that slow , self-contained , world-ignoring relic of pre-history , bent , for reasons best known to itself , on crossing the road .	193.57574
it was doing very well , too , having reached the center , and was pursuing its way with commendable singleness of purpose when mr . podger saw hazard approaching in the shape of a flashy little sports car .	150.4191
would he take pains to avoid it ? ?	1.0217978
taking off his hat and signaling the driver with it , mr . podger stepped into the road , lifted the surprised turtle and consummated its road-crossing with what must have been a breath-taking suddenness .	119.73742
the turtle immediately withdrew into its private council room to study the phenomenon .	154.92535
but mr . podger and the driver of the sports car waved at each other .	49.73333
here in the cool darkness mr . podger could still feel the warmth of midday , could still see the yellow butterflies dancing over the road , could still see the friendly grin on the young , sun-browned face as the driver looked back over his shoulder for a moment before the car streaked out of sight .	133.87415
for a few brief minutes they had all been part of one little drama .	169.88063
the three would never meet again , but for some reason or other mr . podger was sure he would always remember the incident .	190.2483
at will , the voice of the auctioneer , the voices of the bidders , and finally the small boy who had been so interested in mr . podger ' s hammock purchase .	54.10574
`` i like them things , too ' ' , he had said .	13.216385
if you ' re lyin ' out in the hammock at night , and it gets kinda cool -- you know -- you just take these sides with the fringe on -- see -- and wrap ' em right over you .	134.24306
i do it , lots o ' times -- i like to lie in a hammock at night , by myself , when it ' s all quiet .	71.68522
the wind moves it a little bit -- you know .	50.717846
mr . podger had thanked him gravely , and now he made use of the advice .	74.0608
as he pulled the fringed sides up and made himself into a cocoon , mr . podger saw that thin , attractive , freckled little face again , and hoped that the boy , too , was lying in a cool , fringed-wrapped quiet .	105.78875
alacrity , the podger cat , came by the hammock , rubbed her back briefly against it , and then , sure of a welcome , hopped up .	197.45195
she remarked that she found the night wind a little chilly , and mr . podger took her inside the fringe .	54.157883
soon her purring rivaled the chirping of the tree crickets , rivaled the hum of voices from inside the pod .	85.06707
mr . podger was just adding this to his pictures of the day when the screen door opened and pam burst out .	78.47433
`` it ' s getting so chilly we ' ve lighted a fire , and we ' re going to tell a round robin story -- a nice , scary one .	68.3161
why are you out here all by yourself ? ?	5.026762
mr . podger opened his cocoon and emerged , tucking alacrity under his arm to bring her in by the fire .	136.2106
`` of course i am ' ' , he said .	8.045882
i just came out here to know it ' ' .	2.8847086
as the south begins another school year , national and even world attention is directed at the region ' s slow progress toward racial equality in the public schools .	124.979805
desegregation is beginning in two more important southern cities -- dallas and atlanta .	74.52835
in each city civic and education leaders have been working hard to get public opinion prepared to accept the inevitability of equal treatment .	97.38255
these programs emphasize the acceptance of biracial classrooms peacefully .	39.303562
the programs do not take sides on the issue itself .	709.28687
they point out simply that `` it is the law of the land ' ' .	10.842903
the two cities have the examples of little rock and new orleans to hold up as warnings against resorting to violence to try to stop the processes of desegregation .	77.11265
even better , they have the examples of nashville and houston to hold up as peaceful and progressive programs .	68.25033
in each case there was an initial act of violence .	15.800769
in houston , there were a few incidents of friction between whites and negroes , none of which were serious .	103.442375
in each city quick public reaction and fast action by the city government halted the threats of more serious incidents .	76.49672
the nashville plan , incidentally , has become recognized as perhaps the most acceptable and thus the most practical to put into effect in the troubled south .	156.03009
it is a `` stair-step ' ' plan , in which desegregation begins in the first grade .	75.63792
each year another grade is added to the process , until finally all 12 grades are integrated .	370.29184
the schedules are flexible so that the program can be accelerated as the public becomes more tolerant or realizes that it is something that has to be done , `` so why not now ' ' .	63.803825
the program has worked well in both nashville and houston .	7.847812
it met a serious rebuff in new orleans , where the two schools selected for the first moves toward integration were boycotted by white parents .	98.41253
another attempt will be made this year in new orleans to resume the program .	49.972412
generally , throughout the south , there is a growing impatience with the pattern of violence with which every step of desegregation is met .	137.82666
perhaps the most eloquent move toward removal of racial barriers has been in dallas .	134.60983
during the summer , negroes began quietly patronizing previously segregated restaurants and lunch counters in downtown retail establishments .	52.88778
it was part of a citywide move toward full integration .	92.96178
so successful has been this program , worked out by white and negro civic leaders , that further extensions are expected in the next few months .	47.046535
hotels , for example , are ready to let down the bars .	77.29775
already , at least one hotel has been quietly taking reservations on a nonracial basis .	61.352085
several conventions have been held in recent months in hotels on a nonsegregated basis .	49.82208
this is a radical change in attitude from the conditions which prevailed several years ago , when a series of bombings was directed against negroes who were moving into previously all-white neighborhoods of dallas .	80.84288
it is also symptomatic of a change in attitude which appears to be spreading all across the south .	124.86335
southern whites themselves are realizing that they had been wrong in using violence to try to stop negroes from claiming equal rights .	62.572018
they insist they are ashamed of such violence and intimidation as occurred in alabama when the freedom riders sought to break down racial discrimination in local bus depots .	206.06335
all across the south there are signs that racial violence is finding less approval among whites who themselves would never take active part but might once have shown a tolerant attitude toward it .	287.30225
business leaders are aware now that they suffer greatly from any outbreak of violence .	81.648575
they are putting strong pressure on their police departments to keep order .	143.65921
in the past these same southerners were inclined to look the other way .	52.753082
and as the businessmen have begun to act , a real sense of co-operation has sprung up .	83.86939
this co-operation has emboldened other southern whites to add their voices to demands for peaceable accommodation .	98.95479
they realize that by acting in concert , rather than individually , they will not be picked out as objects of retaliation -- economic and otherwise .	104.33315
since moving from a chicago suburb to southern california a few months ago , i ' ve been introduced to a new game called lanesmanship .	56.53876
played mostly on the freeways around los angeles , it goes like this	119.83172
a driver cruising easily at 70 m . p . h . in lane a of a four-lane freeway spies an incipient traffic jam ahead .	152.05008
traffic in the next lane appears to be moving more smoothly so he pokes a tentative fender into lane b , which is heavily populated by cars also moving at 70 m . p . h . .	101.844574
the adjacent driver in lane b has three choices open to him .	142.30742
he can ( 1 ) point his car resolutely at the invading fender and force the other driver back into lane a	138.30482
( 2 ) slow down and permit the ambivalent driver to change lanes	226.32031
or ( 3 ) alternately accelerate and decelerate , thus keeping the first driver guessing as to his intentions , thereby making a fascinating sport of the whole affair .	112.6847
the really remarkable thing to me is that most california natives unhesitatingly elect to slow down and permit the invading car free access .	305.29782
whether or not this is done out of enlightened self-preservation , i don ' t know .	19.085955
but it is done , consistently and i ' m both surprised and impressed .	121.949554
this could never happen in my native chicago .	14.357522
there such soggy acquiesence would be looked upon as a sure sign of deteriorating manhood .	59.11992
in chicago , the driver cut out would likely jam his gas pedal to the floor in an effort to force the other car back .	145.17233
failing this , he would pull alongside at the first opportunity and shake his fist threateningly .	95.273735
this negative explanation of courtesy on the freeways , however , does an injustice to southern california drivers .	90.88023
at the risk of losing my charge-a-plate at marshall field and company , i would like to challenge an old and hallowed stereotype .	147.30533
after three months of research , i can state unequivocally that los angeles drivers are considerably more courteous and competent than any other drivers i ' ve ever encountered .	113.932076
during one recent day of driving about los angeles there were actually a dozen occasions when oncoming drivers stopped an entire lane of traffic to permit me to pull out of an impossible side street .	109.87896
an out-of-town writer came up to paul richards today and asked the oriole manager if he thought his ball club would be improved this year .	210.49924
now richards , of course , is known as a deep thinker as baseball managers go .	205.42487
he can often make the complex ridiculously simple , and vice versa .	16.759594
this happened to be vice versa , but even so , the answer was a masterpiece .	66.50084

this was just richard ' s way of saying that last year the birds opened spring training with a lot of jobs wide open .	185.10945
some brilliant rookies nailed them down , so that this spring just two spots , left and right field , are really up for grabs .	206.6085

this angle of just where the orioles can look for improvement this year is an interesting one .	195.37158
you ' d never guess it from the way they ' ve played so far this spring , but there remains a feeling among some around here that the orioles still have a chance to battle for the pennant in 1961 .	98.45219

brooks robinson is great , and it is conceivable that he ' ll do even better in 1961 than he did in 1960 .	133.46146

if they do as well as they did in 1960 there can be no complaint .	103.255554

hansen will be getting a late spring training start , which might very well set him back .	368.2361
he got off to an exceptional start last season , and under the circumstances probably won ' t duplicate it .	113.253914
there are some clubs which claim they learned something about pitching to him last year .	355.45166

he ' ll still be a top player , they concede , because he ' s got a great glove and the long ball going for him .	85.08373

so , all in all , the infield can ' t be expected to supply the added improvement to propel the birds from second to first .	114.672386
and the pitching will also have trouble doing better .	39.266827
richards got a great performance out of his combination of youth and experience last season .	203.76299

triandos hasn ' t proved it yet , but he says he ' s convinced his thumb is all right .	154.76971

if he can bounce back with one of those 25 home runs years , the club will have to be better off offensively .	163.2587

he hasn ' t played too much , because richards has been working on him furiously in batting practice .	66.519516

is the mother of an `` autistic ' ' child at fault ? ?	52.687393
( the `` autistic ' ' child is one who seems to lack a well-defined sense of self .	55.696243
he tends to treat himself and other people as if they were objects -- and sometimes he treats objects as if they were people .	128.83044
) did his mother make him this way ? ?	9.388998
we believe that autism , like so many other conditions of defect and deviation , is to a large extent inborn .	97.218216
a mother can help a child adapt to his difficulties .	118.40594
sometimes she can -- to a large extent -- help him overcome them .	133.32724
but we don ' t think she creates them .	33.873875
we don ' t think she can make her child defective , emotionally disturbed or autistic .	235.77101
the mother of a difficult child can do a great deal to help her own child and often , by sharing her experiences , she can help other mothers with the same problem .	87.92354
since little is known about autism , and almost nothing has been written for the layman , we ' d like to share one experienced mother ' s comments .	168.33885
as the mother of an autistic child who is lacking in interest and enthusiasm about almost anything , i have to manipulate my son ' s fingers for him when he first plays with a new toy .	73.59656
he wants me to do everything for him .	4.9649773
`` you don ' t believe that autistic children become autistic because of something that happens to them or because of the way their mother treats them .	116.35598
but i do and my psychiatrist does , too .	107.582794
i know , that my son wants control and direction , but being autistic myself i cannot give full control or direction .	334.67294
`` one thing i notice which i have seldom heard mentioned .	277.41498
this is that autistic people don ' t enjoy physical contact with others -- for instance , my children and i .	130.07777
when i hold my son he stiffens his whole body in my arms until he is as straight and stiff as a board .	193.16791
he pushes and straightens himself as if he can ' t stand the feeling of being held .	152.32649
physical contact is uncomfortable for him ' ' ! !	18.588211
as a rule , the autistic child doesn ' t enjoy physical contact with others .	30.239988
parents have to find other ways of comforting him .	101.20652
for the young child this may be no more than providing food , light or movement .	180.87347
as he grows older it may be a matter of providing some accustomed object ( his `` magic ' ' thing ) .	128.74706
or certain words or rituals that child and adult go through may do the trick .	327.4821
the answer is different for each autistic child , but for most there is an answer .	78.59634
`` dear doctors we learned this year that our older son , daniel , is autistic .	133.97926
we did not accept the diagnosis at once , but gradually we are coming to .	113.435455
fortunately , there is a nursery school which he has been able to attend , with a group of normal children .	50.18647
`` i try to treat daniel as if he were normal , though of course i realize he is far from that at present .	137.03986
what i do is to try to bring him into contact with reality as much as possible .	90.647385
i try to give him as many normal experiences as possible .	96.535934
`` what is your experience with autistic children ? ?	24.701963
how do they turn out later ' ' ? ?	5.1561766
many autistic children grow up to lead relatively normal lives .	74.58481
certainly , most continue to lack a certain warmth in communication with other people , but many adjust to school , even college , to jobs and even to marriage and parenthood .	172.75989
-- a first grader colors pictures one solid color , everything -- sky , grass , boy , wagon , etc . .	82.52417
when different colors are used , she is just as likely to color trees purple , hair green , etc . .	119.3007
the other children in the class use this same coloring book and do a fairly good job with things their proper color .	363.53046
should i show my daughter how things should be colored ? ?	52.50635
is a relaxed home atmosphere enough to help her outgrow these traits ? ?	49.90238
-- her choice of one color means she is simply enjoying the motor act of coloring , without having reached the point of selecting suitable colors for different objects .	143.38383
this immature use of crayons may suggest that she is a little immature for the first grade .	60.957592
no , coloring isn ' t exactly something you teach a child .	160.89545
you sometimes give them a little demonstration , a little guidance , and suggestions about staying inside the lines .	160.68753
but most learn to color and paint as and when they are ready with only a very little demonstration .	105.50141
seen in decorating circles of late is a renewed interest in an old art embroidery .	113.42216
possibly responsible for this is the incoming trend toward multicolor schemes in rooms , which seems slated to replace the one-color look to which we have been accustomed .	96.49557
just as a varitinted oriental rug may suggest the starting point for a room scheme , so may some of the newest versions of embroidery .	104.99397
one such , in fact , is a rug .	811.4602
though not actually crewel embroidery , it has that look with its over-stitched raised pattern in blue , pink , bronze and gold and a sauterne background .	207.80533
the twirled , stylized design of winding stems and floral forms strongly suggests the embroidered patterns used so extensively for upholstery during the jacobean period in england .	110.3207
traditional crewel embroidery which seems to be appearing more frequently this fall than in the past few years is still available in this country .	108.822876
the work is executed in england ( by hand ) and can be worked in any desired design and color .	154.67313
among some recent imports were seat covers for one series of dining room chairs on which were depicted salad plates overflowing with tomatoes and greens and another set on which a pineapple was worked in naturalistic color .	80.27368
for a particularly fabulous room which houses a collection of fine english chippendale furniture , fabric wall panels were embroidered with a typically chinese-inspired design of this revered eighteenth century period .	134.74025
since the work is done by hand , the only limitation , it is said , `` is that of human conception ' ' .	46.872257
modern embroidered panels , framed and meant to be hung on the wall , are another aspect of this trend .	57.37117
these have never gone out of style in scandinavian homes and now seem to be reappearing here and there in shops which specialize in handicrafts .	219.47412
an amateur decorator might try her hand at a pair during the long winter evenings , and , by picking up her living room color scheme , add a decorative do-it-yourself note to the room .	145.83388
california democrats this weekend will take the wraps off a 1962 model statewide campaign vehicle which they have been quietly assembling in a thousand district headquarters , party clubrooms and workers ' backyards .	135.72874
and they ' re confident that the gop , currently assailed by dissensions within the ranks , will be impressed by the purring power beneath the hood of this grassroots-fueled machine .	132.28267
their meeting at san francisco is nominally scheduled as a conference of the california democratic council directorate .	75.337654
but it will include 200-odd officeholders , organization leaders and `` interested party people ' ' .	68.48416
-- plans for a dramatic , broad-scale party rally in los angeles next december that would enlist top-drawer democrats from all over the country .	65.52487
-- blueprints for doubling the cdc ' s present 55 , 000 enrollment .	87.69919
-- arrangements for a statewide pre-primary endorsing convention in fresno next jan . 26-28 .	185.09082
-- and proposals for a whole series of lesser candidate-picking conventions in the state ' s 38 new congressional districts .	72.28304
at the head of the cdc is an unorthodox , 39-year-old amateur politico , thomas b . carvey jr . , whose normal profession is helping develop hughes aircraft ' s moon missiles .	260.49295
he ' s approached his democratic duties in hard-nosed engineering fashion .	68.87874
viewed from afar , the cdc looks like a rather stalwart political pyramid its elected directorate fans out into an array of district leaders and standing committees , and thence into its component clubs and affiliated groups -- 500 or so .	245.11702
much of its strength stems from the comfortable knowledge that every `` volunteer ' ' democratic organization of any consequence belongs to the aj .	105.02262
moreover , the entire state democratic hierarchy , from gov . brown on down to the county chairmen , also participates in this huge operation .	200.58298
contrarily , republican `` volunteers ' ' go their separate ways , and thus far have given no indication that they ' d be willing to join forces under a single directorate , except in the most loose-knit fashion .	94.84444
carvey believes that reapportionment , which left many democratic clubs split by these new district boundaries , actually will increase cdc membership .	339.4641
where only one club existed before , he says , two will flourish henceforth .	309.2031
biggest organizational problem , he adds , is setting up cdc units in rock-ribbed democratic territory .	372.11356
paradoxically the council is weakest in areas that register 4- and 5-to-1 in the party ' s favor , strongest where democrats and republicans compete on a fairly even basis .	164.27832
like most democratic spokesmen , carvey predicts 1962 will be a tremendously `` partisan year ' ' .	68.48698
hence the attention they ' re lavishing on the aj .	31.65834
in all probability , the council will screen and endorse candidates for the assembly and for congress , and then strive to put its full weight behind these pre-primary favorites .	102.292046
this bodes heated contests in several districts where claims have already been staked out by democratic hopefuls who don ' t see eye-to-eye with the aj .	198.15434
naturally , the statewide races will provide the major test for the expanding council .	139.83926
shunted aside by the rampant organizers for john f . kennedy last year , who relegated it to a somewhat subordinate role in the presidential campaign , the cdc plainly intends to provide the party ' s campaign muscle in 1962 .	53.769997
there is evidence that it will be happily received by gov . brown and the other constitutional incumbents .	147.19734
carvey considers that former vice president nixon would be brown ' s most formidable foe , with ex-gov . knight a close second .	176.97057
but the rest of the gop gubernatorial aspirants don ' t worry him very much .	117.96085
in his cdc work , carvey has the close-in support and advice of one of california ' s shrewdest political strategists former democratic national committeeman paul ziffren , who backed him over a northland candidate espoused by atty . gen . stanley mosk .	90.28933
( significantly , bitter echoes of the 1960 power struggle that saw mosk moving into the national committee post over ziffren are still audible in party circles .	127.41485

it works with english , russian , german , hungarian or almost any other foreign tongue .	129.29355

aug . 4 , 1821 , nearly a century after benjamin franklin founded the pennsylvania gazette -- a century during which it had undergone several changes in ownership and a few brief suspensions in publication -- this paper made its first appearance as the saturday evening post .	107.07026
the country was now full of gazettes and samuel c . atkinson and charles alexander , who had just taken over franklin ' s old paper , desired a more distinctive name .	156.4032
when founded by franklin the gazette was a weekly family newspaper and under its new name its format remained that of a newspaper but its columns gradually contained more and more fiction , poetry , and literary essays .	243.48009
in the middle of the century , with a circulation of 90 , 000 , the post was one of the most popular weeklies in the country .	27.519772
but during the second half of the century its fortunes reached a low point and when in 1897 cyrus h . k . curtis purchased it -- `` paper , type , and all ' ' -- for $1 , 000 it was a 16-page weekly filled with unsigned fiction and initialed miscellany , and with only some 2 , 000 subscribers .	154.93622
little more than a fine old name , valuable principally because of the franklin tradition , the saturday evening post was slow to revive .	98.308304
but curtis poured over $1 million into it and in time it again became one of the most popular weeklies of the country .	44.47741

the 350th anniversary of the king james bible is being celebrated simultaneously with the publishing today of the new testament , the first part of the new english bible , undertaken as a new translation of the scriptures into contemporary english .	49.413525
since it was issued in the spring of 1611 , the king james version has been most generally considered the most poetic and beautiful of all translations of the bible .	110.1445
however , biblical scholars frequently attested to its numerous inaccuracies , as old manuscripts were uncovered and scholarship advanced .	104.985825
this resulted in revisions of the king james bible in 1881-85 as the english revised version and in 1901 as the american standard version .	43.084576
then in 1937 america ' s international council of religious education authorized a new revision , in the light of expanded knowledge of ancient manuscripts and languages .	87.64234
undertaken by 32 american scholars , under the chairmanship of rev . dr . luther a . weigle , former dean of yale university divinity school , their studies resulted in the publishing of the revised standard version , 1946-52 .	71.57448
the new english bible ( the old testament and apocrypha will be published at a future date ) has not been planned to rival or replace the king james version , but , as its cover states , it is offered `` simply as the bible to all those who will use it in reading , teaching , or worship ' ' .	94.30993
time , of course will testify whether the new version will have achieved its purpose .	121.14608
bible reading , even more so than good classical music , grows in depth and meaning upon repetition .	255.76367
if this new bible does not increase in significance by repeated readings throughout the years , it will not survive the ages as has the king james version .	176.60866
however , an initial perusal and comparison of some of the famous passages with the same parts of other versions seems to speak well of the efforts of the british biblical scholars .	111.23591
one is impressed with the dignity , clarity and beauty of this new translation into contemporary english , and there is no doubt that the meaning of the bible is more easily understandable to the general reader in contemporary language in the frequently archaic words and phrases of the king james .	50.67423
for example , in the third chapter of matthew , verses 13-16 , describing the baptism of jesus , the 1611 version reads	70.92344
`` then cometh jesus from galilee to jordan unto john , to be baptized of him .	191.42975
`` but john forbad him , saying , i have need to be baptized of thee , and comest thou to me ? ?	85.67397
`` and jesus answering said unto him , suffer it to be so now for thus it becometh us to fulfill all righteousness .	249.12703
`` and jesus , when he was baptized went up straightway out of the water and lo , the heavens were opened unto him , and he saw the spirit of god descending like a dove , and lighting upon him ' ' .	67.31708
certainly , the meaning is clearer to one who is not familiar with biblical teachings , in the new english bible which reads `` then jesus arrived at jordan from galilee , and he came to john to be baptized by him .	68.87056
' do you come to me ' ? ?	1.0354502
' i need rather to be baptized by you .	393.65707
jesus replied , ' let it be so for the present	66.12809
we do well to conform this way with all that god requires .	124.28739
after baptism jesus came up out of the water at once , and at that moment heaven opened	179.68562
he saw the spirit of god descending like a dove to alight upon him ' '	51.753025
( the paragraphing , spelling and punctuation are reproduced as printed in each version .	63.11738
among the most frequently quoted biblical sentences are the beatitudes and yet so few persons , other than scholars , really understand the true meaning of these eight blessings uttered by jesus at the beginning of the sermon on the mount .	134.85056
to illustrate , the first blessing in the king james bible reads `` blessed are the poor in spirit	132.7887
for their ' s is the kingdom of heaven ' ' .	11.820852
the new version states `` how blest are those who know that they are poor	59.38321
the kingdom of heaven is theirs ' ' .	2.173667
some of the poetic cadence of the older version certainly is lost in the newer one , but almost anyone , with a fair knowledge of the english language , can understand the meaning , without the necessity of interpretation by a biblical scholar .	95.161766
in the second and third chapters of revelation the new version retains , however , the old phrase `` angel of the church ' ' which biblical scholars have previously interpreted as meaning bishop .	66.9141
for the most part , however , the new version is contemporary and , as such , should be the means for many to attain a clearer comprehension of the meaning of those words recorded so many hundreds of years ago by the first followers of christ .	113.837845
originally recorded by hand , these words have been copied and recopied , translated and retranslated through the ages .	31.648724
discoveries recently made of old biblical manuscripts in hebrew and greek and other ancient writings , some by the early church fathers , in themselves called for a restudy of the bible .	125.105736
to have the results recorded in everyday usable english should be of benefit to all who seek the truth .	185.83899
with contemporary english changing with the rapidity that marks this jet age , some of the words and phrases of the new version may themselves soon become archaic .	149.69562
the new testament offered to the public today is the first result of the work of a joint committee made up of representatives of the church of england , church of scotland , methodist church , congregational union , baptist union , presbyterian church of england , churches in wales , churches in ireland , society of friends , british and foreign bible society and national society of scotland .	56.103317
prof . c . h . dodd , 76 , a congregational minister and a leading authority on the new testament , is general director of the project and chairman of the new testament panel .	57.51179

an electric toothbrush ( broxodent ) may soon take its place next to the electric razor in the american bathroom .	80.82939
the brush moves up and down and is small enough to clean every dental surface , including the back of the teeth .	110.25264
in addition , the motor has the seal of approval of the underwriters laboratories , which means it is safe .	63.39569
the unit consists of a small motor that goes on as soon as it is plugged in .	195.62459
the speed is controlled by pressing on the two brake buttons located where the index finger and thumb are placed when holding the motor .	135.84938
the brushes can be cleaned and sterilized by boiling and are detachable so that every member of the family can have his own .	82.84297
most of us brush our teeth by hand .	6.891912
the same can be said of shaving yet the electric razor has proved useful to many men .	158.33281
the electric toothbrush moves in a vertical direction , the way dentists recommend .	108.15915
in addition , it is small enough to get into crevices , jacket and crown margins , malposed anteriors , and the back teeth .	79.37577
the bristles are soft enough to massage the gums and not scratch the enamel .	121.90263
it is conceivable that broxodent could do a better job than ordinary brushing , especially in those who do not brush their teeth properly .	58.534138
several dentists and patients with special dental problems have experimented with the device .	40.68973
the results were good although they are difficult to compare with hand brushing , particularly when the individual knows how to brush his teeth properly .	142.07033
the electric gadget is most helpful when there are many crowned teeth and in individuals who are elderly , bedfast with a chronic disease , or are handicapped by disorders such as cerebral palsy or muscular dystrophy .	102.68472
but for many of us , it will prove an enjoyable luxury .	106.380035
it is not as convenient as the old type toothbrush and the paste tends to shimmy off the bristles .	48.5298
since the apparatus is new , it requires experimentation and changes in technique .	129.08908
writes does numbness in the left hand at night , which awakens the person , indicate brain tumor ? ?	616.84644
this is a common symptom and the cause usually is pressure on the nerve leading to the affected hand .	311.82306
the pressure may come from muscles , tendons , or bones anywhere from the neck to the hand .	40.499607
writes do steam baths have any health value ? ?	17.58655
no , other than cleaning out the pores and making the sweat glands work harder .	75.97475
an ordinary hot bath or shower will do the same .	118.938194
writes what makes my hands numb when sewing ? ?	28.369287
there are many possibilities , including poor circulation , a variety of neurological conditions , and functional disorders .	105.479324
this manifestation may be an early sign of multiple sclerosis or the beginning of sewer ' s cramp .	128.03535
writes does a brace help in sciatica ? ?	1.0751762
a back brace might help , depending upon the cause of sciatica .	59.271442
writes does the cholesterol go down when most of the thyroid gland is removed ? ?	73.23263
the cholesterol level in the blood is influenced by the glands of the body .	20.251059
it is low when the thyroid is overactive and high when the gland is sluggish .	148.6924
the latter is likely to occur when the thyroid is removed .	69.14898
the gap between the bookshelf and the record cabinet grows smaller with each new recording catalogue .	264.66223
there ' s more reading and instruction to be heard on discs than ever before , although the spoken rather than the sung word is as old as thomas alva edison ' s first experiment in recorded sound .	149.38474
edison could hardly have guessed , however , that sophocles would one day appear in stereo .	423.78683
if the record buyer ' s tastes are somewhat eclectic or even the slightest bit esoteric , he will find them satisfied on educational records .	137.02966
and he will avoid eye-strain in the process .	25.934374
everything from poetry to phonetics , history to histrionics , philosophy to party games has been adapted to the turntable .	257.6513
for sheer ambition , take the decca series titled modestly `` wisdom ' ' .	25.365509
volumes one and two , selected from the sound tracks of a television series , contain `` conversations with the elder wise men of our day ' ' .	115.9569
these sages include poet carl sandburg , statesman jawaharlal nehru and sculptor jacques lipchitz , in volume one , and playwright sean o ' casey , david ben-gurion , philosopher bertrand russell and the late frank lloyd wright in the second set .	64.71459
hugh downs is heard interviewing wright , for an added prestige fillip .	134.44894
there ' s more specialization and a narrower purpose in two albums recently issued by dover publications .	63.662117
dover `` publishes ' ' what the company calls `` listen and learn ' ' productions designed to teach foreign languages .	130.16594
previous presentations have been on french , spanish , russian , italian , german and japanese .	76.79623
but the firm has recognized the tight dollar and the tourist ' s desire to visit the `` smaller , less-traveled and relatively inexpensive countries ' ' , and is now prepared to teach modern greek and portuguese through recordings .	59.150795
the respective vocabularies `` essential for travel ' ' are available in separate albums .	49.757336
thanks to spoken arts records , history buffs may hear lincoln ' s `` most memorable speeches and letters ' ' in a two-disc set , interpreted by lincoln authority and lecturer roy p . basler .	184.08768
as a contemporary bonus , the set includes carl sandburg ' s address at a joint session of congress , delivered on lincoln ' s birthday two years ago .	48.971077
for those who `` like poetry but never get around to reading it ' ' , the library of congress makes it possible for poets to be heard reading their own work .	112.29233
the program was instituted in 1940 , and releases are available only from the recording laboratory of the library of congress , washington 25 , d . c . .	52.199226
newest on the list are john ciardi , w . d . snodgrass , i . a . richards , oscar williams , robert hillyer , john hall wheelock , stephen vincent benet , edwin muir , john peal bishop and maxwell bodenheim .	45.699398
two poets are paired on each record , in the order given above .	152.96645
decca is not the only large commercial company to impart instruction .	47.111782
rca victor has an ambitious and useful project in a stereo series called `` adventures in music ' ' , which is an instructional record library for elementary schools .	83.67757
howard mitchell and the national symphony perform in the first two releases , designed for grades one and two .	146.77751
in an effort to fortify himself against the unforseen upsets sure to arise in the future , herbert a . leggett , banker-editor of the phoenix `` arizona progress ' ' , reflects upon a few of the depressing experiences of the feverish fifties .	139.97014
one of the roughest was the tv quiz shows , which gave him inferiority complexes .	118.284325
though it was a great relief when the big brains on these shows turned out to be frauds and phonies , it did irreparable damage to the ego of the editor and many another intelligent , well-informed american .	114.70088
but the one that upset the financially wise was the professional dancer who related in a book how he parlayed his earnings into a $2 , 000 , 000 profit on the stock market .	131.61047
every man who dabbles in the market to make a little easy money on the side and suffers losses could at the time hardly face his wife who was wondering how her husband could be so dumb .	118.78273
investors breathed more freely when it was learned that this acrobatic dancer had turned magician and was only doing a best seller book to make some dough .	164.21605
people who take us for suckers are like the westerner who had on exhibit his superior marksmanship in the form of a number of bull ' s-eye achievements .	65.106125
the promoter who wanted to sign him up for the circus asked him how he was able to do it .	58.306377
he just shot at the board and then drew circles around the holes to form a bull ' s-eye .	54.14537
one of the obstacles to the easy control of a 2-year-old child is a lack of verbal communication .	70.8607
if his mother loves him , he clings to that love as a ballast .	157.79926
he wants mommy to think him a good boy .	89.38256
he doesn ' t want her to look frowningly at him , or speak to him angrily .	138.59497
he wants to be called sweet , good , considerate and mother ' s little helper .	36.96476
but even mother ' s loving attitude will not always prevent misbehavior .	105.41586
his desires are so strong that he needs constant reassurance of his mother ' s love for him and what she expects of him , in order to overcome them .	62.213634
his own inner voice , which should tell him what not to do , has not developed .	108.785675
it won ' t develop until he has words with which to clothe it .	524.0818
what can a mother do then to prevent misbehavior ? ?	51.554935
the fewer nos she has to utter the more effective they will be .	229.90976
she should offer substitutes for the temptations which seem overwhelmingly desirable to the child .	102.03055
if he can ' t play with mommy ' s magazines , he should have some old numbers of his own .	86.93999
if daddy ' s books are out of bounds his own picture books are not .	150.0463
toys he has can be made to act as substitutes for family temptations such as refrigerator and gas stove .	52.813522
during this precarious period of development the mother should continue to influence the growth of the child ' s conscience .	53.61146
she tells him of the consequences of his behavior .	55.986458
if he bites a playmate she says , `` danny won ' t like you ' ' .	45.01976
if he snatches a toy , she says , `` caroline wants her own truck just as you do ' ' .	88.68779
there is no use trying to `` explain ' ' to a 2-year-old .	23.65051
remove the child from the scene of his misbehavior .	224.73903
substitute approved objects for forbidden ones and keep telling him how he is to act .	193.45671
he won ' t submit to his natural desires all the time , and it ' s mother ' s love that is responsible for his good behavior .	60.345837
this is the period during the melancholy days of autumn when universities and colleges schedule what they call `` homecoming day ' ' .	131.41562
they seek thereby to lure the old grad back to the old scenes .	91.51011
the football opponent on homecoming is , of course , selected with the view that said opponent will have little more chance than did a christian when thrown to one of the emperor ' s lions .	113.05466
it is true , of course , the uncertainties of life being what they are , that as now and then the christian killed the lion , homecoming days have been ruined by a visiting team .	161.65022
even with all possible precaution , homecomings are usually rather cruel and sad , and only the perpetually ebullient and the continually optimistic are made happy by them .	196.38031
more often than not , as the old grad wanders along the old paths , his memory of happy days when he strolled one of the paths with a coed beside him becomes an ache and a pain .	101.73769
he can smell again the perfume she wore and recall the lilting sound of laughter , and can smell again the aroma of autumn -- fallen leaves , the wine of cool air , and the nostalgia of woodsmoke which blows through all the winds of fall .	89.03477
it is at precisely such moments that he encounters a couple of undergraduates , faces alight , holding hands and talking happily as they come along , oblivious of him , or throwing him the most fleeting and casual of glances , such as they would give a tethered goat .	131.20012
usually , they titter loudly after they have passed by .	503.26144
he feels , suddenly , the weight of the fat that is on him .	86.38064
his bridgework or his plates feel loose and monstrous .	18.826319
his legs suddenly feel heavy and unaccountably weary , as if he had walked for miles , instead of strolling a few hundred yards along the old campus paths .	84.111015
bitterness comes over him and the taste of time is like unripe persimmons in his mouth .	568.3285
it is not much better if he meets with old classmates .	73.28818
too often , unless he hails them , they pass him by .	189.4804
he recalls with a wry smile the wit who said , on returning from a homecoming reunion , that he would never go again because all his class had changed so much they didn ' t even recognize him .	104.69073
if they do meet and recognize one another , slap backs and embrace , the moment soon is done .	213.24342
after all , when one has asked whatever became of old joe and charlie when one has inquired who it was sue brown married and where it is they now live when questions are asked and answered about families and children , and old professors when the game and its probable outcome has been exhausted that does it .	249.86679
by then one begins to notice the middle-age spread	1130.5886
the gray hairs , the eyeglasses , bodies that are too thin or too heavy	251.09567
the athlete of by-gone years who wears a size 46 suit and puffs when he has finished a sentence of any length then , it is time to break it up and move on .	98.58358
it is , if anything , worse on the old player	131.71544
he sits in the stands and he doesn ' t like that .	26.454649
enough of his life was spent there on the field for him never to like watching the game as a spectator in the crowd .	105.7245
on a team a man feels he is a part of it and akin to the men next to him .	121.37511
in the stands he is lonely and lost , no matter how many are about him .	97.83347
he sits there remembering the tense moment before the ball was snapped	112.94824
the churning of straining feet , the rasp of the canvas pants	20.328356
the smell and feel of hot , wet woolen sleeves across his face .	18.26432
and so , he squirms with each play , remembering his youth .	91.876595
no matter how often a man goes back to the scenes of his youth and strength , they can never be recaptured again .	78.15821
since the obvious is not always true , the republican national committee wisely analyzed its defeat of last autumn and finds that it occurred , as suspected , in the larger cities .	98.40108
of 40 cities with populations of 300 , 000 and more , mr . kennedy carried 26 and mr . nixon 14 .	78.61489
there are eight states in which the largest urban vote can be the balance of power in any close election .	138.3591
these are new york , pennsylvania , michigan , maryland , missouri , new jersey , illinois and minnesota .	25.313799
in 1952 mr . eisenhower won all but missouri .	75.9041
yet , in 1960 all eight gave majorities to mr . kennedy .	26.826439
republican research broke down the vote in philadelphia .	12.242749
mr . nixon , despite a very earnest effort to capture the minority groups , failed to do so .	36.662132
his visit to warsaw , poland , after the russian journey in the summer of 1959 was expected to win the polish vote which , in several cities , is substantial .	105.80242
yet , the gop breakdown discovered that in philadelphia mr . nixon received but 21 per cent of the so-called `` polish ' ' vote	122.7518
30 per cent of the `` irish ' ' vote , and 18 per cent of the `` negro ' ' vote .	43.34294
a gop `` task force ' committee will seek to find out how its party may win support from the ethnic and minority groups in cities .	121.97601
the task force might make a start in washington with republican congressional leaders .	92.58558
these gentlemen already have done the party harm by their seeming reluctance to vote aid for the depressed areas and by their criticism of mr . kennedy for talking about a recession and unemployment .	66.51819
this error was compounded by declaring the recession to be `` a statistical one ' ' , and not a reality .	82.17845
the almost six million persons without jobs and the two million working part-time do not consider themselves and their plight as statistical .	320.3953
they did not view the tour of the distressed cities and towns by secretary of labor goldberg as politics , which the gop declared it to be .	122.83904
the people visited were glad to have a government with heart enough to take an interest in their misery .	235.70615
senator mundt ' s gross distortion of president eisenhower ' s conversation into a denunciation of president kennedy as too left wing , a statement mr . eisenhower declared to be entirely false , is another case in point .	93.98904
if the republicans and southern democrats join to defeat medical care for the old under the social security program , they will thereby erect still another barrier to gop hopes in the cities .	117.17534
the present republican leadership as practiced by mundt , goldwater , bridges , dirksen , et al , is repeating the errors of the party leadership of the 1930s .	74.18234
in that decade the partisan zeal to defend mr . hoover , and the party ' s failure to anticipate or cope with the depression , caused a great majority of americans to see the republican party as cold and lacking in any sympathy for the problems of human beings caught up in the distress and suffering brought on by the economic crash .	82.4768
the republican party was not lacking in humanity , but it permitted its extremely partisan leadership to make it appear devoid of any consideration for people in trouble .	114.94305
farmers called their mule-drawn pickup trucks `` hoover carts ' ' .	2.256782
smokers reduced to `` the makings ' ' , spoke of the sack tobacco as `` hoover dust ' ' .	108.70189
one may be sure the present republican congressional leadership hasn ' t meant to repeat this error .	66.11708
but it is in the process of so doing because it apparently gives priority to trying to downgrade john f . kennedy .	113.44644

the most articulate republicans are those who , in their desire to get back at mr . kennedy , already have created the image of a republican leadership which is reluctant to assist the distressed and the unemployed , and which is even more unwilling to help old people who need medical care .	104.12973

but when former gov . marvin griffin and lt . gov . byrd accepted the invitations of the georgia state chamber of commerce to join the tour next november , the situation was aggravated .	74.75358

the providence journal editorial ( jan . 25 ) entitled `` east greenwich faces a housing development problem ' ' points to a dilemma that faces communities such as ours .	139.94919
your suggested solution , it seems to me , is grossly oversimplified and is inconsistent with your generally realistic attitude toward , and endorsement of , sound planning .	167.84216
first of all there is ample area in east greenwich already zoned in the classification similar to that which petitioner requested .	142.16533
this land is in various stages of development in several locations throughout the town .	84.14298
the demand for these lots can be met for some time to come .	33.58698
this would seem to indicate that we are trying neither `` to halt an influx of migrants ' ' nor are we `` setting up such standards for development that only the well-to-do could afford to buy land and build in the new sites ' ' .	188.75114
what we are attempting to do is achieve and maintain a balance between medium density and low density residential areas and industrial and commercial development .	59.020344
it is in fact entirely consistent with your suggestion of modest industrial development to help pay governmental costs .	196.48073
bostitch , inc . is approximately half way through a 10-year exemption of their real estate tax .	52.4565
the wisdom of granting such tax exemptions is another matter , but this particular instance is , in my opinion , completely satisfactory .	107.29862
the 1960 tax book for east greenwich indicates a valuation for this property in excess of two million dollars .	55.73538
with our current $3 per hundred tax rate , it is safe to assume that this will qualify when you suggest a community should `` try to develop a modest industrial plant ' ' as the best way to meet these problems .	71.583115
in order to attract additional industry that is compatible with this community it is all the more important to present to the industrial prospect an orderly balance in the tax structure .	161.32527
as this tax base grows so then can your medium and low density residential areas grow .	183.8553
mr . richard preston , executive director of the new hampshire state planning and development commission , in his remarks to the governors conference on industrial development at providence on october 8 , 1960 , warned against the fallacy of attempting to attract industry solely to reduce the tax rate or to underwrite municipal services such as schools when he said `` if this is the fundamental reason for a community ' s interest or if this is the basic approach , success if any will be difficult to obtain ' ' .	87.90325
he went on to say `` in the first place , industry per se is not dedicated to the role of savior of foundering municipalities .	121.51056
it is not in business for the purpose of absorbing increased municipal costs no matter how high a purpose that may be ' ' .	188.89493
while councilman olson cited the anticipated increase in school costs in answer to a direct question from a taxpayer , the impact upon a school system does not have to be measured only in increased taxes to find alarm in uncontrolled growth .	137.68182
we in east greenwich have the example of two neighboring communities , one currently utilizing double sessions in their schools , and the other facing this prospect next year .	255.39526
it has already been reported in your newspapers that the east greenwich school committee is considering additions to at least one elementary school and to the high school to insure future accommodations for a school population that we know will increase .	131.49254
if they are to be commended for foresight in their planning , what then is the judgment of a town council that compounds this problem during the planning stage ? ?	139.99619
where then is the sound planning and cooperation between agencies within the community that you have called for in other editorials ? ?	133.6081
i submit that it cannot be dismissed simply by saying we are not facing the facts of life .	58.011497
the `` fruitful course ' ' of metropolitanization that you recommend is currently practiced by the town of east greenwich and had its inception long before we learned what it was called .	116.7945
the east greenwich police department utilizes the radio transmission facilities of the warwick police department , thereby eliminating duplication of facilities and ensuring police coordination in the cowessett-east greenwich-potowomut area of the two communities .	133.6794
the east greenwich fire district services parts of warwick as well as east greenwich .	73.39848
the taxpayers of east greenwich appropriate sums of money , as do other kent county communities , for the support of the kent county memorial hospital , a regional facility .	59.425076
the east greenwich free library receives financial support from the town of east greenwich and the city of warwick to supplement its endowment .	50.77728
feelers were put out last year to the city of warwick , as reported in your newspapers , suggesting investigation of a common rubbish disposal area to service the potowomut and cowessett areas of warwick along with east greenwich .	102.704605
east greenwich was one of the first rhode island towns to enter into contract agreement with the rhode island development council for planning services we could not provide for ourselves .	138.36847
the education program for retarded children conducted by the east greenwich school system has pupils from at least one neighboring community .	97.766266
i feel compelled to write this because i am greatly concerned with the problem of community growth rate and the relation between types of growth in a town such as east greenwich .	86.51012
i believe it is an area in which professional planners have failed to set adequate guide posts	248.3306
and yet they cannot ignore this problem because it concerns the implementation of nearly all the planning programs they have devised .	70.58464
these programs are volumes of waste paper and lost hours if the citizens of a community must stand aside while land developers tell them when , where , and in what manner the community shall grow .	514.94696
we have far less to fear in the migrant family than we have in the migrant developer under these conditions .	220.93333
until professional planners meet this situation squarely and update the concepts of zoning in a manner acceptable to the courts , i hope we in east greenwich can continue to shape our own destiny .	98.60031
i would like very much , on behalf of my husband and myself , to send our eternal thanks to all the wonderful people responsible for the gabrielle fund .	107.506134

i am a sophomore at mount pleasant high school .	4.717716
my future plans are to become a language teacher .	56.12264
of course , having this desire , i am very interested in education .	92.024666
a few weeks ago , i read in the bulletin that there were to be given chinese classes in cranston .	124.70359
the article also said that a person had to be 18 years old or over , and must not be going to high school to attend these classes .	139.85733

at the height of the first snowstorm we had , it was impossible for me to get medical attention needed during an emergency .	112.688835
however , the east providence rescue squad made its way through to my home in time of desperation .	158.98987
words cannot tell of the undivided attention and comfort their service gave to me .	132.04056

had they not gotten me to the hospital when they did , perhaps i would not be here to commend them at this time .	59.08579
the providence sunday journal article ( jan . 29 ) asking whether american taxpayers are being victimized by a gigantic giveaway to pay for the care of war veterans who have non-service-connected disabilities sounds as though the providence journal is desperate for news .	112.002174
usually a veteran has to hang himself to get space on the front page .	72.25279
on the question of admission to veterans administration hospitals of service-connected and non-service-connected disabled veterans , it must be recognized that there are many men who are greatly affected by war service .	57.08448
it can manifest itself before discharge from service , or it can come out years later .	132.24255
there is one other point we should never lose sight of many veterans who enter va hospitals as non-service cases later qualify as service-connected .	308.2612
no psychiatrist could tell me that the experience in a war can not have its effect in the ensuing years .	87.65007
the arguments advanced by those individuals and groups who oppose the system in force and who would drastically curtail or do away entirely with hospital care for the non-service-connected case , seem to be coldly impractical and out-of-step with the wishes of the general public .	134.34584
i believe in priority for service-connected disabled veterans in admission to va hospitals .	34.54214
but i don ' t believe we should close the door on non-service-connected patients .	335.33908
this matter is of great importance , and the outcome may mean the difference between life or death , or at least serious injuries , for many veterans .	42.309425
some critics say that the length of stay in a hospital is too long .	90.54034
there ' s a reason for this length of stay .	18.04692
first of all , the admitting physician in the va hospital gets the patient as a new patient .	71.92626
he has no experience with this veteran ' s previous medical record .	251.58813
if the doctor is conscientious , he wants to study the patient .	61.241016
as a result , it takes a little longer than it would on the outside where the family physician knows about the patient .	41.555515
secondly , the va physician knows that when the patient leaves the hospital , he is no longer going to have a chance to visit his patient .	61.088623
so he keeps the veteran in until he can observe the effects of treatment or surgery .	45.62948
the american public must be presented with the facts concerning va hospitalization .	25.280863
the public should understand that whether they support a state hospital or a va hospital , the tax dollar has to be paid one way or the other .	120.73024
the responsibility is still going to be there whether they pay for a va hospital or the tax dollar is spent for the state hospital .	86.44686
an adequate system of va hospitals is better equipped to care for the veterans than any 50 state hospitals .	279.43433
it seems that open season upon veterans ' hospitalization is once more upon us .	260.79932
the american medical association is once again grinding out its tear-soaked propaganda based upon the high cost of the veterans administration medical program to the american taxpayer .	103.75216

they opposed the forand bill , which would have placed the major burden of financial support upon the individual himself through compulsory payroll deduction	114.33338
yet they supported the eisenhower administration which will cost a small state like ours approximately five million dollars ( matched incidentally by a federal grant ) to initiate .	282.5903

but no president ever before referred to his as a `` lousy job ' ' ( as walter trohan recently quoted president kennedy as doing in conversation with sen . barry goldwater ) .	85.53283

top scientists have warned that an area hit by an atomic missile of massive power would be engulfed in a suffocating fire storm which would persist for a long time .	93.63676
the scientists have also warned that no life above ground or underground , sheltered or unsheltered could be expected to survive in an area at least 50 miles in diameter .	92.74535
this sum spent for foreign economic aid , the peace corps , food for peace , or any other program to solve the problems of the underdeveloped countries would be an investment that would pay off in world peace , increased world trade , and prosperity for every country on the globe .	105.536026

-- in reply to a letter in today ' s `` voice ' ' urging the sale of meat after 6 p . m . , i wish to state the other side of the story .	68.349724
i am the wife of the owner of a small , independent meat market .	100.68628
my husband ' s hours away from home for the past years have been from 7 a . m . to 7 p . m . the early part of the week , and as late as 8 or 9 on week-ends .	66.66184
now he is apparently expected to give up his evenings -- and sundays , too , for this is coming .	73.15971
there is a trend to packaging meat at a central source , freezing it , and shipping it to outlying stores , where meat cutters will not be required .	71.530876
if a customer wishes a special cut , it will not be available .	20.137625
we are slowly being regimented to having everything packaged , whether we want it or not .	119.54556
most women , in this age of freezers , shop for the entire week on week-ends , when prices are lower .	82.50029
also , many working wives have children or husbands who take over the shopping chores for them .	72.1761
and my husband hasn ' t had a vacation in 14 years .	143.64407
but if we closed the store for a vacation , we would lose our customers to the chain stores in the next block .	60.472694
the meat cutters ' union , which has a history of being one of the fairest and least corrupt in our area , represents the little corner markets as well as the large supermarkets .	157.06044
what it is trying to do is to protect the little man , too , as well as trying to maintain a flow of fresh meat to all stores , with choice of cut being made by the consumer , not the store .	176.99884

had i been granted the floor on a point of personal privilege , the matter she raised would have been clarified .	121.60219
the resolution under discussion at the convention was to require the boards of election to instruct judges to properly display the american flag .	84.42491
judges under the jurisdiction of the chicago board of election commissioners are instructed to do this .	53.67216
the resolution further asked that polling place proprietors affix an attachment to their premises for the display of the flag .	60.97949
it was my desire to advise the membership of the legion that the majority of polling places are on private property and , without an amendment to the law , we could not enforce this .	78.7575
my discussion with reference to the resolution was that we should commend those citizens who serve as judges of election and who properly discharge their duty and polling place proprietors who make available their private premises , and not by innuendo criticize them .	146.92084

-- your july 26 editorial regarding the position of attorney general robert f . kennedy on prospective tax relief for dupont stockholders is based on an erroneous statement of fact .	55.205555
as a result , your criticism of attorney general robert f . kennedy and the department of justice was inaccurate , unwarranted and unfair .	20.25854
the editorial concerned legislative proposals to ease the tax burden on dupont stockholders , in connection with the united states supreme court ruling that dupont must divest itself of its extensive general motors stock holdings .	57.34363
these proposals would reduce the amount of tax that dupont stockholders might have to pay -- from an estimated 1 . 1 billion dollars under present law to as little as 192 million dollars .	81.6992
congressman wilbur d . mills , chairman of the house ways and means committee , asked the department of justice for its views on these legislative proposals as they related to anti-trust law enforcement .	179.05807
the attorney general responded by letter dated july 19 .	32.268585
copies of this letter were made avaliable to the press and public .	121.84655
in this letter , mr . kennedy made it clear that he limited his comment only to one consideration -- what effect the legislative proposals might have on future anti-trust judgments .	157.41747
there are a number of other considerations besides this one but it is for the congress , not the department of justice , to balance these various considerations and make a judgment about legislation .	91.719185
yet your editorial said `` now the attorney general writes that no considerations ' justify any loss of revenue of this proportion ' ' ' .	71.44422
what mr . kennedy , in fact , wrote was `` it is the department ' s view that no anti-trust enforcement considerations justify any loss of revenue of this proportion ' ' .	54.14229
the editorial , by omitting the words anti-trust enforcement , totally distorted mr . kennedy ' s views .	43.587856
the headline is offensive , particularly in view of the total inaccuracy of the editorial .	26.521614

being ethical and professional people interested in community health and well-being , we felt this wasn ' t a function of our position .	112.39523

sir -- i read of a man who felt he should not build a fallout shelter in his home because it would be selfish for him to sit secure while his neighbors had no shelters .	103.199

if in a town of 2 , 000 private homes , half of them have shelters , the need for the community shelters will be reduced to that extent .	88.44437
