sir -- permit me to commend your editorial in which you stress the fact that a program of county colleges will substantially increase local tax burdens and that taxpayers have a right to a clear idea of what such a program would commit them to .	119.37068
the bill which passed the assembly last may and is now pending in the senate should be given careful scrutiny .	79.34418
the procedure for determining the amounts of money to be spent by county colleges and raised by taxation will certainly startle many taxpayers .	244.43106
under the proposal the members of the board of trustees of a county college will be appointed	30.228354
the trustees will prepare an annual budget for the college and submit it to the board of school estimate .	86.01052
this board will consist of two of the trustees of the college , and the director and two members of the board of freeholders .	37.72059
it will determine the amount of money to be spent by the college and will certify this amount to the board of freeholders , which `` shall appropriate in the same manner as other appropriations are made by it the amount so certified and the amount shall be assessed , levied and collected in the same manner as moneys appropriated for other purposes ' ' .	81.01932
the approval of only three members of the board of school estimate is required to certify the amount of money to be allotted to the college .	38.718018
since two of these could be trustees of the college , actually it would be necessary to have the consent of only one elected official to impose a levy of millions of dollars of tax revenue .	44.57327

the viewers of the `` deep peep show ' ' at 15th and m streets nw have an added attraction -- the view of a fossilized cypress swamp .	97.49286
twenty feet below the street level in the excavation of the new motel to be constructed on this site , a black coal-like deposit has been encountered .	111.50797
this is a black swamp clay in which about one hundred million years ago cypress-like trees were growing .	241.12024
the fossilized remains of many of these trees are found embedded in the clay .	67.58919
some of the stumps are as much as three feet long , but most of them have been flattened by the pressure of the overlying sediments .	51.18463
although the wood has been changed to coal , much of it still retains its original cell structure .	391.75287
in the clay are entombed millions of pollen grains and spores which came from plants growing in the region at the time .	45.776802
these microfossils indicate the swamp was `` formed during the lower cretaceous period when dinosaurs were at their heyday and when the first flowering plants were just appearing .	120.34009
the 15th street deposit is not to be confused with the nearby famous mayflower hotel cypress swamp on 17th street reported in the washington post , august 2 , 1955 , which was probably formed during the second interglacial period and is therefore much younger .	83.0882
recently the secretary of the friends committee on national legislation was interviewed on the air .	77.96547

are we not late , especially those of us who call ourselves friends , in doing enough about this lack of understanding ? ?	145.52948
as to protection , the speaker disapproved of shelters , pointing out that fallout shelters would not save everyone .	125.38989
is this a reason for saving no one ? ?	11.014224
would the man with an empty life boat row away from a shipwreck because his boat could not pick up everyone ? ?	184.37265
the speaker suggested that the desolation of a post-attack world would be too awful to face .	112.83552

many of our young people think it would .	456.6066
lastly , the speaker decried our organized program of emergency help calling it `` civilian defense ' ' .	101.5897
in 1950 , public law 920 created civil defense ( different from civilian-groups of world war 2 ) , a responsibility of the government at all levels to help reduce loss of life and property in disaster , natural or manmade .	101.90452
far from creating fear , as the speaker suggests , preparedness -- knowing what to do in an emergency -- gives people confidence .	281.37048
civil defense has far to go and many problems to solve , but is it not in the best spirit of our pioneer tradition to be not only willing , but prepared to care for our own families and help our neighbors in any disaster -- storm , flood , accident or even war ? ?	111.25734
it seems rather peculiar that residents of apartments are denied the right of providing themselves with the protection and companionship of dogs .	91.33029
i feel that few burglars would be prone to break and enter into someone ' s apartment if they were met with a good hardy growl that a dog would provide .	145.78534

in your editorial of sept . 30 `` the smoldering congo ' ' you make the following comment `` far too many states are following the russian example in refusing to pay their assessments .	187.44737
it is up to the assembly to take action against them .	67.42563
they are violating their charter obligation , the prescribed penalty for which is suspension of membership or expulsion ' ' .	65.010956
i would like to quote from the charter of the united nations	8.750123
the general assembly shall consider and approve the budget of the organization .	11.573062
the expenses of the organization shall be borne by the members as apportioned by the general assembly .	41.186935
a member of the united nations which is in arrears in the payment of its financial contributions to the organization shall have no vote in the general assembly if the amount of its arrears equals or exceeds the amount of the contributions due from it for the preceding two full years ' ' .	81.1718
the u . s . s . r . and her followers are careful in paying their obligations to the regular budget .	75.35202
but they refuse , as do the arab states , to support the united nations ' expenses of maintaining the united nations emergency force in the middle east as a buffer between egypt and israel , and the u . n . troops in the congo , which expenses are not covered by the regular budget of the united nations , but by a special budget .	48.584316
according to the official interpretation of the charter , a member cannot be penalized by not having the right to vote in the general assembly for nonpayment of financial obligations to the `` special ' ' united nations ' budgets , and of course cannot be expelled from the organization ( which you suggested in your editorial ) , due to the fact that there is no provision in the charter for expulsion .	81.75419
connally amendment ' s repeal held step toward world order	10496.856
in your sept . 27 editorial appraisal of the work of the first session of the eighty-seventh congress you referred to the lack of `` consciousness of destiny in a time of acute national and world peril ' ' .	89.28054
yet your list of things left undone did not include repeal of the connally amendment to this country ' s domestic jurisdiction reservation to its adherence to the statute of the international court of justice .	36.511234
the connally amendment says that the united states , rather than the court , shall determine whether a matter is essentially within the domestic jurisdiction of the united states in a case before the world court to which the united states is a party .	41.16864
if the case is thus determined by us to be domestic , the court has no jurisdiction .	99.78456
since the connally amendment has the effect of giving the same right to the other party to a dispute with the united states , it also prevents us from using the court effectively .	91.05369
yet although the kennedy administration , and the eisenhower administration before it , have both declared themselves solidly for repeal of the connally amendment , as contrary to our best interests , no action has yet been taken .	124.308014
our `` destiny ' ' in these perilous times should be to lead strongly in the pursuit of peace , with justice , under law .	131.56918
to achieve this destiny , acts as well as words are needed -- not only acts that lead to physical strength but also acts that lead to strength based on right doing and respect .	305.20377
what better affirmative step could be taken to this end than repeal of the connally amendment -- an act which could expose the united states to no practical risk yet would put an end to our self-judging attitude toward the court , enable us to utilize it , and advance in a tangible way the cause of international law and order ? ?	126.45049
we believe that the list of vital things left undone to date by the eighty-seventh congress should have included repeal by the senate of the connally amendment .	35.552616
many home-bound subway riders utilizing the flushing-main street express are daily confronted with the sight of the local departing from the woodside station as their express comes to a stop , leaving them stranded and strained .	150.59335
to the tens of thousands who must transfer to ride to seventy-fourth street and change for the ind , this takes a daily toll of time and temper .	129.14511
the transit authority has recently placed in operation `` hold ' ' lights at bmt thirty-ninth and fifty-ninth street stations in brooklyn .	114.11802
this `` holds ' ' the local until the express passengers change trains .	238.52643
without question , this time and temper saver should be immediately installed at the woodside station .	70.13243
as a business man i have to use the telephone constantly , from three to four hours a day .	125.59741
in the last few years the telephone company has managed to automate many areas of their service .	63.305252

there is no charge and no state aid .	14.907113

your continuing editorials concerning the schuylkill expressway are valuable	472.19745
one of the problems associated with the expressway stems from the basic idea .	104.03647
we shuffle a large percentage of the cars across the river twice .	61.149418
they start on the east side of the schuylkill , have to cross over to the west to use the expressway and cross over again to the east at their destination .	158.11778
bridges , tunnels and ferries are the most common methods of river crossings .	180.04893
each one of these is , by its nature , a focal point or a point of natural congestion .	41.79563
we should avoid these congestion points or , putting it another way , keep cars starting and ending on the east side of the river -- on the east side .	92.20335
this can be accomplished by several logical steps ( 1 )	25.27565
widen the east river drive at least one lane .	244.51021
so widen it as to minimize the present curves and eliminate drainage problems .	225.0543
paint continuous lane stripes and install overhead directional lights as on our bridges .	206.15042
one additional lane would then be directional with the traffic burden and effectively increase the traffic carrying capability of the east river drive by fifty percent .	204.43538
this could be accomplished without the tremendous expenditures necessitated by the schuylkill expressway and without destroying the natural beauty of the east river drive .	35.24449

there is a trend today to bemoan the fact that americans are too `` soft ' ' .	48.532486
unfortunately , those who would remedy our `` softness ' ' seek to do so with calisthenics .	84.42258
they are working on the wrong part of our anatomy .	32.02799

ashamed of our wealth and power , afraid of so-called world opinion and addicted to peace , we have allowed our soft-heartedness to lead to soft-headed policies .	167.25487
when we become firm enough to stand for those ideals which we know to be right , when we become hard enough to refuse to aid nations which do not permit self-determination , when we become strong enough to resist any more drifts towards socialism in our own nation , when we recognize that our enemy is communism not war , and when we realize that concessions to communists do not insure peace or freedom , then , and only then will we no longer be `` soft ' ' .	113.32025
america doesn ' t need to `` push-up ' ' , she needs to stand up ! !	24.5578
the new column by maurice stans regarding business scandals , is fair and accurate in most respects and his solution to the problem has some merit .	95.22091
however , he states unequivocally `` the scandals in business are far less significant than the scandals in labor ' ' .	110.94022
i must , in fairness , take issue with his premise , primarily because the so-called scandals in labor unions were very much connected with business scandals .	113.56188
the area most prominently commented on during the mcclellan hearings had to do with `` sweetheart contracts ' ' .	49.330082
these arrangements would have been impossible if the business community was truly interested in the welfare of its employes .	99.55706
a sweetheart arrangement can come about as often by employers doing the corrupting as by unscrupulous labor leaders demanding tribute .	287.2402
anyone familiar with the details of the mcclellan hearings must at once realize that the sweetheart arrangements augmented employer profits far more than they augmented the earnings of the corruptible labor leaders .	181.66878
further , it should be recalled that some very definite steps were taken by congress to combat corruption in the labor movement by its passage of the landrum-griffin act .	64.02183
the nuclear war is already being fought , except that the bombs are not being dropped on enemy targets -- not yet .	95.07831
it is being fought , moreover , in fairly close correspondence with the predictions of the soothsayers of the think factories .	283.3475
they predicted escalation , and escalation is what we are getting .	48.752705
the biggest nuclear device the united states has exploded measured some 15 megatons , although our b-52s are said to be carrying two 20-megaton bombs apiece .	261.859
some time ago , however , mr . khrushchev decided that when bigger bombs were made , the soviet union would make them .	115.64923
he seems to have at least a few 30- and 50-megaton bombs on hand , since we cannot assume that he has exploded his entire stock .	127.89811
and now , of course , the hue and cry for counter-escalation is being raised on our side .	109.82172
khrushchev threatens us with a 100-megaton bomb ? ?	1.0489212
so be it -- then we must embark on a crash program for 200-megaton bombs of the common or hydrogen variety , and neutron bombs , which do not exist but are said to be the coming thing .	158.0271
so escalation proceeds , ad infinitum or , more accurately , until the contestants begin dropping them on each other instead of on their respective proving grounds .	112.078255
what is needed , philip morrison writes in the cornell daily sun ( october 26 ) is a discontinuity .	70.388756
the escalation must end sometime , and probably quite soon .	337.6467
`` only a discontinuity can end it ' ' , professor morrison writes .	52.582344
`` the discontinuity can either be that of war to destruction , or that of diplomatic policy ' ' .	105.942116
morrison points out that since our country is more urbanized than the soviet union or red china , it is the most vulnerable of the great powers -- europe of course must be written off out of hand .	65.87434
he feels , therefore , that to seek a discontinuity in the arms policy of the united states is the least risky path our government can take .	78.570366
his proposal is opposed to that of richard nixon , governor rockefeller , past chairmen strauss and mccone of the atomic energy commission , dr . edward teller and those others now enjoying their hour of triumph in the exacerbation of the cold war .	47.31761
these gentlemen are calling for a resumption of testing -- in the atmosphere -- on the greatest possible scale , all in the name of national security .	85.8777
capable as their minds may be in some directions , these guardians of the nation ' s security are incapable of learning , or even of observing .	70.423035
if this capacity had not failed them , they would see that their enemy has made a disastrous miscalculation .	116.06345
he has gained only one thing -- he has exploded a 50-megaton bomb and he probably has rockets with sufficient thrust to lob it over the shorter intercontinental ranges .	141.60379
but if his purpose was to inspire terror , his action could hardly have miscarried more obviously .	228.75444
not terror , but anger and resentment have been the general reaction outside the soviet sphere .	119.090965
khrushchev himself is reported to be concerned by the surge of animosity he has aroused , yet our own nuclear statesmen seem intent on following compulsively in his footsteps .	238.14139
when one powerful nation strives to emulate the success of another , it is only natural .	62.862705
thus , when the russians sent up their first sputnik , american chagrin was human enough , and american determination to put american satellites into orbit was perfectly understandable .	217.18102
but to imitate an opponent when he has made the mistake of his life would be a new high in statesmanlike folly .	71.115074
when east germans fled to the west by the thousands , paeans of joy rose from the throats of western publicists .	89.357376
they are less vocal now , when it is the west berliners who are migrating .	155.56644
the flood is not as great -- only 700 a week according to one apparently conservative account -- but it is symptomatic .	380.03754
west berlin morale is low and , in age distribution , the situation is unfavorable .	442.29752
nearly 18 per cent of west berlin ' s 2 , 200 , 000 residents are sixty-five or older , only 12 . 8 per cent are under fifteen .	81.42315
r . h . s . crossman , m . p . , writing in the manchester guardian , states that departures from west berlin are now running at the rate not of 700 , but of 1 , 700 a week , and applications to leave have risen to 1 , 900 a week .	127.56562
the official statistics show that 60 per cent are employed workers or independent professional people .	108.803055
whole families are moving and removal firms are booked for months ahead .	80.17399
the weekly loss is partly counterbalanced by 500 arrivals each week from west germany , but the hard truth , says crossman , is that `` the closing off of east berlin without interference from the west and with the use only of east german , as distinct from russian , troops was a major communist victory , which dealt west berlin a deadly , possibly a fatal , blow .	126.335205
the gallant half-city is dying on its feet ' ' .	7.16395
another piece of evidence appears in a dispatch from bonn in the observer ( london ) .	98.52568
mark arnold-foster writes `` people are leaving ( west berlin ) because they think it is dying .	84.511505
they are leaving so fast that the president of the west german employers ' federation issued an appeal this week to factory workers in the west to volunteer for six months ' front-line work in factories in west berlin .	62.09825
berlin ' s resilience is amazing , but if it has to hire its labor in the west the struggle will be hard indeed ' ' .	116.198074
the only hope for west berlin lies in a compromise which will bring down the wall and reunite the city .	129.05542
state department officials refusing to show their passes at the boundary , and driving two blocks into east berlin under military escort , will not avail .	93.499115
tanks lined up at the border will be no more helpful .	142.8967
the materials for compromise are at hand the nation , walter lippmann and other sober commentators ( see alan clark on p . 367 ) have spelled them out again and again .	125.61634
a compromise will leave both sides without the glow of triumph , but it will save berlin .	91.06894
or the city can be a graveyard monument to western intransigence , if that is what the west wants .	154.37611
the removal of stalin ' s body from the mausoleum he shared with lenin to less distinguished quarters in the kremlin wall is not unprecedented in history .	133.30212
it is , in fact , a relatively mild chastisement of the dead .	36.79729
a british writer , richard haestier , in a book , dead men tell tales , recalls that in the turmoil preceding the french revolution the body of henry 4 , , who had died nearly 180 years earlier , was torn to pieces by a mob .	105.14964
and in england , after the restoration , the body of cromwell was disinterred and hanged at tyburn .	139.3057
the head was then fixed on a pole at westminster , and the rest of the body was buried under the gallows .	25.631361
contemplating these posthumous punishments , stalin should not lose all hope .	76.46189
in 1899 , parliament erected a statue to cromwell in westminster , facing whitehall and there , presumably , he still stands .	152.7459
nikita khrushchev , however , has created yet another problem for himself .	90.03224
the lenin tomb is obviously adequate for double occupancy , moscow is a crowded city , and the creed of communism deplores waste .	147.53294
who will take stalin ' s place beside lenin ? ?	5.647912
there is karl marx , of course , buried in london .	267.3031
the macmillan government might be willing to let him go , but he has been dead seventy-eight years and even the soviet morticians could not make him look presentable .	103.41841
who , then , is of sufficient stature to lodge with lenin ? ?	22.668615
since he has just shown who is top dog , he may not be ready to receive this highest honor in the gift of the soviet people .	50.567066
besides , he can hardly avoid musing on the instability of death which , what with exhumations and rehabilitations , seems to match that of life .	70.995445
suppose he did lie beside lenin , would it be permanent ? ?	175.2408

when a man is laid to rest , he is entitled to stay put .	43.480305

the appointment of u thant of burma as the u . n . ' s acting secretary general -- at this writing , the choice appears to be certain -- offers further proof that in politics it is more important to have no influential enemies than to have influential friends .	109.81857
mongi slim of tunisia and frederick boland of ireland were early favorites in the running , but france didn ' t like the former and the soviet union would have none of the latter .	104.99323
with the neutralists maintaining pressure for one of their own to succeed mr . hammarskjold , u thant emerged as the only possible candidate unlikely to be waylaid by a veto .	56.07585
what is interesting is that his positive qualifications for the post were revealed only as a kind of tail to his candidacy .	170.72104

he has , moreover , another qualification which augurs well for the future .	40.269054
he is a buddhist , which means that to him peace and the sanctity of human life are not only religious dogma , but a profound and unshakable weltanschauung .	97.7479
u thant of course , will hold office until the spring of 1963 , when mr . hammarskjold ' s term would have come to an end .	47.18982

heavily armed and mobilized as a fast-moving civil defense outfit , 23 operators and office personnel stand ready to move into action at a minute ' s notice ' ' .	96.77236
according to friends , the unit was organized by john snook , a former world war 2 , commando who is vice president and general manager of the telephone company .	46.558083
the girls , very fetching in their uniforms , are shown firing rockets from a launcher mounted on a dump truck	135.53362
