we do well to remind ourselves that from men and women of new england ancestry also issued the church of jesus christ of latter day saints , the seventh day adventists , christian science , the american board of commissioners for foreign missions , the american home missionary society , the american bible society , and new england theology .	84.95522
the atmosphere was one of optimism , of confidence in human progress , and of a determination to rid the world of its ills .	83.10176
the hopkinsian universal disinterested benevolence , although holding to original sin and the doctrine of election , inspired its adherents to heroic endeavours for others , looked for the early coming of the millennium , and was paralleled by the confidence in man ' s ability cherished by the unitarians , emerson , and the transcendentalists .	110.77012
we should recall the number of movements for the service of mankind which arose from the kindred evangelicalism of the british isles and the pietism of the continent of europe -- among them prison reform , anti-slavery measures , legislation for the alleviation of conditions of labour , the inner mission , and the red cross .	65.26213
we cannot take the space to record all the efforts for the removal or alleviation of collective ills .	102.013084
a few of the more prominent must serve as examples of what a complete listing and description would disclose .	192.55093
several were born in the early decades and persisted throughout the century .	153.1779
some disappeared with the attainment of their purpose .	5.1104217
still others sprang up late in the century to meet conditions which arose from fresh stages of the revolutionary age .	64.94155
the movement to end negro slavery began before 1815 and mounted after that year until , as a result of the civil war , emancipation was achieved .	75.973404
long before 1815 the christian conscience was leading some to declare slavery wrong and to act accordingly .	163.22871
for example , in 1693 the philadelphia yearly meeting of friends declared that its members should emancipate their slaves and in 1776 it determined to exclude from membership all who did not comply .	228.1701
in the latter year samuel hopkins , from whom the hopkinsian strain of new england theology took its name , asked the continental congress to abolish slavery .	76.71746
as we have seen , methodism early took a stand against slavery .	37.59519
beginning at least as far back as 1789 various baptist bodies condemned slavery .	112.571915
after 1815 anti-slavery sentiment mounted , chiefly among protestants and those of protestant background of the older stock .	49.766792
the nineteenth-century immigration , whether protestant or roman catholic , was not so much concerned , for very few if any among them held slaves they were mostly in the northern states where slavery had disappeared or was on the way out , or were too poverty-stricken to own slaves .	117.938126
benjamin lundy ( 1789-1839 ) , a quaker , was a pioneer in preparing the way for anti-slavery societies .	95.87909
it was he who turned the attention of william lloyd garrison ( 1805-1879 ) to the subject .	107.375694
garrison , massachusetts born of nova scotian parentage , was by temperament and conviction a reformer .	50.032887
chiefly remembered because of his incessant advocacy of `` immediate and unconditional abolition ' ' , he also espoused a great variety of other causes -- among them women ' s rights , prohibition , and justice to the indians .	78.91836
incurably optimistic , dogmatic , and utterly fearless , in his youth a devout baptist , in spite of his friendship for the quaker poet john greenleaf whittier ( 1807-1892 ) he eventually attacked the orthodox churches for what he deemed their cowardly compromising on the slavery issue and in his invariably ardent manner was emphatically unorthodox and denied the plenary inspiration of the bible .	118.678505
a marked impulse came to the anti-slavery movement through the finney revivals .	30.30323
finney himself , while opposed to slavery , placed his chief emphasis on evangelism , but from his converts issued much of the leadership of the anti-slavery campaign .	119.9317
theodore dwight weld ( 1803-1895 ) was especially active .	586.4645
weld was the son and grandson of new england congregational ministers .	12.247139
as a youth he became one of finney ' s band of evangelists and gave himself to winning young men .	71.37847
a strong temperance advocate , through the influence of a favorite teacher , charles stewart , another finney convert , he devoted himself to the anti-slavery cause .	125.150604
a group of young men influenced by him enrolled in lane theological seminary and had to leave because of their open anti-slavery position .	116.98457
the majority then went to the infant oberlin .	41.166916
they and others employed some of finney ' s techniques as they sought to win adherents to the cause .	110.52963
weld contributed to the anti-slavery convictions of such men as joshua r . giddings and edwin m . stanton , enlisted john quincy adams , and helped provide ideas which underlay harriet beecher stowe ' s uncle tom ' s cabin .	89.4217
he shunned publicity for himself and sought to avoid fame .	123.7388
wendell phillips ( 1811-1884 ) , from a prominent massachusetts family , in his teens was converted under the preaching of lyman beecher .	133.91132
although he later broke with the churches because he believed that they were insufficiently outspoken against social evils , he remained a devout christian .	127.527916
he was remembered chiefly for his fearless advocacy of abolition , but he also stood for equal rights for women , for opportunity for the freedmen , and for prohibition .	141.86487
the anti-slavery movement and other contemporary reforms and philanthropies were given leadership and financial undergirding by arthur tappan ( 1786-1865 ) and his younger brother , lewis tappan ( 1788-1873 ) .	78.25961
individuals possessing unusual gifts and great personal power were transmuted at death into awesome spirits	842.6481
they were almost immediately worshipped for these newer , even more terrible abilities .	103.79347
their direct descendants inherited not only their worldly fortunes , but also the mandate of their newfound power as spirits in the other half of the universe .	40.168854
royal lineages could be based on extraordinary worldly achievements translated into eternal otherworldly power .	36.628548
thus , the emperor could draw on sources not available to those with less puissant ancestors .	240.27196
but this eminence was not without its weighty responsibilities .	8.455682
since he possessed more power in an interdependent universe of living beings and dead spirits , the emperor had to use it for the benefit of the living .	76.060684
the royal ritual generated power into the other world it also provided the living with a way to control the spirits , and bring their powers directly to bear on the everyday affairs of the world .	109.31863
proper ritual observance at any level of society was capable of generating power for use in the spirit world	144.09445
but naturally , the royal ritual , which provided unusual control over already supremely powerful divine spirits , was held responsible for regulating the universe and insuring the welfare of the kingdom .	151.56863
this is the familiar system of `` cosmic government ' ' .	17.373405
the chinese emperor , by proper observance of ritual , manifested divine powers .	37.80105
he regulated the dualities of light and darkness , yang and yin , which are locked in eternal struggle .	92.16079
by swaying the balance between them , he effected the alternation of the seasons .	74.44265
his power was so great that he even promoted and demoted gods according to whether they had given ear or been deaf to petitions .	231.20483
in this system , no man is exempt from obligations .	124.892166
failure in daily moral and ethical duties to one ' s family , outrages to community propriety , any departure from rigid standards of moral excellence were offenses against the dead .	215.5949
and to offend the dead meant to incur their wrath , and thus provoke the unleashing of countrywide disasters .	93.975365
the family home was , in fact , a temple	444.5072
and the daily duties of individuals were basically religious in nature .	173.11002
the dead spirits occupied a prominent place in every hope and in every fear .	198.83061
the common belief was that there existed one moral order , which included everything .	196.84213
the dead controlled the material prosperity of the living , and the living adhered to strict codes of conduct in order not to weaken that control .	79.475006
men believed they could control nature by obeying a moral code .	22.535479
if the moral code were flouted , the proper balance of the universe would be upset , and the disastrous result could be floods , plague , or famine .	37.133644
modern westerners have difficulty comprehending this fusion of moral and material , largely because in the west the historical trend has been to deny the connection .	86.56355
living in urban conditions , away from the deadweight of village constraint and the constrictions of a thatched-roof world view , the individual may find it possible , say , to commit adultery not only without personal misgivings , but also without suffering any adverse effects in his worldly fortunes .	152.6254
basing action on the empirical determination of cause and effect provides a toughness and bravado that no powerful otherworldly ancestor could ever impart -- plus the added liberation from the constraint of silent burial urns .	122.590645
in china , the magical system par excellence was taoism .	263.65884
the taoists were quietist mystics , who saw an unchanging unity -- the tao -- underlying all phenomena .	83.253586
it was this timeless unity that was all-important , and not its temporary manifestations in the world of reality .	50.026485
the taoists believed the unity could be influenced by proper magical manipulation	40.278988
in other words , they were actually an organization of magicians .	44.711487
mahayana buddhism was no exception to these prevailing magical concepts .	23.69625
after this form of indian buddhism had been introduced into china , it underwent extensive changes .	104.99363
during its flowering in the sixth to the eighth centuries , mahayana offered a supernatural package to the chinese which bears no resemblance to the highly digested philosophical zen morsels offered to the modern western reader .	121.19709
mahayana had gods , and magic , a pantheon , heavens and hells , and gorgeously appareled priests , monks , and nuns , all of whom wielded power over souls in the other world .	85.49376
the self-realized mahayana saint possessed superhuman powers and magic .	73.18588
the mahayana that developed in the north was a religion of idolatry and coarse magic , that made the world into a huge magical garden .	180.30032
in its monastic form , mahayana was merely an organization of magic-practicing monks ( bonzes ) , who catered to the chinese faith in the supernatural .	114.40902
nonmagical confucianism was a secular , rational philosophy , but even with this different orientation it could not escape from the ethos of a cosmic government .	117.3706
confucianism had its own magic in the idea that virtue had power .	140.62883
if a man lived a classical life , he need not fear the spirits -- for only lack of virtue gave the spirits power over him .	151.14095
but let us not be mistaken about confucian `` virtue ' '	34.209232
this was not virtue as we understand the word today , and it did not mean an abandonment of the belief in magic manipulation .	55.71797
to the confucian , `` virtue ' ' simply meant mastery and correct observance of three hundred major rules of ritual and three thousand minor ones .	199.76402
propriety was synonymous with ritual observance , the mark of a true gentleman .	194.76437
to live correctly in an interdependent moral and material universe of living and dead was decisive for man ' s fate .	176.00203
this , in brief , was the historical background out of which zen emerged .	210.58217
promoters of zen to the west record its ancestry , and recognize that zen grew out of a combination of taoism and indian mahayana buddhism .	111.828735
but the `` marvelous person ' ' that is supposed to result from zen exhibits more chinese practicality than indian speculation -- he possesses magical powers , and can use them to order nature and to redeem souls .	233.81792
proponents of zen to the west emphasize disproportionately the amount of mahayana buddhism in zen , probably in order to dignify the indisputably magical taoist ideas with more respectable buddhist metaphysic .	97.20107
but in the chinese mind , there was little difference between the two -- the bonzes were no more metaphysical than a magician has to be .	70.32605
actually , zen owes more to chinese quietism than it does to mahayana buddhism .	61.42292
the ch ' an ( zen ) sect may have derived its metaphysic from mahayana , but its psychology was pure early taoist .	177.07507
this is well evidenced by the quietist doctrines carried over in zen the idea of the inward turning of thought , the enjoinder to put aside desires and perturbations so that a return to purity , peace , and stillness -- a union with the infinite , with the tao -- could be effected .	193.04941
in fact , the antipathy to outward ceremonies hailed by modern exponents as so uniquely characteristic of the `` direct thinking ' ' zennist was a feature of taoism .	119.586105
so , too , was the insistence on the relativity of the external world , and the ideas that language and things perceived by consciousness were poor substitutes indeed for immediate perception by pure , indwelling spirit the opposition of pure consciousness to ratiocinating consciousness .	145.61311
zen maintains that cognitive things are only the surface of experience .	74.201805
one of its features attractive to the west is its irreverence for tradition and dogma and for sacred texts .	184.92525
one patriarch is supposed to have relegated sacred scriptures for use in an outhouse .	157.02014
but this is not the spirit of self-reliant freedom of action for which the westerner mistakes it .	193.32982
it is simply that in taoist tradition -- as in all good mysticisms -- books , words , or any other manifestations that belong to the normal state of consciousness are considered only the surface of experience .	120.47732
the truth -- the eternal truth -- is not transmittable by words .	181.74373
reality is considered not only irrelevant to the acquisition of higher knowledge , but a positive handicap .	112.87463
the technique of reality confusion -- the use of paradox and riddles to shake the mind ' s grip on reality -- originated with fourth and third century b . c . chinese quietism the koan is not basically a new device .	89.03018
it is important for an understanding of zen to realize that the esoteric preoccupations of the select few cannot be the doctrine of the common man .	84.63059
in the supernatural atmosphere of cosmic government , only the ruling elite was ever concerned with a kingdom-wide ordering of nature popular religion aimed at more personal benefits from magical powers .	242.24316
and this is only natural -- witness the haste with which modern man gobbles the latest `` wonder drug ' ' .	134.95624
early chinese anchoritism was theoretically aimed at a mystic pantheist union with the divine , personal salvation being achieved when the mystical recluse united with divine essence .	228.65051
but this esoteric doctrine was lost in the shuffle to acquire special powers .	128.38254
the anchorite strove , in fact , to magically influence the world of spirits in the same way that the divine emperor manifested his power .	61.817974
thus , the mahayana metaphysic of mystical union for salvation was distilled down to a bare self-seeking , and for this reason , the mystic in asia did not long remain in isolated contemplation .	217.26117
as the zen literature reveals , as soon as an early zen master attained fame in seclusion , he was called out into the world to exercise his powers .	46.830746
the early anchorite masters attracted disciples because of their presumed ability to perform miracles .	39.639706
exponents of zen often insist that very early zen doctrine opposed the rampant supernaturalism of china , and proposed instead a more mature , less credulous view of the universe .	114.8228
in support of this , stories from the early literature are cited to show that zen attacks the idea of supernatural power .	128.3086
but actually these accounts reveal the supernatural powers that the masters were in fact supposed to possess , as well as the extreme degree of popular credulity `` hwang pah ( o baku ) , one day going up mount tien tai which was believed to have been inhabited by arhats with supernatural powers , met with a monk whose eyes emitted strange light .	108.66421
they went along the pass talking with each other for a short while until they came to a river roaring with torrent .	222.60297
there being no bridge , the master had to stop at the shore	121.26288
but his companion crossed the river walking on the water and beckoned to hwang pah to follow him .	92.60779
thereupon hwang pah said `` if i knew thou art an arhat , i would have doubled you up before thou got over there ' ' ! !	188.78732
the monk then understood the spiritual attainment of hwang pah , and praised him as a true mahayanist .	35.4112
a second tale shows still more clearly the kind of powers a truly spiritual monk could possess `` on one occasion yang shan ( kyo-zan ) saw a stranger monk flying through the air .	120.36752
when that monk came down and approached him with a respectful salutation , he asked `` where art thou from ' ' ? ?	74.74947
`` early this morning ' ' , replied the other , `` i set out from india ' ' .	59.600056
`` why ' ' , said the teacher , `` art thou so late ' ' ? ?	45.9871
`` i stopped ' ' , responded the man , `` several times to look at beautiful sceneries ' ' .	97.82876
`` thou mayst have supernatural powers ' ' , exclaimed yang shan , `` yet thou must give back the spirit of buddha to me ' ' .	81.06566
then the monk praised yang shan saying `` i have come over to china in order to worship manjucri , and met unexpectedly with minor shakya ' ' , and after giving the master some palm leaves he brought from india , went back through the air .	169.18138
in the popular chinese mind , ch ' an ( zen ) was no exception to the ideas of coarse magic that dominated .	94.12713
a closer look at modern zen reveals many magical carryovers that are still part of popular zen attitudes .	114.50055
to the zen monk the universe is still populated with `` spiritual beings ' ' who have to be appeased .	87.28709
part of the mealtime ritual in the zendo consists in offerings of rice to the spiritual beings ' ' .	124.55193
modern zen presentation to the west insists on the anti-authoritarian , highly pragmatic nature of the zen belief -- scriptures are burned to make fire , action is based on direct self-confidence , and so on .	171.52821
this picture of extreme self-reliant individuation is difficult to reconcile with such zendo formulas as `` o you , demons and other spiritual beings , i now offer this to you , and may this food fill up the ten quarters of the world and all the demons and other spiritual beings be fed therewith .	107.56756
pope leo 13 , on the 13th day of december 1898 , granted the following indulgences `` an indulgence of three hundred days is granted to all the faithful who read the holy gospels at least a quarter of an hour .	128.78764
a plenary indulgence under the usual conditions is granted once a month for the daily reading ' ' .	56.913006
pope pius the sixth , at rome , in april , 1778 , wrote the following `` the faithful should be excited to the reading of the holy scriptures for these are the most abundant sources which ought to be left open to everyone , to draw from them purity of morals and of doctrine , to eradicate errors which are so widely disseminated in these corrupt times ' ' .	98.29828
the american bishops assembled at the third plenary council of baltimore urged the catholic people to read the holy bible .	113.87955
`` we hope ' ' , they said , `` that no family can be found amongst us without a correct version of the holy scriptures ' ' .	71.79009
they recommended , also , that `` at a fixed hour , let the entire family be assembled for night prayers , followed by a short reading of the holy scriptures ' ' .	73.80669
since the catholic church expresses such desire that the sacred scriptures be read , the following taken from the holy bible ( new catholic edition ) will prove a means of grace and a source of great spiritual blessing .	104.20214
do not wonder that i said to thee , `` you must be born again ' ' .	19.21844
the new birth is necessary because god is holy .	26.50219
but as the one who called you is holy , be you also holy in all your behavior	455.96085
for it is written , you shall be holy , because i am holy .	66.298836
1 , st . peter 15 , 16 .	9.884001
holiness without which no man will see god .	11.951957
the new birth is necessary because all have sinned .	10.312282
as it is written , there is not one just man	795.27814
all have sinned and have need of the glory of god .	26.472553
the new birth is necessary because the natural man is spiritually dead and blind .	136.89311
therefore as through one man sin entered into the world and through sin death , and thus death has passed unto all men because all have sinned .	126.037476
you also , when you were dead by reason of your offenses and sins .	142.43172
and if our gospel also is veiled , it is veiled only to those who are perishing .	66.54246
in their case , the god of this world ( satan ) has blinded their unbelieving minds , that they should not see the light of the gospel of the glory of christ , who is the image of god .	67.458206
for his workmanship we are , created in christ jesus .	35.518353
the new birth is effected through the word of god	5.1689095
for you have been reborn , not from corruptible seed but from incorruptible , through the word of god .	88.13636
of his own will he has begotten us by the word of truth .	80.52018
amen , amen , i say to thee , unless a man be born again of water ( symbol of the word of god , see ephesians 26 ) and the spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of god .	64.29371
that which is born of the flesh is flesh	4.550064
and that which is born of the spirit is spirit .	21.059437
if we are born of god we have faith in christ as the only saviour .	35.839367
everyone who believes that jesus is the christ is born of god .	28.973515
as many as received him were born of god .	26.229214
if we are born of god we do not practice sin as a habit .	71.1336
whoever is born of god does not commit sin ( that is , he does not practice sin .	32.825947
cf . 1 st . john 2 1 ) .	13.963066
we know that no one who is born of god commits sin .	34.726234
( the new nature , received at the time of regeneration , is divine and holy , and as the believer lives under the power of this new nature he does not practice sin .	84.557625
) if we are born of god we practice righteousness .	71.58482
if you know that he ( god ) is just ( righteous ) , know that everyone also who does what is just ( righteous ) has been born of him .	89.97246
if we are born of god we love god .	81.02326
everyone who loves is born of god , and knows god .	147.52739
if we are born of god we love the brethren .	70.44476
we know that we have passed from death to life , because we love the brethren .	83.73281
he who does not love abides in death .	5.9400587
if we are born of god we overcome the world .	26.386303
all that is born of god overcomes the world	70.0738
and this is the victory that overcomes the world , our faith .	46.948895
if we are born of god we grow in ( not into , but in ) grace .	441.65622
but grow in grace and knowledge of our lord and savior , jesus christ .	18.899763
if we are born of god we persevere unto the end .	36.183167
i am convinced of this , that he who has begun a good work in you will bring it to perfection until the day of christ jesus .	156.8185
now to him who is able to preserve you without sin and to set you before the presence of his glory , without blemish , in gladness , to the only god our savior , through jesus christ our lord , belong glory and majesty , dominion and authority , before all time , and now , and forever .	135.40437
the new birth is necessary because the spiritual kingdom requires a spiritual nature .	128.53064
jesus answered and said to him ( nicodemus ) `` amen , amen , i say to thee , unless a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of god ' ' .	18.573336
`` amen , amen , i say to thee , unless a man be born again of water and the spirit , he cannot enter into the kingdom of god .	40.32831
that which is born of the flesh is flesh	3.0570252
and that which is born of the spirit is spirit .	22.966297
do not wonder that i said to thee , ' you must be born again ' ' ' .	41.621315
for in christ jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision but a new creation is of any account .	232.42671
if then any man is in christ , he is a new creature ( literally , `` he is a new creation ) , the former things have passed away	113.48101
for by grace you have been saved through faith	172.91656
and that not from yourselves , for it is the gift of god	50.518673
not as the outcome of works , lest anyone may boast .	183.2215
for his workmanship we are , created in christ jesus .	55.532467
the new birth is the implantation of a new life .	149.7523
he who has the son has the life .	38.38798
he who has not the son has not the life .	112.4029
he who believes in the son ( jesus christ , the son of god ) , has everlasting life .	26.061962
the new birth is the impartation of the divine nature .	37.48459
through which he has granted us the very great and precious promises , so that through them you may become partaker of the divine nature .	149.47978
the new birth is christ living in you by faith .	253.76843
christ in you , your hope of glory .	5.633995
it is now no longer i that live , but christ lives in me .	147.35098
and the life that i now live in the flesh , i live in the faith of the son of god , who loved me and gave himself up for me .	56.418888
to have christ dwelling through faith in your hearts .	13.477235
the wind blows where it will , and thou hearest its sound but dost not know where it comes from or where it goes .	209.29161
so is everyone who is born of the spirit .	33.22773
amen , amen , i say to you , he who hears my word , and believes him who sent me , has life everlasting , and does not come to judgment , but has passed from death to life .	139.04688
the new birth is a work of god .	28.729923
but to as many as received him he gave the power of becoming sons of god	192.43977
to those who believe in his name who were born not of blood , nor of the will of the flesh , nor of the will of man , but of god .	144.17316
you may be very religious , a good church member , an upright , honest and sincere person	120.413216

you cannot go to heaven unless you are born again .	33.37846
our blessed lord jesus christ , the sinless son of god , who could not lie , said , `` amen , amen , i say to thee , unless a man be born again , he cannot see the kingdom of god ' ' ( st . john 3 3 ) .	21.189356
`` you must be born again ' ' ( st . john 3 7 ) .	21.15894
being convinced that salvation is alone by accepting christ as saviour , and being convicted by the holy spirit of my lost condition , i do repent of all effort to be saved by any form of good works , and just now receive jesus as my personal saviour and salvation as a free gift from him .	106.38475
you may do as you please with god now .	148.13417

he was then in man ' s hands .	4.806405

this issue that you are reading marks my 15th anniversary .	23.569666
when i came into being , 15 years ago , i had one primary purpose to help men and women everywhere to know god better , and through knowing him better to become happier and more effective people .	126.17229

some of the people who speak through my pages are famous	727.2152

some are so filled with gratitude , for the gift of life and the love of god , that their joy spills out on the paper and brightens the lives of thousands whom they have never known , and will never see .	86.20938
fifteen years ago , there were no guideposts at all .	29.14107
this month a million guideposts will circulate all over the world .	13.410057
experts in the publishing field consider this astounding .	5.1875944
they do not understand how a small magazine with no advertising and no newsstand sale could have achieved such a following .	277.23315
to me , the explanation is very simple .	13.425537
i am not doing anything , of myself .	7.040956
it is the force in the universe that makes men love goodness , even when they turn away from it .	207.33578
it is the power that holds the stars in their orbits , but allows the wind to bend a blade of grass .	124.74152

sometimes such people sense that they are being used	53.90226
fifteen years ago , troubled by the rising tide of materialism in the post-war world , a businessman and a minister asked themselves if there might not be a place for a small magazine in which men and women , regardless of creed or color , could set forth boldly their religious convictions and bear witness to the power of faith to solve the endless problems of living .	95.8529
neither had any publishing experience , but they had faith in their idea .	149.86288
they borrowed a typewriter , raised about $2 , 000 in contributions , hired a secretary , persuaded a couple of young men to join them for almost no pay and began mailing out a collection of unstapled leaflets that they called guideposts .	153.99823
compared to the big , established magazines , my first efforts seemed feeble indeed .	1012.90814
but from the start they had two important ingredients sincerity and realism .	44.134686
the people who told the stories were sincere .	4.6414976
for example , early in my life , when one of my editorial workers wanted to find out how churches and philanthropic organizations met the needs of new york ' s down-and-outers , he didn ' t just ask questions .	87.28959
len lesourd went and lived in the slums as a sidewalk derelict for ten days .	72.28528

the help and sympathy that were forthcoming from everywhere .	97.846535
the crisis later on when debts seemed about to overwhelm me .	120.49553
that was when a remarkable woman , teresa durlach , came to my aid -- not so much with money , as with wisdom and courage .	104.60036

havana was filled with an excitement which you could see in the brightness of men ' s eyes and hear in the pitch of their voices .	75.94544
rumors flew from lip to lip that fidel castro was on his way to havana , coming from the mountains where he had fought batista for five years .	49.671547
already the city was filled with barbudos , the bearded , war-dirty revolutionaries , carrying carbines , waving to the crowds that lined the prado .	133.36342
and then castro himself did come , bearded , smiling	39.642864
yet if you looked closely you ' d see that his eyes did not pick up the smile on his lips .	83.90499
at first i was happy to throw the support of our newspaper behind this man .	291.36972
i am sure that castro was happy , too , about that support .	287.90802
diario de la marina was the oldest and most influential paper in cuba , with a reputation for speaking out against tyranny .	172.79071
my grandfather had been stoned because of his editorials .	112.40087
my own earliest memories are of exiles my three brothers and i were taken often to the united states `` to visit relatives ' ' while my father stayed on to fight the dictator machado .	101.075096
when it was my turn , i , too , printed the truth as i knew it about batista , and rejoiced to see his regime topple .	138.96118
none of us was aware that the biggest fight was still ahead .	82.59991
i was full of hope as fidel castro came into havana .	16.040125
within a week , however , i began to suspect that something was wrong .	84.61938
for castro was bringing cuba not freedom , but hatred .	267.85147
he spent long hours before the tv spitting out promises of revenge .	191.86024
he showed us how he dealt with his enemies he executed them before tv cameras .	164.00305
on home sets children were watching the death throes of men who were shot before the paredon , the firing wall .	68.66788
he seemed bent on coupling them with vengeance .	2.445563
new schools were rising , but with this went a harsh proclamation any academic degree earned during batista ' s regime was invalid .	134.52962
he had promised cheaper housing arbitrarily he cut all rents in half , whether the landlord was a millionaire speculator or a widow whose only income was the rental of a spare room .	122.81486
under another law , hundreds of farms were seized .	41.36475
farm workers had their wages cut almost in half .	36.19191
of this , only 50 cents a day was paid in cash , the rest in script usable only in `` people ' s stores ' ' .	54.45882
a suspicion was growing that fidel castro was a communist .	54.812336
in my mind , i began to review his use of hate to gain support	202.85384
his division of society into two classes , one the hero , the other the villain .	236.57565
but most disturbing of all were the advisers he called to sit with him in the palace	70.03872
what should i do about it , i asked myself ? ?	68.44039
i had watched castro handling his enemies before the paredon .	4.7240243
there was no doubt in my mind that if i crossed him , mobs would appear outside our windows shouting `` paredon ! !	126.64788

i knew in that moment that i did not have any choice .	21.763552
from that day on i began to write editorials about the things i did not think correct in fidel castro ' s regime .	76.418846
too often a beginning bodybuilder has to do his training secretly either because his parents don ' t want sonny-boy to `` lift all those old barbell things ' ' because `` you ' ll stunt your growth ' ' or because childish taunts from his schoolmates , like `` hey lookit mr . america	171.94815
whaddya gonna do with all those muscles ( of which he has none at the time ) ' ' ? ?	35.26273
after all , a guy ' s gotta have a little ego ! !	72.75009
therefore it ' s a genuine pleasure to tell you about an entirely happy bodybuilder who has never had to train in secret has never heard one unkind word from his parents and never has been taunted by his schoolmates ! !	123.100975
this happy , always smiling lad with the sunny disposition is our new junior mr . canada -- henri de courcy .	156.82417
far from discouraging henri , his parents urge him on to greater and greater accomplishments .	347.23685
instead of admonishing him to let the weights alone they personally took him to that master montreal bodybuilding authority , professor roland claude .	316.48914
and they couldn ' t have entrusted henri to better hands because `` le professeur ' ' knows his muscles from the sterno-cleido mastoideus of the neck right down to the tibialis anticus of the leg and better still , he knows just what exercises work best for them and what weider principles to combine them with for fast , fast muscle growth .	281.3109
that ' s because the good professor teaches only weider methods at his famous montreal health studio which is located at 1821 mt . royal east in montreal .	268.82776
undoubtedly you have read the case histories of some of his prize-winning pupils ( every pupil has a physique title of some kind or other ) .	254.25633
there ' s gaetan d ' amours who is our newest mr . canada	411.54327
jean-paul senesac , whose story appeared here two issues ago	876.01855
jack boissoneault , who was with us last month	291.11932
charles harve , who recently won the `` most muscular man ' ' subdivision award in the mr . canada event	222.10571
yesiree , the professor knows his muscles ! !	1.121714
now when henri was just 12 he was only 4 ' 10 ' ' ' ' tall and weighed an astounding 72 pounds , and his greatest desire was to pack on some weight .	128.56712
about that time he began reading mr . america and muscle builder and he learned of the famous weider way to fast weight gaining .	234.64687
seeing so many illustrations and reading so many testimonials to the value of quick-wate and super-protein , those two wonder-working weider food supplements , he decided to try them and see what they could do for him .	104.26183
well , sir they did real great ! !	1.155669
for in almost less time than it takes to tell it , henri ' s bodyweight was increasing rapidly .	96.05476
he ' s crazy about water skiing and swimming and this vigorous exercise in conjunction with the added food supplements packed pounds of solid muscle on his skinny frame .	208.84758
henri has always had shapely legs from swimming and water skiing and really doesn ' t have to work them very much .	41.826538
but he was totally dissatisfied with his upper body .	25.601318
it was muscular but it wasn ' t symmetrical .	108.4239
`` a real ' nothing ' torso ' ' , says henri .	16.208252
it just got longer and longer ' ' .	1.5252566
that ' s when he went to professor claude .	168.75333
and at once claude saw what the trouble was and he knew just how to correct it .	63.91857
in his gym the professor has some of the most `` knocked out ' ' equipment since vic tanny .	76.82348
mr . claude is a specialist in torso development and he has long favored the now-famous weider push-pull super-set technique in which one exercise of the super-set is a pressing or `` pushing ' ' movement which accents one sector of a muscle group in a specific way , followed by a `` pulling ' ' exercise which works the opposing sector of the same muscle group .	82.57991
so right away claude introduced henri to his famous `` moon ' ' bench and proceeded to teach him his first push-pull super-set consisting of the wide-grip straight-arm pullover ( the `` pull ' ' part of the push-pull super-set ) which dramatically widens the ribcage and strongly affects the muscles of the upper back and chest and the collar-to-collar bench press which specifically works on the chest to build those wide , reeves-type `` gladiator ' ' pecs , while stimulating the upper lats and frontal deltoids .	100.31152
as you can see , in this push-pull super set the entire chest-back-shoulder area is vigorously exercised in alternate sectors by alternate exercises so the complete torso remains pumped-up all the time ! !	339.48904
now when henri has completed four complete push-pull super-sets no . 1 , the professor allows him about a five-minute rest period before starting him on four complete push-pull super-sets no . 2 .	130.48587
super-set no . 2 is made up of similar exercises , but this time done with dumbbells , and using both `` moon ' ' and flat benches .	116.52593
the `` push ' ' exercise of this push-pull super-set is the bench press done with elbows well pulled back and with a greater downward stretch of the pectorals not possible with the barbell variation .	193.03679
you need the barbell variation to build width and mass in the pecs .	76.31452
the dumbbell variation develops a most classically sculptured outline to the aj .	15.817222
the `` pull ' ' exercise in this super-set is the one-dumbbell bent-arm pullover .	813.7538
( note how strongly the upper lats and serratus are worked in this fine exercise because of the pin-point concentration of force which the dumbbell variation affords ) .	163.36038
in the third push-pull super-set the `` push ' ' exercise is the widegrip pushup between bars , while the `` pull ' ' exercise is the moon bench lateral raise with bent arms .	184.87013
the pushup done in this manner is the greatest pectoral-ribcage stretcher ever invented ! !	168.1217
this is true only if a very wide grip is used and only when the greatest possible stretch is achieved .	99.59984
you ' ll know when you ' ve made the greatest stretch because your shoulder blades will touch ! !	144.77711
as you see , the professor has designed a piece of apparatus that forces the bodybuilder to use a w-i-d-e grip .	143.73575
he just can ' t do anything about it at all ! !	41.72379
but as you can also see , it ' s not a painful exercise at all , because henri de courcy -- the `` happy ' ' bodybuilder -- looks as though he were having the time of his life ! !	62.56417
the last exercise of roland claude ' s prescribed program for henri is a single exercise , done in individual sets with a bit longer pause between sets .	259.44965
by this time henri ' s entire chest-back-lat-shoulder area is pumped-up to almost bursting point , and claude takes time to do a bit more pectoral-front deltoid shaping work .	353.01376
he has henri do from four to six sets of the incline bench press ( note the high incline ) .	77.472435
this gives a wide flare to the pecs , causing them to flow dramatically upward into deltoids and dramatically downward into the serratus and aj .	138.2543
this is the kind of chest that invariably wins contests	11.954379
that steel-edged `` carved-out-of-solid rock ' ' looks of the great champions .	59.0291
so with four complete push-pull super-sets no . 1 , four of no . 2 , four of no . 3 and four to six sets of the incline bench press , you can see that henri de courcy has had a terrific mass-building , muscle-shaping , torso-defining workout that cannot be improved upon .	89.08637
physique contests are rarely won on muscle size alone .	101.29439
rarer still is a mr . america or mr . universe of true herculean build .	171.50433
the aspects of physical development that catch the judges ' eyes and which rightfully influence their decisions are symmetry and that hallmark of the true champion -- superior definition of the muscles .	171.8506
now good definition is one thing that all of us can acquire with occasional high-set , high-rep , light-weight workouts .	148.25487
but contest definition -- that dramatic muscular separation of every muscle group that seems as though it must have been carved by a sculptor ' s chisel -- is something quite different .	140.43947
this comes not alone from high-set , high-rep training , but from certain definition-specialization exercises which the champion selects for himself with the knowledge of exactly what works best for him .	95.29622
often these exercises work well for some bodybuilders but less spectacularly for others .	143.31274
because they are `` minority ' ' exercises and have but a limited appeal they soon find themselves in the limbo of the forgotten .	146.29927
only when the newest mr . america or mr . universe discovers them and puts them into practice are we reacquainted with them and once again see how effective they really are .	303.37558
the exercise i shall discuss in this -- the first of a new series of articles on muscle definition-specialization of a particular body part -- is the one leg lunge .	68.28649
why it was ever forgotten for even a moment i cannot say because it works perfectly for everyone , no matter whether he has short or long thigh-bone lengths ! !	382.95187
it is the one exercise that drastically influences the definition of the thighs at the hipline -- that mark of the champion that sets him apart from all other bodybuilders	105.418076
a criterion of muscle `` drama ' ' that is unforgettable to judges and audiences alike	76.910385
the facet of muscular development that wins prizes .	32.44272
definition of the thighs at the uppermost part is quite commonly seen in most championship olympic lifters which is easily understandable .	131.29575
the one leg lunge is a split and all lifters practice this in their regular workouts .	428.28778
but for purely definition purposes -- used in conjunction with your regular squatting , leg curling , leg extensor programs -- a heavy weight is not needed .	174.6303
indeed , a lighter weight works much better because a greater , more extensive split can be performed .	250.704
used in several sets of high reps once or twice each week it will not be long before your entire upper leg takes on a razor-sharp definition in which the muscles look like wire cables writhing and twisting under the skin ! !	161.48212
really there is no reason why this fine exercise should not find its way into your leg program at all times , for the following suggestions show why it is so effective 1 .	231.69838
it ' s a complete thigh contraction-extension exercise .	4.6811156
it places terrific tension on the leg muscles from start to finish of each repetition .	150.1931
it improves over-all balance and control for the bodybuilder , and helps to make squats more easily and more correctly performed .	128.69156
it speeds muscle growth and power development even for the advanced bodybuilder because each hip and leg is exercised separately , thus enabling a massive , concentrated effort to be focused on each .	191.25868
you ' ll need your weider power stands for this fine exercise and here ' s the way it ' s done 1 .	107.08128
place your power stands in position and adjust their height so that this will correspond to the height of your shoulders when you are in a deep leg split as for a heavy clean .	116.91799
grasp the bar ( which will rest against the back of your neck )	78.60585
extend your feet forward and backward until you are in a deep leg split .	55.849564
now raise the weight by straightening your front leg , without moving your feet .	179.61719
when the front knee is straight and locked , allow it to bend again until you feel the bar come lightly into contact with the sides of the power stands .	253.36461
after you have taken a breather , reverse the position of your legs so that the front thigh of the previous exercise is now to the rear , and the rear thigh now to the front , and perform the same movement in the same manner .	76.08851
that ' s the one-leg lunge in a nutshell .	193.91774
you should have a couple of training partners to stand by when you make your first experiments just for safety .	394.35913
you should also begin this exercise with a very light barbell until you become accustomed to it balance-wise .	520.8329
oh , you ' ll wobble and weave quite a bit at first .	68.68893
before your first training experiment has ended there will be a big improvement and almost before you know it you ' ll be raising and lowering yourself just like a veteran ! !	91.03103
although i suggested that you hold the bar at the back of the neck there ' s no reason why you shouldn ' t make some experiments with the bar held in front of the neck .	44.830482
squat-style lifters and leg-split lifters would both benefit enormously by practicing those variations providing that they remember to make alternate sets with the left and right leg to the front .	211.16547
the most beautiful bed of pansies i ' ve seen was in a south dakota yard on a sizzling day .	57.077652
pansies are supposed to like it cool , but those great velvety flowers were healthy and perky in the glaring sun .	289.99597
i sought out the gardener and asked him what he did to produce such beauties in that weather .	168.55074
`` i just love them ' ' , he said .	9.210857
the more i talked with him , the more convinced i became that that was the secret of their riotous blooming .	120.411674
of course his love was expressed in intelligent care .	113.83921
he planted the pansy seeds himself , buying them from a pansy specialist .	29.989904
these specialists , i learned , have done a great deal of work to improve the size and health of the plants and the resulting flowers .	90.38427
their seeds produce vigorous blooming plants half again the size of the unimproved strains .	36.763134
i asked him if he took seeds from his own plants .	132.8044
occasionally , when he had an unusual flower that he wanted more of he did	130.46864
but pansy seeds , he told me , soon `` run down ' ' .	48.9464
it ' s best to buy them fresh from a dealer who is working to improve them .	49.687843
his soil was `` nothing special ' ' , just prairie land , but he had harrowed in compost until it was loose , spongy and brown-black .	52.000755
i fingered it and had the feeling of adequacy that comes with the right texture , tilth and body .	235.58334
it isn ' t easy to describe it , but every gardener knows it when his fingers touch such soil .	96.517296
nothing is easier to grow from seed than pansies .	57.46763
they germinate quickly , the tiny plants appearing in a week , and grow along lustily .	85.9446
it doesn ' t really matter which month of the year you sow them , but they germinate best when they have a wide variation of temperature , very warm followed by cool in the same 24 hours .	205.47209
i like to make a seedbed right in the open , though many people start them successfully in cold frames .	163.66173
they ' d rather have things rugged , with only moderate protection on the coldest days .	331.57608
if you do use a cold frame be sure that its ventilation is adequate .	57.892868
for my seedbed i use good garden soil with a little sand added to encourage rooting .	38.11947
i dig it , rake it smooth , sow the seeds and wet them down with a fog spray .	237.15099
then i cover the sowing with a board .	14.703756
this keeps it cool and moist and protects it from birds .	108.22214
ants carry away the seeds so better be sure that there are no ant hills nearby .	38.8804
when the first sprinkling of green appears i remove the board .	176.23297
a light , porous mulch applied now keeps the roots cool and the soil soft during these early days of growth .	259.3026
i like sawdust for this , or hay .	6.79244
when they have 4 to 6 leaves and are thrifty little plants , it ' s time to set them out where they are to remain .	109.210464
every time you transplant a pansy you cause its flowers to become smaller .	129.19118
the moral is don ' t transplant it any oftener than you must .	399.27304
as soon as they are large enough to move , i put mine 9 inches apart where they are to bloom .	282.69153
i put a little scoop of pulverized phosphate rock or steamed bone meal into each hole with the plant .	220.27336
that encourages rooting , and the better developed the roots , the larger and more plentiful the flowers .	109.04047
i doubt if it is possible to overfeed them .	45.94442
lacking that , decayed manure spread over the bed is fine .	124.07285
one year i simply set the plants in the remains of a compost pile , to which a little sand had been added , and i had the most beautiful pansies in my , or any of my neighbors ' experience .	67.31821
in addition to the rich soil they benefit by feedings of manure water every other week , diluted to the color of weak tea .	147.8132
as a substitute for this , organic fertilizer dissolved in water to half the strength in the directions , may be used .	79.158775
three inches of porous material will do a good job of keeping weeds down and the soil moist and cool .	46.46962
when winter comes be ready with additional mulch .	7.1726117
i like hay for this and apply it so that only the tops of the plants show right after a good frost .	198.60036
that keeps in the cold , retains moisture and prevents the heaving of alternate freezing and thawing .	51.25914
don ' t miss the pansies that appear from time to time through the winter .	73.52311
whenever there is a thaw or a few sunny days , you ' ll be likely to find a brave little blossom or two .	50.605816
if those aren ' t enough for you , why not grow some just for winter blooming ? ?	233.68504
the pansies i cherished most bloomed for me in february during a particularly cold winter .	258.68033
i started the seed in a flat in june and set out the little pansies in a cold frame .	191.35399
( an unheated greenhouse would have been better , if i had had one .	101.91885
) the plants took zero nights in their stride , with nothing but a mat of straw over the glass to protect them .	117.47212
in response to the lengthening days of february they budded , then bloomed their 4-inch velvety flowers .	164.33809
its mass of bright bloom set in a border of snow made my spirits rise every time i looked at it .	406.4299
like strawberries in december , pansies are far more exciting in february than in may .	228.2775
try that late winter pickup when you are so tired of cold and snow that you feel you just can ' t take another day of it .	105.138466
the day will come , in midsummer , when you find your plants becoming `` leggy ' ' , running to tall-growing foliage at the expense of blossoms .	94.32959
try pegging down each separate branch to the earth , using a bobby pin to hold it there .	103.69558
pick the flowers , keep the soil dampened , and each of the pegged-down branches will take root and become a little plant and go on blooming for the rest of the season .	93.718636
as soon as an experimental tug assures you that roots have taken over , cut it off from the mother plant .	157.00232
a second and also good practice is to shear off the tops , leaving an inch high stub with just a leaf or two on each branch .	207.32797
these cut-down plants will bud and blossom in record time and will behave just as they did in early spring .	272.13895
i like to shear half my plants at a time , leaving one half of them to blossom while the second half is getting started on its new round of blooming .	102.22768
probably no one needs to tell you that the way to stop all bloom is to let the blossoms go to seed .	157.49434
nature ' s aim , different from ours , is to provide for the coming generation .	71.95696
that done , her work is accomplished and she ignores the plant .	287.48605
here is a word of advice when you go shopping for your pansy seeds .	69.48218
go to a reputable grower , preferably a pansy specialist .	19.103308
it is no harder to raise big , healthy , blooming plants than weak , sickly little things	343.08472
but you will never get better flowers than the seed you grow .	105.986725
many people think that pansies last only a few weeks , then their period of growth and bloom is over .	63.26056
if the plants are cared for and protected over the winter , the second year is more prolific than the first .	54.19596
would you like to grow exhibition pansies ? ?	1.0312792
remove about half the branches from each plant , leaving only the strongest with the largest buds .	98.59622
they stick to their principles , insist upon their due , but grow and bloom with dependable regularity if given it .	171.20242
treat them right and they ' ll make a showing every month in the year except the frigid ones .	189.83826
give them food , some shade , mulch , water and more food , and they ' ll repay your solicitude with beauty .	61.991367
a salad with greens and tomato is a popular and wonderfully healthful addition to a meal , but add an avocado and you have something really special .	111.550354
this delightful tropical fruit has become well-known in the past thirty years because modern transportation methods have made it possible to ship avocados anywhere in the united states .	67.38022
it has a great many assets to recommend it and if you haven ' t made avocado a part of your diet yet , you really should .	122.292366
you will find that avocado is unlike any other fruit you have ever tasted .	149.74887
it is roughly shaped like a large pear , and when properly ripened , its dark green skin covers a meaty , melon-like pulp that has about the consistency of a ripe bartlett pear , but oily .	118.40736
the avocado should have a `` give ' ' to it , as you hold it , when it is ripe .	79.11301
the flavor is neither sweet , like a pear , nor tart like an orange	416.63394
it is subtle and rather bland , nut-like .	10.108777
it is a flavor that might take a little getting used to -- not because it is unpleasant , but because the flavor is hard to define in the light of our experience with other fruits .	76.93914
sometimes it takes several `` eatings ' ' of avocado to catch that delightful quality in taste that has made it such a favorite throughout the world .	252.40222
once you become an avocado fan , you will look forward to the season each year with eager anticipation .	371.58426
today , refrigerated carriers have made the shipping of avocados possible to any place in the world .	58.24944
the fruit is allowed to mature on the tree , but it is still firm at this point .	29.780472
it is brought to packing houses , cleaned and graded as to size and quality , and packed in protective excelsior .	71.32628
the fruit is then cooled to 42-degrees-f . , a temperature at which it lapses into a sort of dormant state .	111.67388
this cooling does not change the avocado in any way , it just delays the natural softening of the fruit until a grovelike temperature ( room temperature ) is restored .	143.66093
this happens on the grocer ' s shelf or in your kitchen .	81.68643
one of the most attractive things about avocados is that they do not require processing of any kind .	107.734856
there is no dyeing or waxing or gassing needed .	199.53915
if the temperature is controlled properly , the avocado will delay its ripening until needed .	550.55237
and unlike other fruits , one cannot eat the skin of the avocado .	16.009108
it is thick , much like an egg plant ' s skin , so that poison sprays , if they are used , present no hazard to the consumer .	76.870926
good taste and versatility , plus safety from spray poisons would be enough to recommend the frequent use of such a fruit , even if its nutritional values were limited .	119.15357
avocados , however , are very rich in nutrients .	91.144
their main asset is an abundance of unsaturated fatty acids , so necessary for maintaining the good health of the circulatory system .	45.96115
aside from this , the average portion contains some protein , an appreciable amount of vitamins a and c -- about one-tenth of the minimum daily requirement , and about a third of the official vitamin e requirement .	156.01892
the b vitamins are well represented , especially thiamin and riboflavin .	17.053516
calcium , phosphorus and iron are present in worthwhile amounts , and eleven other minerals also have been found in varying trace amounts .	94.070595
none of these values is destroyed , not significantly altered by refrigeration storage .	109.81831
dr . wilson c . grant , of the veterans ' administration hospital , coral gables , florida , and the university of miami school of medicine , set out to discover if avocados , because of their high content of unsaturated fatty acids , would reduce the cholesterol of the blood in selected patients .	71.40693
the study comprised 16 male patients , ranging in age from 27 to 72 .	179.66104
they were put on control diets to determine as accurately as possible , the normal cholesterol level of their blood .	61.088505
then they were given 1/2 to 1-1/2 avocados per day as a substitute for part of their dietary fat consumption .	48.677616
five , four , three , two , one , fire ! !	91.438446
the tremendous energy released by giant rocket engines perhaps can be felt much better than it can be heard .	109.96183
the pulsating vibration of energy clutches at the pit of your stomach .	164.43318
never before has the introduction of a weapon caused so much apprehension and fear .	209.29399
nuclear weapons are fearsome , but the long-range ballistic missile gives them a stealth and merciless swiftness which is much more terrifying .	95.78742
a great many writers are bewitched by the apparently overwhelming advantage an attacker would have if he were to strike with complete surprise using nuclear rockets .	420.78015
it is relatively easy to go a step further and reason that an attacker , in possession of such absolute power , would simultaneously destroy his opponent ' s cities and people .	85.4539
with a nation defenseless before it , why would the attacker spare the victim ' s people ? ?	106.733826
wouldn ' t the wanton destruction of cities and people be the logical act of complete subjugation ? ?	124.84859
the will of its people , so crucial in time of peril , would be broken .	133.81403
nuclear weapons have given the world the means for self-destruction in hours or days	491.79803
and now rockets have given it the means to destroy itself in minutes .	252.36746
at this point it should be painfully obvious that cities , being `` soft ' ' , and the people within them are ideally suited to destruction by nuclear weapons .	75.759315
however , because this vulnerability is mutual , it is to the advantage of neither side to destroy the opponent ' s cities , at least so long as the opponent has nuclear weapons with which to effect reprisal .	87.97282
it should be appallingly apparent that city-trading is not a profitable military tactic .	89.274666
icbms have given us a capability which could be used in two different ways .	26.56834
they could be used to attack a nation ' s people ( which would inevitably mean the loss of the attacker ' s own people ) , or they could be used with discrimination to destroy the enemy ' s military force .	59.817093
if our national interest lies in being able to fight and win a war rather than committing national suicide , then we must take a much more penetrating look at ballistic missiles .	58.927326
we must determine whether missiles can win a war all by themselves .	227.91238
we must make certain that the aircraft is finished before we give the entire job to the missile .	103.66023
missiles are very valuable weapons , but they also have their too little known limitations .	421.1792
because of a missile ' s ballistic trajectory , the location of a fixed target must be known quite accurately .	100.804214
placing missiles in submarines , on barges , railroads , highways , surface vessels and in the air provides them with passive protection by taking advantage of the gravest weakness of long-range ballistic missiles today -- the extreme difficulty of destroying a mobile or moving target with such weapons .	145.9271
one must first detect a fleeting mobile or moving target , decide that it is worthy of destruction , select the missile to be fired against the target , compute ballistics for the flight , and prepare the missile for firing .	99.76682
even if all these operations could be performed instantaneously , the icbm still has a time of flight to the target of about 30 minutes .	82.7292
therefore , if the target can significantly change its location in something less than 30 minutes , the probability of having destroyed it is drastically lowered .	111.523766
because of this , it would appear inevitable that an increasing percentage of strategic missiles will seek self-protection in mobility -- at least until missile defenses are perfected which have an exceedingly high kill probability .	118.132195
in order to destroy the enemy ' s mobile , moving , or imprecisely located strategic forces , we must have a hunter-killer capability in addition to our missiles .	58.900074
until this hunter-killer operation can be performed by spacecraft , manned aircraft appear to be the only means available to us .	80.58767
it seems reasonable that if general nuclear war is not to be one cataclysmic act of burning each other ' s citizens to cinders , we must have a manned strategic force of long-endurance aircraft capable of going into china or russia to find and destroy their strategic forces which continued to threaten us .	97.91048
let us suppose the russians decide to build a rail-mobile icbm force .	179.17389
it is entirely feasible to employ aircraft such as the b-52 or b-70 in hunter-killer operations against soviet railway-based missiles .	90.659134
if we stop thinking in terms of tremendous multimegaton nuclear weapons and consider employing much smaller nuclear weapons which may be more appropriate for most important military targets , it would seem that the b-52 or b-70 could carry a great many small nuclear weapons .	61.58099
an aircraft with a load of small nuclear weapons could very conceivably be given a mission to suppress all trains operating within a specified geographic area of russia -- provided that we had used some of our icbms to degrade russia ' s air defenses before our bombers got there .	165.5921
the aircraft could be used to destroy other mobile , fleeting , and imprecisely located targets as well as the known , fixed and hardened targets which can also be destroyed by missile .	93.26761
why , then , aren ' t we planning a larger , more important role for manned military aircraft ? ?	142.5887
is there any other way to do the job ? ?	14.871574
survivability of our strategic forces ( polaris , mobile and hardened minuteman , hardened atlas and titan , and airborne skybolt ) means that it will take some time , perhaps weeks , to destroy a strategic force .	78.27987
war , under these circumstances , cannot be one massive exchange of nuclear devastation .	46.928356
forces will survive a surprise attack , and these forces will give depth , or considerable duration , to the conflict .	125.17734
the forces which survive the initial attack must be found and destroyed .	29.317945
even mobile forces must be found and destroyed .	16.148666
but , how does one go about the job of finding and destroying mobile forces ? ?	32.322952
they are not susceptible to wholesale destruction by ballistic missile .	12.219825
some day , many years in the future , true spacecraft will be able to find and destroy mobile targets .	78.388054
but until we have an effective spacecraft , the answer to the hunter-killer problem is manned aircraft .	108.71531
however , the aircraft which we have today are tied to large , `` soft ' ' airfields .	186.05269
here then is our problem aircraft are vital to winning a war today because they can perform those missions which a missile is totally incapable of performing	227.70033
but the airfield , on which the aircraft is completely dependent , is doomed by the missile .	90.87568
this makes today ' s aircraft a one-shot , or one mission , weapon .	182.4
aircraft are mighty expensive if you can use them only once .	260.37546
this is the point on which so many people have written off the aircraft in favor of the missile .	65.413765
but remember this -- it isn ' t the aircraft which is vulnerable to nuclear rockets , it is the airfield .	141.04796
eliminate the vulnerability of aircraft on the ground and you have essentially eliminated its vulnerability to long-range ballistic missiles .	78.24409
there are four rather obvious ways to reduce or eliminate the vulnerability of aircraft on the ground	32.127575
put aircraft in `` bomb-proof ' ' hangars when they are on the ground .	55.01498
build long-range aircraft which can take off from small ( 3 , 000-foot ) airfields with runways .	124.63052
if we could use all the small airfields we have in this country , we could disperse our strategic aircraft by a factor of 10 or more .	73.559586
use nuclear propulsions to keep our long-range military aircraft in the air for the majority of their useful life .	79.47989
using very high thrust-to-weight ratio engines , develop a vertical-takeoff-and-landing ( vtol ) long-range military aircraft .	107.21889
we have the technology today with which to build aircraft shelters which could withstand at least 200 aj .	103.32648
we could put a portion of our strategic bombers in such shelters .	22.535091
large , long-range bombers can be developed which would have the capability to take off from 3 , 000-foot runways , but they would require more powerful engines than we have today .	71.398926
there is little enthusiasm for spending money to develop more powerful engines because of the erroneous belief that the aircraft has been made obsolete by the missile .	95.012955
this same preoccupation with missiles at the expense of aircraft has resulted in our half-hearted effort to develop nuclear propulsion for aircraft .	125.21787
one seldom hears the analogy `` nuclear propulsion will do for the aircraft what it has already done for the submarine ' ' .	61.36048
if , for some reason such as economy , we are not going to develop aircraft nuclear propulsion with a sense of national urgency , then we should turn our effort to developing jet engines with a thrust-to-weight ratio of 12 or 15 to one .	76.54682
with powerplants such as these , vertical takeoff and landing combat aircraft could be built .	27.477438
for example , a 12-to-one engine would power a supersonic vtol fighter .	10.369023
with a 15-to-one engine , a supersonic aircraft weighing 300 , 000 pounds could rise vertically .	92.02668
the reason that we are not going ahead full speed to develop high thrust-to-weight engines is that it would cost perhaps a billion dollars -- and you don ' t spend that sort of money if aircraft are obsolete .	100.54345
when aircraft are no longer helpless on airfields , they are no longer vulnerable to aj .	52.765686
if our sac bombers were , today , capable of surviving a surprise missile attack and because of infinite dispersion or long endurance had the capability to strike at russia again , and again , and again , those bombers would unquestionably assure our military dominance .	236.9246
we would have the means to seek out and destroy the enemy ' s force -- whether it were fixed or mobile .	119.896194
with such a force of manned bombers we could bring enormous pressure to bear on an enemy , and this pressure would be selective and extremely discriminating .	66.35969
no need to kill an entire city and all its people because we lacked the precision and reconnaissance to selectively disarm the enemy ' s military force .	101.978455
our first necessity , at the very outset of war , is post-attack reconnaissance .	101.74279
in a few years we will have samos ( semiautomatic missile observation system ) .	60.038635
but in the case of moving targets , and targets which have limited mobility , what will their location be when it is time to destroy them ? ?	129.6586
what targets have we successfully knocked out ? ?	1.0717863
a ballistic missile cannot , today , tell you if it was successful or unsuccessful .	84.56803
what targets still remain to be hit ? ?	1.0814453
these crucial questions must be answered by post-attack reconnaissance .	68.42476
samos will be hard put to see through clouds -- and to see in the dark .	74.47534
even if this is some day possible , there remains the 30-minute time of flight of a missile to its overseas target .	159.20154
if the target can change its position significantly during the 30 minutes the missile is in the air on its way , the probability of the missile destroying the target is drastically reduced .	91.184906
pre-attack reconnaissance is vital but only post-attack reconnaissance will allow us to terminate the war favorably .	91.493744
it would be priceless to have an aircraft to gather that post-attack reconnaissance .	55.709263
it could operate under the clouds and perform infrared photography through clouds and at night .	26.433697
it would be even more valuable because that same aircraft could immediately destroy any targets it discovered -- no need to wait for a missile to come all the way from the united states with the chance that the target , if it were mobile , would be gone .	121.6592
a large aircraft , such as the b-52 or b-70 , could carry perhaps 50 or 100 small nuclear weapons .	183.9023
few people realize that one kiloton of nuclear explosive power will create 1 , 000 psi overpressure at 100 feet .	111.07812
or put another way , the hardest missile site planned today could be destroyed by placing a one-kiloton warhead ( 1/20th the size of those used in hiroshima and nagasaki ) within 100 to 200 feet of the target ! !	134.41138
it is our lack of extreme accuracy which forces the use of very large yield nuclear weapons .	184.24373
today we have side-looking radar which has such high resolution that the radar picture clearly shows individual buildings , runways , taxi-ways , separate spans of bridges , etc . .	125.331436
with these keen `` eyes ' ' and small nuclear weapons delivered with accuracy , military forces can be directly attacked with minimum damage to urban areas .	219.99467
if we fail to develop the means to hunt down and destroy the enemy ' s military force with extreme care and precision , and if war comes in spite of our most ardent desires for peace , our choice of alternatives will be truly frightening .	94.73916
the lyric beauties of schubert ' s trout quintet -- its elemental rhythms and infectious melodies -- make it a source of pure pleasure for almost all music listeners .	130.93275
but for students of musical forms and would-be classifiers , the work presents its problems .	90.725655
since it requires only five players , it would seem to fall into the category of chamber music -- yet it calls for a double bass , an instrument generally regarded as symphonic .	132.50545
moreover , the piece is written in five movements , rather than the conventional four of most quintets , and this gives the opus a serenade or divertimento flavor .	115.16392
the many and frequent performances of the trout serve to emphasize the dual nature of its writing .	108.71863
some renditions are of symphonic dimensions , with the contrabass given free rein .	266.671
other interpretations present the music as an essentially intimate creation .	71.61691
in these readings , the double bass is either kept discreetly in the background , or it is dressed in clown ' s attire -- the musical equivalent of a bull in a china shop .	131.44464
recently i was struck anew by the divergent approaches , when in the course of one afternoon and evening i listened to no fewer than ten different performances .	99.316284
the occasion for this marathon angel ' s long-awaited reissue in its `` great recordings of the century ' ' series of the schnabel-pro arte version .	108.65421
let me say at the outset that the music sounded as sparkling on the last playing as it did on the first .	106.33186
whether considered alone or in relation to other editions , colh 40 is a document of prime importance .	141.47017
artur schnabel was one of the greatest schubert-beethoven-mozart players of all time , and any commentary of his on this repertory is valuable .	223.51387
but schnabel was a great teacher in addition to being a great performer , and the fact that four of the ten versions i listened to are by schnabel pupils ( clifford curzon , frank glazer , adrian aeschbacher , and victor babin ) also sheds light on the master ' s pedagogical skills .	120.01529
certain pianistic traits are common to all five schnabelian renditions , most notably the `` schnabel trill ' ' ( which differs from the conventional trill in that the two notes are struck simultaneously ) .	85.008545
but the most impressive testimony to schnabel ' s distinction as a teacher is reflected by the individuality which marks each student ' s approach as distinctly his own .	147.9179
schnabel ' s emphasis on structural clarity , his innate rhythmic vibrancy , and impetuous intensity all tend to stamp his reading as a symphonic one .	89.69975
yet no detail was too small to receive attention from this master , and as a result the playing here has humor , delicacy , and radiant humanity .	138.22523
this is a serious-minded interpretation , but it is never strait-laced .	56.139446
and although schnabel ' s pianism bristles with excitement , it is meticulously faithful to schubert ' s dynamic markings and phrase indications .	45.87125
the piano performance on this trout is one that really demands a search for superlatives .	208.34576
about the pro arte ' s contribution i am less happy .	105.23351
i , for one , rather regret that schnabel didn ' t collaborate with the budapest quartet , whose rugged , athletic playing was a good deal closer to this pianist ' s interpretative outlook than the style of the belgian group .	95.8753
from a technical standpoint , the string playing is good , but the pro arte people fail to enter into the spirit of things here .	96.0038
the violinist , in particular , is very indulgent with swoops and slides , and his tone is pinched and edgy .	45.23861
the twenty-five-year-old recording offers rather faded string tone , but the balance between the instruments is good and the transfer is very quiet .	88.48254
there is a break in continuity just before the fourth variation in the `` forellen ' ' movement , and i suspect that this is due to imperfect splicing between sides of the original aj .	70.21845
turning to the more modern versions , curzon ' s ( london ) offers the most sophisticated keyboard work .	68.530975
every detail in his interpretation has been beautifully thought out , and of these i would especially cite the delicious laendler touch the pianist brings to the fifth variation ( an obvious indication that he is playing with viennese musicians ) , and the gossamer shading throughout .	161.58072
some of curzon ' s playing strikes me as finicky , however .	131.05713
why , for example , does he favor two tempos , rather than one , for the third movement ? ?	47.74247
the assisting musicians from the vienna octet are somewhat lacking in expertise , but their contribution is rustic and appealing .	123.181305
( special compliments to the double bass playing of johann krumpp his scrawny , tottering sound adds a delightful hilarity to the performance .	123.883026
the glazer-fine arts edition ( concert-disc ) is a model of lucidity and organization .	82.10681
it is , moreover , a perfectly integrated ensemble effort .	599.39465
but having lived with the disc for some time now , i find the performance less exciting than either schnabel ' s or fleisher ' s ( whose superb performance with the budapest quartet has still to be recorded ) and a good deal less filled with humor than curzon ' s .	113.75017
aeschbacher ' s work is very much akin to schnabel ' s , but the sound on his decca disc is dated , and you will have a hard time locating a copy of it .	88.67747
the hephzibah menuhin-amadeus quartet ( angel ) and victor babin-festival quartet ( rca victor ) editions give us superlative string playing ( both in symphonic style ) crippled by unimaginative piano playing .	90.06981
( babin has acquired some of schnabel ' s keyboard manner , but his playing is of limited insight .	217.33195
) badura-skoda-vienna konzerthaus ( westminster ) and demus-schubert quartet ( deutsche grammophon ) are both warm-toned , pleasantly lyrical , but rather slack and tensionless .	124.32669
helmut roloff , playing with a group of musicians from the bayreuth ensemble , gives a sturdy reading , in much the same vein as that of the last-mentioned pianists .	122.32392
telefunken has accorded him beautiful sound , and this bargain-priced disc ( it sells for $2 . 98 ) is worthy of consideration .	174.75398
returning once again to the schnabel reissue , i am beguiled anew by the magnificence of this pianist ' s musical penetration .	79.992256
here is truly a `` great recording of the century ' ' , and its greatness is by no means diminished by the fact that it is not quite perfect .	33.814194
this recording surely belongs in everyone ' s collection .	270.22827
from the beginning of commercial recording , new discs purported to be indistinguishable from the real thing have regularly been put in circulation .	87.67557
seen in perspective , many of these releases have a genuine claim to be milestones .	94.39825
although lacking absolute verisimilitude , they supply the ear and the imagination with all necessary materials for re-creation of the original .	112.49379
