using a cheap brush , coat one side of the bottom with the resin and then apply the cloth .	40.640976
when the cloth is smooth , apply another coat of resin , spreading it with a paint roller .	82.3008
be sure it is well saturated and then allow it to harden .	300.56088
when the whole bottom has hardened , use a disk sander to feather the edges of the cloth at the keel line and near the spray rail .	56.166706
then lay a three-inch-wide strip of cloth along the keel line from the transom to the point of the stem .	28.433954
before the resin has hardened , screw a one-inch mahogany keel strip along the centerline .	50.589413
fiberglas materials are available from glass plastic supply co . , 1605 w . elizabeth ave . , linden , n . j . .	63.8374
the hull is now turned over ( with the help of about seven friends ) and placed in a level , well-braced position .	254.19669
i laid three layers of glass cloth on the inside of the stem , also installing a bow eye at this time .	116.172424
for added strength , i also fastened a small block on each side of every frame and batten joint .	105.03329
again , these blocks were set in resin-saturated glass cloth and nailed .	36.981995
after trimming off the excess on the frames and transom which was used to fasten them to the jig at a working height , the top of the side planking is installed .	52.069756
this is made up of scraps left over from the sides and bottom .	29.810238
these flaring parts really help to keep the boat dry .	345.65707
when they ' re on , the top edges are planed even with the sheer batten .	199.352
the sides of the motor well run from the bottom battens to the top and from frame six to the transom , forming a real strong transom brace .	37.3189
note another piece of wood six inches wide is fastened to the transom between these pieces .	89.954956
all the flooring and the storage bin is half-inch exterior fir plywood .	87.834785
most floor battens are glued and screwed to the flooring .	8.645959
these battens are glued and screwed to the frames .	8.042567
with all deck battens in place , the bilge is cleaned and painted up to the floor line .	105.4139
use one coat of firzite and one coat of marine paint .	31.827585
bottoms of the floorboards are also painted and the flooring is then screwed in place .	61.682617
after the decking is on , the cabin sides are installed .	238.74821
they ' re followed by the front and rear bulkheads as illustrated .	415.31094
the windshield glass is shatterproof and plexiglas is used in the cabin .	46.792286
inside , bunks are framed up and installed as indicated .	126.76533
a head is a handy thing to have and i installed one under a removable section of the port bunk .	102.56356
the sink in the hinged panel above the bunk drains into the head and a five-gallon water tank is mounted on the bulkhead above the sink .	91.62512
for padding the seats and bunks , i used ensolite , type aj .	153.96275
lightweight , non-absorbent , fire resistant and dimensionally stable , it is easily bonded to the wood with contact cement .	84.03175
available in af sheets , it costs about a dollar a square foot .	296.59006
it is a full scale , small , but efficient house that can become a year ' round retreat complete in every detail .	253.59764
because of the unique design by the architect egils hermanovski , you can build most of it in your own home workshop in your spare time .	100.53075
most of it is panelized and utilizes standard materials , and requires the use of only simple tools .	63.78731
on the following pages and in the following issues we take you every step of the way to your vacation cottage , from choosing the proper site to applying the final trim .	128.54695
in recognition of the growing trend for second homes , or vacation cottages , we have designed this one specifically with the family handyman in mind .	146.99442
it is a big project , not to be taken lightly .	45.627174
but each step has been broken down into easy stages , utilizing standard materials and simple tools , well within the capabilities of the handyman .	143.7089
the idea behind our design is modular units , or panelization .	151.50648
everything possible has been scaled to standard sizes and measurements of materials .	91.615425
wall panels and structural timbers are standard as are windows and doors , making for a minimum of cutting .	205.45004
we have developed an ingenious method of interlocking these so that you can make the major part of your house in your own workshop , panel by panel , according to plan .	109.341354
thus , when you have prepared your foundation and laid the floor , these can be trucked to the site and erected with a small crew of friends in a weekend .	63.74231
the roof timbers are precut and the panels standard so that the house can be completely enclosed in a matter of three or four days .	87.235405
then you can do the finishing touches at your leisure .	72.78747
due to the fact that building codes and regulations vary so much throughout the country , the first thing to do is to find out what , if any , they are .	105.55283
close to a large city they might even specify the size of the nails used	135.83984
in a remote section there might be no restrictions at all .	45.07352
this can usually be found out at the nearest town hall .	52.465298
at the same time check the electrical , plumbing , and sanitary requirements , as well as possible zoning regulations .	31.27085
whether electricity and public water and sewers are available or not , check the local customs in the use of bottled or l-p gas ( we give you alternatives later on ) .	205.11958
be sure that this information is reasonably official and not just an unfounded opinion .	94.85162
if there are any major restrictions , they usually can be obtained in printed form .	144.73886
where a building permit is required , find out what you must present when applying for one .	117.2462
in many cases , you must file a complete set of plans with the local building inspector .	35.928207
these will be available at cost from our plans department .	111.934265
some general things to look for in a site , if you haven ' t already bought one , are accessibility , water drainage , and orientation .	168.17583
how are the roads , and how will they stand up ? ?	107.28291
a visit in the early spring after a thaw will be very informative .	89.039055
note where the sun rises and sets , and ask which direction the prevailing winds and storms come from .	169.30478
will the view be something you can live with ? ?	67.219826
don ' t worry too much about rocky or sloping terrain	24.283222
we will take up alternative foundations later on .	890.344
with this first issue we give you a list of the materials needed to build the basic ( aja version ) and the expandable ( ajb version ) .	72.70407
this will be for the shell of the house only ( roof , walls , and floor ) , and does not include the carport or balcony .	93.35277
this will permit you to get a rough estimate of how much the materials for the shell will cost .	68.97585
bear in mind that this does not include interior panels for partitions , fancy flooring , appliances and fixtures , electrical wiring , and plumbing , all of which will be taken up in detail in later issues .	62.820812
the wall panels are constructed of a framework of standard af and af of a good grade , free from structural faults .	77.86352
they should be as straight as possible , as this will effect their ability to mesh properly when the walls are erected .	109.035416
the outside surface of the solid units shall be of an exterior grade of panel board such as plywood , plastic coated panel board , high density particle board , asbestos-cement board , or any other product locally obtainable upon recommendation of your building supply dealer .	193.68958
the inner panels do not have to be weatherproof , and the choice will depend on the quality of finish desired .	125.50474
all panel board comes in standard af foot size .	80.94364
it is recommended that panels be both glued as well as nailed to the frame .	44.62896
the fixed window panels with louvers should have a good grade of 1/8-inch double-strength glass set in a mastic glazing compound .	70.96072
the louvers are constructed as shown in the detail , with a drop door for ventilation .	201.03052
there are standard sliding glass windows in wood or aluminum frames for those panels requiring them .	86.90873
the door panels are designed to accommodate standard doors which should be of exterior grade .	97.09554
the filler panels for the gable ends are cut from full af sheets as shown , leaving no wastage .	436.75937
the battens covering the joints are of af stock and are applied after the walls are erected .	62.1125
all nails should be rustproof , and aluminum is highly recommended .	153.76979
note if 1/2-inch panel board is used inside and out , or 5/8-inch one side and 3/8-inch the other , and 1/8-inch glass is used , stock lumber in af , af , and af can be used in making the glass panels .	116.25276
other thicknesses may necessitate ripping a special size lumber for the glass trim .	318.37195
in any case , there is no special milling or rabbeting required for the panels .	126.175354
with modern techniques of woodworking and the multitude of cutting tools , fixtures , and attachments available , the drill press has become a basic home workshop tool .	94.37539
the drill press consists of a vertical shaft ( spindle ) which is tapered or threaded on one end to hold a drill chuck , a tubular housing ( quill ) in which the spindle is mounted , a head in which the quill is mounted , a feed lever which moves the quill up or down , a power source , and a movable table upon which the work is placed .	94.96888
there is often a means of locking the quill and , on larger presses , the table can be tilted .	195.72395
the size of the press is usually expressed in terms of chuck capacity ( the maximum diameter tool shank it will hold ) or distance between the spindle center and the column .	107.10882
a press with an 11 inch capacity lets you drill to the center of a 22 inch board or circle .	90.96772
a new radial drill press with a 16 inch capacity has a tilting head that allows drilling to be done at any angle .	100.41882
the head is mounted on a horizontal arm that swivels on the supporting column to position the drill bit instead of the work .	190.91507
the drill press should be leveled and , depending on whether it is a bench or floor model , bolted securely to a sturdy bench or stand or screwed to the floor with lag or expansion screws .	143.74432
a coat of paste wax or a rubdown with a piece of wax paper will protect the polished surface of the table	40.57923
wiping with a slightly oiled cloth will discourage rusting of the column and quill .	24.155035
presses not fitted with sealed spindle bearings will need a drop of oil now and then in the lubrication holes in the quill .	86.38468
the rest of the press should be kept clean by dusting with a clean rag or brush .	54.13542
be careful to keep the drive belt free of oil and grease .	55.160294
belt tension is adjusted by manipulation of two locking bolts and a movable motor mount .	67.07948
keep the belt just tight enough so the pulleys won ' t slip when pulled by hand	70.2426
excess tension will only cause undue wear on the motor and spindle bearings .	18.099146
most drill presses have a quill return spring that raises the spindle automatically when the feed lever is released and holds the quill in the raised position .	92.10816
the return spring tension may be adjusted to suit individual requirements by gripping the spring housing with a pair of pliers ( to prevent the spring from unwinding when it is released ) , loosening the lock nut or screw , and rotating the housing until the desired tension is achieved .	144.09465
turning the housing clockwise will reduce tension , counter-clockwise will increase it .	2206.3677
some manufacturers have had the foresight to provide a socket for the chuck key	139.08362
otherwise , you ' ll have to spend a few minutes to either attach a suitable spring clip somewhere on the press head or fit the key to a length of light chain and fasten to the bottom of the motor mount so that the key is out of the way when not in use .	105.89787
drill speeds are important if you want a good job .	11.215943
each cutting tool will operate best at a given speed , depending on the material worked .	203.63632
on most drill presses , it is impossible to get the exact speed , but you can come close by adjusting the drive belt on the step-cone pulleys .	75.91518
you will find a chart giving the various speed ratios available with your particular drill press somewhere in the instruction booklet that came with the tool .	295.59903
see the table on page 34 for exact recommended speeds .	499.5868
generally , the larger the tool and the harder the material , the slower the speed .	231.14233
too much pressure will force the tool beyond its cutting capacity and result in rough cuts and jammed or broken tools .	331.10577
too light a feed , particularly with metal or other hard material , causes overheating of the tool and burning of the cutting edge .	126.81569
the best results will be obtained by matching the correct speed with a steady feed pressure that lets the tool cut easily at an even rate .	346.242
there are numerous types and styles of tools to drill holes .	61.17774
the most common are the twist drill , the solid center shaft with interchangeable cutting blades , the double spur bit , and the power wood bit .	90.45602
all will do a good job if sharp , but the twist drills don ' t cut quite as smoothly as the others , since they do not have the outlining spurs that sever the fibers before actual boring starts .	79.67188
the adjustable fly cutter is very useful for cutting large diameter holes and can be used to cut exact-size discs by reversing the cutter blade .	89.93256
since fly cutters are one sided and not balanced , they should be used at the slowest speed available , and fed very slowly to avoid binding .	79.4675
fly cutters can fool you into putting your hand too close to the tool , so if you want to avoid nicked fingers , keep your hands well out of the way .	82.55502
when drilling all the way through a workpiece , always place a piece of scrap wood underneath .	139.27786
this will not only protect the work table , but also assure a clean breakthrough .	92.457375
another method of assuring a clean hole is to first drill a small pilot hole all the way through , then drill half way with the dimensional bit , turn the piece over , and finish from the other side .	138.45149
in soft woods with pronounced grain , there is sometimes a tendency for the hole to wander , due to the varying hardness of the wood .	68.17412
in this case , drilling a small pilot hole or clamping the work will do much to improve accuracy .	134.66183
when a hole is to be bored to a predetermined depth , mark the depth on the side of the stock , then run the bit down so that it is even with the mark .	123.60777
the depth gauge rod can now be set , and any number of holes bored to exact and identical depth .	133.37296
the old-time bridges over the merrimac river in massachusetts are of unusual interest in many respects .	142.89165
for their length , their types of construction , their picturesque settings , and their literary associations , they should be known and remembered .	50.05193
in this sequence i shall write about them in the order of their erection .	42.919724
the first bridge known to have been covered wholly or in part , -- and perhaps the most interesting one , connected newbury ( now newburyport ) with salisbury point .	198.6264
its building was first proposed in 1791 , when a group of citizens , mostly newburyport men , petitioned the general court for an act of incorporation .	133.10497
this document began `` no . 1 newbury port , may 30th , 1791	181.80605
`` whereas , a bridge over merrimack river , from the land of hon ' ble jonathan greenleaf , esquire , in newbery , to deer island , and from said island to salisbury , would be of very extensive utility , by affording a safe conveyance to carriages , teams and travellers at all seasons of the year , and at all times of tide .	87.29162
`` we , the subscribers , do agree , that as soon as a convenient number of persons have subscribed to this , or a similar writing , we will present a petition to the hon ' ble general court of the commonwealth of massachusetts , praying for an act incorporating into a body politic the subscribers to such writing with liberty to build such a bridge , and a right to demand a toll equal to that received at malden bridge , and on like terms , and if such an act shall be obtained , then we severally agree each with the others , that we will hold in the said bridge the several shares set against our respective names , the whole into two hundred shares being divided , and that we will pay such sums of money at such times and in such manners , as by the said proposed corporation , shall be directed and required ' ' .	143.58984
this paper was signed by forty-five persons , subscribing a total of two hundred shares .	83.35472
a month later the general court served notice to the town of newbury that the bridge was to be built .	45.981285
the matter was considered and reconsidered , and finally opposed , but in spite of many objections , the court granted a charter on january 9 , 1792 .	99.82911
on november 26 of that year the bridge was completed and opened .	65.01148
timothy palmer , who invented and later patented the arch type of construction for wooden bridges , was the genius who planned and supervised the building of the essex , or `` deer island ' ' bridge although the actual work was carried out under the direction of william coombs , who received $300 as recompense .	63.989597
this two-part bridge is best described by rev . timothy dwight , president of yale college , in his `` travels in new-england and new-york ' ' , published in new haven in 1821 .	80.32078
`` it consists of two divisions , separated by an island at a small distance from the southern shore .	72.42467
the division between the island and this shore , consists principally of an arch	132.19357
whose chord is one hundred and sixty feet , and whose vortex is forty feet ( it was actually 37 feet ) above the high-water mark .	171.91313
in appearance and construction it resembles the pascataqua bridge .	78.592995
the whole length of essex bridge is one thousand and thirty feet and its breadth thirty-four .	156.79651
i have already mentioned that mr . timothy palmer of newburyport was the inventor of the arched bridges in this country .	26.828281
as mr . palmer was educated to house-building only , and had never seen a structure of this nature	119.91083
he certainly deserves not a little credit for the invention ' ' .	9.216473
it is hardly necessary to remind students of covered bridges that timothy palmer was born in 1751 in nearby rowley	239.4471
that he moved with his parents to west boxford when he was sixteen years old	86.02767
and was there apprenticed to a builder and architect , moody spofford .	86.35317
it was indeed a remarkable feat that a man who had had no experience of bridge building should have applied the principle of the arch , which appears in his famous bridges at portsmouth , haverhill , and philadelphia .	110.639626
the essex merrimack bridge when first built was not covered .	184.97542
as far as we know , no american bridge had been thus protected in 1792 .	333.21512
richard s . allen is the authority for the statement that the northern section was probably roofed by 1810 .	175.08311
its original appearance is shown in an engraving published in the `` massachusetts magazine ' ' in may 1793 , which is reproduced herewith ( fig . 1 ) .	44.184475
a brief description accompanying the picture says that the bridge contained more than 6000 tons of timber .	64.5004
between the abutments on the newbury shore and the south bank of deer island there was one span or arch measuring 160 feet	50.908398
between the north shore of deer island and the salisbury side there was an arch of 113 feet and a series of piers with a draw forty feet long .	34.82468
a dinner and celebration in honor of this piece of engineering took place july 4 , 1793 , in a tavern erected by the corporation on the island .	81.984634
it is said that the eccentric timothy dexter , who was one of the first share-holders , stood on the table and made a speech worthy of the occasion .	55.429264
the `` essex journal ' ' says that he `` delivered an oration on the bridge , which for elegance of style , propriety of speech or force of argument , was truly ciceronian ' ' .	118.67087
the reporter must have written this with tongue in cheek , because dexter ' s oration could hardly be understood	95.28027
and , although he later explained that he was talking french , it seems rather more likely that he had succumbed to the joys of the evening .	51.01563
the north portion of the essex bridge was well worth the cost of construction , although it proved to be twice what was estimated in the beginning .	94.69661
it stood in its original form until 1882 .	4.226146
the southern half , however , on account of its underbracing , was considered by boat owners a menace to navigation .	81.32467
in 1810 it was torn down and replaced by a chain suspension bridge .	140.50616
this was built by john templeman from plans submitted by james finley of fayette county , pennsylvania .	67.93123
timothy palmer had general supervision of the work .	29.338852
an advertisement in the `` newburyport herald ' ' , december 21 , 1810 , shows palmer in a new light as an expert on chain bridges .	127.27343
information is hereby given that mr . timothy palmer of newburyport , mass . has agreed to take charge of the concerns of the patentees of the chain bridge , in the states of massachusetts , new hampshire , vermont , rhode island , and connecticut , so far as relates to the sale of patent rights and the construction of chain bridges .	42.07481
`` mr . palmer will attend to any applications relating to bridges and if desired will view the proposed site , and lay out and superintend the work , or recommend a suitable person to execute it .	125.34315
this chain bridge proved less durable than the wooden arch on the salisbury end .	215.11328
it fell , february 6 , 1827 , carrying with it a horse and wagon , two men and four oxen .	167.73645
the horse and men were saved , but the oxen drowned .	54.311474
in spite of this catastrophe , the bridge was rebuilt on the same plan and opened again on july 17 , 1827 .	129.39166
this second chain bridge was 570 feet long , had two thirty-foot towers and a draw , and a double roadway .	113.63041
the essex bridge was a toll crossing until 1868 , when the county commissioners laid out all the merrimack bridges as highways .	109.64971
sturdy and strong after more than a century of continuous use , the old covered , wooden bridge that spans the tygartis valley river at philippi will have a distinctive part in the week-long observance of the first land battle of the civil war at its home site , may 28th to june 3rd .	108.72868
colonel frederick w . lander , impersonated , will again make his break-neck ride down the steep declivity of talbott ' s ( now college ) hill and thunder across the bridge to join colonel benjamin f . kelley ' s ( west ) virginia infantry , then swarming through the streets in pursuit of the retreating confederates .	125.75671
he was closely followed by the ohio and indiana troops -- thus the old bridge has another distinction	653.7046
that of being the first such structure secured by force of arms in the war of the ' 60s .	52.38585
the bridge has survived the natural hazards of the elements , war , fire , and floods , as well as injuries incident to heavy traffic , for more than a hundred years .	74.53816
twice during the civil war it was saved from destruction by the opposing armies by the pleas and prayers of a local minister .	89.45087
it still stands as a monument to the engineering skills of the last century and still serves in the gasoline age to carry heavy traffic on u . s . route 250 -- the old beverly and fairmont turnpike .	99.19422
it is one of the very few , if not the only surviving bridge of its type to serve a main artery of the u . s . highway system , thus it is far more than a relic of the horse and buggy days .	63.817947
this covered , wooden bridge is so closely identified with the first action in the early morning of june 3 , 1861 , and with subsequent troop movements of both armies in the philippi area that it has become a part and parcel of the war story .	84.20331
so frequently have pictures of the bridge appeared in books and in national publications that it vies with the old john brown fort at harpers ferry as the two nationally best known structures in west virginia .	182.74457
completed and opened for traffic in 1852 , the bridge was designed and built by lemuel chenoweth and his brother , eli , of beverly .	141.2218
the chenoweth brothers were experienced bridge builders , and against the competition of other , and better known , bridge designers and builders they had constructed nine of the covered , wooden bridges on the parkersburg and staunton turnpike a dozen years before , as well as many other bridges for several counties .	92.64652
the philippi bridge , however , was the chenoweth master piece , with its 139-foot , dual lane , span -- and it stands today as a monument to its builders .	289.9177
never rebuilt , the bridge was strengtened in 1938 by two extra piers , a concrete floor , and a walk-way along the upper side in order to care for modern traffic .	245.36375
during the war it was in constant use by the wagon trains transporting supplies from the railhead at grafton to the troops operating in the interior .	72.56453
union soldiers at times used it for sleeping quarters to escape from the rain or other inclement weather , and some of them left momentoes of their stay by carving their names and small tokens on its walls and beams .	98.37368
but what the elements could not do was seriously threatened when brigadier general william e . ( grumble ) jones reached philippi while on the famous jones-imboden raid in may , 1863 .	257.23013
general jones was fresh from a long series of bridge burnings , including the long bridge at fairmont , and , after seeing a great drove of horses and cattle he had collected safely across the bridge , he sent his men to work piling combustibles in and around it .	85.18555
reverend joshual corder , a baptist minister , gathered a few citizens of southern sympathies , to call on jones and plead with him to spare the structure	139.86053
he reasoned and argued , pointing out that jones or other confederate commanders would need it should troops pass that way in retreat .	213.64178
jones relented , he did not order his men to apply the torch -- the drove of livestock was driven up the valley , via beverly , and across the mountains to feed and serve the confederate army , while jones and his raiders turned toward buckhannon to join forces with imboden .	146.52525
again reverend corder saved the bridge when union soldiers planned to destroy it , after filling its two lanes with hay and straw -- but for what reason is not recorded nor remembered , certainly not because of pressure from an opposing confederate force .	303.3954
on the second occasion it took prayers as well as reason to dissuade the soldiers from their purpose .	70.11012
centering around this historic old structure , a group of public-spirited barbour county citizens have organized and planned a week-long series of events , beginning on may 28th and continuing through june 3rd , to observe most appropriately the centennial of the first land engagement of the civil war at philippi .	125.87801
it is a good eight years now since each of us acquired a swimming pool -- eight enlightening , vigorous , rigorous , not wholly unrewarding years .	270.09583
we have learned a lot -- a dash of hydrochemistry here , a bit about plumbing and pump-priming there .	130.60664
we have had sound grounding in the principles of the mailed-fist-in-velvet-glove school of diplomacy .	41.191704
we have become amateur insurance experts and fine-feathered yard birds .	313.12292
true , our problems have lessened a bit as more and more of our neighbors have built their own pools , thereby diluting our spectacular attractions .	105.865204
but problems cling to pools , as any pool owner knows .	369.5848
so our innate generosity of spirit prompts us to share our trials , errors and solutions with any who are taking the pool plunge for the first time -- in the pious hope that some may profit from our experience .	130.32787
position may not be everything , but in the case of a pool it can certainly contribute difficulties , social and/or physical .	214.95692
one of us has a pool set in a wooded area very near the house .	51.414265
the other has his pool far away from the house in a field high on a hill .	42.76555
if you are dreaming of a blue , shimmering pool right outside your living room windows , close your eyes firmly and fill in the picture with lots and lots of children , damp towels , squashed tubes of suntan oil and semi-inflated plastic toys .	167.98122
you are likely to be nearer the truth .	7.7914143
you can also see that the greater the proximity of the pool to your main living quarters , the greater the chance for violation of family privacy , annoying noise and the let ' s-make-your-house-our-club attitude .	178.49103
on the other hand , out-of-sight does not lead to out-of-mind when children cannot be easily observed and you have to make a long trek to reach the pool .	86.87998
another dilemma as picturesque as a sylvan pond in the forest may be , trees offer a leaf and root hazard to the well-being of a pool .	80.43426
yet a grassy approach can turn a pool into a floating lawn every time the grass is mowed .	290.67932
as in choosing a wife , it is only sensible to consider also how appealing a pool is likely to be in bad weather as well as in good .	94.83752
in the colder climes , for instance , you will have to live through the many unglamorous winter months when your pool will hardly look its best .	153.33517
it may be a big hole in the ground filled with salt hay , or an ice floe studded with logs .	146.24083
even a neat , plastic-covered plunge is not exactly a joy to behold .	72.16217
( we do , however , recommend those patented covers to prevent both people and junk -- flora and fauna generally -- from accidentally wintering in the pool .	284.77206
probably no location for a pool is perfect on all counts .	141.08005
naturally it will be dictated to a large extent by the shape and size of your land .	98.91296
but if space and money are no problem and small children are not on hand every day , it is certainly more restful to have your pool and entertainment area removed from the immediate environs of the house .	111.09724
and a good several feet around the pool should be neither greensward nor woods , but good hard pavement .	421.52942
the placement of your pool , however , will not of itself solve the two major problems of pool owning -- those that involve your social life and those pertaining to safety .	196.92117
coping with them demands stern discipline -- of yourself as well as of your family , neighbors , friends and anyone you ever talked to on a transoceanic jet .	136.28642
eight years ago while we were going through the mud-sweat-and-tears construction period , we were each solaced by the vision of early morning dips and evening home-comings to a cool family collected around the pool with a buffet table laid out nearby for the lord and master ' s delectation .	225.04005
but not even our first pool-side gatherings came anywhere near those rosy fantasies .	96.749565
we seemed to be witnessing the population explosion right in our own backyards .	134.43216
our respective families looked as if they had quadrupled .	434.24478
had we taken a lien on a state park ? ?	115.15233
we had merely been discovered by the pool sharks .	112.35253
from proud pool-owners to perpetual hosts and handymen was a short step -- no more than the change from city clothes to trunks .	178.77646
naive of us , maybe , but the results of our impulsive invitations to `` come over next summer and swim in our new pool ' ' were both unexpected and unsettling .	268.54398
after the first few weeks , it was obvious that rules had to be made , laid down and obeyed -- even if our popularity ratings became subnormal as a result .	137.1181
so rules we made , in unabashed collusion .	37.443325
since our viewpoints in this respect coincided precisely , we present the fruits of our efforts herewith as a single social code for pool owners .	133.19374
first and foremost no one -- no , not anyone -- in the family is allowed to issue blanket invitations to his or her own circle .	130.95074
just short of forty lashes we finally managed to coerce our children to this view .	103.38384
their friends and ours are welcome to share the pool , but on our terms and at our times .	151.0408
no friends are to arrive without an invitation or without at least telephoning beforehand .	299.03268
no ringers , either -- even if they are trailing legitimate invitees .	40.248306
we want to know when the potlatches telephone exactly how many they are planning to bring , so that we won ' t end up with a splashing mob that looks like coney island in august .	113.93767
no young children may come without adults except for a specific , organized , chaperoned party .	145.8717
and accompanying adults are urged to keep an alert and sensible eye on their responsibilities .	62.381
a gaggle of gabbling mothers , backs to the pool , is no safeguard .	124.07168
no bottle pool is tolerated -- bottle pool being our lingo for those who come to swim and sink into our bar while protesting that they can only dunk and run .	213.35114
( sanity , solvency and relations with our wine merchant took a beating that first summer as we inadvertently became the neighborhood free-drink stop .	453.53915
we designated one day a week as the time when neighborhood teen-agers might swim at definite hours .	521.90967
this has saved us from constant requests seven days a week and made us feel less brutal to the young `` less fortunate ' ' than ours .	148.76573
we also worked out logistics for sunday afternoon swimmers who arrive two hours early with their weekend guests while we are still enjoying an alfresco lunch en famille .	195.94592
we gently usher them to an island of tables and chairs strategically placed on the far side of the pool where they can amuse each other until we get ready to merge sides .	112.94624
all dressing ( undressing to be more exact ) must be done in our small bath house or at the swimmers ' homes .	130.47585
( to avoid any possible excuse for a dripping parade through your house , it is a good idea to have a telephone extension near the pool as well as a direct outdoor route between the pool , and the parking area .	101.82069
) we do , however , provide a limited number of extra suits , mainly for children , and we stock extra towels and a few inexpensive bathing conveniences .	113.331116
life-preservers , the buckle-on kapok-filled kind , are held in readiness , too , for the very young .	169.92601
safety rules , of course , are more important than all the others put together .	101.01237
in many localities , now , the law requires all pools to be fenced , usually to a minimum height of 5 feet .	149.10313
but fenced or unfenced , no pool-side is the place for running or horseplay .	94.604675
we allow no underwater endurance contests , either , or inexpert versions of water polo .	132.53067
diving boards must have non-skid surfaces ( coco matting takes an awful beating from chlorine and rots quickly , but grit-impregnated paints are excellent ) .	267.70145
and divers must be enjoined to look before they leap , either on top of someone else or onto a pool edge .	91.02751
our pools also have wide , shallow steps -- for the benefit of the littlest swimmers who can thus be introduced to the water with far greater safety than a ladder affords .	100.067116
all bottles must be kept a safe distance away from the pool and drinking glasses are banned in favor of plastic or metal cups .	87.35912
when you first acquire a pool , we earnestly recommend -- for your own mental health -- a good long chat with your insurance agent .	100.21643
you should be prepared to cope with any pitfall such as plunges into empty pools or shallow ends and all manner of winter as well as summer lawsuits .	203.22707
soignee pools , alas , do not just happen .	58.164787
they are the result of a constant and careful contest with the elements .	89.326195
unless you want to make your wife a pool widow and to spend a great many of your leisure hours nursing your pool ' s pristine purity , its care and feeding -- from ph content to filtering and vacuuming -- is best left to a weekly or bi-monthly professional service .	146.10191
of course , if your pool is close to the house , your wife can always add it to her housekeeping chores ( you hope ) .	147.92833
or you can make pool care the price of swimming for teen-agers .	112.10113
even so , every pool owner , in case of emergency , should have some idea of what makes things work .	300.80978
a brief course in hydraulics from the pool builders may well be appreciated in a future crisis .	163.13916
a sudden high rise in temperature will turn your pool poison green overnight .	128.8968
with or without professional help , you will have to be able to do some of these jobs yourself unless you have a full-time pool nurse .	50.79607
you should see to it that the trap , the dirt-catcher in front of the filter , is always clean .	72.99632
a pool is no place for a shut trap .	35.61846
you should firmly insist that no bobby pins or hair pins be worn in the water .	37.792084
you can hope against hope that come spring cleaning , your fair-weather friends will lend a hand at scrubbing and furbishing .	214.92575
many hours of spring cleaning will be saved , however , if you remove the main drain grate when you close the pool season in the fall .	74.88726
as the pool is emptied , stand by to brush down the walls and bottom while they are still wet .	104.02139
much of the dirt and leaf stain is easily removed when damp , but requires dynamite if allowed to dry .	480.554
if you have a 6- to 8-inch drain pipe , you may easily wash out all the debris when the grate is out .	85.245155
of course , when your 6-inch torrent of water is released , it may cause a lot of comment as it passes through or by neighboring properties .	77.28164
if your pool is located on or near sloping ground , it may have natural drainage which is certainly more desirable than to be faced with the annual expense and labor of first pumping out the water and then scooping out all the debris .	88.71825
it may be true that pool lighting dramatizes an evening scene , but lights also attract all the insect life for miles around .	307.11255
once on the water , these little visitors seldom leave , and this adds to your filtering and vacuuming problems as well as providing a slapping good time for all those present .	149.47949
often one floodlight high in a tree will provide all the light you need at much less expense .	240.95015
our experience has taught us that it pays to buy the best equipment possible , from pipes to brushes .	156.711
follow pool-care instructions to the letter , and be sure that one person ( in the family or not ) is regularly responsible for each aspect of the job , with no chance for claiming , `` it wasn ' t my turn ' ' .	91.559
never let anyone not in the know take a turn at the valves -- even if the little boys do want to play space ship .	199.86615
you may find yourself hitting bottom , literally , as you discover that water is running out even while you are putting it in .	104.78381
draw a line across the country at the latitude of lower pennsylvania .	155.37161
any house built now below that line without air conditioning will be obsolete in 10 years .	57.54142
fortunately , it is the fha which has arrived at this conclusion , for it means that cooling equipment of all kinds may now be included in a mortgage , and thus acquired with a minimum of financial stress .	159.12868
even if you live above that line , the fha will back you , for they have decided that the inclusion of air conditioning in all new homes is a good thing and should be encouraged .	150.8502
new simplified packaged units , recently devised prefabricated glass-fiber ducts , and improved add-on techniques make it possible to acquire a system for an 1800-square-foot house for as little as $600 to $900 .	82.26788
two men can often do the installation in a day .	27.794558
you can install it yourself -- this is a central system that will cool every part of your house .	108.071556
no less an authority than the fha concurs that the savings air conditioning makes possible more than offset its operating costs .	42.008095
home air conditioning has come a long way from the early days of overcooled theaters and the thermal shock they inflicted .	266.42404
we know now that a 15-degree differential in temperature is the maximum usually desirable , and accurate controls assure the comfort we want .	171.2176
we know , too , that health is never harmed by summer cooling .	352.95905
on the contrary , there are fewer colds and smaller doctor bills .	377.53503
the filtered air benefits allergies , asthma , sinus , hay fever .	99.098434
control of temperature and humidity is a godsend to the aged and the invalid .	49.770542
heart conditions and high blood pressure escape the stresses brought on by oppressive heat .	440.72153
the cleaner air means less time spent pushing a vacuum , fewer trips to the dry cleaners , lighter loads for the washing machine .	86.897835
the need for reupholstering , redecorating , repainting becomes more infrequent .	389.61346
clothes hold their shape better , and mildew and rust become almost forgotten words .	222.53824
when you ' re less fatigued , things just naturally look brighter .	596.7957
the children can have their daytime naps and hot meals , and be put to bed on schedule in shade-darkened rooms .	91.20009
you ' ll sleep longer and better , too , awake refreshed and free of hot weather nerves .	110.52599
you can forget about screens , and leave the storm windows up all year around .	185.85947
best of all , central air conditioning is something you can afford .	102.77848
like its long-lived cousin , the refrigerator , a conditioner can be expected to last 20 to 25 years or more .	81.8091
that brings its per-year cost down mighty low .	24.074038
no matter what style your home is , ranch , two-story , colonial or contemporary , central air conditioning is easily installed .	123.83596
the equipment won ' t take up valuable space either .	240.84952
but there ' s no denying that the easiest and most economical way to get year- ' round whole-house air conditioning is when you build .	113.162964
if that ' s done , the house can be designed and oriented for best operation , and this can mean savings both in the size of equipment and in the cost of the house itself .	102.00516
if you can ' t see your way clear to have summer cooling included when building , by all means make provision for its easy adding later .	480.31073
manufacturers have designed equipment for just such circumstances , and your savings over starting from scratch will be substantial .	177.11266
if your house is to have a forced warm air system , cooling can be a part of it .	122.06393
this costs less than having a completely separate cooling system , for your regular heating ductwork , filters and furnace blower do double duty for cooling .	75.38659
you can get year- ' round air conditioners in the same variety of styles in which you buy a furnace alone -- high or low boy , horizontal or counterflow .	141.81104
the units can be installed in basement , attic , crawlspace , or in a closet located in the living area .	96.14774
the cooling coil is located in the furnace ' s outlet .	26.974213
from the coil small copper pipes connect to a weatherproof refrigeration section set in the yard , garage , carport , or basement .	80.11479
if you plan to add cooling later to your heating system , there are things to watch for .	146.06178
be sure ducts that require insulation get it when they are installed .	107.493935
be sure your ducts and blower are big enough to handle cooling .	28.190619
this is especially important if you live in a mild-winter zone .	109.55319
be sure you get a perimeter heating system , and diffusers that will work as well for cooling as they do for heating .	245.3861
you can get a hot water system that will also work for cooling your house .	205.2874
for cooling , chilled water is circulated instead of hot water .	89.03061
instead of radiators you ' ll have cooling-heating units , each with its own thermostat .	97.54429
these systems are more expensive than year- ' round forced air systems .	189.9836
the minimum cost for an average one-story , 7-room house with basement , is likely to run $1500 above the cost of the heating alone .	97.171684
if the problems of combining cooling with your heating are knotty , it may be cheaper to plan on a completely separate cooling system .	47.508038
the simplest kind of separate system uses a single , self-contained unit .	134.57312
it is , in effect , an oversize room conditioner equipped with prefab glass-fiber ducts to distribute the cooled , cleaned , dehumidified air where it is wanted .	85.446
in a long , rambling ranch , two such units can be installed , one serving the living area , the other the sleeping zone .	181.61984
in a two-story house , one unit may be installed in the basement to serve the first floor , another in the attic to cool the second .	62.04205
in each case , having separate systems for living and sleeping areas has the advantage of permitting individual zone control .	305.34586
one of the more remarkable of the new cooling systems is one that can be switched to heating .	113.36976
as you know , a conditioner makes indoor air cool by pumping the heat out of it and then releasing this heat outdoors .	151.74068
a relatively simple switching arrangement reverses the cycle so that the machine literally runs backward , and the heat is extracted from outdoor air and turned indoors .	96.99171
up until recently , this heat pump method of warming air was efficient only in areas of mild winters and when outside temperatures were above 40 degrees .	180.25203
now , the machine has been improved to a point where it is generally more economical than oil heat at temperatures down to 15 degrees .	97.50183
you can get this added heating feature for as little as $200 more than the price of cooling alone .	222.27597
consider it as a standby setup , at negligible cost , for those emergencies when the furnace quits , a blizzard holds up fuel delivery , or for cool summer mornings or evenings when you don ' t want to start up your whole heating plant .	98.926254
how large a cooling unit you need , and the method of its installation , depends on a variety of factors .	70.416756
among other things , besides the nature of your house and how much heat finds its way into its various rooms from the outside , it will depend upon your personal habits and the makeup of your family .	89.11964
families with children usually don ' t want the house quite so cool .	242.79176
if you are a party thrower , you may need added capacity .	240.10796
the body is a heat machine , and 20 to 25 guests can easily double your cooling load .	424.18896
cooling requirements are best expressed in terms of aj .	94.820465
a btu is a unit of heat , and the btu rating of a conditioner refers to how much heat your machine can pump out of your house in an hour .	64.49501
a very rough rule of thumb is that , under favorable conditions , you ' ll need 15 btu ' s of cooling for every square foot of your house .	110.377106
this is if outdoor temperatures have a high average of 95 degrees .	32.364025
you ' ll need more if the high average is above that , less if it ' s below .	226.26279
a ton of cooling compares to the cooling you get by melting a ton of ice .	316.01123
by accepted definition , a 1-ton conditioner will provide 12 , 000 btu of cooling in one hour .	132.48422
you may find a conditioner rated by horsepower .	5.8109064
it is generally an inaccurate method of rating , for the horsepower is that of the compressor motor , and many other components beside it determine how much cooling you ' ll get .	97.04829
a 1-hp conditioner , for example , may vary in effectiveness from under 8 , 000 btu to well over 10 , 000 aj .	167.04477
the safest procedure is to let your builder estimate the size of the unit you need , rather than trying to do this yourself .	108.78184
don ' t urge your builder to give you a little extra cooling capacity just to be sure you have enough .	64.67933
better to have your equipment slightly undersized than too big .	134.14648
reducing humidity is often as important as cooling .	60.772923
an oversize unit will cool off your house quickly , then shut down for a long period .	48.045937
before it cycles on again , humidity can build up and make you uncomfortable even though the temperature is still low .	131.25024
with a unit of the right size , a compressor will run continuously during hot weather , reducing humidity as evenly as it does temperature .	236.81775
attention to details can cut in half the size unit you need and pare operating expense proportionately .	150.95549
a well-designed , 1200-square-foot house can be comfortably cooled and heated for as little as $128 a year , or $11 a month .	132.33965
if you have a house which heat doesn ' t penetrate easily , your unit will have less heat to remove .	111.20505
keep the direct sun from reaching the house and you ' ve won the first battle .	105.33407
in a new house , generous roof overhangs are a logical and effective solution .	58.159184
if the house you plan to buy or build won ' t have big overhangs , you can still do a fair job of keeping the sun off walls and windows with properly designed trellises , fences and awnings .	98.69232
shade trees , too , are a big help , so keep them if you can .	108.27045
drawn blinds and draperies do some good , but not nearly as much as shading devices on the outside of the house .	44.19754
the more directly the sun strikes walls and roof , the greater its heat impact .	285.8238
the way a house is set on its lot can therefore influence how much cooling you ' re going to need .	236.55534
a shift in the walls , or a change in the roof slope , so the sun hits them more obliquely , can save you money .	179.76062
you can use heat-absorbing glass to stop the sun , double glass and insulated glass to combat condensation .	151.45694
restrict large glass areas to the north and south sides of the house .	21.15605
an attic space above insulation makes a house easier to cool .	14.878558
you ' ll even gain by putting your water heater outside the conditioned space , and using an electric range instead of a gas one .	125.00824
insulate , weatherstrip , double-glaze to the maximum .	285.41956
in insulation , the numbers to remember are 6-4-2 .	8.800871
they stand for 6 inches of mineral wool insulation in the ceiling , 4 inches in the side walls , 2 inches in the floors .	74.3009
such extra-thick insulation not only permits a much smaller cooling installation , but will continue to reduce operating expenses both in heating and cooling .	57.98816
a light-colored roof will reduce sun heat by 50 per cent .	18.145325
it costs two to three times as much to remove a btu in summer as it does to add one in winter , so every solitary btu is worth attention .	164.51389
you ' ll foil them in droves , along with their pal humidity , by having and using a kitchen range exhaust fan , a bathroom ventilator for when you shower , and an outside vent for the clothes drier .	137.65636
it ' s no use pretending that all conditioners are quiet , but the noise they produce can be kept to a minimum .	126.0245
good workmanship is important in the installation , so if you ' re doing your own contracting , don ' t award the job on the basis of price alone .	59.617336
most recreation work calls for a good deal of pre-planning .	106.0075
you must know before you start what the needs and objectives of your organization are	313.7957
you must have a list of requirements on where , how many , and what type sites are needed .	118.76953
with such a program you can make constructive selections of the best sites available .	48.89529
begin the examination of a site with a good map and aerial photos if possible .	268.68503
these are becoming more and more available through the work of counties and other government agencies .	53.61862
the new editions of topographic maps being made by the federal government are excellent for orienting yourself to the natural features of the site .	60.365837
these are inexpensive and available from the u . s . geological society , washington 25 , d . c . .	18.766504
in recent years many counties and the u . s . forest service have taken aerial photos which show features in detail and are very good for planning use .	84.10255
most counties also have maps available from the county engineer showing roads and other features and from the assessor ' s office showing ownerships of land .	218.14186
inspect the site in the field during the time of the year when the area will be most heavily used for recreation .	86.99758
this gives you a better opportunity to get the feel of the climate conditions , the exposure to the sun and wind , the water interests , etcetera , which vary greatly with the seasons .	78.70948
it is usually helpful to make a sketch map in the field , showing the size and location of the features of interest and to take photographs at the site .	57.62885
these are a great aid for planning use back at the office .	194.76466
for site planning work , it is best to have a qualified and experienced park planner to carry through the study .	167.25104
however , there is also much to be gained by making use of the abilities of the local people who are available and interested in recreation .	97.69566
county judges , commissioners , engineers , assessors , and others who have lived in the area for a long time may have valuable knowledge regarding the site or opinions to offer from their varied professional experiences .	121.42442
a visit to the site by a group of several persons can usually bring out new ideas or verify opinions most helpful to the planning study of any recreation area .	202.52676
this , of course , depends on the character of the site itself , the previous experience of the investigator , and the number of factors needed to arrive at a good decision .	58.166946
it is too easy for the inexperienced person to make a quick judgment of a few values of the area and base a decision on these alone .	88.50001
usually there are more factors to good site planning than first impressions .	272.29886
a site may be a rundown slum or a desolate piece of desert in appearance today but have excellent potentials for the future with a little development or water .	136.34883
the same is true of areas which at first look good because of a few existing recreation features but may actually be poor areas to develop for general public use .	222.06853
in looking for the best sites available that meet the requirements , you need information to compare the site with others .	79.417915
how well can the site be developed ? ?	1.2806548
how useful will it be to the public ? ?	18.838375
check the quantity and quality of all of the recreation interests already existing at the site .	77.23269
naturally , a park site with scenic views , a good lake , trees , and sand dunes , will attract more people than a nearby area with only trees and dunes .	174.1714
frontage on a body of clear , clean water will be vastly different from the same amount of frontage on polluted water .	92.319305
some recreation features , such as scenic values and water interest , also have greater overall value than other interests .	250.64447
one of the most desirable features for a park are beautiful views or scenery .	325.596
it may be distant views of a valley or the mountains or natural features such as a small lake , colorful rock formations , or unusual trees .	229.53667
a site which overlooks a harbor or river may offer interest in the activities of boating traffic .	114.984215
an area on the coast may have relaxing views of the surf rolling in on a beach .	56.90183
a site may also be attractive just through the beauty of its trees and shrubs .	75.756676
note extent of these interests and how available they will be for the public to enjoy .	71.55322
water interest is one of the most valuable factors you can find for a recreation site .	80.16539
most park planners look to water frontage for basic park areas .	179.66576
this follows naturally since frontage on an ocean , stream , or lake provides scenic values and opportunities for the very popular recreation activities of bathing , fishing , boating , and other water sports .	83.612915
a body of water is usually the center of interest at parks which attract the greatest picnic and camping use .	143.8074
it also cools the air in summer and nourishes the trees and wild life .	62.766705
the amount of water frontage , the quantity and quality of the water , and the recreation afforded by it are important .	66.59677
a restricted frontage may be too crowded an area for public use .	60.7465
a stream or pond which is attractive in the springtime may become stagnant or dry in late summer .	137.6196
if the site is on a reservoir , the level of the water at various seasons as it affects recreation should be studied .	88.59772
a stream which has all of its watershed within a national forest or other lands under good conservation practices is less likely to be affected by pollution than one passing through unrestricted logging or past an industrial area .	110.54144
other factors , such as water temperature , depth of water , the fish life it supports , wave action , flooding , etcetera , will affect its recreation value .	180.92773
other natural features which can be of high interest are the forests , canyons , mountains , deserts , seacoast , beaches , sand dunes , waterfalls , springs , etcetera with which the area is blessed .	63.202488
just as the national and state parks place emphasis on features which are of national or state significance , counties should seek out these features which are distinctive of their area .	208.9988
although the site may not contain the features themselves , there are often opportunities to include them as additional interest to the site .	94.45264
the route to the park may lead people past them or display views of them .	346.53683
a group of native trees or plants which are outstanding in a particular county can be featured at the site .	99.50851
the fish , animals , and birds which may be found at the site are another interest .	94.420715
fishing interest calls for a check of the species found , quantity and size , the season they are available , and the stocking program of the fish commission .	174.42506
animals may be present at the site or provide hunting in nearby areas .	38.72312
the site may be on one of the major flyways of migratory birds or have its own resident bird life .	178.7519
clams , crabs , and other marine life may add interest at coastal areas .	125.15615
each area has its own historical interests with which much can be done .	84.16566
park visitors are always eager to learn more about the area they are in .	99.96773
the historical sign tells its story , but nothing gets interest across as well as some of the original historical items or places themselves which still have the character of the period covered .	298.68213
notice should be taken of unusual rock formations , deposits , or shapes of the earth ' s crust in your region .	87.23749
those which tell a story of the earth ' s formation in each area can add geological interest to the recreation sites .	130.49072
an old shipwreck , a high dam , an old covered bridge , a place to find agates or other semi-precious stones or a place to pan gold , etcetera may be of interest .	135.82204
some areas may provide archeological values such as ancient indian village sites or hunting areas , caves , artifacts , etcetera .	77.22196
how well can the site be developed ? ?	1.2431988
look at the physical features of the land to determine how desirable it is for use , what can be done to correct the faults , and what it will cost to make the area meet your needs in comparison to other sites .	85.42795
-- the size of the area alone can be a determining factor .	50.011696
an area may be too small for the needs of the project .	62.72069
areas should be large enough to include the attractions , have ample space for the use of facilities needed , and have room around the edges to protect the values of the area from encroachment by private developments .	92.971176
acreage in excess of the minimum is good practice as recreation areas are never too large for the future and it is often more economical to operate one large area than several small ones .	190.37726
shape of the area is also related to the use attractions and needs of the development .	75.5979
a large picnic area or camping development is most efficient in shape as a square or rectangle several hundred feet in width in preference to a long narrow area less than one hundred feet wide .	99.589584
this is true because of savings in utility lines and the fact that your buildings have a useful radius equal in all directions .	101.4811
however , a narrow strip may be very practical for small developments , or to provide additional stream frontage for a fisherman ' s trail , or include scenic strips within the park unit .	126.13625
-- the values of the site may be affected by the appearance of the adjoining lands , ownership and use of the land , and the utilities available there .	79.13927
for instance , a site adjoining other publicly owned lands , such as a national forest or a public road , may be desirable , whereas a site next to an industrial plant might not .	88.000465
the utilities available nearby may provide a savings in the cost of extending electricity or water to the site .	54.400803
check the elevation of the ground , degree and direction of slopes , drainage , rock outcrops , topsoil types and quality , as well as subsoil .	171.93527
nearly level areas are required for parking areas , beaches , camp areas , ballfields , etcetera .	57.747547
determine how much topography limits useful area or what the costs of earth moving or grading might be .	184.84695
-- in addition to its recreation interests , water is needed for drinking , sanitation , and irrigation .	79.13836
the quantity and quality of water sources is often a big factor in site selection .	119.818
the area may provide good springs or opportunities for a well or be near to municipal water lines .	357.67178
figure the cost of providing water to the use areas .	61.632458
-- the existing plant growth calls for thorough checking .	18.10533
look at the trees as to size and interest , the amount of shade they provide , how healthy they are , the problems of maintenance , fire hazards , wind throw , etcetera .	145.55759
an area may have been partially logged and requires removal of stumps or clean-up .	138.53952
some shrubs may be of good landscaping value , other areas of brush may need to be cleared .	67.94992
the extent and location of open areas is noted .	102.25649
-- how much will wind , rain , sun , and temperature affect the use ? ?	166.58992
an area sheltered from strong winds may be highly desirable for recreation use .	34.19781
the direction , velocity , and season of these winds should be noted as to just how they will affect the recreation use and your maintenance and operation of the area .	99.42877
lack of rainfall and extreme temperatures may call for the development of shade and irrigation of a site to make it useable .	84.99282
sometimes , you have a choice of exposure for sites where the topography or trees of the area will provide afternoon shade , morning sun , or whatever may be most desirable for the use intended .	103.256935
-- some areas may already have been improved and contain buildings , roads , utilities , cleared land , etcetera which may raise the cost of the site .	97.22434
your invitation to write about serge prokofieff to honor his 70th anniversary for the april issue of sovietskaya muzyka is accepted with pleasure , because i admire the music of prokofieff	101.664085
and with sober purpose , because the development of prokofieff personifies , in many ways , the course of music in the union of soviet socialist republics .	42.035316
the serge prokofieff whom we knew in the united states of america was gay , witty , mercurial , full of pranks and bonheur -- and very capable as a professional musician .	51.749634
these qualities endeared him to both the musicians and the social-economic haute monde which supported the concert world of the post-world war 1 , era .	101.175545
prokofieff ' s outlook as a composer-pianist-conductor in america was , indeed , brilliant .	284.4645
prokofieff ' s classical symphony was hailed as an ingenious work from a naturally gifted and well-trained musician still in his twenties .	168.35844
to the traditionalists , it was a brilliant satire on modernism	72.19692
to the neo-classicists , it was a challenge to the pre-war world .	20.858936
a trial balloon to test the aesthetic climate of the times	74.52249
certainly its composer was an ascending star on a new world horizon .	62.7023
i heard the classical symphony for the first time when koussevitzky conducted it in paris in 1927 .	58.439316
i myself was one of the skeptics ( 35 years ago ) .	37.919403
i remember ernest bloch in the foyer , shouting in his high-pitched voice `` it may be a tour de force , mais mon dieu , can anyone take this music seriously ' ' ? ?	153.00905
the answer is , `` yes ' ' ! !	5.678851
certainly , america took prokofieff and his classical symphony seriously , and with a good deal of pleasure .	29.334047
his life-long friend , serge koussevitzky , gave unreservedly of his praise and brilliant performances in boston , new york , and washington , d . c . , , to which he added broadcastings and recordings for the whole nation .	42.49775
chicago was also a welcome host there , in 1921 , prokofieff conducted the world premiere of the love for three oranges , and played the first performance of his third piano concerto .	63.320107
`` uncle sam ' ' was , indeed , a rich uncle to prokofieff , in those opulent , post-war victory years of peace and prosperity , bold speculations and extravaganzas , enjoyment and pleasure `` the golden twenties ' ' .	113.21693
we attended the premieres of his concertos , symphonies , and suites	150.0166
we studied , taught , and performed his piano sonatas , chamber music , gavottes , and marches	123.7365
we bought his records and played them in our schools and universities .	63.01005
we unanimously agreed that prokofieff had won his rights as a world citizen to the first ranks of twentieth-century composers .	65.7867
nevertheless , prokofieff was much influenced by paris during the twenties the paris which was the artistic center of the western world -- the social paris to which russian aristocracy migrated -- the chic paris which attracted the tourist dollars of rich america -- the avant-garde paris of diaghileff , stravinsky , koussevitzky , cocteau , picasso -- the laissez-faire paris of dadaism and ultramodern art -- the paris sympathique which took young composers to her bosom with such quick and easy enthusiasms .	118.707535
so young prokofieff was the darling of success in his motherland	76.95532
in the spacious hunting grounds of `` uncle sam ' '	3.8442187
in the exciting salons of his lovely , brilliant paris -- mistress of gaiety -- excess and abandon -- world theatre of new-found freedoms in tone , color , dance , design , and thought .	165.14177
meanwhile , three great terrible forces were coagulating and crystallizing .	31.239298
in this world-wide conscription of men , minds , and machines , prokofieff was recalled to his native land .	81.791664
the world exploded when fascism challenged all concepts of peace and liberty , and the outraged , freedom-loving peoples of the capitalist and socialist worlds combined forces to stamp fascist tyranny into cringing submission .	146.26794
after this holocaust , a changing world occupied the minds of men	86.91979
a world beset with new boundaries , new treaties and governments , new goals and methods , and the age-old fears of aggression and subjugation -- hunger and exposure .	216.79228
in this changed world , prokofieff settled to find himself , and to create for large national purpose .	128.66885
here , this happy , roving son of good fortune proved that he could accept the disciplines of a new social-economic order fighting for its very existence and ideals in a truculent world .	221.76643
here , prokofieff became a workman in the vineyards of socialism -- producing music for the masses .	89.49473
it is at this point in his life that the mature prokofieff emerges .	127.74519
one might have expected that such a violent epoch of transition would have destroyed the creative flair of a composer , especially one whose works were so fluent and spontaneous .	165.3189
he accepted the environment of his destiny -- took root and grew to fulfill the stature of his early promise .	97.730385
by 1937 he had clarified his intentions to serve his people `` i have striven for clarity and melodious idiom , but at the same time i have by no means attempted to restrict myself to the accepted methods of harmony and melody .	75.98097
this is precisely what makes lucid , straightforward music so difficult to compose -- the clarity must be new , not old ' ' .	104.90871
how clearly he saw the cultural defection of experimentation as an escape for those who dare not or prefer not to face the discipline of modern traditionalism .	131.66321
and with what resource did prokofieff back up his credo of words -- with torrents of powerful music .	193.44684
compare the vast difference in scope and beauty between his neat and witty little classical symphony and his big , muscular , passionate , and eloquent fifth symphony	116.37523
or the love for three oranges ( gay as it is ) with the wonderful , imaginative , colorful , and subtle tenderness of the magnificent ballet , the stone flower .	108.29534
this masterpiece has gaiety , too , but it is the gaiety of dancing people earthy , salty and humorous .	85.60398
of course , these works are not comparable , even though the same brain conceived them .	74.03121
the early works were conceived for a sophisticated , international audience	537.7078
the later works were conceived to affirm a way of life for fellow citizens .	180.66995
however , in all of prokofieff ' s music , young or mature , we find his profile -- his `` signature ' ' -- his craftsman ' s attitude .	68.888985
prokofieff never forsakes his medium for the cause of experimentation per se .	58.953995
in orchestration , he stretches the limits of instrumentation with good judgment and a fine imagination for color .	140.78397
his sense for rhythmic variety and timing is impeccable .	5.501207
his creative development of melodic designs of slavic dance tunes and love songs is captivating witty , clever , adroit , and subtle .	103.23783
his counterpoint is pertinent , skillful , and rarely thick .	2013.4385
also , it should be noted that the polytonal freedom of his melodies and harmonic modulations , the brilliant orchestrations , the adroitness for evading the heaviness of figured bass , the skill in florid counterpoint were not lost in his mature output , even in the spectacular historical dramas of the stage and cinema , where a large , dramatic canvas of sound was required .	177.39697
that prokofieff ' s harmonies and forms sometimes seem professionally routine to our ears , may or may not indicate that he was less of an `` original ' ' than we prefer to believe .	131.27545
need for novelty may be a symptom of cultural fatigue and instability .	51.288883
prokofieff might well emerge as a cultural hero , who , by the force of his creative life , helped preserve the main stream of tradition , to which the surviving idioms of current experimentalism may be eventually added and integrated .	134.47113
at this date , it seems probable that the name of serge prokofieff will appear in the archives of history , as an effective traditionalist , who was fully aware of the lure and danger of experimentation , and used it as it served his purpose	86.138954
yet was never caught up in it -- never a slave to its academic dialectics .	134.4973
certainly , it is the traditional clarity of his music which has endeared him to the western world -- not his experimentations .	104.137924
so prokofieff was able to cultivate his musical talents and harvest a rich reward from them .	92.84876
nor can anyone be certain that prokofieff would have done better , or even as well , under different circumstances .	86.16631
his fellow-countryman , igor stravinsky , certainly did not .	24.96605
why did prokofieff expand in stature and fecundity , while stravinsky ( who leaped into fame like a young giant ) dwindled in stature and fruitfulness ? ?	106.904816
i think the answer is to be found in prokofieff ' s own words `` the clarity must be new , not old ' ' .	97.399414
when prokofieff forged his new clarity of `` lucid , straightforward music , so difficult to compose ' ' , he shaped his talents to his purpose .	38.13257
when stravinsky shaped his purpose to the shifting scenes of many cultures , many salons , many dialectics , many personalities , he tried to refashion himself into a stylist of many styles , determined by many disparate cultures .	121.36371
prokofieff was guided in a consistent direction by the life of his own people -- by the compass of their national ideas .	61.72357
but stravinsky was swayed by the attitudes of whatever culture he was reflecting .	306.5832
in all his miscalculations , stravinsky made the fatal historical blunder of presuming that he could transform other composers ' inspirations -- representing many peoples , time periods and styles -- into his own music by warping the harmony , melody , or form , to verify his own experiments .	106.3706
because of the authentic homogeneity of his early nationalistic materials , and his flair for orchestrations -- his brilliant petruchka , his savage sacre du printemps , his incisive les noces -- the world kept hoping that he could recapture the historical direction for which his native talents were predisposed .	94.597595
but time is running out , and many of stravinsky ' s admirers begin to fear that he will never find terra firma .	113.38463
his various aesthetic postulates remain as landmarks of a house divided against itself supra-expressionism , neo-paganism , neo-classicism , neo-romanticism , neo-jazz , neo-ecclesiasticism , neo-popularism , and most recently , post-serialism -- all competing with each other within one composer ! !	294.0421
what a patchwork of proclamations and renunciations ! !	1.6606421
meager and shabby by-products linger to haunt our memories of a once mighty protagonist	500.77573
a maladroit reharmonization of our national anthem ( the star-spangled banner )	34.66699
a poor attempt to write an idiomatic jazz concerto	3.3135347
his hopes that the tunes from his old music might be used for popular american commercial songs ! !	188.8962
stravinsky , nearing the age of eighty , is like a lost and frantic bird , flitting from one abandoned nest to another , searching for a home .	180.2062
prokofieff was able to adjust his creative personality to a swiftly changing world without losing his particular force and direction .	421.33932
in the process , his native endowments were stretched , strengthened and disciplined to serve their human purpose .	220.79073
with a large and circumspect 20th-century technique , he wove the materials of national heroes and events , national folklore and children ' s fairy tales -- slavic dances and love songs -- into a solid musical literature which served his people well , and is providing much enjoyment to the world at large .	127.38776
of course , it must not be forgotten that in achieving this historical feat , prokofieff had the vast resources of his people behind him	122.59182
it must be conceded that his native land provided prokofieff with many of the necessary conditions for great creative incentive economic security and cultural opportunities , incisive idioms , social fermentations for a new national ideology -- a sympathetic public and a large body of performers especially trained to fulfill his purpose .	256.35718
thus in prokofieff the union of soviet socialist republics produced one of the great composers of the twentieth century .	36.433765
that his moods , even in his early years , are those of his people , does him honor , as his music honors those who inspired it .	180.23878
that he mastered every aspect of his medium according to his own great talents and contemporary judgments , is a good and solid symbol of his people under the tremendous pressures of proclaiming and practising the rigors of a new culture	119.34024
and perhaps of even greater significance -- his music is strong 20th-century evidence of the effectiveness of evolution , based on a broad traditionalism for the creative art of music .	86.04109
april 10 marked a memorable date in new york ' s musical history -- indeed in the musical history of the entire eastern united states .	60.796513
on that date the musicians emergency fund , organized to furnish employment for musicians unable to obtain engagements during the depression and to provide relief for older musicians who lost their fortunes in the stock market crash , observed its 30th anniversary .	98.155464
roy mason is essentially a landscape painter whose style and direction has a kinship with the english watercolorists of the early nineteenth century , especially the beautifully patterned art of john sell cotman .	90.33653
and like this english master , mason realizes his subjects in large , simplified masses which , though they seem effortless , are in reality the result of skilled design born of hard work and a thorough distillation of the natural form that inspired them .	298.00626
as a boy roy mason began the long process of extracting the goodness of the out-of-doors , its tang of weather , its change of seasons , its variable moods .	156.86441
his father , a professional engraver and an amateur landscape painter , took his sons on numerous hunting expeditions , and imparted to them his knowledge and love of nature .	94.27477
out of this background of hunting and fishing , it was only natural that roy first painted subjects he knew best hunters in the field , fishermen in the stream , ducks and geese on the wing -- almost always against a vast backdrop of weather landscape .	117.64174
it is this subject matter that has brought mason a large and enthusiastic following among sportsmen , but it is his exceptional performance with this motif that commends him to artists and discerning collectors .	172.06035
