the question , however , cannot be ignored for long .	150.05646
the basic problem involved is that a college setting up a graduate school must have an entirely separate faculty for the advanced degree .	170.72495
most professors in the course must , naturally , again have a higher degree than the course offers .	175.73642
one solution is the aquisition of degrees in education but it is a poor substitute .	79.000145
it is a sort of academic ring-around-a-rosy and you solve it .	258.3894
this brings us to the question of accreditation of art schools in general .	91.82277
only the independent art schools , that is , those not connected with any university or college , receive severe and separate investigation before accreditation by the various regional organizations .	261.0824
it has been the custom for most universities to stretch the blanket of accreditation for their liberal arts school to cover the shivering body of their fine arts department .	112.36212
this , plus the habit of many schools of simply adding interior design to the many subjects of their home economics department , yet , nevertheless , claiming that they teach interior design , has contributed to the low repute of many university courses in interior design .	111.17975
in spite of this , many universities offer adequate and even distinguished courses in the subject .	189.31856
there will be no mitigation of these offences until all art schools , whether independent or attached to universities have separate accreditation -- as do medical schools -- by an art accreditation group such as the `` national association of schools of art ' ' .	213.36151
independent art schools granting degrees must , naturally , follow this with academic accreditation by the appropriate regional group .	139.27695
how long has it been since you reviewed the objectives of your benefit and service program ? ?	71.41132
have you permitted it to become a giveaway program rather than one that has the goal of improved employee morale and , consequently , increased productivity ? ?	293.98785
what effort do you make to assess results of your program ? ?	32.542015
do you measure its relation to reduced absenteeism , turnover , accidents , and grievances , and to improved quality and output ? ?	96.71331
have you set specific objectives for your employee publication ? ?	63.377407
is it larger or fancier than you really need ? ?	51.16206
are you using the most economical printing methods , paper , etc . .	68.05216
are there other , cheaper communications techniques that could be substituted ? ?	46.97061
has your attitude toward employee benefits encouraged an excess of free `` government ' ' work in your plant ? ?	117.83352
is your purchasing agent offering too much free-buying service for employees ? ?	131.8449
when improvements are recommended in working conditions -- such as lighting , rest rooms , eating facilities , air-conditioning -- do you try to set a measure of their effectiveness on productivity ? ?	79.673256
when negotiating with your union , do you make sure employees have a choice between new benefits and their cents-per-hour cost in wages .	276.42807
can you consider restricting any additional employee benefits to those paid for by profit-sharing money , such as was done in the union contract recently signed by american motors corporation ? ?	244.65239
do your employees understand all the benefits to which your insurance entitles them ? ?	39.21562
are they encouraged to take full legal advantage of these benefits ? ?	61.608772
have you publicized the cents-per-hour value of the company ' s share of insurance premiums ? ?	44.78681
when did you last compare your present premium costs with the costs of insurance from other sources ? ?	41.774586
can your insurance company aid you in reducing administrative costs ? ?	24.491776
do you try to maintain the principle of employee-contributed ( as opposed to fully company-paid ) programs ? ?	181.67493
do you protect your holiday privileges with an attendance requirement both before and after the holiday ? ?	131.58167
do you plan to limit additional holidays to area and/or industrial patterns ? ?	821.12885
have you investigated the possibility of moving midweek holidays forward to monday or back to friday in order to have an uninterrupted work week ? ?	181.95375
are you carefully policing wash-up time and rest periods to be certain that all other time is productive ? ?	119.567
are you watching work schedules for boiler operators , guards , and other 24-hour-day , 7-day-week operations in order to minimize overtime ? ?	136.72128
are you careful to restrict the number of people on leave at one time so that your total employment obligation is minimized ? ?	212.83302
have you considered using vending equipment to replace or reduce the number of cafeteria employees ? ?	82.252075
what are the possibilities for operating your cafeteria for a single shift only and relying upon vending machines or prepackaged sandwiches for the second- and third-shift operations ? ?	110.97958
have you checked the cost of subcontracting your cafeteria operation in order to save administrative costs ? ?	93.65252
are there possibilities of having cafeteria help work part-time on custodial or other jobs ? ?	49.6441
can staggered lunch periods relieve the capacity strain on your feeding facilities ? ?	82.47555
would it be feasible to limit the menu in order to reduce feeding costs ? ?	28.567854
have you considered gradual withdrawal of subsidies to your in-plant feeding operation ? ?	271.10577
are you utilizing cafeteria space for company meetings or discussions ? ?	62.869476
are your expenses in this area commensurate with the number of employees who benefit from your program ? ?	58.932632
have you audited your program recently to weed out those phases that draw least participation ? ?	706.2582
do employees contribute their share of money to recreational facilities ? ?	81.9148
have you considered delegating operational responsibility to your employee association and carefully restricting your plant ' s financial contribution ? ?	77.25165
could an employee ' s garden club take over partial care of plant grounds ? ?	90.83075
would a camera club be useful in taking pictures pertinent to plant safety ? ?	199.96254
are you spending too much money on team uniforms that benefit only a few employees ? ?	66.852066
are you utilizing vending machine proceeds to help pay for your program ? ?	78.11648
do you know the trend in your cost of maintaining access roads and parking lots ? ?	57.121784
if you use parking attendants , can they be replaced by automatic parking gates ? ?	44.49783
will your local bus company erect and/or maintain the bus stops at your plant ? ?	69.99348
if you provide inter-plant transportation , can this be replaced by available public transportation ? ?	179.49217
if you use company transportation to meet trains or to haul visitors , would taxis be cheaper ? ?	143.81117
how efficient and necessary are your intra-company vehicles ? ?	23.454323
can part-time drivers be assigned to other productive work ? ?	100.60493
which is more economical for your plant -- a vacation shutdown or spaced vacations that require extra employees for vacation fill-ins ? ?	72.2879
can vacations be spaced throughout the 12 months to minimize the number of employee fill-ins ? ?	29.265633
do you insist that unneeded salary employees take their vacations during plant shutdowns ? ?	110.0116
what can your sales and purchasing departments do to curtail orders , shipments , and receipts during vacation shutdown periods ? ?	84.75296
is an arbitrary retirement age of 65 actually costing your plant money ? ?	95.2378
what sort of effort do you make to assure that older or disabled workers are fully productive ? ?	129.92868
would early retirement of non-productive , disabled employees reduce the number of make-work jobs ? ?	83.787926
will your union accept seniority concessions in assigning work for older or disabled employees ? ?	73.04911
can you share medical facilities and staff with neighboring plants ? ?	15.709876
if you have a full-time doctor now , can he be replaced with a part-time doctor or one who serves on a fee-per-case basis only ? ?	108.5379
can your plant nurse be replaced by a trained first-aid man who works full-time on some other assignment ? ?	92.16039
do you rigidly distinguish between job- and non-job-connected health problems and avoid treating the latter ? ?	197.29732
are you indiscriminantly offering unnecessary medical services -- flu shots , sun lamp treatments , etc . ? ?	73.48158
if you have an annual or regular physical examination program , is it worth what it is costing you ? ?	57.898914
consider what you can afford to spend and what your goals are before setting up or revamping your employee benefit program .	116.2276
too many plant officials are all too eager to buy a package program from an insurance company simply because it works for another plant .	211.33994
but even if that other plant employs the same number of workers and makes the same product , there are other facts to consider .	71.61971
in what section of the country are you located ? ?	44.698772
are you in a rural or urban area ? ?	6.456936
these factors can make the difference between waste and efficiency in any benefit program .	389.19235
above all , don ' t set up extravagant fringe benefits just to buy employee good will .	648.44025
unions stress fringe benefits , but the individual hourly worker prefers cash every time .	83.28646
some plants go overboard on one type of fringe -- say a liberal retirement plan -- and find themselves vulnerable elsewhere .	312.08694
if you want credit for your employee services program , let your workers know what they ' re entitled to .	216.74141
this can be done by stories in your house organs , posters , special publications , letters to workers ' homes as well as by word of mouth through your chain of command .	190.48787
hallmark cards , inc . , kansas city , mo . , has a do-it-yourself quiz game called `` benefit bafflers ' ' , which it distributes to employees .	48.752895
m & r dietetic laboratories , inc . , columbus , gives all its workers a facsimile checkbook -- each check showing the amount the company spends on a particular fringe .	327.434
u . s . rubber company , new york , passes out a form itemizing the value of benefits .	44.086174
the blue-collar worker thus knows his insurance package , for example , costs $227 . 72 .	136.8073
have the insurance company or your own accounting department break down the cost of your insurance package periodically .	180.36473
you may find certain coverage costing much more than is economically feasible , thereby alerting you to desirable revisions .	165.33986
check to see if some of your benefits -- such as on-the-job disability pay -- can be put on a direct payment rather than an insured basis at a savings to you .	127.525055
it can put an end to marginal claims which play havoc with your insurance rates .	273.047
also , beware of open-end policies , especially in the medical field .	20.874254
this will mean that every time there ' s an increase in hospital rates your cost will go up in like manner .	194.60924
don ' t go overboard on insurance that pays benefits only upon death .	254.31369
generally , your employee will greatly appreciate benefits that protect him during his working life or during retirement .	211.3214
in granting bereavement leaves , specify the maximum time off and list what the worker ' s relation to the deceased must be to qualify .	123.88953
thus , you avoid headaches when an employee wants off for his fourth cousin ' s funeral .	84.09837
also , reserve the right to demand proof of death despite the fact that you ' ll probably never use it .	88.7146
coffee breaks can be a real headache if not regulated .	127.37482
vending machines can alleviate the long hike to the cafeteria during the break with resulting waste of production time .	348.51395
if coffee is sold at the cafeteria , let a few workers in each department get it for the whole group .	232.53537
consider installing supplemental serving lines in production areas .	5.5098133
make sure milk for the coffee is placed in dispensers rather than in containers , if you are supplying the coffee .	63.8307
otherwise , you may be saddled with a good-size milk bill by milk drinkers .	215.09964
keep the retirement age flexible so skilled craftsmen such as tool and die makers can be kept on the job for the convenience of the company .	57.968365
and so deadheads on the payroll can be eased out at the earliest possible age .	222.2322
make sure you have minimum age and time-on-the-job requirements tied into your pension plan .	222.74005
younger men usually don ' t think of pensions as an important job benefit factor anyhow and they ' re liable to change jobs several times before settling down .	171.35342
choose carefully between contributory or non-contributory pension plans .	4.195601
there are two sides of a coin for this decision .	123.60965
workers usually think more of a plan they contribute to .	128.25789
and they can at least collect the money they put in , plus interest , when they leave the company .	131.56511
a non-contributory plan usually won ' t pay off for the worker until he retires .	72.67617
thus , there is an added incentive to stay on the job .	11.945137
make sure you don ' t pay for holidays that occur when an employee would not otherwise be working .	121.467514
these include leaves of absences , illnesses , and layoffs .	172.11844
consider adopting a system of holidays in which time off is granted with an eye to minimum inconvenience to the operation of the plant .	123.8362
it ' s usually not too hard to sell workers on this as it gives them longer holiday periods .	208.65836
for example , the friday after thanksgiving can be substituted for washington ' s birthday .	41.66072
this reduces the number of expensive plant shutdowns and startups .	63.20692
require each employee to work his last shift both before and after the holiday to be eligible for pay .	127.30966
consider using vending machines rather than subsidized cafeterias .	3.798419
latest models serve hot meals at reasonable prices , and at a profit to you .	42.985786
if a concessionaire runs the cafeteria , keep an eye out for quality and price .	188.6635
if the soup tastes like dishwater , your employees won ' t blame the concessionaire .	90.319
check your cafeteria location to make sure it ' s convenient for most employees .	46.790802
you may save valuable production minutes with a change .	83.59331
spread your vacation period over the widest possible span of time or shut the plant down for two weeks .	145.01332
this will cut the expense of vacation replacements .	8.680409
and with the shutdown method there will be no argument as to who gets the choice vacation dates .	255.97668
also make sure you have reasonable requirements as to hours worked before a production employee is entitled to a vacation .	190.14139
you might try providing standard vacation time off but make the vacation pay depend on the number of hours worked in the previous year .	213.1059
the long and ever-increasing column of sportsmen is now moving into a new era .	84.469124
modern times have changed the world beyond recognition .	8.778259
the early years of the twentieth century seem very far away .	57.992085
but with all the changes in philosophy , dress and terrain -- a few things remain constant , including the devotion of americans to the great field sports , hunting and fishing .	186.79031
as the generations move on , clothes become more suitable for the enjoyment of outdoor sports .	32.03839
sporting firearms change , markedly for the better .	47.68843
just as modern transportation has outmoded the early studebaker covered wagon , the demand of today ' s sportsmen and women has necessitated changes in their equipment .	114.19183
the american firearms and ammunition manufacturers through diligent research and technical development have replaced the muzzle loader and slow-firing single-shot arms with modern fast firing auto-loaders , extremely accurate bolt , lever , and slide action firearms .	137.35828
and millions of rounds of entirely new and modern small-arms ammunition , designed for today ' s hunting and target shooting .	115.94966
and due to modern resource-use and game management practices , there is still game to shoot , even with the ever-expanding encroachment on land and water .	110.33321
present conservation practices regard wildlife , not as an expendable natural resource , but as an annual harvest to be sown and also reaped .	130.33165
unlimited game bags are possible and legal in more than 40 states , on shooting preserves ( one of the newer phases of modern game-management ) for five and six months each year .	99.1833
close to two million game birds were harvested on 1 , 500 commercial and private shooting preserves , and on state game commission-controlled upland game areas during the 1960-61 season .	153.13686
the shooting development program of the sporting arms and ammunition manufacturers ' institute has successfully published these facts in all major outdoor magazines , many national weeklies and the trade papers .	105.0919
the most effective way to develop more places for more sportsmen to shoot is to encourage properly managed shooting preserves .	163.8554
this has been the aim of the director of the shooting development program , the new york staff of the sportsmen ' s service bureau , and the saami shooting preserve field consultants since the start of the program in 1954 .	59.05762
following the kick-off of saami ' s shooting development program in 1954 , a most interesting meeting took place in washington , d . c . .	33.231674
the group known as the american association for health , , physical education , and recreation ( a division of the national education association ) initiated a conference which brought together representatives of the national rifle association , saami and the american fishing tackle manufacturers .	109.648674
this meeting was called to determine how these groups might cooperate to launch what is known as the outdoor education project .	154.97589
the outdoor education project took cognizance of the fact , so often overlooked , that athletic activities stressed in most school programs have little or no relationship to the physical and mental needs and interests of later life .	167.42914
the various team sports assuredly have their place in every school , and they are important to proper physical development .	68.12346
but with the exception of professional athletes , few contact sports and physical education activities in our schools have any carryover in the adult life of the average american man or woman .	127.00481
following a vigorous campaign of interpretation and leadership development by oep director dr . julian smith , today thousands of secondary schools , colleges and universities have shooting and hunting education in their physical education and recreation programs .	156.76624
saami ' s financial support since 1955 has contributed to the success of this project in education .	35.724957
personnel assigned through the shooting development program have proudly participated in over 53 state and regional workshops , at which hundreds of school administrators , teachers , professors , and recreational leaders have been introduced to outdoor education .	89.96358
considering that the current school-age potential is 23 million youths , the project and its message on hunting and shooting education have many more to reach .	304.33475
in 1959 saami ' s shooting development program announced a new activity designed to expose thousands of teen-age boys and girls to the healthy fun enjoyed through the participation in the shooting sports .	123.72075
this program is now nationally known as `` teen hunter clubs ' ' .	9.78542
teen hunter clubs were initially sponsored by affiliated members of the allied merchandising corporation .	78.780785
the first program was sponsored by abraham & strauss , hempstead , new york , under the direction of special events director jennings dennis .	35.971714
other pilot programs were conducted by a & s , babylon , new york	106.77516
other thc activities followed , conducted by shopping centers , department stores , recreation equipment dealers , radio-tv stations , newspapers , and other organizations interested in the need existing to acquaint youngsters with the proper use of sporting firearms and the development of correct attitudes and appreciations related to hunting and wise use of our natural resources .	89.13179
saami ' s field men have served as consultants and/or have participated in 75 teen hunter club activities which have reached over 40 , 000 enthusiastic young americans .	101.790344
through the efforts of saami ' s shooting development program these shooting activities , and many others , including assists in the development of public and privately financed shooting parks , trap and skeet leagues , rifle and pistol marksmanship programs have been promoted , to mention only a few .	108.825005
the continuation and expansion of the shooting development program will assure to some degree that national and community leaders will be made aware of the ever-growing need for shooting facilities and activities for hunting and shooting in answer to public demand .	100.40063
while individual sportsmen are aware of this situation , too many of our political , social , educational and even religious leaders too often forget it .	91.59878
help is needed from dealers , at the grass-roots level .	169.64136
the american gun and ammunition producers sponsor a successful promotional program through their industry trade association .	264.6182
since saami ' s conception in 1926 , and more specifically since the adoption of the shooting development program in 1954 , millions of dollars and promotional man-hours have gone into the development of more places to shoot for more youths and adults .	66.25418
we trust that you , as a gun and ammunition dealer , have benefited through additional sales of equipment .	80.441895
are you getting top dollar from the shooting sports ? ?	16.868393
are you looking ahead to the exploding market of millions of american boys and girls , who will grow up to enjoy a traditional american way of life -- ranging the fields with a fine american gun and uniformly excellent ammunition ? ?	119.12397
is your sporting firearms and ammunition department primed for the expanding horizons ? ?	88.86935
would you like to organize teen hunters clubs , shooting programs , and have information on seasons including six months of hunting with unlimited game bags on shooting preserves ? ?	100.94111
we were camping a few weeks ago on cape hatteras campground in that land of pirates , seagulls and bluefish on north carolina ' s famed outer banks .	129.357
this beach campground with no trees or hills presents a constant camping show with all manner of equipment in actual use .	175.52306
with the whole camp exposed to view we could see the variety of canvas shelters in which americans are camping now .	165.91458
there were umbrella tents , wall tents , cottage tents , station wagon tents , pup tents , pop tents , baker tents , tents with exterior frames , camper trailers , travel trailers , and even a few surplus parachutes serving as sunshades over entire family camps .	55.890827
moving around camp we saw all kinds of camp stoves , lanterns , coolers , bedding , games , fishing tackle , windbreaks and sunshades .	59.352863
we saw similar displays in the other three campgrounds in this 70-mile-long national seashore recreation area .	269.2505
dealers would do well to visit such a campground often , look at the equipment and talk with the campers .	112.92955
here you begin to appreciate the scope of the challenges and possibilities facing the industry .	87.233574
almost every official who reflects on it thinks this movement of americans to canvas dwellings opens one of the most promising of all outdoor markets .	91.39268
you read various guesses on how many americans are camping .	34.638836
the number depends on who is talking at the moment .	12.75131
the figures range as high as 15 million families .	6.9254966
i ' ve heard 10 million mentioned often , but i ' m more inclined to think there may be a total of some five to seven million families camping .	101.10648
seven million families would total 30 million americans or more .	90.81148
consider the equipment needed to protect this many from the weather , to make their cooking easy and their sleeping comfortable .	104.57522
harassed state park officials often have more campers than they know what to do with .	196.28107
they are struggling to meet the demand for camping space , but families are being turned away , especially on holiday weekends .	197.17581
the national parks , always popular camping places , are facing the same pressure .	45.37469
the national park service hopes by 1966 to have 30 , 000 campsites available for 100 , 000 campers a day -- almost twice what there are at present .	133.78647
the u . s . forest service cares for hundreds of thousands of campers in its 149 national forests and is increasing its facilities steadily .	234.99634
they bring their families and tents and camp kitchens and bedding .	9.4399395
they bring their fishing rods and binoculars and bathing suits .	304.78278
they come prepared for family fun because americans in ever-growing numbers are learning that here is the way to a fine economical vacation that becomes a family experience of lasting importance .	148.88295
there are a half dozen reasons helping to account for the migration to the campgrounds .	212.39546
among them , according to the u . s . department of commerce , are ( 1 ) shorter work weeks , ( 2 ) higher pay , ( 3 ) longer paid vacations , ( 4 ) better transportation , ( 5 ) earlier retirement , and ( 6 ) more education .	99.236755
the more people learn about their country , the more they want to learn .	69.14812
camping is family fun , and it is helping more americans see more of the country than they ever saw before .	290.12848
but make no mistake about it , the first reason people turn to camping is one of economy .	347.51944
here is the promise of a vacation trip they can afford .	163.42342
the american automobile association , computing the cost for two people to vacation by automobile , comes up with an average daily expenditure figure of $29 .	137.16473
the aaa then splits it down this way $10 . 50 for meals , $9 . 50 for lodging , $7 for gas and oil , and $2 for tips and miscellaneous .	154.4206
what does the camping couple do to this set of figures ? ?	134.29504
the $9 . 50 for lodging they save .	51.79133
because they prepare their own meals they also keep in their pockets a good portion of that $10 . 50 food bill along with most of the tip money .	321.71603
the automobile expenses are about the only vacationing cost they can ' t either eliminate or pare down drastically by camping along the way .	132.01556
where americans used to think of a single vacation each summer , they now think about how many vacations they can have .	137.04646
long weekends enable many to get away from home for three or four days several times a year .	137.30032
and even if they stay in resorts part of the time , they might , if the right salesman gets them in tow , develop a yearning to spice the usual vacation fare with a camping trip into the wide open spaces .	76.58683
it would be a mistake to sell those thousands of beginning campers on the idea they ' re buying the comforts of home .	61.980488
home is the place to find the comforts of home .	21.743568
they ' re buying fun and adventure and family experiences .	199.1257
but it would also be a mistake for them not to realize how comfortable camping has become .	256.3259
this is no longer a way of life for the bearded logger and the wandering cowboy .	74.59936
today ' s campers want comforts , and they have them .	73.796974
and this helps explain why so many people are now going camping .	216.87024
it ' s fun , and it ' s easy -- so easy that there is time left after cooking , and tent keeping , for the women to get out and enjoy outdoor fun with their families .	124.76241
neither are beds , thanks to air mattresses and sleeping bags .	12.426169
neither are shelters , because there is one to meet the needs of every camper or prospective camper .	63.570568
but there is still the sometimes complex problem of helping campers choose the best equipment for their individual needs .	173.5998
throughout history , the man who showed superior performance has become the commander of others -- for good or bad .	120.6396
since the industrial revolution , when factories emerged , this classical pattern has been followed .	103.80056
there have always been tales of disillusionment -- the competent technician who became an administrator , willingly or not , and found he didn ' t like it	92.44939
the scientist who rebelled against the personnel and paper work	3789.7346
and much more commonly in recent years , the engineer who found that other duties interfered with -- or eliminated -- his engineering contributions .	300.59598
there have been many extremely competent men who have been converted into very incompetent managers or submerged in paper work , to their own and the public ' s dissatisfaction and loss .	88.91437
this has been more evident since our products have incorporated astronomically increased technology .	166.83826
the remedies have been many and varied -- attempts to teach management techniques -- either in plant , at special schools , or in university `` crash ' ' courses -- provision of management-trained assistants or associates .	228.62338
but the realization has been growing that these are not the complete answer .	77.10853
some men have no talent for or interest in management	335.0905
forcing them into management can only create trouble .	12.14897
the old shop adage still holds `` a good mechanic is usually a bad boss ' ' .	27.556793
yet our economy clings inexorably to recognition of managerial status as the gage of success .	125.20576
labor fights to change its collar from blue to white .	85.65898
all grades of management seek more resounding titles and incomes because of social pressures .	158.36475
as several recent books have over-emphasized , we have become the most status-conscious nation in the world .	47.38102
what can be done for the `` individual contributor ' ' who is extremely important -- and likely to be more so -- in the operation of the technically oriented company ? ?	83.01997
he is usually conscious of the social pressures at home and outside	141.9075
usually concerned about america ' s belief that attainment and success are measured in dollars and titles .	256.0044
yet titles are traditionally given only to management men , and income tends to rise with title .	155.29376
even the college professor in america has been affected .	24.179228
it is , as one engineer says , `` indeed a difficult thing for the engineer to accept that he can go as far on his technical merit as he could employing managerial skills .	88.282524
this difficulty arises even though we can give examples of men who have actually followed this course .	299.91876
this leads one to conclude , as you have , that there is inevitably more prestige in a management position in the minds of our people ' ' .	69.43552
nobody should be more able to answer the questions on this score than engineering vice-presidents and chief engineers .	215.99188
so we asked such men in major companies in the design field to offer their opinions on the `` dual-road-up ' ' problem -- and more importantly -- their solutions .	125.244385
in the paragraphs that follow , we quote from 32 men who are identified on the final page .	57.39202
among the more familiar plans for dual-channel advancement is that of general electric .	80.489395
there is no one point in a man ' s career at which he must select either the technical or the managerial path upward .	125.72331
further , the management path does not open the door to higher opportunities than are offered by the more technical path .	243.88306
it is common to shift back and forth , working up through a number of supervisory and individual-contributor positions .	145.8651
actually , there are a number of individual-contributor positions in both operating departments and in the company-wide `` services ' ' operation that are filled by men with successful managerial experience who are currently broadening their capabilities .	187.24529
also , moving into a managerial position does not necessarily end a man ' s recognition as a technical expert .	75.82002
as examples at ge glen b . warren , formerly manager of the turbine division , widely recognized as a turbine designer .	49.33242
the late w . r . g . baker , a pioneer in television design and long-time vp & gm of the electronics division , and later , by his own choice , an individual consultant .	81.85538
harold e . strang , expert in switchgear design , for a long period vp & gm of the measurements & industrial products division , and who currently , approaching retirement , is vice-president and consulting engineer in the switchgear & control division .	96.73162
in the ge plan , a number of individual contributors have positions and compensation higher than those of many managers .	116.474266
westinghouse has a similar system , with two classifications representing various levels of competence on the strictly technical side consulting engineer or scientist , as the case may be , and advisory engineer or scientist .	106.466354
many companies have systems , particularly in r & d , which work more or less well , depending upon size and actual belief in the policy on the part of administration , as will be abundantly apparent in subsequent quotations .	101.9433
another factor that may hold hope is for parallel recognition is , as one man says it `` that the fad for educating top people along managerial lines is yielding to the technically trained approach ' ' .	178.7358
one company instituted , early in 1959 , a vertical classification system consisting of four levels .	285.55515
there is no formal equivalence to the supervisory ranks	30.996464
the top non-supervisory level , senior staff engineer , enjoys status and pay ranging up to that for the second level of engineering supervision .	119.35424
the second level , senior engineer , rates slightly below first-level supervision .	827.1773
the expectation is that first-level supervisors will be selected in approximately equal numbers from the second and third engineering level , with very few coming from the first level .	119.63378
the company expects to extend upward both compensation and status for non-supervisory engineers , but probably not into executive levels .	324.58456
in this organization , about half of the engineers with 15 or more years of employment are in supervision , engineering or elsewhere .	173.15286
this reflects the very heavy engineering content of the products -- which are not military .	103.32909
`` we have over 20 divisions -- each of which has an engineering department headed by a chief engineer .	151.1297
we have set up a central r & d department , as well as engineering-management departments -- about 80 people working on problems related to those of our plants .	181.34741
a separate research department is , of course , confined to new or future designs .	397.69708
part of this headquarters staff , however , are engineering managers who work between divisional chief engineers and headquarters management .	161.14476
these headquarters engineers , headed by the vice-president -- engineering , counsel and advise divisional managers and chief engineers on product problems as well as aid with design	150.91185
and many are engineers who have been advanced from the divisions .	65.79341
they must learn to wear several hats , so to speak , working with management , sales and engineering problems related to the product .	133.48347
`` we do not have people in our organization termed ' consultants ' or ' fellows ' , who are specialists in one particular technical subject .	144.86868
i suppose it is because we are just not big enough .	86.1777
we have a few ' consultants ' -- retired engineers retained and called in on certain problems .	528.2607
the only ' fellows ' in our company are those who have been honored by asme , aiee or aiche .	63.33291
i am sure that the engineer who enters management is nearly always opening the door to greater possibilities than he would have as a technical specialist -- because of his wider accountability ' ' .	99.089035
`` we have tried to make both paths attractive , so that good men could find opportunity and satisfaction in either .	216.68054
one way to formalize this is in the job structure .	244.86469
we have these positions , which compare directly af	59.991703
`` above these jobs we have chief engineer for the company and vice-president of engrg , r & aj .	104.82729
the latter jobs include major management responsibilities and have been filled by those who have come up primarily through the engineering-management side .	180.36336
we have not yet succeeded in establishing recognition of technical specialization comparable to our higher levels of management , but i believe we will trend in this direction but not to exceed vice-president ' ' .	66.17256
approximately four years ago , we initiated a dual ladder of advancement for technical persons .	112.493835
the highest position is known as a ' research scientist .	10.783323
the primary deterrent appears to lie with the technical people themselves , and their concept of what constitutes status in present-day society .	188.1794
scientists who agitate hardest for technical recognition are often the most reluctant to accept it .	30.633492
we have discovered that the outward trappings such as private offices and private secretaries are extremely important	318.32684
and although we have attempted to provide these status symbols , support of the ' dual-ladder ' plan has been half-hearted despite the creation of a salary potential for a research scientist commensurate with that of men in top managerial positions .	168.33092
`` a serious problem accompanying the technical-ladder approach is the difficulty of clearly defining responsibilities and standards of performance for each level .	157.16936
with no set standards , there is the tendency to promote to the next highest level when the top of a salary band is reached regardless of performance .	135.02531
promotion is too often based on longevity and time in salary grade instead of merit .	274.8899
if no specific organization plan exists limiting the number of scientists at each salary level , the result is a department top-heavy with high-level , high-salaried personnel ' ' .	108.4647
`` we have two approaches for the technical man the position of staff engineer , which is rated as high in salary as department manager	151.93202
and an administrative organization to take the routine load away from department managers and project engineers as much as possible , thus allowing them more time for strictly technical work .	213.62407
these are only halfway measures , and the answer will come when some way is found to allow the technical man in industry to progress without limit in salary and prestige ' ' .	260.8472
`` we have made limited application of the ' parallel ladder ' plan .	649.7488
the highest rated non-supervisory engineering title is ' research engineer .	37.68903
the salary schedule permits remuneration greater than the average paid to the first level of engineering supervision ( engineering section head ) .	54.060818
we also have an ' engineering section head -- research engineer ' classification which has salary possibilities equivalent to that of a research engineer .	331.38184
above this point there is no generally used parallel ladder .	147.44116
`` we also do a number of things to build up the prestige of the engineer as a ' professional ' and also to give public recognition to individual technical competence .	160.36143
these include encouragement of , and assistance to , the engineer in preparation and publication of technical papers .	122.852104
we have two media for publicizing individual technical activity , a magazine widely distributed both within and without the company , and an information bulletin for engineering personnel distributed to the homes of all engineers .	179.89928
publicity is given to the award of patents to our engineers and financial support is provided for individual membership in technical societies .	105.68055
`` a recent , and more pertinent action , has been the establishment of a technical staff reporting to the vice-president for engineering .	53.078175
this function is staffed by engineers chosen for their technical competence and who have the title , member of the technical staff .	61.474403
salaries compare favorably with those paid to the first two or three levels of management .	69.8749
additional symbols of status are granted , such as reserved parking , distinctive badge passes authorizing special privileges , and a difference in the treatment of financial progress through merit .	117.25453
`` we presently are involved in inaugurating a new development center .	113.42351
operations of this nature offer the best opportunity to recognize scientific status .	22.563976
all scientific staff members will have the title , ' research-staff member .	365.87344
the salary level of an individual within the group will reflect the scientific community ' s acceptance of him as an authority in his scientific field .	115.72983
contrary to usual organization-position evaluations , the position to which research-staff members report administratively will not necessarily encompass the duties of the research-staff member , therefore , are not necessarily evaluated as highly .	154.93533
`` these recent steps do not offer the possibility of extension to the great number of senior engineers who have displayed technical competence .	59.7272
it is doubtful that the complete solution to the over-all problem can result entirely from company efforts .	281.86545
fundamental to the difficulty of creating the desired prestige is the fact that , in the business community , prestige and status are conferred in proportion to the authority that one man has over others and the extent of which he participates in the management functions ' ' .	73.58449
sixty miles north of new york city where the wooded hills of dutchess county meet the broad sweep of the hudson river there is a new home development called `` oakwood heights ' ' .	53.97018
as a matter of fact you could probably find a new home development in every populated county in the country with three-bedroom ranch style cottages in the $14 , 000 range .	208.58623
but oakwood heights is unique in one particular .	24.671621
its oil for heating is metered monthly to each home from a line that starts at a central storage point .	256.68036
this is a pilot operation sponsored by a new entity chartered in delaware as the tri-state pipeline corporation , with principal offices in new york state .	77.87652
its president is otis m . waters , partner in the law firm of timen & waters , 540-k chrysler bldg . , new york city .	111.57068
vice-president is louis berkman and the secretary-treasurer is mark ritter .	58.74121
ritter is the builder of oakwood heights and president of kahler-craft distributors , inc . , newburgh , n . y . .	44.010777
the idea of a central tank with lines to each house is not in itself a novelty .	69.084114
not a year goes by but what several local companies in the u . s . and canada , even overseas , write to fueloil & oil heat to inquire if it ' s feasible and where it is being done .	54.599243
its editors only knew of one example to point to , a public housing development of 278 homes in new haven described by john schulz in the march , 1950 issue .	87.56193
this has survived the years but there has been considerable concern among the tenants over the fact that the oil was not metered .	81.32785
rather the monthly total consumption was divided and charged on the basis of number of rooms and persons in the family .	32.250156
common complaints included `` mrs . murphy ' ' leaving her windows open all the time , a fresh air fan , or the family was visiting `` aunt minnie ' ' with the house shut up but they still paid the same rate for oil .	114.380714
as a result of that attitude , others have been discouraged from trying central distribution .	266.4332
a new low capacity meter is the key that unlocks the situation at oakwood heights .	74.83535
called a `` slo-flo ' ' meter it was designed for this job by power plus industries of los angeles , a key individual being don nelson .	267.84686
tri-state has acquired its exclusive distribution for the northern , principal heating states .	488.23383
there ' s an advantage in having a firm like tri-state headed by a lawyer .	131.95224
the earlier new haven development was public housing , so it easily leaped over the problems met in a private venture .	110.568115
these have to do with property rights , municipal official attitudes and a host of others .	68.96526
in working out the practical legal conclusions president waters was not thinking only of this pilot project , for it is planned to duplicate this program or system in other builder developments nationally .	149.28127
it is always difficult , or at least time-consuming , to get approval of any kind of line under a public street , as one example .	136.1982
to overcome this , the builder lays and completes the street himself , then deeds it to the community while retaining a perpetual easement for the oil lines .	119.08676
when a family buys a home the title is subject to a perpetual easement to tri-state .	114.45994
for the central storage , tri-state buys one acre , buries its tanks and simply holds permanent title to that piece .	642.5325
in other words , the whole storage and pipeline system does not belong to the homeowners nor to the town but rather to tri-state .	130.54955
how does tri-state get its revenue from this plan ? ?	22.747744
it leases the whole facility to a large oil company , at least large enough to have a strong credit position .	61.425144
this first test is being leased for ten years but future projects will require at least 15 years .	108.95611
the amount paid by the oil company to tri-state for the use of its oil distribution system and the privilege of supplying all the homes , is subject to negotiation but naturally must be profitable to both parties .	119.67418
on this first venture the central storage is 20 , 000 gallons , in two tanks , or an average of 400 gallons for each of the 50 homes .	81.63744
the supplier delivers at his convenience in transport loads , so as to maintain two-to-three weeks reserve supply against weather contingencies .	228.04817
however , that is not all he has to do .	67.065094
he must undertake complete servicing of the oilheating equipment to assure fine heating .	173.66891
in the present project the heating is by circulating hot water from paragon boiler-burner units with summer-winter domestic hot water hookups .	130.91028
again , the oil man must read the meters at such intervals as he finds best .	209.2902
for this first development the supplier signing the lease is a major oil company but in turn the deal is being transferred for operation to its local fueloil distributor .	128.44879
the major gets the assured gallonage for the life of the lease and the distributor apparently can do well because delivery cost is low .	103.95753
the officers of the new corporation have naturally explored many angles , as well as personalities that might be affected .	67.183685
for example , the officials of poughkeepsie town ( township ) where the project is located think highly of it because it simplifies their snow clearing problem .	281.76965
the central storage is near a main artery quite easy to reach with large transports on a short crescent swing , with fewer trucks in the residential streets .	155.40495
the public service commission has ruled that this is not a public utility , subject to their many regulations .	68.39553
several financial institutions , both banks and insurance companies , have been sounded out .	92.28137
they like it and would supply most of the capital because of the long term leases by strong oil companies .	89.716995
the government housing agencies consider it feasible with one special stipulation .	461.90854
there must be a restriction in the deed to provide that the customer may not be charged more than the current market price for the oil , an obvious precaution , since the account is permanently wedded , just like with gas or electricity .	89.19386
for a few details of the system the lines are 1-1/4 ' ' ' ' x-tru-coat , a product of republic steel corp . , and all lines are welded .	92.85629
they are laid a minimum of 24 ' ' ' ' deep and in some areas four feet down , particularly under roads , to stay clear of all other piping such as water and sewers and to minimize shocks from heavy trucking .	213.80728
the meter is mounted high on the basement wall .	17.466743
its figures are a half inch high and very easy to read , even into tenth gallons .	99.02593
it will accommodate firing rates as low as a half gallon an hour .	68.42211
ritter , the builder , is convinced that the total cost of all the heating systems plus the oil distribution system is no greater than would be gas heating systems in the houses plus their lines and meters .	129.79121
he believes that this is a sound approach to gas competition in builder developments where gas is available .	372.61264
it would be pretty difficult to install a tri-state system in old neighborhoods , and that ' s an understatement .	113.16857
the job of getting property easements and street easements and the acre for the tanks would become pretty discouraging .	69.06716
but in a new development where everything starts from scratch the solutions are simple .	72.19393
what does tri-state actually want to do , now that it has the meters under franchise and certain phases of its piping system in the `` patent applied for ' ' stage ? ?	139.80885
it wants to interest builders and oil companies in the idea of including its facility in their new home projects , by financing and installing the storage , piping and meters , and leasing these for 15 years , with renewal options , to a strong oil company .	113.97619
it may also work in one other way -- by licensing its system patents and supplying the meters , letting the oil company or even the builder install the facilities .	123.026985
this whole development is certain to be of interest to the readers , for the idea has so often been mentioned , somewhat wistfully .	128.62537
but it ' s too early yet to go visit oakwood heights .	129.15126
only eight of the 50 houses were completed at the time of the editor ' s visit on june 8th	38.023254
the big tanks were at the site but still sunning themselves .	52.066578
a big mechanical ditcher was running the trenches , and the town building inspector was paying a friendly , if curious , visit .	142.76892
the oilheating industry is looking up , led by a revival of research and development .	65.350105
a primary ingredient in these fields is imagination , and tri-state pipeline corporation deserves a very good mark .	80.21315
every year about this time national gargle your cooling system week rolls around .	394.3317
it pays in the long ( hot ) run to take good care of the water works .	285.6077
first , drain that old coolant down the storm sewer .	23.711655
don ' t save the anti-freeze , even if it the expensive `` permanent ' ' type .	99.61613
the word means it won ' t boil away easily , nothing else .	418.61713
the rust inhibitors in the fluid are used up after one year , and you don ' t want to risk the rust that two years ' use could mean .	83.84156
if a lot of rust shows in the drain , use a good flushing cleaner .	121.5488
then fill the system and add a rust inhibitor .	19.73538
of course , you ' ll want to use the softest water you can in your radiators .	85.66809
now , check for leaks in your hoses and hose connections , around the freeze-out plugs , gaskets , water pump seals and heater fittings .	100.25635
next , run the engine and let it heat up so the thermostat opens , and then look for leaks again .	113.37365
be sure the bugs and dirt are blown out of the radiator fins .	22.949919
check the temperature gage and be sure it is working .	39.468945
if you use one of the new year-round cooling system fluids such as `` dowguard ' ' be sure to check it .	59.089085
dow says that the fluid can be used now for two years .	49.634266
check its inhibitor effectiveness before leaving it in during the summer .	114.68152
take precautions now , to be sure you avoid those unpleasant and costly heat breakdowns when the temperature zooms this summer .	438.79214
don ' t let your mechanics pull the thermostats out of those fueloil delivery trucks or installation rigs of yours .	297.89285
spring and summer may be here officially , but those thermos stay in .	171.15408
the fact is that removing and leaving out a thermostat from any water cooled vehicle , will greatly increase the fuel consumption , reduce power and contribute to spark plug fouling due to an accumulation of excessive carbon deposits on the insulators .	127.33475
if you run into excess plug fouling on one truck , check to be sure that the rig has a thermostat .	66.51549
the thermostat is important to get your engine up to operating temperature quickly , and to keep it running at its most efficient temperature through the proper circulation of the coolant .	144.23999
are you paying too much for your truck insurance ? ?	29.256456
there ' s a good chance you are doubling on some coverage , not taking discounts coming to you and not cutting some corners that can be cut .	213.85419
be careful that you keep adequate coverage , but look for places to save money .	124.0502
first go over the type of coverage you now have .	112.425476
look for these features which may mean you can save	244.89912
for example , don ' t pay in a truck policy for medical coverage that you may be paying for in a health and accident policy .	113.877106
does your policy have a lay-up clause ? ?	1.8957984
this means that if your insured vehicle is laid up for more than 30 days , insurance can be suspended and a proportionate return of your premium made to you .	102.70945
this applies to repair work of winter storage .	23.631975
with many company policies you get a fleet discount if you insure five or more rigs .	66.904564
usually premium reductions can be obtained by applying deductibles to your liability plan .	368.6344
for example if your bodily injury claims start payment after the first $250 , a 25% premium saving is often made .	313.61142
in the period since the end of world war 2 , -- a period coinciding with merchandising demands for the colorful , the unusual , and the original in signs and displays -- plastics have come on so strong that today they are the acknowledged leaders in the field .	129.48036
the importance of the sign industry to the plastics industry , however , is not in terms of volume alone .	64.30321
designers of signs and displays have shown a refreshing approach to the adaptation of plastics that has influenced the workings of other industries .	69.10982
many of today ' s developments in thermoforming stem from original work done with signs and displays	334.98172
the art of preprinting in distortion was similarly perfected by the sign makers	115.43882
and the reverse-surface decorating techniques now used for escutcheons , medallions , etc . , owes much to the field , as does the technology of designing with the light-transmitting properties of the transparent plastics .	94.23765
there is much that many industries can continue to learn from some of the more recent developments described below .	127.34834
the concept of trans-illumination ( as shown by the photo on p . 92 ) , as just one example , offers an entirely new approach to lighting problems -- no matter what industry is involved .	151.82578
according to a recent wall street journal survey , plastics units now account for more than 50% of all sign sales .	392.34378
five years ago , they had only 10% of the market , with the remainder firmly entrenched in the stronghold of neon tubing .	59.918633
and it ' s far from the end for plastics .	194.3255
industry sources are now estimating that 75% of the signs made during the 1960 ' s will be of plastic construction .	152.80971
evidence of this trend can best be seen in the recent activities of such leading companies in the field as advance neon sign co . , los angeles , calif . .	47.33903
four years ago , the company ' s entire line was devoted to neon signs	99.190765
from the volume standpoint , the total market represented by the sign industry is impressive .	174.76874
aggregate sales during 1960 reached approximately $500 million .	14.201207
currently , there are some 6000 companies in the field , ranging from small firms with a handful of employees to major concerns having complete facilities for production of metal , electrical , and plastic components .	98.26046
what accounts for the rapid growth of plastics in the sign and display field ? ?	28.738878
out of many factors which might be cited , five are most important 1 .	254.46617
plastics combine such properties as built-in color , light weight , optional transparency or translucency , resistance to corrosion , as well as the ease of fabrication .	113.37338
according to one major producer , materials for a typical plastic sign are approximately 25% less costly than for a comparable neon unit .	238.85034
a 3-by-6-ft . plastic sign weighs about 120 lb . , compared to 275-300 lb . for neon .	89.81515
the weight advantage , plus greater durability of the plastic unit , yields a saving of about one-fifth in shipping .	105.09391
the lighter weight also means less costly supports and mountings are needed .	108.06053
finally , maintenance costs on plastic signs are much lower than on fragile neon signs .	83.63134
they offer exceptional design freedom , making it possible to incorporate contours and details which give free range to the talents of the designer .	91.13587
vacuum- and pressure-formed sheet plastics fill the gap between cardboard and molded plastics .	17.064575
pre-decoration , low-cost molds , and the freedom to form large and small , thick and thin materials make plastics tailor-made for the industry .	190.37762
internal illumination , protected from the elements , gives them powerful visual appeal at night	219.80173
during daylight hours their brilliant colors command attention and interest .	73.48855
advances in equipment and fabrication techniques give the sign or display manufacturer an extremely wide choice of production techniques , ranging from injection molding for intricate , smaller-size , mass-production signs ( generally 5000 units is the minimum ) to vacuum and pressure forming for larger signs of limited runs .	257.2061
among the newest fabrication methods to enter the display field are expandable styrene molding and blow molding .	75.39777
for outdoor signs and displays , acrylic , with its outstanding optical characteristics , weather resistance and formability , strongly dominates the picture .	153.07976
at present , both the familiar cast acrylic and the newer extruded sheets are being used by sign manufacturers , with extruded now representing an estimated 10% of the total .	46.900852
( see panel , p . 166 , for a comparison .	111.24986
of interest is a recent announcement by du pont ' s polychemicals dept . of a new methyl methacrylate monomer designated as monocite h 100 , which was developed specifically for production of cast acrylic sheets for the sign and lighting industry .	153.82567
sheeting cast from this material reportedly weighs only one-third as much as glass , is impervious to all kinds of weather , and will not yellow .	80.88603
its high impact strength , even at low temperatures , resists chipping , cracking , and crazing , according to du pont .	88.389725
cellulose acetate butyrate is used extensively for vacuum-formed signs , background panels , and molded or formed letters because of its exceptional toughness , ease of forming , and excellent weathering properties .	144.8934
its clarity and good optical properties are other important factors .	19.558556
new to the field is a duplex type butyrate laminate in which the two sheets of the laminate are of different color .	39.72513
thermoforming the laminate and then sanding away the top layer is a quick and economical way to produce a two-color sign .	70.423676
( see mpl , mar . 1961 , p . 98 ) .	22.92832
for specialized types of displays , such as large three-dimensional units reproducing a product , package , human or animal figures , etc . , reinforced plastics and rotationally molded vinyl plastisols are other materials frequently used .	221.11249
a relative newcomer in outdoor signs is mylar polyester film , now used as a printed overlay for trans-illuminated signs ( see below ) .	63.72104
for outdoor signs and displays , where the problem of weathering resistance is no longer a factor , the choice of plastics is almost unlimited .	99.071175
here may be found regular and impact styrene , cellulose acetate , cellulose butyrate and cellulose propionate , acrylic , vinyl , expandable styrene foam , and polyethylene .	13.164492
the final choice of material depends upon such factors as costs , method of fabrication , degree of complexity , number of units required , time available for tooling , and projected life expectancy of the unit .	167.18877
often , the finished sign or display incorporates several types of plastics and two or more fabricating techniques .	111.64082
one of the most significant advancements in design of plastics signs is the so-called trans-illuminated billboard , now being produced by several large sign manufacturers such as advance neon sign co . , los angeles , and industrial electric inc . , new orleans , la . .	103.48209
the essential difference between the new trans-illuminated boards and existing billboards is that the former , constructed of translucent plastic panels , are lighted from within .	268.5568
with the source of light behind the copy , there is no loss of lumen output , as with conventional boards illuminated by means of reflected light .	113.85674
also , the light sources are shielded from dirt and weather exposure and cannot obstruct the view of the sign .	106.273766
the copy itself , including any text or illustrations , is reproduced in full color directly on a thin mylar polyester film by a photo screen process .	121.32823
the film has an adhesive on the back which permits it to be stripped onto the acrylic panels forming the sign , and also to be stripped off for replacement by new copy as required .	103.691574
spare sets of face panels simplify the change from one copy or message to another	265.1865
new panels are exchanged for the old right in the field on a single trip .	24.938187
panels with outdated copy are returned to the sign shop so a new message can be applied .	143.30159
signs of this type have already made their appearance in several larger cities , and others are on the way .	57.981083
it is believed that these boards will , within the next few years , replace many of the conventional flood-lighted boards now in use .	113.77116
trans-illuminated signs also show versatility in other directions .	4.7601957
as used by industrial electric inc . , the film panels are printed one at a time , as are 24-sheet posters .	178.94806
thus the film can be applied to back-lighted translucent plastics faces	1769.6998
they can also be applied to opaque panels for use on cutouts , or they can be applied directly to painted bulletin faces .	106.29302
in this way , the sign maker has an economical means for displaying uniform copy on different sign media .	283.9517
recently industrial electric unveiled another new development made possible by modern plastic materials -- a revolving spectacular sign .	115.067085
comprised of 16 triangular trans-illuminated plastic sections , it makes it possible to combine three different signs in a single unit .	98.7928
the triangles automatically revolve in a cycle which permits 9 sec . of viewing time for each poster subject .	194.77599
sixteen panels , each slightly more than 1-1/2 ft . wide , make up the 25-ft . length of the sign .	102.63734
perhaps the best way to indicate the versatility of design that characterizes the use of plastics in signs and displays would be to look at what is happening in only one of the areas in this complex field -- changeable signs .	83.92124
signs are meant to convey a message , and in most cases , this requires words and letters .	120.23198
frequently , the message must be changed at intervals to feature new products , price changes , etc . .	187.86543
the huge market for changeable signs has spurred a universal demand for individual plastic letters , in all shapes and sizes -- and a number of companies are set up to supply them .	79.22225
here are some of the newer items currently available	6.572849
poster products inc . , chicago , ill . a changeable copy and display sign which consists of an extruded impact styrene background in choice of colors , onto which are mounted snap-in letters , figures , or words screened on acetate or other types of sheet stock .	231.54453
the background , which is available in various widths and continuous lengths , is extruded with parallel undercut grooves which grip the flexible letters securely .	89.7336
the adaptaplex co . , beaverton , ore . letters molded of butyrate , available in several sizes in either red or black .	176.07027
ideal for merchandising use , they are weather-resistant , and have mounting pegs on the back which fit into openings in a vacuum-formed waffle-pattern background panel .	148.2507
for large letters , e . g . thermoformed of acrylic or butyrate , there are other techniques .	112.12182
for example , in a typical store installation , fifty 24-in . and six 36-in . red acrylic letters were mounted against a white painted wood background .	123.49683
the fact that even the larger letters weighed only 5 lb . each made it possible to secure the letters to the building through clear acrylic angle brackets cemented to the letters .	147.19756
stainless steel screws were used to minimize corrosion stains .	28.915394
for mounting to corrugated plastic backgrounds , very small holes may be drilled in the sides of the letters and stainless steel wire threaded through the openings , its ends twisted behind the panels .	39.660397
large injection-molded letters are also available for sign installations .	17.957663
wagner sign service inc . , chicago , for example , supplies them in several colors , in heights of 4 , 6 , 8 , 10 , and 17 inches .	72.94399
they are molded of a special weather-resistant formulation of tenite butyrate .	21.448496
also available from this company are snug-grip plasti-bars , extruded of transparent acrylic material , which may be cemented to any corrugated acrylic background material .	56.928913
made in lengths from 3 to 10 ft . , the bars are shaped in cross section to provide a secure fit for the tapered slots molded in back of the letters .	99.347115
still another approach to the changeable letter type of sign is a modular unit introduced by merritt products , azusa , calif . .	72.01113
this vacuum formed sign is comprised of 27-in . ( or smaller ) panels formed of 0 . 080-in . clear butyrate sheet stock , masked and sprayed on the rear side .	139.02216
finished signs are produced by sliding the separate letter panels into channels of 0 . 025-in . aluminum , which may be mounted to various surfaces .	120.58324
the sheets are extruded of tenite butyrate by jet specialties co . , los angeles , calif . .	30.517605
on large-area units , where additional structural requirements are imposed , one recent approach utilizes modular extruded or formed channels ( e . g . right-angled corrugations ) of the acrylic or butyrate .	56.25497
joined side by side , such channels make possible construction of continuous two-dimensional luminous areas up to 50 ft . high and of unlimited width .	294.71954
letters may be wired to the face of the combined channels , painted on the first surface , or handled in other ways .	76.8374
don ' t build from the outside in -- try to build from the inside out	169.39563
don ' t insert your components into fixed openings , they may or may not fit	96.69746
position your components before you close them in .	196.51389
don ' t wall in your kitchen before you hang the wall cabinets and set the appliances .	60.182674
it ' s a lot quicker and easier to dimension the kitchen to fit the cabinets and erect the end wall after they are all in place .	94.432335
set your bathtub before you close in the end of the bathroom .	63.927376
don ' t try to wrestle a 400-lb . tub af through a narrow doorway .	274.36258
finish your plumbing before you frame it in ( most economical framing is a thin non-bearing partition on either side of the pipes ) .	152.6179
finish installing and connecting up your furnace and your water heater before you wall them in .	137.32887
there is no better way to waste time than trying to install a furnace in a finished af closet .	66.63257
don ' t position your studs before you insert your windows in conventional construction	259.4024
that way you may pay more to shim the window into place than you paid for the window .	332.79544
you can save all that shimming time if you set your windows in one , two , three order -- first the stud on one side , then the window , then the stud on the other side .	68.389656
install your disappearing stair ( or stairs ) to the attic and finish your overhead ducts before you drywall the ceiling .	73.76907
don ' t close in your house until everything has been carried in .	61.38884
last wall bob schmitt erects is the wall between the house and garage .	63.61005
that way he can truck his parts right indoors and unload them under the roof .	103.192696
no auto maker would dream of putting the head on the engine before he fitted the pistons in the block .	94.280846
and trailer makers , those most industrialized and therefore most efficient of homebuilders , say they save hundreds of dollars by always building from the inside out .	223.45982
new rule no . 3 rethink everything to get all the big savings the revolution in materials handling offers you	237.88432
this revolution is the biggest build-better-for-less news of all , because 1 .	406.14532
it makes it easy to handle much heavier units , so you can plan to build with much bigger and heavier prefabricated components like those shown in the pictures alongside .	90.33007
it makes materials handling the only construction cost that ( like earthmoving and roadbuilding ) should be lower today than in 1929 .	112.55694
it changes the answers to `` who should do what , and where ' ' ? ?	22.22682
it lessens the need for costly on-site fabrication and increases the chance for shop fabrication , where almost everything can be made better and cheaper .	127.179634
it changes the answers on when to do what at the site .	62.02395
for example , instead of putting in your driveways last ( as many builders do ) you can now save money by putting them in first .	244.45612
instead of closing the house in first ( as most builders do ) you can now cut your costs by not closing it in until you have to ( see p 121 ) .	172.01639
not so long ago many builders were finding they could cut their costs by `` buying direct ' ' and short-cutting the dealer .	145.0262
but now many of these same builders are finding they can cut their costs more by teaming up with a dealer who has volume enough to afford the most efficient specialized equipment to deliver everything just where it is needed -- drywall inside the house , siding along the sides , trusses on the walls , roofing on the roof , etc . .	104.54804
says clarence thompson `` we dealers must earn our mark-up by performing a service for the builder cheaper than he could do it himself ' ' .	91.064415
the revolution now under way in materials handling makes this much easier .	339.52823
the revolution is well under way , but much more remains to be done	321.1338
five years ago a house & home round table cosponsored by the lumber dealers ' research council reported unhappily	114.93027
`` only one lumber dealer in ten is equipped to handle unit loads	21.84227
only one box car in eight has the wide doors needed for unit loads	263.19498
only one producer in a hundred is equipped to package and ship unit loads	136.76204
only one builder in a thousand is equipped to receive unit loads .	15.765875
`` so from raw materials to finished erection the costs of materials handling ( most of it inefficient ) add up to one-fourth of the total construction cost of housing ' ' .	173.41463
`` that house & home round table was the real starting point for today ' s revolution in materials handling ' ' , says clarence thompson , long chairman of the lumber dealers ' research council .	72.93763
`` it made our whole industry recognize the need for a new kind of teamwork between manufacturer , carrier , equipment maker , dealer , and builder , all working together to cut the cost of materials handling .	68.95392
before that we lumber dealers were working almost single-handed on the problem ' ' .	19.631239
almost all of the 3 , 000 lumber dealers who cater primarily to the new-house market and supply 90% of this year ' s new houses are mechanized .	137.52461
there are few areas left where a builder cannot find a dealer equipped to save him money by delivering everything at lower cost just where his workmen will need it .	275.672
practically all bulky housing products can now be ordered in standard units palletized or unitized for mechanical handling -- including lumber , asphalt shingles , glass block , face brick , plaster , lime , hardboard , gypsum wallboard and sheathing , cement , insulation sheathing , floor tile , acoustical tile , plaster base , and asbestos shingles .	83.75105
truck and materials-handling equipment makers now offer specialized units to meet almost every homebuilding need .	191.23679
for some significant new items see the pictures .	16.108576
an nlrda survey found that at least 492 lumber mills will strap their shipments for mechanized handling .	244.9177
of these , 376 said they make no extra charge for strapping in standard units , because they save enough on mechanized carloading to offset their strapping cost .	166.62512
most of the others will swallow their $ . 50 to $3 charge rather than lose a good customer .	81.0522
`` with a 15 , 500-lb . fork-lift , dealers can unload unitized lumber from wide-door box cars for $ . 30/mbf compared with $1 . 65 or more to unload loose lumber one piece at a time ' ' , says james wright of aj .	134.63461
lumber dealers and lumber manufacturers have agreed on a standard unit for unitized shipments -- 48 ' ' ' ' wide by a nominal 30 ' ' ' ' high ( or six mccracken packets 24 ' ' ' ' wide by nominal 7 ' ' ' ' high ) .	98.263885
these units make it easy to load as much as 48 , 000 bd/ft ( say 120 , 000 lb in a 50 ' box car ) much more than the average for loose-loaded cars .	103.04391
the railroads have responded by adding 20 , 000 more box cars with doors 12 ' or wider for forklift unloading ( a 21% increase while the total number of box cars was falling 6% ) and by cutting their freight rates twice on lumber shipped in heavily loaded cars .	131.70094
first was a 1958 cut of more than 50% on that portion of the load in excess of 40 , 000 lb	30.16049
later came a 1961 cut on the west coast ( still pending elsewhere ) of $ . 07/cwt on 70 , 000 lb-plus carloads ( which works out to more than $4/mbf on that portion of the load in excess of 70 , 000 lb .	116.19242
more unitized lumber is being shipped on flat cars , and nlrda studies show that flat cars loaded with the new type 6-b floating-load method can be unloaded for as little as $ . 054/mbf .	158.12411
for long hauls these shipments should be protected with water-proof paper .	223.01318
this costs from $ . 75 to $2 . 30/mbf , but the cover can pay off if the lumber is to be stored in the open .	98.3832
these carriers cut handling costs for the dealer -- and the builder	92.78773
says nrlda ' s james wright `` since 1958 carriers that move material from the yard to the job site have undergone more radical changes than any of the dealer ' s other equipment ' ' .	146.04695
the reason today ' s components and lumber packages are far too bulky to be handled by a truckdriver and a helper .	55.663055
so manufacturers have pioneered a new type of vehicle -- the self-unloading carrier .	129.48357
it cuts the lumber dealer ' s cost because it takes only one man -- the driver -- to unload it , and because it unloads in a fraction of the time and at a fraction of the cost of hand unloading .	84.83564
and it helps the builder because it can handle a more efficiently packaged load , can deliver it to the best spot ( in some cases , right on the roof or inside the house ) , and never takes any of the builder ' s high-priced labor to help unload it .	104.91295
says wright `` our survey shows that one third of the retail dealers plan to increase the mechanization of their materials handling in the coming two years .	106.28649
and most of the gain will be in self-unloading vehicles ' ' .	112.62254
restudy what your men do , to help them waste less of the time you pay for	136.65793
half the manhours you pay for on most jobs are wasted because the job was not planned right , so the right tools were not handy at the right place at the right time , or the right materials were not delivered to the handiest spots or materials were not stacked in the right order for erection , or you bought cheap materials that took too long to fit , or your workmen had to come back twice to finish a job they could have done on one trip .	119.53547
even `` america ' s most efficient builder ' ' , bob schmitt of berea , hopes to cut his labor costs another $2 , 000 per house as a result of the time-&-motion studies now being completed on his operation by industrial efficiency engineers from the stanley works .	122.434494
already this study has suggested ways to cut his foundation manhours from 170 to 105 by eliminating idle time and wasted motion .	132.62613
builder eddie carr of washington , past president of nahb , cut his bricklaying costs $150 a house by adopting the `` scr masonry process ' ' worked out after careful time-&-motion studies by the structural clay products research foundation to help bricklayers do better work for less .	202.46776
a midwestern builder cut his labor costs per thousand bricks from $81 to $43 . 50 by adopting this same process , cut them another $7 . 50 to $36 by buying his bricks in convenient , easy-to-spot 100-brick packages .	232.73094
the scr process , with its precision corner-posts , its precision guide lines , its working level scaffold , and its hand-level brick supply takes eight manhours to get set , but once ready it makes it easy for bricklayers to lay a thousand bricks a day .	174.51083
one good way to cut your labor waste is to make sure you are using just the right number of men in each crew .	70.68825
