some have plenty of money -- some have very little money .	161.1984
some are blest with an abundance of good health -- some are in poor health and many are invalids .	138.0497
some have lovely homes -- some live in small apartments .	299.1461
some have beautiful gardens -- some not even a blade of grass .	51.550312
some have serenity of mind , the ability to accept what they have , and make the most of it ( a wonderful gift to have , believe me ) -- some see only darkness , the bitter side of everything .	163.39389
well , whatever you have , that ' s it ! !	13.602146
you ' ve got to learn to live with it .	39.812122
the question is `` how are you going to live with it ' ' ? ?	21.782412
you can sit back and moan and bewail your lot .	118.295555
but , if you do , your life will be just one thing -- unhappiness -- complete and unabridged .	119.6909
it seems to me , the first thing you ' ve got to do , to be happy , is to face up to your problems , no matter what they may be .	62.23387
make up your mind to pool your resources and get the most out of your remaining years of life .	139.53099
one thing , i am sure of , you must get an interest in life .	70.91955
many of you will say , `` well , what can i do ' ' ? ?	22.198673
there are many , many things to do .	38.711666
find out what you like to do most and really give it a whirl .	136.16359
if you can ' t think of a thing to do , try something -- anything .	195.30014
i , frankly , can ' t draw a straight line .	22.570719
maybe you are not that gifted either , but how about puttering around with the old paints ? ?	135.17819
you may amaze yourself and acquire a real knack for it .	32.418083
anyway , i ' ll bet you have a lot of fun .	28.668854
does making your own clothes or even doll clothes , interest you ? ?	109.36471
do you love to run up a hem , sew on buttons , make neat buttonholes ? ?	77.862
there is always a market for this line of work .	94.49954
some women can sit and sew , crochet , tat or knit by the hour , and look calm and relaxed and turn out beautiful work .	152.35245
where sewing is concerned , i ' m a total loss .	226.45695
when you see a needle in my hands you will know the family buttons have fallen off and i have to sew them back on , or get out the safety pins .	184.04555
then again , there ' s always that lovely old pastime of hooking or braiding rugs .	161.49245
not for me , but perhaps just the thing for you .	110.54265
how ' s about mosaic tile , ceramics or similar arts and crafts ? ?	145.87311
some people love to crack tile and it ' s amazing what beautiful designs they come up with as a result of their cracking good time .	100.744865
do you yearn to make cakes and pies , or special cookies and candies ? ?	47.651394
there is always an open market for this sort of delicacy , in spite of low calorie diets , cottage cheese and hands-off-all-sweets to the contrary .	78.59622
some people can carve most anything out of a piece of wood .	46.349133
some make beautiful chairs , cabinets , chests , doll houses , etc . .	54.897636
perhaps you couldn ' t do that but have you ever tried to see what you could do with a hunk of wood ? ?	71.4783
outside of cutting your fingers , maybe you would come up with nothing at all , but then again , you might turn out some dandy little gadgets .	137.30261
some women get a real thrill out of housework .	74.69201
they love to dust , scrub , polish , wax floors , move the furniture around from place to place , take down the curtains , put up new ones and have themselves a real ball .	149.13727
i can look at furniture in one spot year in and year out and really feel for sure that ' s where it belongs .	414.17517
perhaps you would like to become a writer .	3.5833654
this gives you a wide and varied choice .	3.1977654
will it be short stories , fiction , nonfiction , biography , poetry , children ' s stories , or even a book if you are really ambitious ? ?	60.92098
ever since i was a child , i have always had a yen to try my hand at writing .	187.79897
if you do decide to write , you will soon become acquainted with rejection slips and dejection .	120.256744
just let the rejection slips fall where they may , and keep on plugging , and finally you will make the grade .	180.38055
few new writers have their first story accepted , so they tell me .	72.771225
but , it could happen , and it may happen to you .	97.55512
then there ' s always hobbies , collecting stamps , coins , timetables , salt and pepper shakers , elephants , dogs , dolls , shells , or shall we just say collecting anything your heart desires ? ?	59.247307
i can hear some of you folks protesting .	14.59805
you say , `` but it costs a lot of money to have a hobby .	44.983303
i haven ' t got that kind of money ' ' .	10.844002
it does cost a lot of money for most hobbies but there are hobbies that are for free .	189.96077
how about a rock collection , or a collection of leaves from different trees or shrubs and in different colors ? ?	90.45834
also , there ' s scrap books , collecting newspaper pictures and clippings , or any items of interest to you .	131.65259
it ' s getting interested in something that counts .	141.66302
as for me , i am holding in reserve two huge puzzles ( i love puzzles ) to put together when time hangs heavy on my hands .	310.23038
so far , the covers have never been off the boxes .	175.76384
i just don ' t have time to do half the things i want to do now .	143.05841
so in closing , fellow retired members , i advise you to make the most of each day , enjoy each one to the n ' th degree .	144.35799
keep occupied to the point you are not bored with life and you will truly find these final days and years of your lives to be sunshine sweet .	350.59393
to one and all -- good days ahead ! !	27.006594
what does it mean to be creative , a term we hear with increasing frequency these days ? ?	225.05045
when we turn to noah webster we find him helpful as usual .	108.711426
`` to be creative is to have the ability to cause to exist -- to produce where nothing was before -- to bring forth an original production of human intelligence or power ' ' .	150.78526
we are creative , it seems , when we produce something which has not previously existed .	209.91478
thus creativity may run all the way from making a cake , building a chicken coop , or producing a book , to founding a business , creating a league of nations or , developing a mature character .	115.16172
all living creatures from the lowest form of insect or animal life evidence the power of creativity , if it is only to reproduce a form like their own .	137.90376
while man shares this procreative function with all his predecessors in the evolutionary process , he is the only animal with a true non-instinctive and conscious creative ability .	109.28975
an animal , bird or insect creates either a burrow , or nest or hive in unending sameness according to specie .	90.73115
man ' s great superiority over these evolutionary forbears is in the development of his imagination .	68.24987
this gives him the power to form in his mind new image combinations of old memories , ideas and experiences and to project them outside of himself into his environment in new and ever-changing forms .	156.25218
it has been truly said that anything man can imagine he can produce or create by projecting this inner image into its counterpart in the objective world .	218.24062
in our own time we have seen the most fantastic imagery of a jules verne come into actuality .	70.248535
the vision of a lord tennyson expressed in a poem 100 years ago took visible form over london in the air blitzes of 1941 .	184.51717
in fact all of our civilized world is the resultant of man ' s projection of his imagination over the past 60 centuries or more .	75.53315
it is in this one aspect , at least , that man seems to be made in the image of his creator .	73.8974
not only can man project his imagination out into his environment in concrete forms , but even more importantly , he can turn it inward to help create new and better forms of himself .	133.08339
we recognize that young people through imaginative mind and body training can become athletes , acrobats , dancers , musicians and artists , developing many potentialities .	170.79488
we know that actors can learn to portray a wide variety of character roles .	30.994766
by this same combination of the will and the imagination , each one of us can learn to portray permanently the kind of character we would like to be .	125.273895
we must realize with prof . charles morris in his the open self that `` man is the being that can continually remake himself , the artisan that is himself the material for his own creation ' ' .	111.787094
so far in history man has been too greatly over-occupied with projecting things into his environment rather than first creating the sort of person who can make the highest use of the things he has created .	121.37956
is not the present world crisis a race between things we have created which can now destroy us and between populations of sufficient wisdom and character to forestall the tragedy .	155.54456
is it not the obligation of us older citizens to lend our weight to being creative on the character side and to hasten our own maturing process ? ?	136.20256
sir julian huxley in his book uniqueness of man makes the novel point that just as man is unique in being the only animal which requires a long period of infancy and childhood under family protection , so is he the only animal who has a long period after the decline of his procreativity .	106.097206
some recent writings assume that the ignorant young couples are a thing of the remote , victorian past	89.815704
that nowadays all honeymooners are thoroughly familiar with the best sex-manuals and know enough from talk with friends and personal experimentation to take all the anxiety and hazards out of the situation .	166.61026
perhaps -- but extensive discussions with contemporary practitioners , family doctors and gynecologists indicate that this is still an area of enormous ignorance .	83.86799
joking and talking may be freer and easier , but the important factual information is still lacking for far too many newly-married men and women .	44.23609
various factors in the setting can still be of great advantage in making the first intercourse a good rather than a bad memory for one or both .	69.89826
privacy must be highly assured both in time and place .	46.002274
that is , locking the room or stateroom door gives privacy of location , but it is equally important to be sure there is time enough for an utterly unhurried fulfillment .	103.28141
if the wedding party lasted late , and the travel schedule means there are only a few hours before resuming the trip or making an early start , the husband may forestall tensions and uncertainties by confiding to his bride that lying in each other ' s arms will be bliss enough for these few hours .	137.2454
the consummation should come at the next stopping place when they have a long private time ( day or night ) for that purpose .	135.31168
first intercourse for the bride brings with it the various problems connected with virginity and the hymen .	77.423645
one thing should be clear to both husband and wife -- neither pain nor profuse bleeding has to occur when the hymen is ruptured during the first sex act .	151.90349
ignorance on this point has caused a great deal of needless anxiety , misunderstanding and suspicion .	89.83943
the hymen is , in essence , a fragile membrane that more or less completely covers the entrance to the vagina in most female human beings who have not had sex relations .	173.37833
( hymen , in fact , is the greek word for membrane .	110.88903
often it is thin and fragile and gives way readily to the male organ at the first attempt at intercourse .	72.51071
as might be expected , girls in this situation bleed very little and perhaps not at all in the process of losing their virginity .	79.609566
it is also important to realize that many girls are born without a hymen or at most only a tiny trace of one	178.01436
so that the absence of the hymen is by no means positive proof that a girl has had sex relations .	210.59824
but there is a basis in fact for the exaggerations of the folk-lore beliefs .	46.71328
some hymens are so strongly developed that they cannot be torn without considerable pain to the girl and marked loss of blood .	262.1915
more rarely , the hymen is so sturdy that it does not yield to penetration .	41.79056
extreme cases are on record in which the doctor has had to use instruments to cut through the hymen to permit marital relations to be consummated .	258.78088
these cases , for all their rarity , are so dramatic that friends and relations repeat the story until the general population may get an entirely false notion of how often the hymen is a serious problem to newly-weds .	191.65224
in recent times , when sexual matters began to be discussed more scientifically and more openly , the emotional aspects of virginity received considerable attention .	79.007256
obviously , the bridal pair has many adjustments to make to their new situation .	65.68244
is it necessary to add to the other tensions the hazard of making the loving husband the one who brought pain to his bride ? ?	106.72136
gynecologists and marriage manuals began to advise that the bride should consult a physician before marriage .	135.37099
if he foresaw any problem because of the quality of the hymen , it was recommended that simple procedures be undertaken at once to incise the hymen or , preferably , to dilate it .	163.77
as a natural outgrowth of this approach it was often suggested that the doctor should complete the preparation for painless intercourse by dilating the vagina .	137.6654
this recommendation was based on the fact that the hymen was not the only barrier to smooth consummation of the sex act .	50.390884
the vagina is an organ capable of remarkable contraction and dilation .	42.22095
this is obvious when it is remembered that , during childbirth , the vagina must dilate enough to permit the passage of the baby .	74.3037
the intricate system of muscles that manage the contraction and dilatation of the vagina are partly under voluntary control .	93.48574
but an instinctive reflex may work against the conscious intention of the woman .	54.430847
that is , when first penetration takes place , the pressure and pain signals may involuntarily cause all the vaginal muscles to contract in an effort to bar the intrusion and prevent further pain .	107.5748
the advantages of dilatation by the physician are both physical and psychological .	124.25391
since it is a purely professional situation , none of the pain is associated with love-making or the beloved .	100.79859
by using instruments of gradually increasing size , the vagina is gently , and with minimum pain at each stage , taught to yield to an object of the appropriate shape .	74.25812
in this process the vaginal muscles come under better conscious control by the girl .	312.5085
she learns how to relax them to accept -- instead of contracting them to repel -- the entering object .	220.58775
apart from the standard problem of controlling the vaginal muscles , other serious barriers may exist that need special gynecological treatment .	112.38795
it is far better to have such conditions treated in advance than to have them show up on the honeymoon where they can create a really serious situation .	273.68442
when no medical problems exist , the newly married couple generally prefer to cope with the adjustments of their new relationship by themselves .	149.70425
special information and guidance about the possible difficulties are still of great value .	92.64445
folk-lore , superstition and remembered passages from erotic literature can create physical and emotional problems if blindly taken as scientific facts and useful hints .	383.20047
the long , unhurried approach and the deliberate prolongation of fore-play work on several levels .	335.01047
under the excitement of caresses and sexual stimulation the vagina relaxes and dilates and the local moisture greatly increases , providing an excellent lubricant to help achieve an easier penetration .	154.66614
extensive observations by physicians during vaginal examinations have established the fact that a single finger inserted along the anterior wall ( the top line of the vagina as the woman lies on her back ) may cause a great deal of distress in a virgin .	75.69612
but during the same examination , two fingers may be inserted along the posterior wall ( the bottom of the vagina in the same position ) without any pain	56.39264
and in fact without any difficulty if the pressure is kept downward at all times .	159.9943
these regional differences of sensitivity to pain may be of crucial significance during the earliest intercourse .	51.577713
the husband and wife should start with this anatomical information clearly in mind .	335.65454
they may then adjust their positions and movements to avoid too much pressure on the urethra and the anterior wall of the vagina	52.165592
at least until repeated intercourse has dilated it and pain is no longer a possible threat against the full pleasure of love-making .	168.62204
in fact , the technical procedure in medical examinations may be wisely adapted to his romantic purposes by the husband during the honeymoon .	114.32259
locker-room talk often stresses the idea that a man is doing the girl a favor if he is forceful and ruthless during the first penetration .	108.60019
the false reasoning is that a gradual advance prolongs the pain while a swift powerful act gets it over with and leaves the girl pleased with his virility and grateful for his decisiveness in settling the problem once and for all .	208.28966
ruthlessness at this time can be a very severe shock to the bride , both physically and psychologically .	151.64417
the insistent , forceful penetration may tear and inflame the vaginal walls as well as do excessive damage to the hymen .	89.727905
the pain and distress associated with the performance may easily give the wife a deep-seated dread of marital relations and cause her , unconsciously , to make the sex act unpleasant and difficult for both by exercising her vaginal muscles to complicate his penetration instead of relaxing them to facilitate it .	153.3748
serious attention must also be given to the husband ' s problems in the honeymoon situation .	56.005493
the necessity for keeping alert to his bride ' s hazards can act as an interference with the man ' s spontaneous desire .	136.88025
the emotional stimulation may be so great that he may experience a premature climax .	68.83001
this is a very common experience and should in no way discourage or dishearten either husband or wife .	123.19076
or the frequent need to check and discipline himself to the wisest pace of the consummation can put him off stride and make it impossible for him to be continuously ready for penetration over a long period .	146.11327
the signals to proceed may therefore come when he is momentarily not able to take advantage of them .	83.451035
the best course is to recover his physical excitement by a change of pace that makes him ardent again .	178.16103
this may require imagination and reminding himself that now he can be demanding and self-centered .	77.886505
he can take security from the fact that the progress he has made by his gentle approach will not be lost .	141.63965
now while he uses talk , caresses or requires caresses from her , his bride will sympathetically understand the situation and eagerly help him restore his physical situation so they can have the consummation they both so eagerly desire .	263.06046
the accumulated information on this point shows that first intercourse , even when it is achieved with minimum pain or difficulty , is seldom an overwhelming sexual experience to a woman .	153.39476
too many new things are happening for it to be a complete erotic fulfillment .	48.76327
only under rare circumstances would a bride experience an orgasm during her first intercourse .	93.1927
both man and wife should be aware of the fact that a lack of climax , and even the absence of the anticipated keen pleasure are not a sign that the wife may be cold or frigid .	74.63682
if the early approaches are wise , understanding and patient , the satisfactions of marital fulfillment will probably be discovered before the marriage is much older .	144.82787
writing in a large volume on the nude in painting and sculptures , titled the nude a study in ideal form , kenneth clark declares `` the human body , as a nucleus , is rich in associations .	136.25641
it is ourselves and arouses memories of all the things we wish to do with ourselves ' ' .	30.797647
perhaps this is a clue to the amazing variety and power of reactions , attitudes , and emotions precipitated by the nude form .	132.17776
the wide divergence of reactions is clearly illustrated in the kinsey studies in human sexuality .	107.0108
differences were related to social , economic , and educational backgrounds .	111.05312
whereas persons of eighth grade education or less were more apt to avoid or be shocked by nudity , those educated beyond the eighth grade increasingly welcomed and approved nudity in sexual relations .	148.78609
such understanding helps to explain why one matron celebrating thirty-five years of married life could declare with some pride that her husband had `` never seen her entirely naked ' ' , while another woman , boasting an equal number of years of married life , is proud of having `` shared the nudist way of life -- the really free , natural nude life -- for most of that period ' ' .	133.55821
attempts at censorship always involve and reveal such complex and multiple individual reactions .	184.76085
the indignant crusader sees the nude or semi-nude human form as `` lewd and pornographic , a threat and danger ' ' to all the young , or good , or religious , or moral persons .	90.32705
the equally ardent proponent of freedom from any kind of censorship may find the nude human form the `` natural , honest , free expression of man ' s spirit and the epitome of beauty and inspiration ' ' .	80.63368
one is always a little surprised to bump into such individual distinctions when it is unexpected .	161.50754
i still recall the mild shock i experienced in reading material of an enthusiastic advocate of the `` clean , healthful , free way of natural life in nudism ' ' , who seemed to brave much misunderstanding and persecution in fine spirit .	118.85582
in tradition and in poetry , the marriage bed is a place of unity and harmony .	56.523262
the partners each bring to it unselfish love , and each takes away an equal share of pleasure and joy .	81.35811
at its most ecstatic moments , husband and wife are elevated far above worldly cares .	157.76132
but marriage experts say that such mutual contribution and mutual joy are seldom achieved .	263.5075
instead one partner or the other dominates the sexual relationship .	17.9722
in the past , it has been the husband who has been dominant and the wife passive .	141.74857
but today there are signs that these roles are being reversed .	54.972607
in a growing number of american homes , marriage counselors report , the wife is taking a commanding role in sexual relationships .	102.073326
it is she who decides the time , the place , the surroundings , and the frequency of the sexual act .	67.327324
it is she who says aye or nay to the intimate questions of sexual technique and mechanics -- not the husband .	243.27931
the whole act is tailored to her pleasure , and not to theirs .	54.876568
beyond a certain point , of course , no woman can be dominant -- nature has seen to that .	228.41676
but there is little doubt that in many marriages the wife is boss of the marital bed .	48.70209
of course , there remain many `` old-fashioned ' ' marriages in which the husband maintains his supremacy .	52.9097
yet even in these marriages , psychologists say , wives are asserting themselves more strongly .	109.846436
the meekest , most submissive wife of today is a tiger by her mother ' s or grandmother ' s standards .	54.361027
to many experts , this trend was inevitable .	32.802586
they consider it simply a sign of our times .	994.73065
our society has `` emancipated ' ' the woman , giving her new independence and new authority .	307.82892
it is only natural that she assert herself in the sexual role .	106.35447
`` the sexual relationship does not exist in a vacuum ' ' , declares dr . mary steichen calderone , medical director of the planned parenthood federation of america and author of the recent book , release from sexual tensions .	101.24991
`` it reflects what is going on in other areas of the marriage and in society itself .	63.05995
a world in which wives have taken a more active role is likely to produce sexual relationships in which wives are more self-assertive , too ' ' .	47.64476
yet many psychologists and marriage counselors agree that domination of the sex relationship by one partner or the other can be unhealthy and even dangerous .	124.77324
it can , in fact , wreck a marriage .	342.39212
when a husband is sexually selfish and heedless of his wife ' s desires , she is cheated of the fulfillment and pleasure nature intended for her .	87.335884
and she begins to regard him as savage , bestial and unworthy .	48.394325
on the other hand , wifely supremacy demeans the husband , saps his self-respect , and robs him of his masculinity .	75.97967
he is a target of ridicule to his wife , and often -- since private affairs rarely remain private -- to the outside world as well .	172.06093
`` a marriage can survive almost any kind of stress except an open and direct challenge to the husband ' s maleness ' ' , declares dr . calderone .	92.89084
this opinion is supported by one of the nation ' s leading psychiatrists , dr . maurice e . linden , director of the mental health division of the philadelphia department of public health .	52.077354
`` when the roles of husband and wife are reversed , so that the wife becomes leader and the husband follower ' ' , dr . linden says , `` the effects on their whole relationship , sexual and otherwise , can be disastrous ' ' .	65.911095
in one extreme case , cited by a pittsburgh psychologist , an office worker ' s wife refused to have sexual relations with her husband unless he bought her the luxuries she demanded .	149.98083
to win her favors , her husband first took an additional job , then desperately began to embezzle from his employer .	229.3893
caught at last , he was sentenced to prison .	134.82072
while he was in custody his wife divorced him .	109.67664
more typical is the case of a suburban long island housewife described by a marriage counselor .	209.77138
this woman repeatedly complained she was `` too tired ' ' for marital relations .	46.519737
to please her , her husband assumed some of the domestic chores .	33.607876
finally , he was cooking , washing dishes , bathing the children , and even ironing -- and still his wife refused to have relations as often as he desired them .	135.30426
one wife , described by a new york psychologist , so dominated her husband that she actually placed their sexual relationship on a schedule , writing it down right between the weekly pta meetings and the thursday-night neighborhood card parties .	306.53552
after every money argument , she rebuffed her husband ' s overtures until the matter was settled in her favor .	71.12488
experts say the partners in marriages like these can almost be typed .	763.0088
the wife is likely to be young , sophisticated , smart as a whip -- often a girl who has sacrificed a promising career for marriage .	131.03632
she knows the power of the sex urge and how to use it to manipulate her husband .	72.45275
the husband is usually a well-educated professional , preoccupied with his job -- often an organization man whose motto for getting ahead is `` don ' t rock the boat ' ' .	90.20963
sometimes this leads to his becoming demandingly dominant in marriage .	75.80604
hemmed in on the job and unable to assert himself , he uses the sex act so he can be supreme in at least one area .	211.155
more often , though , he is so accustomed to submitting to authority on the job without argument that he lives by the same rule at home .	222.5584
some psychologists , in fact , suggest that career-bound husbands often are more to blame for topsy-turvy marriages than their wives .	530.8494
the wife ' s attempt at control , these psychologists contend , is sometimes merely a pathetic effort to compel her husband to pay as much attention to her as he does to his job .	104.78841
naturally no woman can ever completely monopolize the sexual initiative .	111.173546
unless her husband also desires sex , the act cannot be consummated .	118.93956
generally , however , in such marriages as those cited , the husband is at his wife ' s mercy .	58.423214
`` the pattern ' ' , says dr . morton schillinger , psychologist at new york ' s lincoln institute for psychotherapy , `` is for the husband to hover about anxiously and eagerly , virtually trembling in his hope that she will flash him the signal that tonight is the night ' ' .	74.55622
no one seriously contends , of course , that the domineering wife is , sexually speaking , a new character in our world .	198.97383
after all , the henpecked husband with his shrewish wife is a comic figure of long standing , in literature and on the stage , as dr . schillinger points out .	163.03735
there is no evidence that these milquetoasts became suddenly emboldened when they crossed the threshhold of the master bedroom .	54.809093
furthermore , dr . calderone says , a certain number of docile , retiring men always have been around .	156.92516
they aren ' t `` frigid ' ' and they aren ' t homosexual	54.886826
they ' re just restrained in all of life .	47.88526
one such man once confided to dr . theodor reik , new york psychiatrist , that he preferred to have his wife the sexual aggressor .	78.202126
asked why , he replied primly `` because that ' s no activity for a gentleman ' ' .	50.387856
but such cases were , in the past , unusual .	369.58765
society here and abroad has been built around the dominating male -- even the bible appears to endorse the concept .	212.7902
family survival on our own western frontier , for example , could quite literally depend on a man ' s strength and ability to bring home the bacon	84.548515
and the dependent wife seldom questioned his judgment about anything , including the marriage bed .	173.94116
this carried over into the more urbanized late 19th and early 20th centuries , when the man ruled the roost in the best bull-roaring life with father manner .	111.08791
in those days , a wife had mighty few rights in the domestic sphere and even fewer in the sexual sphere .	79.096146
`` grandma wasn ' t expected to like it ' ' , dr . marion hilliard , the late toronto gynecologist , once summed up the attitude of the ' 90s .	62.012794
wives of the period shamefacedly thought of themselves as `` used ' ' by their husbands -- and , history indicates , they often quite literally were .	134.69342
when did women begin to assert themselves sexually ? ?	33.65656
some date it from woman suffrage , others from when women first began to challenge men in the marketplace , still others from the era of the emancipated flapper and bathtub gin .	186.25977
virtually everyone agrees , however , that the trend toward female sexual aggressiveness was tremendously accelerated with the postwar rush to the suburbs .	161.5573
left alone while her husband was miles away in the city , the modern wife assumed more and more duties normally reserved for the male .	89.01889
circumstances gave her almost undisputed sway over child-rearing , money-handling and home maintenance .	117.54793
she found she could cope with all kinds of problems for which she was once considered too helpless .	87.18376
she liked this taste of authority and independence , and , with darkness , was not likely to give it up .	68.88997
`` very few wives ' ' , says dr . calderone , `` who balance the checkbook , fix the car , choose where the family will live and deal with the tradesmen , are suddenly going to become submissive where sex is concerned .	114.34794
a woman who dominates other family affairs will dominate the sexual relationship as well ' ' .	49.41612
and an additional factor was helping to make women more sexually self-assertive -- the comparatively recent discovery of the true depths of female desire and response .	231.96115
marriage manuals and women ' s magazine articles began to stress the importance of the female climax .	77.17297
they began to describe in detail the woman ' s capacity for response .	59.936924
in fact , the noted psychologist and sex researcher , dr . albert ellis , has declared flatly that women are `` sexually superior ' ' to men .	55.682434
according to dr . ellis , the average 20-year-old american woman is capable of far greater sexual arousal than her partner .	257.47495
not surprisingly , dr . ellis says , some recently enlightened wives are out to claim these capabilities .	277.138
yet , paradoxically , according to dr . maurice linden , many wives despise their husbands for not standing up to them .	249.73146
an aggressive woman wants a man to demand , not knuckle under .	283.9551
`` when the husband becomes passive in the face of his wife ' s aggressiveness ' ' , dr . linden says , `` the wife , in turn , finds him inadequate .	39.85654
often she fails to gain sexual satisfaction ' ' .	1.718163
one such wife , dr . linden says , became disgusted with her weak husband and flurried through a series of extramarital affairs in the hope of finding a stronger man .	120.61171
but her personality was such that each affair lasted only until that lover , too , had been conquered and reduced to passivity .	225.26828
then the wife bed-hopped to the next on the list .	61.9212
in some cases , however , domination of the sex act by one partner can be temporary , triggered by a passing but urgent emotional need .	105.69971
thus a man who is butting a stone wall at the office may become unusually aggressive in bed -- the one place he can still be champion .	163.06644
if his on-the-job problems work out , he may return to his old pattern .	175.33107
sometimes a burst of aggressiveness will sweep over a man -- or his wife -- because he or she feels age creeping up .	74.27777
on the other hand , a husband who always has been vigorous and assertive may suddenly become passive -- asking , psychologists say , for reassurance that his wife still finds him desirable .	204.15775
or a wife may make sudden demands that she be courted , flattered or coaxed , simply because she needs her ego lifted .	237.75958
in any case , dr . calderone remarks , such problems are a couple ' s own affair , and can ' t always be measured by a general yardstick .	70.665695
`` as long as the couple is in agreement in their approach to sex , it makes little difference if one or the other dominates ' ' , dr . calderone declares .	131.62666
`` the important point is that both be satisfied with the adjustment ' ' .	35.575294
other experts say , however , that if sexual domination by one or the other partner exists for longer than a brief period , it is likely to shake the marriage .	174.44177
and just as domination today often begins with the wife , so the cure generally must lie with the husband .	152.49045
`` to get a marriage back where it belongs ' ' , comments dr . schillinger of the lincoln institute , `` the husband must take some very basic steps .	108.69499
he must begin , paradoxically , by becoming more selfish .	59.066128
he must become more expressive of his own desires , more demanding and less ' understanding ' ' ' .	94.148094
too many husbands , dr . schillinger continues , worry about `` how well they ' re doing ' ' , and fear that their success depends on some trick or technique of sexual play .	128.52046
she gave herself a title , lady diana harrington .	5.2133336
the new york d . a . gave her another , the golden girl of cafe society .	123.65623
houston police gave her a third , less flamboyant , title , prostitute .	170.34966
and houston police have the final say in the matter since she died there on september 20 , 1960 , `` diane harris graham , 30 , d . o . a . , circumstances -- unusual ' ' .	99.57657
early in her life she had discovered that where there were men , there was money , and with the two came luxury and liquor .	170.37906
she was still in the play for pay business when she died , a top trollop who had given the world ' s oldest profession one of its rare flashes of glamour .	125.71833
she never hid the fact that she liked to play .	34.483257
her neighbors in the expensive houston apartment building told reporters that the ash-blonde beauty had talked at times about her past as `` the golden girl of the mickey jelke trial ' ' .	126.00905
it was the trial of oleomargarine heir minot ( mickey ) jelke for compulsory prostitution in new york that put the spotlight on the international play-girl .	79.838646
( jelke later served 21 months when he was found guilty of masterminding a ring of high-priced call girls .	141.1172
diane was needed as a material witness in the case and new york police searched three continents before they found her in their own back yard -- in a swank hotel , of course .	75.89118
she had been moving in cafe society as lady diana harrington , a name that made some of the gossip columns .	67.97426
it was when she was seized as a material witness that she got the designation she liked best .	181.6181
clad in mink and diamonds , she listened to assistant district attorney anthony liebler describe her to the arraigning judge	467.8089
`` this girl is the golden girl of cafe society .	33.414066
`` in 1951 she was a prostitute in new york county .	51.849678
in the spring and early summer of that year she met a wealthy foreign tycoon who took her to france , where she later met a very wealthy man and toured all europe with him .	162.04019
`` at deauville she met an egyptian by the name of pulley bey .	20.937948
he was the official procurer for king farouk , now in exile .	67.09416
she was in egypt during the revolution and had passport difficulty .	180.40155
`` we have checked her in different parts of europe and egypt and finally back into this country .	96.531235
`` our information is that she gave the proceeds of her acts to jelke ' ' .	17.26534
i am not a prostitute , and i had only one very wealthy boy friend ' ' , she said .	72.83228
during the course of the trial , jelke backed up part of that statement .	489.45084
`` diane is the type of girl ' ' , jelke said , `` who wouldn ' t get loving -- even on her wedding night -- unless you piled up all your money in the middle of the floor ' ' .	58.11433
but she seemed to have underestimated the number of her `` boy friends ' ' .	41.372868
she came to new york from detroit as a teenager , but with a `` sponsor ' ' instead of a chaperone .	62.4045
as she told it , `` he ' s a rich boy friend , an old guy about 60 ' ' .	57.966568
she was mary lou brew then , wide-eyed , but not naive .	84.18528
she had talked her `` boy friend ' ' into sending her to new york to take a screen test .	68.3864
the screen test was never made -- but diane was .	1156.3346
she quickly moved into cafe society , possibly easing her conscience by talking constantly of her desire to be in show business .	329.04895
she seemed so anxious to go on the stage that some of her friends in the cocktail circuit set up a practical joke .	114.7384
an ex-fighter was introduced to her in a bar as `` mr . warfield , the famous producer ' ' .	86.14881
the phony producer asked her if she would like to be in one of his shows .	61.2851
`` i ' d love to audition for you ' ' , she gushed .	66.06603
the audition was held a few minutes later in somebody ' s apartment .	87.46783
she thought she had great possibilities in the ballet and wanted to show the eminent producer how well she could dance .	211.34367
after a few minutes he said , `` i can ' t use you if you dance like that .	85.341675
i ' d like to see you dance nude ' ' .	17.01848
diane loved to dance in the nude , something she was to demonstrate time and again .	144.4101
even among the fast set in which she was moving , her method for keeping an escort from departing too early was unique .	326.0004
when the date would try to bid her good-night at the door , she would tell him , `` if you go home now , i ' ll scream ' ' .	35.699318
more often than not he would bow to the inevitable .	31.82329
one who needed no such threats was a french financier .	100.03925
one of the blonde ' s yearnings that he satisfied was for travel .	411.11844
she wanted to go around the world , but she settled for a french holiday .	136.1652
in an anonymous interview with a french newspaper the financier told of spending several months with her .	117.79492
`` then she went to deauville where she met a member of a powerful greek syndicate of gamblers ' ' .	27.825357
the greek evidently fell for her , `` monsieur x ' ' recounted , and to clinch what he thought was an affair in the making he gave her 100 , 000 francs ( about $300 ) and led her to the roulette tables .	106.75953
she could do no wrong at the tables that time .	117.89866
and in short order the croupier had pushed several million francs her way .	330.66855
smarter than most gamblers , she slipped away from the casino , packed her bag and took the night train to paris .	157.98596
no one ever learned what happened to the greek .	1001.6947
the luxury of paris ' most fashionable hotel , the george 5 , , bored the beautifully-built blonde , so she high-tailed it to rome .	194.91405
she teamed up with another beauty , whose name has been lost to history , and commenced with some fiddling that would have made nero envious .	111.67383
to climax her roman revels , she was thrown out of the swanky hotel excelsior after she had run naked through its marble halls screaming for help .	158.11053
it was a rugged finish for what must have been a very interesting night .	78.3947
discreet italian police described it in a manner typically continental .	58.25591
`` there had been a threesome at the party in the suite ' s bedroom miss harrington ( this was diane ' s choice for a roman name ) , another woman who has figured in other very interesting events and one of your well-known american actors .	118.50281
`` the actor had had much to drink and apparently became very violent .	379.86288
the hotel staff , as well as residents of the excelsior , told us they saw that both ladies were bleeding from scratches as they were seen fleeing down the hall .	167.05782
`` they were wearing nothing but their scratches .	5.9172697
the girls , after dressing , were indignant .	2.0013747
`` you can ' t do this to us ' ' , diane screamed .	41.121155
in the morning she found rooms directly across from the excelsior at the equally luxurious hotel ambassador .	70.58192
with the ambassador as headquarters , she continued to promote good will abroad .	159.54372
of course , her benevolence was limited to those who could afford it , but then there is a limit to what one person can do .	50.068653
by this time diane was a beguiling lass of 19 and still seeking her place in the world .	67.84026
she thought royal status might come her way when , while she was still in rome , she met pulley bey , a personal procurer to king farouk of egypt .	80.23319
a close friend of hers in the roman days described it this way	377.71906
she had a hard time making him understand that it was farouk she wished to meet .	76.87343
`` pulley bey insisted that she bestow her favors on him ' ' , the friend continued .	35.064034
it seemed as though she were always auditioning .	10.593089
no believer in the traditional devotion of royal servitors , the plump pulley broke the language barrier and lured her to cairo where she waited for nine months , vainly hoping to see farouk .	114.228
pulley had set her up at the semiramis hotel , but she grew impatient waiting for a royal reception and moved to a luxurious apartment to which the royal pimp had no key .	86.496254
she picked her own middle-eastern friends from the flock of ardent egyptians that buzzed around her .	80.72825
tewfik badrawi , mohammed gaafer and numerous other wealthy members of cairo society enjoyed her company .	270.39285
`` so extensive became her circle of admirers ' ' , egyptian police said , `` that her escapades caused distrust ' ' .	55.721348
the roof was about ready to fall in on diane ' s little world , but it took nothing less than the egyptian revolution to bring it down .	122.03059
when farouk was overthrown , police picked up his personal pimp , pulley bey .	46.206932
they also called upon diane with a request for a look at her passport .	84.170746
the cagey pulley bey , who spoke no english , had taken the passport so that diane couldn ' t leave the country without his approval .	67.059814
officials provided a temporary passport , good only for return to the united states .	21.364202
and return to the united states she did , into waiting arms -- the unromantic ones of the new york district attorney ' s office .	61.796192
held as a material witness in the compulsory prostitution trial of mickey jelke , the comely courtesan was unable to raise bail and was committed to the women ' s house of detention , a terribly overcrowded prison .	71.63885
it is a tribute to her talents that she was able to talk the district attorney into having her removed from the prison to a hotel room , with her meals taken at vesuvio ' s , an excellent italian restaurant .	127.74647
newspapers at the time noted that the move indicated that she was co-operating with the district attorney .	43.985653
with the end of the trial diane disappeared from new york .	26.951494
it was no longer fashionable to be seen with fabulous `` lady harrington ' ' .	91.95189
several years ago she married a houston business man , robert graham .	126.43488
she later divorced graham , who is believed to have moved to bolivia .	55.421043
houston police got to know diane two years ago when the vice squad picked her up for questioning about a call girl ring .	98.39212
last may , they said , she admitted being a prostitute .	50.32671
the next time the police saw her she was dead .	35.647064
it was september 20 , 1960 , in a lavishly decorated apartment littered with liquor bottles .	69.62556
she had had a party with a regular visitor , dr . william w . mcclellan .	49.09394
mcclellan , who had once lost his medical license temporarily on a charge of drug addiction , was with her when she died .	147.10745
he had been in the apartment two days and was hazy about what had happened during that time .	93.02177
when he realized she was dead , he called two lawyers and then the police .	98.27288
when the police arrived , they found mcclellan and the two lawyers sitting and staring silently .	52.681625
the blonde ' s nude body was in bed , a green sheet and a pink blanket covered her .	136.71535
pictures of her in more glamorous days were on the walls .	21.083456
an autopsy disclosed a large amount of morphine in diane ' s body .	97.530014
police theorize that a combination of dope , drink and drugs killed her .	331.85416
`` i think that maybe she wanted it this way ' ' , a vice squad cop said .	36.370712
`` a maid told us that she still bragged about getting $50 a date .	435.66052
she was on the junk , and they slide fast when that happens .	366.76254
at least she never knew what the bottom was like ' ' .	27.305416
i work for one of the biggest chains of retail carpet houses in the east .	41.48817
we cater mostly to nice people in the $5-8 , 000 annual income bracket and we run a string of snazzy , neon-lit , chromium-plated suburban stores .	207.37218
i am selling the stuff of which is made one of the great american dreams -- wall-to-wall carpeting .	55.93909
there is only one trouble with this big , beautiful dream .	133.36081
from where i sit it looks more like a nightmare .	19.527327
they depend on my supposedly expert knowledge of a trade of which they themselves know little .	271.26456
franklin d . lee proved a man of prompt action when mrs . claire shaefer , accompanied by a friend , visited him in bakersfield , california , several months ago as a prospective patient .	126.440735
`` doctor ' ' lee asked her to lie down on a bed and remove her shoes .	50.093037
then , by squeezing her foot three times , he came up -- presto -- with a different diagnosis with each squeeze .	120.73214
she had -- he informed her -- kidney trouble , liver trouble , and a severe female disorder .	147.23595
( he explained that he could diagnose these ailments from squeezing her foot because all of the nervous system was connected to it .	111.60351
) he knew just the thing for her -- a treatment from his `` cosmic light ozone generator ' ' machine .	120.47284
as he applied the applicator extending from the machine -- which consisted of seven differently colored neon tubes superimposed on a rectangular base -- to the supposedly diseased portions of mrs . shaefer ' s body , lee kept up a steady stream of pseudo-scientific mumbo-jumbo .	85.804276
yes , the ozone from his machine would cure practically everything , he assured her .	73.19873
did she know , he asked , why the colors of the tubes were important to people ' s health ? ?	81.10885
the human body -- he pointed out , for example -- required 33 units of blue light .	460.59375
for that reason , he informed her , the lord made the sky blue .	156.85416
continuing glibly in this vein , he paused to comfort her	78.10326
this machine will cure your cancer-ridden body ' ' .	1.6962639
`` you didn ' t tell me i had cancer ' ' .	24.847054
but as long as you can have treatment from my machine you have nothing to worry about .	144.89445
why , i once used this machine to cure a woman with 97 pounds of cancer in her body ' ' .	96.65965
he urged her to buy one of his machines -- for $300 .	119.95264
when she said that she didn ' t have the money , he said that she could come in for treatment with his office model until she was ready to buy one .	88.50402
he then sold her minerals to cure her kidney ailment , a can of sage `` to make her look like a girl again ' ' , and an application of plain mud to take her wrinkles away .	136.29858
lee renewed his pressure on mrs . shaefer to buy his machine when she visited him the next day .	88.30425
after another treatment with the machine , he told her that `` her entire body was shot through with tumors and cysts ' ' .	88.10964
he then sold her some capsules that he asserted would take care of the tumors and cysts until she could collect the money for buying his machine .	101.00322
when she submitted to his treatment with the capsules , mrs . shaefer felt intense pain .	51.197277
leaving lee ' s office , mrs . shaefer hurried over to her family physician , who treated her for burned tissue .	140.4538
for several days , she was ill as a result of lee ' s treatment .	44.066257
mrs . shaefer never got around to joining the thousand or so people who paid lee some $30 , 000 for his ozone machines .	248.6535
for mrs . shaefer -- who had been given a clean bill of health by her own physician at the time she visited lee -- and her friend were agents for the california pure food and drug inspection bureau .	119.262245
and she felt amply rewarded for her suffering when the evidence of lee ' s quack shenanigans , gathered by the tape recorder under her friend ' s clothing , proved adequate in court for convicting franklin d . lee .	102.44083
the charge violation of the california medical practices act by practicing medicine without a license and selling misbranded drugs .	53.316616
the sentence 360 days ' confinement in the county jail .	24.069887
rather , it is typical of the thousands of quacks who use phony therapeutic devices to fatten themselves on the miseries of hundreds of thousands of americans by robbing them of millions of dollars and luring them away from legitimate , ethical medical treatment of serious diseases .	82.32557
the machine quack makes his rube goldberg devices out of odds and ends of metals , wires , and radio parts .	112.90693
with these gadgets -- impressive to the gullible because of their flashing light bulbs , ticks , and buzzes -- he then carries out a vicious medical con game , capitalizing on people ' s respect for the electrical and atomic wonders of our scientific age .	136.12555
he milks the latest scientific advances , translating them into his own special buck rogers vocabulary to huckster his fake machines as a cure-all for everything from hay fever to sexual impotence and cancer .	178.40286
the gadget faker operates or sells his phony machines for $5 to $10 , 000 -- anything the traffic will bear .	123.29995
he may call himself a anaprapath , a physiotherapist , an electrotherapist , a naturopath , a sanipractor , a medical cultist , a masseur , a `` doctor ' ' -- or what have you .	81.59731
not only do these quacks assume impressive titles , but represent themselves as being associated with various scientific or impressive foundations -- foundations which often have little more than a letterhead existence .	304.26712
the medical device pirate of today , of course , is a far more sophisticated operator than his predecessor of yesteryear -- the gallus-snapping hawker of snake oil and other patent medicines .	149.59993
his plunder is therefore far higher -- running into hundreds of millions .	75.11374
according to the food and drug administration ( fda ) , `` doctor ' ' ghadiali , dr . albert abrams and his clique , and dr . wilhelm reich -- to name three notorious device quacks -- succeeded , respectively , in distributing 10 , 000 , 5000 , and 2000 fake health machines .	83.058495
authorities believe that many of the doctor frauds using these false health gadgets are still in business .	113.82239
look at the sums paid by two device quack victims in cleveland .	43.70173
sarah gross , a dress shop proprietor , paid $1020 to a masseur , and mr . a . , a laborer , paid $4200 to a chiropractor for treatment with two fake health machines -- the `` radioclast ' ' and the `` diagnometer ' ' .	58.180153
multiply these figures by the millions of people known to be conned by medical pirates annually .	77.177315
you will come up with a frightening total .	11.250071
that ' s why the fda , the american medical association ( ama ) , and the national better business bureau ( bbb ) have estimated the toll of mechanical quackery to be a substantial portion of the $610 million or so paid to medical charlatans annually .	113.16398
the postmaster general recently reported that mail order frauds -- among which fake therapeutic devices figure prominently -- are at the highest level in history .	77.28013
similarly , the american cancer society ( acs ) , the arthritis and rheumatism foundation , and the bbb have each stated lately that medical quackery is at a new high .	129.69699
for example , the bbb has reported it was receiving four times as many inquiries about quack devices and 10 times as many complaints compared with two years ago .	266.89453
authorities hesitate to quote exact figures , however , believing that any sum they come up with is only a surface manifestation -- turned up by their inevitably limited policing -- of the real loot of the medical racketeer .	240.49835
in this sense , authorities believe that all estimates of phony device quackery are conservative .	168.7715
the economic toll that the device quack extracts is important , of course .	24.3831
but it is our health -- more precious than all the money in the world -- that these modern witch doctors with their fake therapeutic gadgets are gambling away .	72.04757
by preying on the sick , by playing callously on the hopes of the desperate , by causing the sufferer to delay proper medical care , these medical ghouls create pain and misery by their very activity .	186.81953
typically , sarah gross and mr . a both lost more than their money as the result of their experiences with their cleveland quacks .	108.430305
sarah gross found that the treatments given her for a nervous ailment by the masseur were not helping her .	88.64268
as a result , she consulted medical authorities and learned that the devices her quack `` doctor ' ' was using were phony .	118.631035
she suffered a nervous breakdown and had to be institutionalized .	15.214737
mr . a . , her fellow townsman , also experienced a nervous breakdown just as soon as he discovered that he had been bilked of his life savings by the limited practitioner who had been treating his wife -- a woman suffering from an incurable disease , multiple sclerosis -- and himself .	102.2329
mr . a has recovered , but he is , justifiably , a bitter man .	103.78947
`` that ' s a lot of hard-earned money to lose ' ' , he says today .	23.138807
`` neither me nor my wife were helped by that chiropractor ' s treatments ' ' .	39.396675
and there was the case of tom hepker , a machinist , who was referred by a friend to a health machine quack who treated him with a so-called diagnostic machine for what doctor fraud said was a system full of arsenic and strychnine .	122.58258
after his pains got worse , tom decided to see a real doctor , from whom he learned he was suffering from cancer of the lung .	91.42192
yes , tom caught it in time to stay alive .	267.91956
but he ' s a welfare case now -- a human wreck -- thanks to this modern witch doctor .	214.73726
but the machine quack can cause far more than just suffering .	38.659912
in such diseases as cancer , tuberculosis , and heart disease , early diagnosis and treatment are so vital that the waste of time by the patient with doctor fraud ' s cure-all gadget can prove fatal .	108.878365
moreover , the diabetic patient who relies on cure by the quack device and therefore cuts off his insulin intake can be committing suicide .	79.14542
in chicago , some time ago , mr . h . , age 27 , a diabetic since he was six , stopped using insulin because he had bought a `` magic spike ' ' -- a glass tube about the size of a pencil filled with barium chloride worth a small fraction of a cent -- sold by the vrilium company of chicago for $306 as a cure-all .	96.88516
`` hang this around your neck or attach it to other parts of your anatomy , and its rays will cure any disease you have ' ' , said the company .	146.14247
mr . h . is dead today because he followed this advice .	104.125854
doris hull , suffering from tuberculosis , was taken by her husband to see otis g . carroll , a sanipractor -- a licensed drugless healer -- in spokane .	107.98882
carroll diagnosed mrs . hull by taking a drop of blood from her ear and putting it on his `` radionic ' ' machine and twirling some knobs ( fee $50 ) .	112.89628
his prescription hot and cold compresses to increase her absorption of water .	77.15182
although she weighed only 108 pounds when she visited him , carroll permitted her to go on a 10-day fast in which she took nothing but water .	183.54329
inevitably , mrs . hull died of starvation and tuberculosis , weighing 60 pounds .	49.291447
moreover , her husband and child contracted t . b . from her .	36.41356
( small wonder a spokane jury awarded the husband $35 , 823 for his wife ' s death .	31.476915
in california , a few years ago , a ghoul by the name of h . f . bell sold electric blankets as a cure for cancer .	104.35504
he did this by the charming practice of buying up used electric blankets for $5 to $10 from survivors of patients who had died , reconditioning them , and selling them at $185 each .	316.89673
when authorities convicted him of practicing medicine without a license ( he got off with a suspended sentence of three years because of his advanced age of 77 ) , one of his victims was not around to testify he was dead of cancer .	130.01167
`` unfortunately ' ' , says chief postal inspector david h . stephens , who has prosecuted many device quacks , `` the ghouls who trade on the hopes of the desperately ill often cannot be successfully prosecuted because the patients who are the chief witnesses die before the case is called up in court ' ' .	136.71796
that ' s where device quackery can lead .	10.560696
the evidence shows that fake therapeutic machines , substituted for valid medical cures , have hastened the deaths of thousands .	186.05942
who are the victims of the device quacks ? ?	7.0600605
authorities say that oldsters are a prime target .	25.101147
says wallace f . jannsen , director of the fda ' s division of public information `` quacks are apt to direct their appeal directly to older people , or to sufferers from chronic ailments such as arthritis , rheumatism , diabetes , and cancer .	85.06183
people who have not been able to get relief from regular medical doctors are especially apt to be taken in by quacks ' ' .	139.1008
the victims of the quacks are frequently poor people , like mr . a . , who scrape up their life savings to offer as a sacrifice to doctor fraud ' s avarice .	95.01223
they are often ignorant as well as underprivileged .	7.555364
ten-year-old richard stewart had been irritable and quarrelsome for almost a year .	50.120594
his grades had gone steadily downhill , and he had stopped bringing friends and classmates home from school .	240.10829
mr . and mrs . stewart were puzzled and concerned .	254.14201
then one day dick ' s classmate jimmy , from next door , let the cat out of the bag .	129.76282
the youngsters in the boys ' class had nicknamed dick `` bugs bunny ' ' because his teeth protruded .	84.65836
when richard ' s parents told him they wanted to take him to an orthodontist -- a dentist who specializes in realigning teeth and jaws -- their young son was interested .	100.87755
during the year that followed , dick co-operated whole-heartedly with the dentist and was delighted with the final result achieved -- an upper row of strong straight teeth that completely changed his facial appearance .	196.18227
`` the majority of children in the united states could benefit by some form of orthodontic treatment ' ' , says dr . allan g . brodie , professor and head of the department of orthodontics at the university of illinois and a nationally recognized authority in his field .	40.05806
what do parents need to know about those `` years of the braces ' ' in order not to waste a child ' s time and their money ? ?	114.11785
how can they tell whether a child needs orthodontic treatment ? ?	42.948753
why and when should tooth-straightening be undertaken ? ?	1.0140731
occlusion is the dentist ' s expression for the way teeth fit together when the jaws are closed .	223.49255
malocclusion , or a bad fit , is what parents need to look out for .	171.19417
one main type of malocclusion is characterized by a receding chin and protruding upper front teeth .	65.78792
a chin too prominent in relation to the rest of the face , a thrusting forward of the lower front teeth , an overdeveloped lower jawbone , and an underdeveloped upper jaw indicate the opposite type of malocclusion .	78.63307
these two basic malformations have , of course , many variations .	37.31231
a child probably requires some form of treatment if he has any of the following conditions	143.59758
a noticeable protrusion of the upper or lower jaw .	21.428822
crooked , overlapping , twisted , or widely spaced teeth .	375.0392
front teeth not meeting when the back teeth close .	135.81647
upper teeth completely covering the lowers when the back teeth close .	247.17947
the eyeteeth ( third from the middle on top , counting each front tooth as the first ) beginning to protrude like fangs .	112.45876
second teeth that have come in before the first ones have fallen out , making a double row .	46.58551
contrary to the thinking of 30 to 40 years ago , when all malocclusion was blamed on some unfortunate habit , recent studies show that most tooth irregularity has at least its beginning in hereditary predisposition .	86.683784
however , this does not mean that a child ' s teeth or jaws must necessarily resemble those of someone in his family .	65.27997
tooth deformity may be the result of excessive thumb- or finger-sucking , tongue-thrusting , or lip-sucking -- but it ' s important to remember that there ' s a difference between normal and excessive sucking habits .	57.5704
it ' s perfectly normal for babies to suck their thumbs , and no mother need worry if a child continues this habit until he is two or three years old .	185.46365
occasional sucking up to the fifth year may not affect a youngster ' s teeth	92.0481
but after that , if thumb-sucking pressure is frequent , it will have an effect .	102.914566
malocclusion can also result if baby teeth are lost too soon or retained too long .	174.19116
if a child loses a molar at the age of two , the adjoining teeth may shift toward the empty space , thus narrowing the place intended for the permanent ones and producing a jumble .	126.023415
if baby teeth are retained too long , the incoming second teeth may be prevented from emerging at the normal time or may have to erupt in the wrong place .	112.04608
every orthodontist sees children who are embarrassed by their malformed teeth .	80.12396
some such youngsters rarely smile , or they try to speak with the mouth closed .	79.412155
in certain cases , as in dick stewart ' s , a child ' s personality is affected .	43.13857
yet from the dentist ' s point of view , bad-fitting teeth should be corrected for physical reasons .	215.67572
bad alignment may result in early loss of teeth through a breakdown of the bony structure that supports their roots .	65.097565
this serious condition , popularly known as pyorrhea , is one of the chief causes of tooth loss in adults .	52.758278
then , too , misplaced or jammed-together teeth are prone to trapping food particles , increasing the likelihood of rapid decay .	86.30275
`` for these and other reasons ' ' , says dr . brodie , `` orthodontics can prolong the life of teeth ' ' .	19.168161
the failure of teeth to fit together when closed interferes with normal chewing , so that a child may swallow food whole and put a burden on his digestive system .	141.1464
because of these chewing troubles , a child may avoid certain foods he needs for adequate nutrition .	261.59955
badly placed teeth can also cause such a speech handicap as lisping .	75.41618
`` most orthodontic work is done on children between the ages of 10 and 14 , though there have been patients as young as two and as old as 55 ' ' , says dr . brodie .	63.60835
in the period from 10 to 14 the permanent set of teeth is usually completed , yet the continuing growth of bony tissue makes moving badly placed teeth comparatively easy .	247.23428
orthodontic work is possible because teeth are held firmly but not rigidly , by a system of peridontal membrane with an involved nerve network , to the bone in the jaw	155.96365
they are not anchored directly to the bone .	12.439354
abnormal pressure , applied over a period of time , produces a change in the bony deposit , so a tooth functions normally in the new position into which it has been guided .	83.42128
what can 10-year-old susan expect when she enters the orthodontist ' s office ? ?	24.480886
on her first visit the orthodontist will take x-rays , photographs , tooth measurements , and `` tooth prints ' ' -- an impression of the mouth that permits him to study her teeth and jaws .	55.09928
if he decides to proceed , he will custom-make for susie an appliance consisting of bands , plastic plates , fine wires , and tiny springs .	74.87161
this appliance will exert a gentle and continuous or intermittent pressure on the bone .	58.939125
as the tooth moves , bone cells on the pressure side of it will dissolve , and new ones will form on the side from which the tooth has moved .	124.99852
this must be done at the rate at which new bony tissue grows , and no faster .	186.72165
`` if teeth are moved too rapidly , serious injury can be done to their roots as well as to the surrounding bone holding them in place ' ' , explains dr . brodie .	71.768906
`` moving one or two teeth can affect the whole system , and an ill-conceived plan of treatment can disrupt the growth pattern of a child ' s face ' ' .	58.400898
during the first few days of wearing the appliance and immediately following each adjustment , susan may have a slight discomfort or soreness , but after a short time this will disappear .	119.20914
parents are often concerned that orthodontic appliances may cause teeth to decay .	100.16341
when in place , a well-cemented band actually protects the part of the tooth that is covered .	70.209656
next susie will enter the treatment stage and visit the orthodontist once or twice a month , depending on the severity of her condition .	71.17343
during these visits the dentist will adjust the braces to increase the pressure on her teeth .	70.991585
susie ' s teeth have now been guided into a desirable new position .	79.41519
but because teeth sometimes may drift back to their original position , a retaining appliance is used to lock them in place .	74.45511
usually this is a thin band of wire attached to the molars and stretching across the teeth .	65.281555
susie may wear this only at night or for a few hours during the day .	59.310226
then comes the time when the last wire is removed and susie walks out a healthier and more attractive girl than when she first went to the orthodontist .	109.48838
straightening one tooth that has come in wrong may take only a few months .	114.04148
aligning all the teeth may take a year or more .	34.525345
an added complication such as a malformed jaw may take two or three years to correct .	117.26476
the charge for a complete full-banded job differs in various parts of the country .	18.458055
work that might cost $500 to $750 in the south could cost $750 to $1 , 200 in new york city or chicago .	135.42497
an average national figure for two to three years of treatment would be $650 to $1 , 000 .	60.06321
`` factors in the cost of treatment are the length of time involved and the skill and education of the practitioner ' ' , says dr . brodie .	45.634792
to become an orthodontist , a man must first be licensed by his state as a dentist , then he must spend at least two years in additional training to acquire a license as a specialist .	94.30058
`` costs may seem high , but they used to be even higher ' ' , says dr . brodie .	25.678177
`` fees are about half to a third of what they were 25 years ago ' ' .	53.71567
people today are aware of the value of orthodontics , and as a result there are more practitioners in the field .	43.86617
most orthodontists require an initial payment to cover the cost of diagnostic materials and construction of the appliances , but usually the remainder of the cost may be spread over a period of months or years .	52.670837
in many cities in the united states clinics associated with dental schools will take patients at a nominal fee .	124.61211
some municipal agencies will pay for orthodontic treatment for children of needy parents .	138.10146
growth studies have been carried on consistently by orthodontists .	88.65341
dr . brodie has 30-year records of head growth , started 20 minutes after children ' s births .	70.3505
`` in the past anyone who said that 90% of all malocclusion is hereditary was scoffed at	895.66925
now we know that family characteristics do affect tooth formation to a large extent ' ' , he says .	91.29019
`` fortunately through our growth studies we have been able to see what nature does , and that helps us know what we can do ' ' .	43.277992
this knowledge both modifies and dictates diagnosis and treatment .	6.9354525
for example , a boy may inherit a small jaw from one ancestor and large teeth from another .	241.91177
in the past an orthodontist might have tried , over four or five years , to straighten and fit the boy ' s large teeth into a jaw that , despite some growth , would never accommodate them .	119.01961
in other cases , in view of present-day knowledge of head growth , orthodontists will recommend waiting four or five years before treatment .	342.3952
the child is kept on call , and the orthodontist watches the growth .	599.2918
`` nature often takes care of the problem ' ' , says dr . brodie .	7.1642036
`` a child with a certain type of head and teeth will outgrow tooth deformity ' ' .	38.926823
that is why dr . brodie asks parents not to insist , against their dentist ' s advice , that their child have orthodontic work done too early .	122.843094
`` both because of our culture ' s stress on beauty and our improved economic conditions , some parents demand that the dentist try to correct a problem before it is wise to do so .	172.76624
let the orthodontist decide the proper time to start treatment ' ' , he urges .	135.88326
superior new material for orthodontic work is another result of research .	165.01881
plastics are easier to handle than the vulcanized rubber formerly used , and they save time and money .	53.52298
plaster of paris , once utilized in making impressions of teeth , has been replaced by alginates ( gelatin-like material ) that work quickly and accurately and with least discomfort to a child .	194.7889
as a rule , the earlier general dental treatment is started , the less expensive and more satisfactory it is likely to be .	77.97406
`` after your child ' s baby teeth are all in -- usually at the age of two and one half to three -- it ' s time for that first dental appointment ' ' , dr . brodie advises .	92.07505
`` then see that your youngster has a routine checkup once a year ' ' .	63.441563
to help prevent orthodontic problems from arising , your dentist can do these things	125.08711
he can correct decay , thus preventing early loss of teeth .	65.19075
if a child does lose his first teeth prematurely because of decay -- and if no preventive steps are taken -- the other teeth may shift out of position , become overcrowded and malformed .	253.58362
in turn the other teeth are likely to decay because food particles may become impacted in them .	414.5747
from time to time the medium mentions other people `` around him ' ' , who were `` on the other side ' ' , and reports what they are saying .	50.082623
after a while there come initials and names , and he is interested to hear some rather unusual family nicknames .	203.95166
as the hour progresses , the sensitive seems to probe more deeply and to make more personal and specific statements .	175.55394
there are a few prognoses of coming events .	10.286854
another medium , another sitter , would produce a somewhat different content , but in general it would probably sound much like the foregoing reading .	149.05324
some mediums speak in practical , down-to-earth terms , while others may stress the spiritual .	188.99898
not all , as a matter of fact , consider themselves `` mediums ' ' in the sense of receiving messages from the deceased .	74.95456
in fact , some sensitives rule this out , preferring to consider their expression as strictly extra-sensory perception ( esp ) , on this side of the `` veil ' ' .	64.41028
however that may be , people are known to go to mediums for diverse reasons .	60.088013
perhaps they are mourning a recent death and want comfort , to feel in touch with the deceased , or seek indications for future plans .	95.95511
they may , of course , be curiosity seekers -- or they may just be interested in the phenomenon of mediumship .	125.129005
the mediums with whom the parapsychology foundation is working in this experiment are in a waking or only slightly dissociated state , so that the sitter can make comments , ask and answer questions , instead of talking with a `` control ' ' who speaks through an entranced sensitive .	136.57338
what we have here is in some ways more like an ordinary conversation .	258.44507
but it is not really only a conversation .	18.080944
many a sitter ( in a personal sitting ) has been amazed to realize that the medium was describing very vividly his state of mind .	143.89189
he himself might not have been really aware of his own mood	85.81839
it had been latent , unspecified , semi-conscious and only partly realized -- until she described it to him ! !	238.90707
most striking indeed is this beyond-normal ability to put a finger on `` pre-conscious ' ' moods and to clarify them .	34.916515
however , in the next visit that the researcher made to the medium , he did not receive a personal reading .	86.657875
instead he brought with him the names of some people he had never met and of whom the medium knew nothing .	256.92453
for this was to be a `` proxy sitting ' ' .	5.422912
as was noted earlier , it is important that in valid , objective study of this sort of communication , the interested sitter should be separated from the sensitive .	122.924706
dr . karlis osis , director of research at the parapsychology foundation , described the basis for the experiment in a tomorrow article , ( `` new research on survival after death ' ' , spring 1958 ) .	121.523994
he remarked `` it has been clearly established that in a number of instances the message did not come from a spirit but was received telepathically by the medium from the sitter ' ' .	80.12396
the possibility has to be ruled out that the medium ' s esp may tap the memory of the sitter , and to do this , the two central characters in this drama must be separated .	67.86166
one way to do this is by `` proxy sittings ' ' , wherein the person seeking a message does not himself meet with the medium but is represented by a substitute , the proxy sitter .	88.733894
if the latter knows nothing about the absent sitter except his name ( given by the experimenter ) , he cannot possibly give any clues , conscious or unconscious , far less ask leading questions .	176.88687
all he can do is to be an objective and careful questioner , seeking to help the sensitive in clarifying and making more specific her paranormal impressions .	176.20245
sometimes in these experiments `` appointment sittings ' ' are used .	23.189407
here the absent sitter makes a `` date ' ' with a communicator ( someone close to him who is deceased ) , asking him to `` come in ' ' at a certain hour , when a channel will be open for him .	66.11847
in this case the proxy sitter will know only the name of the communicator , nothing else .	84.33941
he gives this to the medium at the appointed time , and the reading then will be concerned with material about or messages from the communicator .	123.32448
as always , a tape recording or detailed notes are made , and a typescript of this is sent to the absent sitter .	38.544495
so this proxy situation has set up at least a partial barrier between the medium ' s esp and the absent sitter ' s mind .	28.734041
it is now harder to assume telepathy as a basis for the statements -- though research still does not know how far afield esp can range .	422.32712
now the original absent sitter must decide whether the statements are meaningful to him .	43.021477
here again laboratory approaches are being evolved , for it is recognized how `` elastic ' ' these readings can be , how they can apply to many people , and are often stated in general terms all too easily applied to any individual ' s own case .	101.95035
if you look at a reading meant for someone else , you will probably see that many of the items could be considered as applicable to you , even when you were not in the picture at all ! !	55.323795
